description: On our second stop of barhopping on a Wednesday evening, we came to Harlot for their $5 well drinks. I can't say for how this place turns out on a weekend since it seems like it becomes a club/lounge, but it's a decent bar with cheap happy hour on weekdays. The space has a dark and swanky feel to it. If it's your first time, note that the bar is a bit hidden around the alleyway on Minna St.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
This place is so small and like a hole in the wall place - 
It is not worth it to go here - and pay the cover -
This is a restaurant turned into bar /"lounge since it's in the middle of the residential complex
author: Victor D.

description:
Ambiance - Not too big dance floor. Pretty decent crowd to not so crowded I'd say. I am guessing there is potential to get a larger crowd in the future. Music is not too bad though a bit boring at first.

Bar - Quick bartenders and pretty nice communication. I love their bar section though.

Price - liquor is not so cheap as usual. Free to get in before 11pm ?!? After that, 20$ cover I believe.

I'll come back to chill when I feel like I don't want to be crowded for the night.
author: Thet P.

description:
No idea what this place is like as a nightclub - please check other reviews if that's what you're looking for!

As a happy hour spot, they have some really solid deals for the neighborhood - and it goes until NINE. The downside is that a lot of these deals are on kind of "meh" product - their draft selections and $5 shots are just not great stuff. I'd happily do a $5 shot of well tequila, if they offered it,  for example...but they don't. But at least they still got the deals on well drinks! So I'll just take that tequila shot in some OJ and grenadine, please :D.

I love the decor, too; very inventive. 

The super weird thing about this place was the crowd. It was very chill and relaxed, but everyone was smushed up against the bar with their backpacks left at their tables. Uh...guys? This is a major city with a pretty big theft problem; you might not wanna do that. Especially considering like 99% of the people were yuppies, so there were probably shiney macbooks in most of them. 

I also had to push through a ton of people to get anywhere - to the bar, to the seating, to the door. It felt like everything I did interrupted about 4 conversations because people weren't aware of their surroundings. I dunno if 25 people all from the same company invaded the bar or what, but that crowd was a very odd experience. 

Anyway I got my cheap beer; would totally come here with coworkers anytime. Oh and did I mention that happy hour goes until NINE?
author: Chris S.

description:
Honestly. If it's free? Go. If you have a cover. Of 1-?$ don't pay. Mediocre interior. Crowded. No organization. You would think you were on the strip vs. an alley on SF. I've been going out in this city for years (15+) this is seriously the most disappointed I've been in  SF nightlife. I went on a Sunday. So I can't speak for the other days but 4/8/18 they were really trying it. Go to the end up. Have a good time and end your night there before it can go down hill.

Then the dj admitted to being drunk and playing the same songs repeatedly wishing 3 minutes of each other. Leaving dead spots in between tracks. Save your time, energy and money.
author: Phillip W.

description:
Hello ' I'm just going to write an honest review here ' I am an active party gal and I love to explore places in the city . It's my fist time here because my frd birthday . It's a group of about 20 and they got two tables with three bottles and we knew that she can com 30,people . So we knew before we walk in. When we are at the entrance, mentioning our buddy name , that ASIAN CASHIER LADIE told us our friend cancels the table and we had to pay. WHICH WAS A BULLSHIT. But we didn't argue but wanna get in.That bitch INSIST to charge us money for entrance and giving us that it's the RULE attitude . After w check in and mention this to our friend , she was surprised . 

We went back out to talk to her because it's unfair and that bitch is not supposed to do this to us , she insist it's the policy which was bullshit . We left and this place jus gave me the BS that we At not supposed to take.
author: Alison C.

description:
The Manager her is so unprofessional (Jeremy)   , i have never been treated so poorly !!!!!! We had bottle service here and are visiting from New York!!  He called us bitches and said " i don't need to let you guys in all " 
Horrible costumer service!!!!!!! 
And willing to spend 100S of dallers!!!! I this is horrible and really say
author: Mel S.

description: Super cheap drinks and good music! Some guy was randomly flying a drone inside which got a bit annoying as it made the place super cold but he was taking a video. I'll come back for the cheap drinks and music.
author: Mira B.

description: A perfect place for water downed shots of  Jameson. Bartenders are cool but bouncers are too cool for school
author: Nicola V.

description:
A sad example of a club that has overestimated its value and purpose. How badly it can treat patrons without suffering the consequences? It feels like it's stuck in the 2009 mode of "fuck your that's why".

- the men's restroom is upstairs, right next to some VIP tables. Enjoy smelling that while paying idiotic bottle service costs
- they had the audacity to charge cover even though there was not a live act of playing
- extremely rude bartenders who do not take credit card and make it seem like it's your fault for not having cash.
- no coat check. Really?
- extremely overpriced drinks with no justification 
- bartenders pretend to not take credit card when it's clear they do.

The only redeeming quality is the sound system. If you have a good set of headphones, you'll get better audio quality. Crowd is mainly sad single guys without much common sense.

Don't waste your time and money here. This is s classic example of worthless San Francisco excess.
author: Aleksandr S.

description:
First time here and the place is pretty cool with nice dancers and all but the music is wayyyy toooo loud for such a small place... I thought I will lose my hearing that night... 
Music was kinda ok but live DJ and all was good... Also the place was not super crowded so it was not suffocating to be in there like other places...
author: Rupa S.

description: Tried to get bottle service here and they never responded. Customer service sucks here. And why do they ask for your Facebook profile? It's kind of weird. Discriminatory much?
author: Whitney M.

description:
Decent place to swing by for a happy hour drink or two...or three!

Usually no cover if you're there early enough & sometimes they'll provide free chips & salsa. 

Live DJ as well, with ample room on the dance floor.
author: Roger D.

description: Well this is an old story, but still needs to be told. It has been well over a year, but the experience was so egregious, I think at least some of the Bay Area nightclub goers should be aware of the problem I had on my only two nights attempting to gain entrance to this establishment. I think  the upper level management should be aware of this too. In June of 2017, I was enthralled to go to Harlot because the Golden State Warriors (my favorite NBA team) celebrated their NBA Championship party there. I wanted to see where my team was partying and check out the club. I drove all the way from the mid peninsula to San Francisco. When I got to the door, the bouncer looked me up and down (I was well dressed), and said "what do can I do for you?". I must have had a perplexed face, because I thought it was obvious, that I wanted to go in. He said it was late, and the manager will have to make the call (It was barely 1:00 am). Seriously, most clubs do not officially close until 2:00 am. I asked him to get the manager, as I wanted to politely ask him myself, which I did. He came out and said "We are winding down, so we are not letting anyone else in for the night". I said okay, and went home. The next night, I said I will try Harlot again, as I wanted to experience where my favorite team who brought another championship back to the Bay Area had their victory party. I drove a half an hour plus drive back up the peninsula to SF. When I got to the front door, a new bouncer (who had a thick British accent), said "Yes?" as he looks me up and down (I was dressed nice again). I am thinking what dreadful customer service and terribly impersonal impression he gives off.  I told him I would like to go inside and check out the club. He said "Ah, sorry man, you have to have a woman with you to get in here". I said "Huh? I have never head that in all my years of attending night life events and clubs in SF". He said "At this club, you need to come with a lady to get in". I told him that seems really strange, because they never told me that last night when I came try to get in. He looked befuddled, and shrugged his shoulders with a clueless look. I walked off shaking my head. This is very unprofessional as an establishment to not maintain consistency with rules each night and communicate any changes with their staff members. They really need to educate their staff on their customer service and interpersonal relation skills. If there are rules that state you must accompany a woman as a single man, then this should be visibly stated on their website and the on the front door (or at least one of those places). Seriously, this is not like trying to get into the Playboy Mansion in Los Angeles or Studio 54 back in New York back in the day. If it is not a private, members only club, don't act like one.
author: Hamilton B.

description: I love the harlot. Miguel the bartender is great and always so much fun when hes there. Love the music. Also, glenda the bathroom attendent is super cute and sweet and deserves a raise!!!
author: Sasha G.

description: The Manager here is so unprofessional and rude !!! Bad for business !!! He told us he doesn't need to let us in at all b because he is the manager " we ar 5 young woman willing to pay and he was very irritated and flustered from a previous situation I guess !!! Very sad
author: Lisa K.

description: Tried reporting the inappropriate touching of a female friend's body by Harlot staff to management. They were not interested.  This was a police matter, but she was too upset to file a police report so we left.  We were fine with leaving as the scene is kind of creepy and old, don't places like this go out of business in SF.  Time for a better place to take its place.
author: Greg D.

description: Pretty poppin on nights with events but relatively ratchet otherwise!  I'd say this about most clubs though - it's all about who's promoting
author: Anna W.

description:
I'm debating if I should give this place 2 or 3 stars but since I'm willing to give this place another chance I'll keep it at 2 stars.

Went on a Sunday night and I don't think I'll ever be back on a Sunday night during a holiday weekend. Holiday weekends tend to bring a crowd that I'm not too crazy about (more ratchets than usual) but for the most part it was a good mix of regular people there.

This place is small and about 80% bottle service, leaving us regular folks trying to find space to dance, let alone breath. The upstairs was cool but again it is the same problem.

The dj that night was trash, and since the crowd was mostly ratchet, he was playing songs that only catered to them. (I'm talking about the songs you don't hear on the radio, that gets the crowd hella hyped...sometimes too hyped like a riot is gonna break out lol.)

Drinks were ok, about $10+. The bartender that helped me was nice and attentive.

Overall I wish I went somewhere else but again I'll give this place another chance.
author: M. H.

description: Miguel and Johnny are the best bartenders in town been living in SF for 5 years and Harlot has the best happy hour by far! #happyhour #five$shot
author: Sergio R.

description:
Thank you, doorman, for noticing that I took off my coat to show you that I put some effort into my outfit and for letting me in for free even though the four girls behind me each had to pay $20.

Also, thank you, random guy, for hitting on my friend and for buying me drinks as well since she pretty much forced you to. Those two men made my evening fun and inexpensive.

Harlot is a stone's throw away from my place and I'm glad I finally got to check it out. Even though the space is not that big, it was also not overly crowded. The music was alright and the dancers wore cute black lingerie.

I did not like the creepy looking guys standing alone against the wall grabbing my arm and other parts of me as I was walking toward the bar. No, I don't want to dance with you.
author: Yi Z.

description: I wish I could give this place no star at all. This place is such a horrible place. First of all it's small af. We got bumped out for just being asians. The thing is that we actually got in, paid for the entrance fee and all of the sudden, this one guy just showed up tried ripping our bracelets off and gave us our money back and asked us to leave. Seriously wth?!!
author: Linda C.

description: Eh...on crowded nights it can be a fun time. It's a really small venue so when it's not packed it's just not worth the cover charge. You are better off walking over a block and paying to get into Temple.
author: N J.

description:
Where do I begin? We came for the NYE party. There was a group of six of us (1:1 ratio male to female, and our first time here), and I feel pretty stupid for even having to mention that. To be honest, I was slightly fearful that we wouldn't even be able to get in considering the horror story reviews I have read here on yelp about racism and getting turned away even if you've bought a ticket (and I say this as a black patron who also bought a ticket for this event). To my delight, there was no problem getting in and the wait was like 2 minutes.

Coat check was right there and it was $5 (for NYE the price got jacked up by $1). It says that they're not responsible for lost or stolen items which I think is silly considering we're paying you to watch over our items?? Why am I paying then if I'm not guaranteed my item will still be there under your possession? 

There's also an ATM and a smoke room which was the only place besides the VIP tables that you could sit. No sitting room? So you want more girls in the club, who are probably wearing heels, but can't accommodate if we wanna sit and rest our feet? Boo! 

Dance floor is the size of my living room and I think no dance floor should be the size of a living room unless you live in a mansion. In other words, it's small.

The crowd consisted mostly of older people (mid 30s, some 20-somethings sprinkled in the crowd). Furthermore, no one barely danced. Most of them just stood there in a circle thinking they looked cool. Like, get off the dance flooring you're not gonna dance!

But, I can't blame them because the music was a little dry. I felt like I was at a cheap EDM concert, not a club. Who actually plays Taylor Swift in a club? I couldn't take the DJ seriously after that. Not that Taylor Swift is bad, just not something you dance to in a club? Totally unexpected. As each song came on, the worse it got. The DJ dropped the beats all wrong and mixed certain parts of the song that didn't make sense. It made for an awkward set list. At one point the music got so bad that I went from actual dancing to just head nodding, and that's when I knew it was time to go. I mean If the DJ can't keep you dancing...

Bar service was quick but terribly over priced ($12 for a watered down amaretto sour). No thanks.

NYE decor was Dollar Tree sale bin special. 

Balloon drop was cute until all the crazies started popping them in people's faces and to top the night off, there was an altercation between two drunkards on the dance floor!

Overall it seemed to be an average experience but something was missing; probably better music and a more diverse crowd. Leaving, walking by all the clubs, it seemed every other club we walked past was 10 times more lit than Harlot. Just saying.

Most exciting part of New Years was getting a bacon wrapped hot dog on the way back to the car from one of those street food cart ladies that you always see at large or popular events.
author: Alexys E.

description:
Good DJs, but the whole ticket thing can be weird. Will call guest list last minute? Maybe that's normal.

The lower stars are for the "special occasion" non-smoking area that is suddenly smoking friendly??? Wtf??
author: Samantha L.

description:
When I am in the Bay Area I always like to check out different Nightlife for the 21+ crowd. My local friends decided to sign us up for the guest-list which was free for women before 10:30 pm. Upon arriving, there were no lines but check in to the guest list was easy and had no problem getting in. The drinks were pretty strong and the dj was spinning 90's-current hip hop. 

Don't get me wrong i loved the drinks and the music. I would recommend this to start your night off if you decide to club/bar hop in downtown SF. However, it was just a weird and different vibe for me. Maybe its just the people they promote to go there is just....i dont know how to describe it. Maybe just not really my idea of "fun". Dance floor was a small and the crowd is aimed for the older, lounge experience.

Recommended for: 30+ age group, like to lounge or bottle service, upscale attire.
author: Michelle M.

description:
This could be a cool club. It has many of the right components.
I love the dancers and their bottle service people are so nice
and friendly.  Ive only been here a few times, there was this guy there
in a hat that kept stopping the music and being like "hey guys" to the crowd, he had
a dumb hipster hat (i love hipsters dont get me wrong, you'd probably
label me one too) but like, it wasn't cool or fun. I think he kept stopping the music
because he didnt know how to beat match very well.  Harlot, book some real djs
who know how to mix and Ill buy bottles all night.
author: Amanda B.

description: This place is trash! From bouncers to bartenders it's just an unpleasant ride. The manager Jeremy paz(bald tacky guy)is the worst part of it! Stay away from this bar and specially from Jeremy Paz.
author: Saint O.

description:
How many people does it take to operate a club door? I don't think harlot has figured out the golden ratio yet. The most unorganized nightclub front door I've ever seen. We arrived at around 11pm and waited in line for nearly 45 minutes. Security kept screaming that everyone needed to get in line but kept letting people in who bum rushed the front of the line where the entry was before letting the people who were actually following instructions and waiting in line inside!

They offered an online promotion that allowed the guestlist to be free all night, and while waiting inline we were told we had to pay 40 dollars because it was after 11.

I've had a much easier times attending clubs in Vegas on fight weekends. The crowd was ghetto! We never made it in, ended up going to another place I suggest you do the same!
author: Bay N.

description:
I've been here for both Sub Society events (3rd Thursday typically) and Tutu Tuesdays (2nd one of the month).

The Sub Society events were amazing musically.

Tutu Tuesday was incredible all-around, though. Mind-blowing, gorgeous house music, bunch of fun(ny) people in tutus and surprisingly uncrowded on the dance floor. Will definitely make it a priority moving forward.

Bottom line? Nice people for the EDM events. Venue looks great and is backed up by competent A/C. Recommended on all fronts. :)
author: John M.

description: First time going to this place. The bouncer was a nice guy. The music was good at the beginning but later it turned out  bad. To much rap and the most important it was so empty the place. You could easily break dance there  ... I will not go there anymore because of the music and the environment.
author: Brenda H.

description:
Meowww... I had an ahhhmazing time at Harlot on Friday night for the Animal Party. This place is not too big or too small of a venue, and their decor is definitely swanky and sexy. Their artwork on the wall is lovely to look at. I was definitely feeling the music that was playing there--- EDM mostly (yay!) with some hiphop/top 40s splashed in there. 

I love the blowup animals and thanks to Marco for getting me the giraffe. So cute!

I would definitely come again for another animal party in the near future or their other parties. Thanks for the grrreat time, Harlot! ;)
author: Amy C.

description:
I attended two small mixers here. Harlot is perfect for hosting networking events, but I can't imagine wanting to come here on any other night. When this place gets packed, it's nearly impossible to move around unless people are nice enough to let you through. When you first walk in, there is a small window for coat check that is easy to miss, and it's stricly for coats. There is a side room for smoking, which is nice I guess.

There are booths that line the wall opposite of the bar which is perfect for networking events. There is an upstairs VIP type area that I'm not sure how to access, but this adds a little more space to the cramped downstairs floor. Everyone who works here seems pretty chill but the vibe of course is defined by the crowd that Harlot attracts. Hit or miss, I suppose. I would definitely book this place for a private event (though it seems a little shabby) but not come here for a regular night on the town.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Came here last SAturday with a friend from out of town - neither of us had ever been. Arrived around 11:15 and were greeted at the door and told that we were being given VIP access.  VIP access basically meant that we could go to the upstairs bar and lounge area as well as the downstairs area.  We came in and they were blasting 90s and early 2000s hip hop, as well as top 40s and classic Bay hits.  They had dancers alongside some of the walls in burlesque wear, dancing alongside the beat.  The place was also extremely packed.  

All in all, a pretty good time.  The drinks were expensive (I bought two cocktails for $23) but after several shots, the bartender gave us free drink tickets.  Despite the expensive drinks, would definitely come again because the music selection was that good.
author: Therese Jane R.

description:
We checked in online and when we arrived at gate at 10pm , 30 min before free entry they turned us down. This is total scam. We have 10 people signed up separately. Everyone booked 2 weeks in advance. 

This is total scam club. A V O I D !!!!
author: Shantanu B.

description:
This is a usual hot spot for my coworkers and I during happy hour. We come here pretty regularly on Fridays mostly. There aren't really huge happy hour deals here that come to mind as the reason we come here so there must be other reasons why. There are.

The place is located in an alleyway so you might miss it walking down the street. We usually come here around 5pm or so after work and the place is pretty empty. So in that regard there is plenty of room and plenty of space to get drinks. In addition the bathrooms are clean and there is air conditioning everywhere. It makes it difficult to get warm and uncomfortable when they blast the AC. Fine by me. 

I guess personally it's a great place to come with a lot of people, not have to wait in lines for drinks. Decent price and comfortable atmosphere. I enjoy this for HH. I don't have any other experience with it's night life.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
Harlot gets one star for overcharging my credit card $32.00. 

Check your credit card statements.  It really ruins my experience when I see this happen because I can't help but think it was intentional.
author: Marianna D.

description: A more intimate DNA lounge, a nicer Public Works. It's small, and the Tutu tuesday crowd is one of the best in the city.
author: DR R.

description:
Harlot is definitely a good spot for a night-out. I've been there on a Saturday night with Vegas-based DJ Spider spinning the decks and had a great time!

The place is not too big, rather intimate, with a separate bottle service area and an exclusive upstairs lounge. Vibe/crowd was relaxed, it got super packed at around midnight to the point where you couldn't really move anymore. I also witnessed that the guy/girl ratio is being strictly enforced at the door, it did, however, feel like a bit of a sausage fest when it got crowded.

Overall, fun place and definitely coming back here.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Maybe Harlot has lost some fans but when we went here on a Friday night there was no line (we got there early) but I had a great time. 

So much for my "I don't go clubbing anymore" mantra.

I liked that there is rock star parking in a non sketchy neighborhood.

I liked that the layout wasn't a maze and it was easy to locate the bathrooms and coat check.

What I didn't like was that the go-go dancers in dominatrix outfits looked absolutely bored out of their skull and didn't even try to look like they were having a good time dancing on the mini stages on the side of the club. What a downer! 

The DJs were playing some deep house and I wish I could have gotten into the music more but they finally managed to play some hip hop so we could dance a little bit.

I may be a few years late to finally show up at Harlot, but I wouldn't mind going again one of these days.
author: Nette T.

description:
Great DJ and most of the staff were really nice. However, the service at the bar was terrible and cocky. I was annoyed because the bartender had looked over me multiple times to serve somebody that had just arrived when I had been there for quite some time. I never called him out, but I did step in front of another person who had just gotten to the bar that he was about to serve.
  I am also a bartender and, as a bartender, you should always be aware of what's going on at your bar. This includes keeping an eye on every person who is currently waiting at the bar, at least let each of them know that they have been seen, and last but not least, be fair and serve everyone in a timely manner. 
 Other than that, it was fun even though the bartender (Curly, blonde-haired douchebag) had the audacity to get wordy with me when I stepped in front to be noticed. Have fun, everyone!
author: Hashim J.

description:
This place is trash. Would give negative stars if possible.

Went for a Halloween party last weekend. Waited at the bar with my fiance for 20 minutes before she was able to order us two drinks. We paid with drink tickets we had purchased in advance of the event. I went back later to the same bartender and ordered the same drinks. He tried to tell me I couldn't order those same drinks with drink tickets, and that I needed to pay. Instead of giving me the tickets back so I could find out what she wanted, instead, he took the drinks and stole the tickets. Curly blonde haired douchebag.
author: Matthew L.

description:
Single rich dudes not welcome.

But alas Yelp wants me to say more. 

Go someplace else?
author: Y Z.

description:
This review is based on one time visit experience!  It may be very bias.

According from many Harlot yelp reviews, people think this place is very crowded.  The day my friends and I went, it was totally opposite of crowded.  We went there a little bit early, but we waited until 11:30.  Still not many people inside.  However, I still have very good impression on this place.

-Lounge  for people
-Quality drinks
author: Brandy C.

description:
It has been a hot minute since I've been here.  Returned to Harlot after about 5-6 years since my last visit?  I think that my last visit was also for a birthday celebration (or a post Fillmore Jazz Festival stumble ... I don't recall).    4 stars for the really nice bouncers, but 3 stars for the actual music and vibe.  The drinks were a-ok.  Someone with the birthday girl of our group actually ordered bottle service, which was a great touch.  The sparklers were cute and Independence Day-ish, but I was partly afraid that they were going to set something on fire (aaaaaaahhh!!!) I tried to get my dance-on, but just wasn't feeling the resident DJ Cobra (sorry).  Eclectic music, which had some good moments, but just couldn't bring me to the floor.

A+ on the female go-go dancers, playing on the theme of HARLOTs.  Very provocative and entertaining diversion for the music, which was eh.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
Had a table reservation on October 17 for my Birthday Party. Carla was very accommodating via back and forth emails and I loved the space we got upstairs.
 But VERY DISAPPOINTED IN THE SERVICE! I mean there was No service what so ever!!! We spent a lot of money for the table minimum. The waitress name Martina brought the bottles, pour shots for my guests ONCE and after we didn't see her. I had to serve my guests by making drinks! And later on everyone had to make their own drinks, shots... I am sorry, but isn't the waitress supposed to do it? I've had table reservations before, in different places, I do know how it works. Never had such a horrible service!!! Why did we tip her? 

I was trying to reach the management since, but couldn't get a hold of no one. That's why this bad experience review is here!
author: Alisa G.

description:
Great music, tight door on Saturdays that results in good looking crowd.

Jeremy who runs the door could be a real diva sometimes, but gladly I don't have to deal with him.

I dont know why I'm just reviewing this, since I've been coming to this place for years now and visit it at bare minimum twice a month.

After Scott left infusion, I will never go there again, as the crowd quality went sharply down. I'm curious to try Audio, but to my knowledge Harlot is pretty much the only club in SF that filters out bridges and tunnels well. Not to sound 1%ish here, but I don't like partying next to ppl with tattoos on their faces, and that's what happens at other clubs a lot.  Lufff Harlot
author: victoria c.

description:
In a town hardly known for great nightclubs, Harlot holds the distinction of being the worst.

Despite having a young, affluent and cool population, San Francisco lags far behind most cities of it's caliber of nightlife. If a nightclub is supposed to be full of attractive, young, cool people who can dance, with a balance between men and women, then San Francisco is a tough. But, most of those reasons for why this is the case are most exquisitely demonstrated in Harlot. 

Firstly, Harlot is a total dump. I would imagine that the place is a serious cash cow, none of it has been reinvested in the club itself.The entire place has a cheap, dated feeling that tries to cover the poverty of the surroundings with low light. The VIP area provides some respite from the overcrowded bar area and dance floor, but it provides no direct access to the dance floor. Service is reasonably good, but nothing special, as it's the worst club in San Francisco. The bathrooms are disgusting, and poorly maintained throughout the night. (There's staff there, so I think that's  a problem of management.) The prices are as expensive as any club in the city.

The crowd is overwhelmingly single males, without any sense of style. At Origin, they'd be denied at the door.. The ratio is probably 60% single males dressed in dress shirts, jeans and loafers. It's mostly guys who work in tech, who clearly have just gotten off work, who believe that the best way to attract a girl is to apparently hang out on the edges of the very crowded dance floor, creepily dancing by themselves and avoiding eye contact with anyone. It's the sort of look that suicide bombers must have when they're attempting to blend in at a nightclub as they move to the center.

There are a lot of fights and tense encounters. Most of the guys are harmless, but what makes Harlot special is that there's a frustrated thirstiness to the crowd that gets worse and worse as the night progresses as the decidedly unsexy crowd and atmosphere prevents any kind of romantic encounters. While virtually every club in San Francisco is full of this type, Harlot actually seems to be more prone to fights and rude behavior than any other club I've been to. I've seen fights break out here virtually every time I've been there. Virtually every time I've been to Harlot, I've seen some guy freaking out on a girl. It's a bizarre atmosphere after midnight. Security is fairly light handed, so it's a good place to check yourself. 

After around 1am, the place can get pretty tense as most the guys in the club realize that they're not going to meet anyone that night (and their best hope is likely to be an arranged marriage) and tensions flare.

Convenient to mass transit, though.
author: Michael B.

description:
Located in the alley, this bar spot offers seclusion and the feel of being down under!

I like how they have a dance floor and offer dips with naan at the bar section!  Great way to keep the crowd going on ordering up more drinks!

Electronic, house music with DJ, makes this place legit to be at!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
This blond bartender... She must be one of the worst bartenders we've ever had...

A gin and tonic isn't tonic and soda water... And a Long Island isn't coke a soda of your choice...

Hire someone who is a bartender... Having huge tits and a crappy personality doesn't qualify you... At least know how to make drinks, gay men and women aren't interested in torn ugly tits and horrible drinks...

Avoid this place AT ALL COSTS...
author: Nathan D.

description:
I dug this place! And I'm pretty picky when it comes to my nightlife excursions.

I saw Jack Beats spin a sick set here, and the venue had a really cool modern gothic/victorian ambiance, with a very intimate vibe that was very cool to see a DJ spin at. I'm not sure if I would go there just in any given night to party, but I think on a normal night when an unknown was there it would be a great place to host after work drinks, or take an interest to before the night dies down.
author: Alexander J.

description: L.O.V.E. this venue absolutely my favorite venue in sf. Completely different from the rest, super sexy with an intimate and upscale touch, rich & authentic both in events and in decor. I love coming here; staff is always welcoming, friendly - we had a table at the last event we attended, Angela was amazing throughout the night. She was, as the club, sexy but genuine and approachable. We were never looking around for her, she was attentive and professional from the moment we met to 'goodbye'. I can't say enough about her she met and exceeded expectations - we will definitely be coming back and asking to work with her again. Many thanks to Angela and Harlot staff for making great memories for & with us.
author: Janai F.

description: The venue is pretty decent. Good music and it was crowded when we went on a Friday night. Minimal drama to get in with a $20 cover charge. The negative review is for the loser coat check guy who demanded a tip when I went to pick up my blazer! This idiot had the audacity to demand a tip (and not in a nice way) after I already paid the outrageous $3 coat check fee. Guess what loser, go get a real job instead of harassing people to give you tips! I've never been talked to so rudely by any coat check person..
author: John C.

description:
More like HarNOT....

Signed up online for guest list and received a confirmation. Get to the place and the bouncer tells us the promoter didn't supply the guestlist. Well who's fucking fault is that? No, I will not pay $20 for a lounge with literally 4 dudes inside. 

Au Revoir forever.
author: Alex G.

description: Place goes off on Thursdays and Weekend nights. Great memories from Harlot and the club is a blast. Ambiance and people are key here. Drinks are pricey but worth it.
author: Marco G.

description:
This place is small..... there are maybe 3 or 4 bottle service tables, the private bar upstairs, and then a small dance floor near the dj booth. 

The bouncers at the front are pretty friendly and no cover !!! 

The go - go dancers/ burlesque dancers are really interesting.  They don't really dance or jump around like all the other dancers seem to.  They move around very slowly and suggestively... if that's all it took to be a dancer I could totally be one too !! 

The crowd here is also diverse, but this club definitely has more of an intimate vibe.  This would not be the place to pick someone up...which is a plus one for me. I hate places where all the guys are trying to get at girls, or where girls are just dressed up to show off their best "assets". 

No douchebags here either! ( or maybe I am just too friendly to everyone ) 

**for free parking at night you can park on 1st or 2nd street between Howard and Folsom  ( unless you wish to pay $20 for garage)  less than 10 min. walking distance to Harlot.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
Word of Advice: DON'T COME HERE EVER. 

I made the mistake of coming here last night, and NEVER AGAIN will I deal with the hassle of coming to this spot.

My friends and I came here for a birthday party, and we had reserved a table on the bottom level - we were promised by a Sara on the phone that we would be given a spot on the dance floor - as opposed to the upstairs area which is less lively. We also emailed the club the names of our guests, so to make for an easy experience.. or so I thought. 

We get to the club at a decent time, 10:15 - only to be told by Jeremy the apparent professional "manager" that they overbooked for the night of Harlot, and our reserved table space had been given to someone else (even though we had already been charged for the expense) - we were told that we would be given an upstairs "VIP" table which normally goes for $1000, at the cost of a table downstairs.  

We agreed to that - as we didn't want to waste time, and awaited the birthday boy - even though our names were all on guest list - we were told we had to pay cover or we could wait until the birthday boy showed. When he showed - Jeremy looked at him, and the three guys with him and said "No, you are now paying full price - there are guys with him". 

Mind you - we had mentioned this to him already and had provided him with a guest list - in addition to this, the professionals that they are - Jeremy said "you can take it or leave it, but i'm not letting them in" - when I spoke up, about how it made no sense and how unprofessional the entire situation was - Jeremy said "You are not coming in no matter what".

Agreed, clubs have the right to reserve entry - however I didn't realize that a club manager's ego and pathetic unprofessionalism was going to be the reason I was told I was not going to be allowed in. 

Anywho - my friends talked to the other bouncers, and all ended up well - we were guaranteed to go back in, the entire situation had resolved and then Jeremy (clearly lacking excitement in his life) - stated that he wanted a public apology for me.

AN APOLOGY. FOR WHAT?! For calling him out on his unprofessionalism? You'd have more luck convincing a boy scout to litter than you would convince me to apologize. 

I did NOT apologize, and my friend told Jeremy to simmer down - which he ended up doing - and we all walked in. 

Sounds like a bad episode of Jersey Shore huh? Except I'm no Snookie, and Jeremy is definitely no Pauly D. 

Frankly, I'm shocked by the unprofessionalism, and utmost rude behavior displayed by the bar manager. It's one thing to be overbooked, and another to be underintelligent. 

As for the club - the music was normal, the alcohol was flowing, the crowd was a bit eh, and it's a smaller spot. 

My advice? Skip this spot and go to The Grand, Infusion, John Collins, Ruby Skye before you waste your time here.
author: Raji R.

description: Went here for an event with a bunch of friends. Great music and awesome dance floor. Danced the night away to a good combination of edm and hip hop jams. Also, great VIP lounge upstairs. Obviously have to know peeps or have copious amounts of money to get up there but is a great time no doubt. Recommend it
author: Brady A.

description:
This review is strictly for their venue space

Came to Harlot to see Her Rebel Highness & couldn't have been more impressed w/ the venue setup

Taking their small limited space & turning it into an interactive, cozy & fun stage setting for the story about rebellious princesses from 1775

Started out in the bar / lounge area where there are bar stools & leather / cow skin couches for us to linger, enjoy some hors d'oveurs & wait for the royal court to be called to session.  The bar itself has dark walls, dark wooden furniture & dark couches - makes for a fun venue setting

As court was about to start, we migrated our way over to the "stage" area & there were seats or more couches from which to choose, the stage was nice & high so we could see all the actresses & the music was loud but nowhere near overwhelming & this was highly appreciated

Nice intimate evening in a relaxing, comfy, funky, fun setting!  And that equals a big A-OK in my book!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Harlot is great, and I'm so excited that they're open more nights a week now! 

The interior space is unique in both the neighborhood and the city, plus the happy hour deals are awesome!
author: Nelli S.

description:
I LOVE Dancing, and Harlot's music variety does not disappoint! 

I spent NYE here as well as another random night dancing the night away with friends. The drinks are average, the people tend to be slightly older and the ratio of boys to girls seems to be skued towards well a meat market, but overall with the right group of friends it is an amazing time... I can definitely foresee spending more nights dancing here.
author: Stephanie I.

description: Okay, we got VIP stamps that got us to go upstairs from the crowded room downstairs. Only thing is this place is incredibly packed and humid inside. The line for the restroom is long and I wasn't too impressed with the music or party.
author: Moua L.

description:
A teensy wit disappointed, but the DJ made up for it. 

Yay for for having Elephante for free, however Nay for having drinks close to $14.  For a very low-key and small club/lounge drinks were extremely over-priced. For a little asian girl, two redbull-vodkas were 28 with tip. I thought I was in Vegas for a second. 

It it a little hard to find since its on a small street. Look for a sketchy alley with small crowds. I would come back if they have someone special spinning, but not something I would venture to on a weekend.
author: Phuong V.

description: First off what an establishment. I always enjoy myself when I come here!! Sometimes a little too much.. Take a few weeks ago for example. I had had a bit too much fun (or to drink) and when I left I left without my purse and wallet. Woke up and thought all hope was lost! Went through the motions of canceling my cards and getting new ones and was about to go to the San Francisco DMV, where dreams go to die btw, to get a replacement ID when an angel who runs the coat check named Calle messaged me. Calle if you're reading this, truly I love you. You saved me!!! She went above and beyond and reached out to me on Facebook and I hit the floor when I read her message. Literal, I rolled on the ground in relief and pure joy. Thank you so much to everyone at Harlot for not only housing my drunk self but for reuniting me with my belongings. I'm elated, can you tell?? :)
author: Cortney J.

description: Discrimination-I tried to go to a special event at this location sponsored by uber. Myself and my wife both of color were not allowed entry due to improper attire while white patrons who were wearing the same improper attire that I was wearing and were affiliated with the promoter, uber, were allowed in. When i asked to speak to the manager the bouncer told me to leave and that the manager was busy. This is unacceptable behavior for a business to play favorites based on color.
author: Rob G.

description:
Very crowded place! They take advance reservations online, but they reserve the right to not accept you, say, if you're in a party that's all guys. The bartenders are fast, the floor isn't too dirty, and the bathrooms are nice, if down a long weird hallway and outside of the club (it's like you enter the lobby of the building that the club is in). They do have gogo dancers, which is a nice touch - but the dancers were clearly bored! Tell the ladies to smile or make eye contact with the crowd :)

Overall score: 2, due to expensive drinks, and no real places to sit (unless you get bottle service).
author: Celeste T.

description:
They seriously need to renovate this place. It feels dirty and outdated. Been there few times because its so close to where we live but still im not too fond of this place. 
I think the vip table service is pricy for what it is. The server girls doesnt really come n check up on us. 
When we made reservation for bottle service the lady said itll be near the door for the price we were willing to pay. But we upgraded our table to be next to the dance floor. When we came, we weren't really happy because it didnt feel like it was next to the dance floor. Not sure what happened. 
But anyways, the music is pretty good. Ok crowd.
author: Anudari K.

description:
Front guys who work security are straight assholes. They probably would be better off working as bouncers as the gentlemens club then a real club. 
Make sure you mention the website and how guest list is free before a certain time or they try and scam you.
Inside is a steamy disgusting space with no air conditioner or fans . 
The ceiling pipes drip with water and it's absolutely morbid.
author: Yas G.

description:
Harlot is one of my favorite clubs to go in SF and I will tell you huwhy exactly. 

Most clubs just wanna pack the most people, book 8 Dj's back to back, have 15 promoters giving comps to ten of their dude friends and everything is hunky dory. What gets lost is the overall presentation- the look, the feel, crowd clientele.  In a sense you've become just like any other club  (i.e. San Jose...ugh )  

Harlot is a club that ranges from the more Techy, Dark , Deep nights to the party rock EDM shows.    It also features some of the best open format around.  

From the live vignette performers to the pretty well done drinks at the bar, I highly recommend this place for the out of towner or groups that have had their fill with Parlor.   

PRO
- Good for groups
- Variety in crowd
- Good Drinks
- Non Aggressive environment 


Cons
-Parking sucks
-A bit hidden
author: Geo D.

description: I am a fan of Harlot...I ended up there on a Friday after having happy hour with coworkers. Not only was the DJ Jamming, but the drinks were delicious! I have heard about this place, but never attended. I am so happy that I stumbled upon this place. I will definitely be back.
author: Sharon M.

description:
The night started pretty well. The place was decently packed but not overcrowded. The DJ was spinning great mix of hip hop, EDM and top hits. Great music. People were having fun. The VIP area were filled with mid 30's looking white woman dancing and celebrating a wedding or a birthday of some sort and that was that.

After midnight, people kept pouring in, crowds and crowds of people. There was no room to dance, no room to stand, no room to sit, no room to breath. What was a good night of partying, have fun turned into sweaty shoulder to shoulder action. People kept bumping into other people trying to get from point A to point B. Drunk people just forcing their way through the crowds and shoving people. 

Also, the fact that I had to pay $20 cover charge is freaking ridiculous. If you're a big club then a cover is fine but if you're a tiny lounge with a dance floor the size of my living room, no........just no. The fact that the cover charge were only for dudes is stupid too. You're not in Vegas.

Pros:
Good lookin woman.
Okay priced drinks
Great DJ
Awesome Music

Cons:
Hot (No AC)
Stupidly packed
Cover charge
Tiny dance floor
author: Will C.

description: I've been to Harlot plenty of times and many clubs around the world.  Last night would be the last time I'd step foot in this joke of a club. If you want to have your drink ripped out of your hand without warning by security and not even having the decency to ask like a normal human being, then you would enjoy this dump. Even the pathetic bouncer whose job is to man the restrooms lacks intelligence hence his sole duty to watch patrons as they enter and exit the restrooms. Since when did leaving your drinks unattended on a table with a complete stranger before you're granted permission to enter the restrooms a policy? It's like asking to get roofied! To top that off, it's a complete sausage fest in this club and none of the guys are even remotely good looking! Skip this club entirely, but if your are looking for a horrible time than this is the place for you!
author: Ciplada R.

description:
I've been to Harlot more times than I could count and every time had a blast.  

Celebrated my birthday here for 3 years in a row and many of my friends decided to do so after having a really good time. 

The staff is very friendly, the hosts are humble and make you feel very welcome every time and the wait at the bar is reasonable compared to other clubs in the city.  

A little tip: get there early as it gets crowded. It's a popular spot in the city and it gets a line at the door which can be avoided by getting there ~10sh.
author: Rica T.

description:
I don't know. This review might be impartial just because I sound like I'm just a total snob. 

But this place for me.. sucked... It was full of unattractive women who dressed poorly in those cheap flea market dresses with chunky typical closed toed black heels.  And some shiny eyeshadow up to their brow bone and cheap red lipstick. The girls who went in were just so not cute to look at and neither were the men. The men all looked weird dressed in t shirts and some sears button ups. If I was a bouncer I would charge these people to even allow them into the club.

I mean, maybe I'm being overly critical, but it was not a pleasant atmosphere. Bartenders yawning, waitresses are flat chested even with the bottle service. I saw them giving out free drink tickets. Wtf, no. No no no no. 

club decorum was nice and had cute cheap viney things hanging from ceiling..  but what's up with the 2004 club mix with bailando and Rihanna from 2007 no no. No . No . No . Noooooooo. 

Clubbing in SF continues to be awkward and disappointing. The search continues.
author: April W.

description: Every time I came here I have a blast,incredible sound system ,great lights,and nice staff like you don't see at SF nightclubs as much,if you're looking for a fun night with friends Harlot is the place!
author: Jose M.

description:
While the one-guy-one-girl ratio enforced at the door can suck if you come with an odd-numbered group of people, the club and the experience inside is very fun. The club is decently ventilated, but the drinks are a bit pricey. But hey, one should ball out if one's going out anyway right?

I attended for "Animal Night" where everyone wore an animal mask. It was super fun, and the attendees there were surprisingly friendly. Dancing was a lot of fun.

Hint: Arrive early when they don't enforce the gender ratio. It is empty around 9 and pretty kicking by 10:45. 

Bottle service is $250 btws
author: Nick L.

description:
Disclaimer: This review is being made in comparison to DC/NYC clubs. Let me just say, I no longer feel home sick for my former east coast night life. 

Sexy, classy, uninhibited, respectful, delightfully fun, Harlot holds the key to my former clubbing heart. Fun for group outings, a night out with your girlfriends or dancing with your significant other. Great place for private parties, birthdays, etc.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Came here for happy hour on a Friday night and it was pretty packed. The place has plenty of seating and the drinks were pretty cheap during HH. Drinks were pretty legit. They also served bar snacks during HH. There was pita bread and several types of dip as well.  People started clearing out after 7pm and the place was nearly empty except for us right around 8pm.

The only small problem is this place is an alley way on Minna and it's not easy to get there with all the construction going on right now.
author: Tim G.

description:
My friends and I come here all the time. I have celebrated many of my birthdays here as well. 

It's a small club, but thats what keeps it special as they continue to book quality talents. They are great with crowd control. The best looking crowd in town! 

There sound system is amazing. The bartenders, servers, bouncers are really cool. The place gets crowded on the weekends so for your comfortability i definitely recommend the bottle service or try to arrive early. The prices are pretty reasonable compared to other places as well.
author: Martina S.

description:
Came here to celebrate my sister & husband's birthdays late December and we all had such a blast! We came with a party of 12-15 people. Since we had such a large group, we got bottled service upstairs (which also has a bar of it's own in case we wanted to order additional and/or a variety of drinks). 

This place was surprisingly crowded with fashion and great looking people - probably because of it's interior decor which is very fun. We came came with the expectation to have a great time and we did! Their DJ was great for dancing and their attendance fantastic! 

I also got to meet one of the owners who made sure we were well taken care of!
author: Claudia P.

description: We came there with group of friends (10 people), all people got inside and purchased a drinks, except two of us, the guard said we can not get inside, because it's private party. He was very rude and didn't explained why all other people inside. (Basically, he failed his job letting them in to the private party, and cmon why he asked to wait outside for 10 minutes, do they really make difference or he just enjoys watching tired people freezing outside???). Don't want to go there anymore, just in case.
author: Maria K.

description:
One of the better places in SF. 
Great music. 
Fun go-go dancer shows.
Generally good and upscale crowd.
author: Mike B.

description: In the dark shadows of a sketchy ally way in the middle of SF, is a hidden gem of a nightclub. Harlot typically hosts an EDM event called Animal Party on Friday nights. It is also a venue for select EDM DJs to play awesome small shows. Even though it can get super crowded and so hot to the point that there's "raver rain", it is such a fun party going environment. I especially love how lax the security is rather than being uptight beezys. The one feature that is pretty cool is the box-like smoking area, that gives people a chance to get a breathe of fresh air, meet new people, and indulge in various types of smoking situations. Overall, going to this spot always guarantees a good night.
author: Cristal C.

description: We are here with a friend from Korea and wanted to show him a dance club here. We had friends inside that were girls and they kicked us out of line because we were not with them. From the outside it seemed like music seemed decent enough.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
JP,

Here is a humble request. Whatever your opinion is about my review, please state them publicly. I do not appreciate receiving 'hate messages from you.

I write my reviews on yelp to record my experience, and to share with my community what I have been through truthfully, and without prejudice. Do not be rude, and make an excuse that I botched up the facts. 

I do not receive any incentive in calling a business bad or sloppy, infact, it pains me when I give a bad rating to any business.I merely want to forewarn my fellow yelpers from having a similar experience. 

Remember, you are in business because a customer exists, not the other way around. If I did not get my facts right, why did 7 of us have to go back after having had to wait for nearly 40 mins trying out different negotiation techniques with you. You made a customer cry on her bday requesting you to let her friends in. That is totally unfair! You cannot undo what is done, but it takes courage to accept when you are wrong.

You cannot force me to think that I am wrong when I am not in the wrong.I am not going to back off, just because you have an inflated ego and write messages.

Even if you think that I did not get my facts right, logically, you are still in the wrong as you did not communicate effectively what your business permits and allows as terms and policies. I do not want to be mean, but want you to exercise the same empathy and restraint I have in holding back my anger against your stupidity in writing rudely to me.

Rest assured, you will never see me again.
author: Harsha G.

description:
Do you like the condensation of hundreds of drunk peoples' hot steamy breath dripping off the ceiling, onto your head, face, and inside your drinks??? Then this is the place for you. I literally had to cover my drink the entire night w my hand and managed to get a nice juicy drop of condensed breath sweat right into my eyeball. I'm surprised I didn't lose my eye. 

As a woman, and as someone who was on the guest list, I was treated decently by security, but I saw how rude they were to pretty much everyone else. No sense of order at the door. 

I would never go back...
author: M D.

description:
I went here last Friday to see Satoshi Tomiie and the music did not disappoint.  But this place is ridiculously small.  The "dance floor" is about 10 feet by 10 feet square.  Long lines to get in and no place to sit or even stand unless you pay a ridiculous amount of money for bottle service.  Totally claustrophobic.

The crowd that night seemed to have spilled right out of their financial district offices and were there not to dance and have fun but to see and be seen.  

Never again, no matter how good the music is I can't enjoy it in this place.
author: Jan D.

description:
Had an interesting evening out to see superstar DJ Nick Warren at this place.  Great DJ, perfect sound, interesting visuals and decor.  Mystifying culture, but I accept that I was the interloper into whatever scene this place fosters.  I think people would have danced if it hadn't been so packed.  If you think an exclusive velvet rope vibe is cool, I guess this could be your place.  Personally, I'd rather see dance places use their floors to facilitate dancing rather than to set up private living rooms for 80% of the patrons to navigate around.  The crowd was super clean cut GQ, collars, ties, hyper-hetero.  Struck me as very 1980s in a self-absorbed coked up sort of way.  This is a crowd that appears to have it all- youth, wealth, looks.  But the faces- soooo serious.  Not much smiling.  

I am left to wonder if there is a Bret Easton Ellis for millennials- does anyone know?.  As a public service, should we stand outside the clubs and hand out free copies of Bright Lights Big City and American Psycho?
author: Urban A.

description:
Varying standards.

High: Impressive talent. Miguel Migs. Jeremy Olander. Maor Levi. Treat to see such names rock a relatively small space. It gets very hot and very crowded.

Low: Who wears Under Armour outside a gym? Let alone to a club? With sneakers? Show some class. Part of a drunk, pushy, disrespectful, bottle service happy contingent.

Which is all the more surprising considering a basic vodka soda is $10.

Staff is nice. Sound system remains impressive. Really want to give another star.

But the inflated ego company and inflated price drinks keeps them at two.
author: Jason B.

description:
I'm torn between what Harlot is and what it could be. I attended last night for an event that...didn't happen. At all. There were a lot of advertisements for a theme night at Harlot, and the event never materialized, so we ended up killing an hour at this tiny 'ultra-lounge-ish' place. It filled up quickly with the usual suspects, and although it seemed billed as a dance club, the floor's about the size of a decimal.

And this is where I"m torn. The decor was awesome, the music was tight, but with so many tables (for all the bottle service, I'm sure), there's no room to mix and mingle. Everyone ended up packed uncomfortably in the open areas and although they were able to get plenty of people in the door (there was a line down the block when we left), I heard several other people inside complaining that they thought this would be totally different. 

Moral of the story, Harlot tries very hard to be both a dance club and an ultra-lounge, and doesn't really succeed at either.
author: Kevin B.

description:
I love small clubs like Harlot. 
I'm trying hard to fill the void left in my heart by the closing of Club 222. This place is a start.

The vibe is an awesome twist between dark underground and elegantly European. Look up and you see antler chandeliers and renaissance aged paintings. Look down and your face is blasted with some deep body shaking bass.  
 
The smoking cage is cool too. The dim lighting and cigarette smoke begs for some seriously sexy photography. Careful with the overly clean glass walls though, I walked straight into it last time.

My one issue is the floor plan. Club 222 had a brilliant design where you could only sit down along the sides, away from dance floor. 
The benches at harlot are just in the way of serious dancers. And get ride of the chairs that are also literally in the dance floor.
author: Faisal S.

description: African American Women are not allowed!!!!!! This lounge is down the street from my job so I thought I'd give it a try. WORST DECISION EVER this establishment held us in Line for 45+ minutes! The security finally let us to the door and the cover fee was somehow different for everyone. I watched as groups of women of other races walked to the front and entered with no hassle. I had a friend (who is afghan) already in the establishment waiting for us.. He was allowed out and back in for no charge!!! However my African American friend and I were told that it was 40$ + to enter! That makes it clear to me that this establishment is prejudice! This had to have been the most unfortunate experience for me! I will never spend my money where they would treat different people so poorly!! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY WITH PREJUDICE ESTABLISHMENTS. I fell victim to this behavior and it is UNACCEPTABLE. I will be looking to higher management for an explanation
author: Jessica M.

description:
I was going to this place a lot in the past and loved it.  Last night went for my buddy's birthday.  We had a table upstairs. And although music is very loud the place has a good atmosphere and good looking people.  

The reason I removed two starts.  One is they decided to put a snow-looking paper flakes all around the floor.  People upstairs drop these flakes down from the balcony that end in people's drink.  So you have to buy another drink after that.
Number two.   For some reason they closed access to the patio for smokers.   Now it creates so much traffic in/out the door and people stumbling to smoke outside on the street.  Not very convenient.  Smoking patio was better.
author: Alex R.

description: Awesome vibe, very cozy. The ambiance is upscale & fun. And the sound system is fantastic!
author: Lisa A.

description: I really give this club zero stars out of five. I stepped outside for some fresh air when the security wouldn't let us come back inside for my best friends birthday who had a table( they never mentioned no ins and outs. Terrible customer service. It was a Sunday night and me and my boyfirend paid 50.00 to get in to an empty club and that was dead as can be.The security refused to identify himself. So whoever was working the door at 12:45am Monday august 22,2016 should be fired(and I mean all of the security because the whole security were pieces of shit and unprofessional saying "nah dawg don't tell her your name she's gonna leave a bad yelp review" well I guess everyone is going down now. I'm not new to the club scene,but I know that you should never treat paying,sober,respectful customers badly! I'm never unprofessionional. So I will tell everyone I know that HARLOT has terrible service due to their security and I will make sure that my friends and family will not patronize this club. My friends spent over $1000.00 and this is how we are treated on a dead ass Sunday! Its OK. I guess that's what's yelp reviews are for. Fuck this place. I willl NEVER RETURN to HARLOT!! Harlot will get an honest review. But I promise I will never patronize this club again and neither will my friends. I hope the club checks their security and makes them accountable for their disrespectful and unprofessional actions. I wish the club was more professional.  There is no doubt about it that I will make it my project to inform everyone of my terrible experience at Harlot. That's really how bad it was. Shame on this place. SMH! But t least we have YELP reviews... #KARMA
author: J.J. S.

description:
Harlot is one of my favorite places to go out in SF. Im from the LA area, so the clubby vibe is something I crave. Harlot gives me that, albeit in a tiny portion.

The word tiny definitely comes in when describing this club. It is VERY small (but I guess thats quite typical for san fran). I think they have only 2 tables that you can reserve for bottle service. My friends sometimes reserve these for their company outings- lots of fun.

Since it is so small, the dance floor gets very crowded and very hot. But it is a lot of fun! Every time Ive been there there has been some type of fun dj spinning EDM. 

Drinks are expensive so be sure to pregame!
author: Viktoriya Z.

description:
I had a great time at Harlot on Friday night with my 6 friends! This was my first club experience since moving to the Bay and it delivered. DJ Solomon was awesome mixing House, Pop and Hip Hop seamlessly. The music is mostly House (which is typically not my thing) but his sets of Pop and Hip Hop were so well timed and curated that I didn't even mind. I mean he played Kanye West, Elie Goulding, Destiny's Child and Young Jeezy!!! Amazing!

The atmosphere is posh. Really cool theme with indoor trees. We heard VIP is cool but by the time we arrived all tables were full. The crowd was actually pretty diverse although young (early 20s). 

The bar wasn't too much of a hassle either. 

Overall, a good experience. I'll be back!
author: Bukky E.

description:
Do you want to get your belonging stolen, that's the right place. They were able to let someone steal my jacket from the coat-checkin.

Paid 

- $20 admission
- $  4 check in my jacket and coat 
- $ 15 for a drink

Unbelievable, but I  ended up getting my jacket stolen for the coat-check. It took half an hour to talk with the manager and at he simply did not care at all. If they cannot guarantee for the safety of a jacket and a coat even when you pay them for this, you can imagine for the rest.  Whatever happens to you or to your belonging in this place they simply don't care, so do yourself a big favor, go somewhere else. There are plenty of places in SOMA where management and security are handled by serious people
author: MyName M.

description:
I just celebrated my birthday here! It was very pleasant and the vibes were very chill. Luckily, I wasn't here on an over-crowded night. I had a great time. 

The bottle service reps are very kind, Lyzza and Jeremy have been very helpful and made sure that everything was taken care of for me.

Thanks again guys!
author: Susan M.

description:
Good volume. Like the red interior and naked lady paintings. Obviously did not like the fire-code breaking crowdedness and heatstroke level temperatures. But you knew that already, Harlot, and ya did it anyway!! Interesting. 

I came here for Jeremy Olander (who i'd follow to the ends of the earth) but i'd probably not come here again because no one should be that uncomfortable whilst trying to enjoy music. If you *must* come here because one of your all-time favorite DJ's is playing, it seems like getting a downstairs table would be worth it in order to get the extra space. The upstairs bottle service area feels a little *too* exclusive...like to the point where you feel excluded from the party going on downstairs.
author: Adrienne C.

description: This place may be good but I had very bad experience at this place. I added my name to guest list three different dates and when I went there all the time they said they do not have my name on the guest list. I showed them the email confirmation but they did not allow to enter. The guy who was standing outside was very rude and said if you do not have money then go somewhere else this is not the place for you. Such an Ass****. So guys do not believe on their guest list ad that you receive through Eventbrite.
author: Josh D.

description: So the manager gives us s--t for reserving a table here and having 8 guys. We get in and there are zero people here other than the ones working here. Nice place, but in all my years of going to places, this is the first time I've been to a completely empty place on a Friday night. Pathetic!!! Check to make sure people are here, before you even think about entering. That manager should be paying us to drink at this joint. So sad! lol
author: Chris T.

description: Thank you to Harlot for being a gracious host to our Leap Sandcastle happy hour fundraiser!  Nicole was so helpful in setting up the event and even reached out to some vendors for their support.  My company has been loyal happy hour patrons of Harlot for almost 8 years, and we greatly appreciate their support in our philanthropic endeavors.
author: Janice M.

description:
I am giving this venue 2 stars because the décor is intriguing and the restroom was clean. Everything else about the place is ridiculously bad. 

I went on a Saturday night. It was extremely crowded, stuffy, miserably hot and if that wasn't bad enough something was dripping from the ceiling! I don't know if it was sewage or what but it was coming from the pipes and it was everywhere! I literally had this grime dripping onto my face and in my hair. There was no escaping it. The stuff falls from every area of the place. Fucking gross!! 

The music wasn't bad but you could not dance because it was way too packed. Being on the dance floor at all pretty much means you will be grinded on by strangers at every angle. 

Drinks were not very expensive and there really wasn't too bad of a wait.. probably because its more of a molly crowd

I would try this place again on a Thursday night maybe to avoid such a high volume of people. *If they FIX THE PLUMBING!
author: Michele M.

description:
I really wanted to like Harlot, but I'm sorry, I can't bring myself to do such a thing.

I've come here twice. The first time I went, I was excited as soon as I walked in the door because I actually heard some hip hop & pop as opposed to the repetitive house music you've heard a million other times at venues in San Francisco. But, it went downhill from there. I saw several men with white hair. If you're fine with men who are older than your father trying to get girls at their VIP tables, then that's fine for you. Whatever gets your juices flowing! I personally prefer a younger crowd. 

Speaking of the crowd, it was not diverse at all. I read the other reviews and saw that the manager can be a bit racist at times, and I totally believe it! The drinks also taste like crap and one of the bouncers there was so creepy and kept pestering me all night for my phone number. Aren't the bouncers supposed to keep the creeps out and make you feel somewhat protected? Sigh. 

I went to Harlot for the second time for a friend's birthday party. Again, not impressed. The crowd was not diverse at all, the place kind of smelled funkalicious, and the drinks didn't taste very good. I did have an okay time, though, because I pregamed and the music was good!

The ambiance is nice, the music and sound system are on point, but overall, pretty unimpressive. Third time's the charm, maybe? I'd only go back for an event, but never will I ever think, "It's the weekend! I can't wait to party at Harlot!" Try it once just to say you have, but don't expect anything amazing.
author: Michelle L.

description:
I am not a frequent visitor to this place, but I would definitely recommend it/come back myself. 

The drinks were a bit pricey, but the pour was heavy so I was more than satisified after two strong cocktails. The music was really fun and I had a blast dancing with all my friends. VIP section was inviting and again a great place to get jiggy with it. 

Overall, great experience!
author: Mimi D.

description: I love this place for Happy Hour on Fridays! Drinks are cheap, bartender is gorgeous, DJs play cool/unique music and it's in a cool location downtown. One time, they kicked me out for smoking a J inside... but I will not hold that against them.
author: Golan S.

description:
Good ambience, good music, clean club.  and a taco truck outside!  

but...UGH!  OLD, CREEPY, SOCIALLY INEPT MEN who like creeping on girls 10 - 15 years younger than them.  Stained teeth, crow's feet, and disheveled ass facial hair is gross.

This seems like a great club for singles in their mid 30's to 40's however.
author: Tina A.

description:
Harlot is a sort of fancy club/bar. They vibe that that least.
A friend insisted on bottle service while trying to impress some girls wear little more than what you'd expect. I didn't want this which somehow resulted in my horny friend paying for my drinks that night so I don't know what cost what sorry.
I guess the clientele was cool and I guess they were horrible and I guess they were normal.
So . . . .  I give this a wash

so bored . . .
author: Alexander R.

description:
Harlot ruined (part of) my birthday!! :( It was so awful that we actually left and went to 5a5 instead. After an hour of frustration (despite having bought bottle service, signing up for the guestlist, and showing up well-dressed with the appropriate male/female ratio), we actually gave up and left to go elsewhere. Here are some of the reasons why we will probably never come back (and will continue telling all our friends the same):

-Harlot decided to give away our pre-reserved table after making us wait outside for an hour: 

We had pre-reserved bottle service and a table, yet when we got there, they actually made us wait in line for an hour and then said "Oops, sorry... we're out of tables now" even though we had payment ready up front.  What's the point of reserving bottle service if the club is just going to give away your table? Also, if they're going to give away your table, why not say so immediately, instead of making the birthday girl + all of her friends wait outside in the freezing code for an hour?? Finally, we gave up and went to 5a5 (a much better / more upscale venue with better drinks, better looking people, and no drama)  instead, where we were well taken care of.

-Harlot promised our group we were on the guestlist but then we weren't:

We were promised free entry for our group of 80+ people and had emailed our list (and received confirmation that everyone was on the list). However, while still at dinner, I started getting calls from many of my friends saying they were there and apparently weren't on the list (although we had received supposed "confirmation").....

-Incredibly non-helpful /rude staff: 

The staff was rude, even though we arrived dressed to the nines (girls decked out in cocktail dresses, and we had some guys in suits even) with the appropriate guy/girl ratio AND had bought a table (until they gave it away). I was literally near tears and about to cry from dealing with the rude staff (who were NOT helpful nor even apologetic about their screw-ups)... seriously the worst experience I've had on a birthday or ever in SF. 

If not for our entire group moving to the classier 5a5 a, it would have been a complete disaster / failed birthday. (Thank you 5a5.) Even so, it was hard rounding up our rather large group to inform everyone of a last-minute venue change, since there were over 80 people in our party and not everyone arrived at the same time.  I've never had to wait in line like this at a lounge (and especially not with bottle service)....I've decided that I'll probably go back to sticking with venues whose owners I know or promoters that I know will take care of me from now on.

Summary: 

BOYCOTT Harlot (unless you want to encourage places like this). I'm telling all of my friends / fellow Yelpers (including the 80+ of us that dealt with this awful treatment that night) to post reviews and avoid giving this place our business!
author: Sarah T.

description: Two words:  Douche Bags.  The worst, seriously.  I love having a lovely & enjoyable Happy Hour at beautiful Salt House...... & then having to use the shared (ugh) bathroom that is split with this Bridge & Tunnel nightclub.  Drunk over-dressed women in towering heels who puke in the bathroom?  Um, no thanks.
author: Jamie R.

description:
Came here ~a month ago for Matisse and Sadko

I think that unless you have a table, this place gets uncomfortably packed. Even upstairs where the "VIP" is, it's too crowded and screams fire hazard. 

EWW: Be prepared to be dripping in your own sweat too. 

To my fellow girls who like to dance on top of things: there's a nice little spot against the wall towards the DJs left where you can dance *alone*. it's elevated and close to the speakers. Just don't go up there too drunk, or you'll fall on whomever is sitting in the seats below you
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Been here several times and I have always enjoyed my night. Good drinks, good vibe , good crowd. The bouncers  really take care of you and are very friendly- well maybe because I'm a female;)
May come back here again soon.
author: Claudine V.

description: I almost forgot about this place. Came a while back for a private party. Spent most of the time upstairs watching the people below. Good bar area, and space to lounge. Im more of an observer than an instigator in these types of places so Im more than happy to spectate. Would I normally come here just to party? Maybe, maybe not depending on the circumstances, but I seem to enjoy the more mellow these days so if they ever have those nights, it maybe more my calling. However it's a nice space and the back alley locale gives it that speakeasy-esque entry.
author: Kim N.

description: Kind of hidden venue but its really nice inside it has two floors and is very well decorated, went on a Sunday night and it may as well have been Saturday cause it was packed. DJ played a lot of hip hop and didn't disappoint but the dance space on the 1st floor is really small but the bartenders were nice and the drinks were worth it.
author: Carmen L.

description: Rude bouncers! At the end of the night, tried to grab the drink right out of my hand while I was talking to a friend. No "excuse me, we are closing, you need to return your drink to the bar". At first I didn't know who was grabbing my drink so I didn't let go, until he rudely kept pulling on it and telling me I can't have it.
author: Jim R.

description: Nice big spacious venue to host,attend and network events .
author: Priyanka L.
