description: This place sucks! Bad crowd and thee worst bouncers ever! I feel ashamed for the headliners to come here and play! It's a trend setting crowd. Like a high school crowd :/
author: Hector E.

description:
Came here for a Saturday night Jeremy Olander set and this is probably one of the better bottle service experiences I've ever had in my life.  

I was really impressed at the staff here and how on top of everything they were. The mixers were always rotated and filled and ice bucket always full.  Jules from security made it clear we could depend on him for any need. It was nice having a space to dance, but also relax away from the crowds.  Really awesome sexy, lounge feel! 

Great venue for music, just enough room to dance, but be prepared to get a little sweaty.  Can't wait to come back ;)
author: Allegra I.

description:
So went there last night hoping it will be better than other few times I've been there, but no, unfortunately it seems to me that its just getting worse. We got to the club pretty early, around 10:30 with about 10 people in front of us. You would think that we would get in pretty quick, but no it took us about 40 minutes to get in with a $30 cover. Club's personnel is not friendly at all to say the least, and it seems that they are doing you the biggest favor in the world letting you in. We were a party of 8 with 7 of the party being girls and I was very disappointed at how we were treated.

After getting inside, the club was already pretty packed, and in the next hour got supper packed, making it close to impossible to dance or get to the bar. I understand that Harlot needs to make money, but come on, filling your club over capacity does not make anybody happy and ruins everybody's night. 

In the middle of the night the speakers on the first floor stopped working for about 20 minutes, pretty incompetent if you would ask me.

And last but not least is the clubs security, which seems to be non existent. Not only they let everybody in the club no matter how drunk or under dressed you are, but they also don't supervise what is going on on the clubs floor. Drunk people stumbling and falling on the floor dragging people with them, people that should be kicked out, brawls breaking out between guys by the bar. Pretty ghetto... 

Few words to Harlot's management, guys you have a pretty small club that could be very enjoyable to be in. Get it right before its too late, seriously its not that hard!
author: Oleg Z.

description: Been to Harlot a bunch of times & I love this place! The people who work there are always supper nice and friendly, Nicole is the best bartender ever, and the DJs are amazing.
author: Shelley M.

description: Great place, been there yesterday did the bottle service, vip section is located on the second floor so I m u can chill if ur tired from dancing. Tons of hot girls, nice sound system and laser light make this place a pretty good Saturday night spot. One star off for a very small bathroom with a very long line :)
author: Alex L.

description: Paid $650 for bottle service and seating near the tiny dance floor.  This place was okay, the dance floor is very small.
author: Charmaine T.

description: The door man is ridiculous. There was a woman throwing up and he let her back in?  However, me the DD for my friends went out side to check on him and refused to let me back in. I don't understand how they can hire people that can't tell the difference between sober and drunkness.
author: Yelp Bunny Advocate G.

description:
Sexy vibe, good music, and cool bouncers who can appreciate a big butt and a smile.

We didn't stay here long enough to enjoy the people scenery but loved the zebra chairs and sleek artwork I would hang on my walls. 

The layout was nice. Simple bar and lounge. You can't go wrong with that formula.

I will return.

RECOMMEND if you like sexy, dark, and LA-inspired lounges.
author: Betty N.

description: Please avoid it.The worst night club ever in sf .very bad altitude from everybody works up there and the worst are the security guys up there .they are totally racists and mean . there drinks are retarded too .never recommend .please avoid it
author: Mohsen A.

description:
Harlot is my #1 club choice in the city. I live in SoMa and there are a lot of options to chose from when it comes to clubbing. Especially since so many of them are walking distance. I continue to try new places but Harlot keeps on bringing me back! 

Things to love:

-No cover for males or females
-Great DJs (95% of the time)
-Sexy burlesque elevated dancers (the boys in our group love this as they wait for drinks)
-Cool decor
-People are usually very dressed up in sexy dresses or guys in blazers or collared shirts

Things to watch out for:

-Get there early if you want to dance as the dance floor is pretty small and it gets crowded
-Skip the upstairs VIP. There is never anyone up there. Super boring.
-Don't try to dance on the window sills like the burlesque dancers, you will get your hand slapped by the bouncers

Oh and don't forget to stop by the gourmet Crepe food truck down the block on your way home for some late night munchies!
author: Danielle R.

description:
Went here for new years eve and turned out to be an okay bar to hang at, but I've experienced better...to start off with, the cover kept changing (ranged from 100.00 to free) so that seemed a bit sketch though I don't know if that just had to do with the time we arrived/gender ratio in the bar.  The worse part though was that dj was playing very chunky electronica music that was hard to dance to all night long =/

Anyways, based on this experience I probably wouldn't return unless I was guaranteed it would be a freakin' awesome dj
author: Emily W.

description:
All of you Negative Nancy's writing bad reviews, that is ONE PERSON that is completely an ass (from what I hear). Fortunately, he was on vacation when I went to Harlot and I had a fun time! 

So for the doormen, they are AWESOME guys, the best! Love them! The club is crowded, but totally manageable! Had a great time!

Just know, Jeremy is the owners friend and isnt going anywhere soon and just try and deal with one of the other doormen!
author: Debra L.

description: Its a pretty cool party spot, they have a nice VIP area upstairs otherwise it gets kind of packed 90 degrees, and slightly ghetto I must say. Definitely the type of club you would go with a big group of people rather than a couple girl friends to grab drinks.
author: Melanie C.

description:
OMG look, there's Moby outside of Harlot. Oh, wait, that's just the bald douchebag of a bouncer.

We get it, you want to maintain Harlot as a hip and swanky club as it once was. But here's a reality check - you are NOT that anymore. And you'll never get there if you continue employing such deploring behavior at the door. You are not a Marquee or an  XS in Vegas. You are in front of a parking lot on a dingy street.

So what was my experience?

Our party of about 15 people, almost even number of girls:guys, all dressed to the nines, wanted to go out dancing on a Friday nite. We were all in a good mood after spending a few hours at the District. So for whatever reason we chose Harlot (I've been a here a couple of times before). As with any large party, we got to Harlot within 10 minutes of each other. The "privileged" few entered the club, while the other people got stuck outside around 11.

Ok, so there was no cover, and not a soul in sight outside, and the inside of the club was empty (according to my peeps who were inside). So Mr.Moby tells us that he can't let us enter because were 3 guys and 1 girl. We were like, we already have our group inside full of girls and guys. Apparently, that did not help, instead Mr Moby recommended to get a table service. SERIOUSLY? REALLY?  Do you think this is the first club we are ever going to in our lives? Buddy, first off there's nobody inside, there are 15 people about to give you a shitload of business but you decide to hold us up?  Charge us a cover for god's sake if that works for you. 

And if that wasn't enough, he happily let some other people inside. I hate, hate, hate to pull the R card especially in SF, but man, this was pretty close. Especially after seeing the way he was letting other people inside. And of course, I'm not even going to start with the rude attitude issues. Again, you are not in Vegas or NY where there;s a line around the block to get inside. 

Anyway, we tried to be nice and negotiate and it did not work, so we called our party out and went to 111 Minna - paid a $5 cover and had a blast! In the mean time, Mr Moby and his bunch at Harlot lost at least $1000 worth of immediate business, a really bad yelp review, and a permanent boycott of Harlot by 15 people. So awesome job Mr Moby, way to go!
author: Sid A.

description:
I had the displeasure of going to Harlot a few months back, but only thought to write the review now, because some friends reminded me of how much fun we didn't have.

A close friend invited me and a few others to go to Harlot with him to see a deep house DJ that I had never heard of. I enjoy deep house, so I was on board with going, but had no expectations for the club itself. For someone with no expectation, boy was I disappointed.

From the outside, the club is nothing to scream about. We were using our phone's GPS to find the place, but had to ask for directions because the entrance to the club is in an alleyway between two buildings, next to an open ditch, bordering an construction site. Inside, the scene isn't much better. Like many SF venues, the interior is a narrow hole in the wall, with double tall ceilings. Above the bar and dance floor, there is a small upstairs VIP lounge/balcony. On the floor there is limited seating and the dance floor is all naked cement. In the back of the room is the DJ booth, which overlooks the hot, sweaty masses.

Pipes leak on the ceiling, annoyingly drop down onto the dance floor. The crowd is mostly fat, balding men who have just got off of work in the business district. The drinks are way overpriced, some girl tried to fight me because she thought I had pushed her, and it is constantly overpacked. This is not a cool place and not my scene.
author: Kevin Y.

description:
I've been here more times than I can count, and have never had a problem getting in regardless if I had girls or guys with me. I was here for a friend's party last Friday and the DJ was great, super fun music and not TOO crowded (private party). It's super dark in here but has a really mysterious and sensual vibe with the dark lights, black seats, dancing girls on the sides and the curtains all over.

The doorguys are fine (not friendly not mean) the bartenders are cool and don't water down your drinks and it's an all over cool vibe. Sure there's the random off night or so but you can't base your entire review just cuz YOU had a bad time. I've come here for private parties, costume parties, birthdays, industry parties, band parties, free parties..all have been a blast no matter what crowd I've been with!
author: Diana R.

description:
My friends and I reserved a table, yet it still took us 30+ minutes to get in.
The bouncers were pretty douchy and doesn't seem to have a clue what they are doing.  

The ambience on the inside is pretty good. 
Probably wouldn't go back again unless friends are throwing a party there or something.
author: Mindy H.

description: The host is a bald guy who is like the meanest and rudest guy in SF. The music was loud and the drinks were limited. Not exactly my recommendation for a night out
author: Chirayu W.

description: I came here last night after 2 years. It was a Friday night and there is no cover for ladies but men was $20. Prepare to bring cash cause they don't take credit card at the door. We went in and the place looks the same since they first opened which is quiet a long time ago. Hint hint... The place is dated and old and need some remodeling. I had a nice time until they switch DJ and Lady Sha started to DJ. She turned up the volume so high that I immediately left the dance floor to find another area where the music is blaring! Say close to a 130 decibel... All of our ears were hurting, if we stayed there any longer, I think we'd lose our hearing. I'Il be back but I'll make sure DJ Lady Sha ain't playing cause she sucks! Almost lost my hearing hence 2 stars were given.
author: Sue L.

description:
Harlot AKA 46 Minna if you/yr promoter is too cool for school.

Normally I dont do the super-clubs but 46 Minna is a good time for sure. I've gone mostly on Thursdays & Saturdays for house music, and the place is always super loud (bring earplugs) and brimming with people getting their dance on. 

The ambiance is pretty cool, nice and dark with lazers and projected images on ribbons of silk. Drinks are pricey so I'll usually ask a cutey to buy one for me. I usually wear jeans and sneakers but if yr feeling particularly stylish, its better to dress more cute than just casual, although casual totally flies.
author: Jenny C.

description: Awesome parties! Great place for tutu Tuesday and Friday happy hour. Fri and Saturday is a good party and fun crowd!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Shaughni N.

description: I used to go to Harlot when I worked in downtown SF. It is a very cool looking bar, the staff was always great. I always thought it was a little small for trying to go for a club type atmosphere. They have a smallish dancefloor.
author: Michael C.

description:
Cece said it best: "... they transplanted a tacky, STD-ridden slice of the LA clubbing scene to my beloved San Francisco. " hahahaha! So true!

If you are considering going here and have standards in terms of crowd, atmosphere, music selection, quality of acoustics, lighting, decor etc.. then THANK ME for posting this review and for steering you away. You will have MUCH more fun heading down 2 blocks and going to Temple. 

This place is too rowdy for just a quick drink and too sketchy/annoying for an entire night out. Dropped by for a bit since it was free cover but quickly left. 

Funny note: There was some creepy guy  selling shellfish and ritz crackers right next to the coat check stand. It did NOT look sanitary and he had used kleenex all around the food. 

Only pluses: Cheap(er) drinks, no cover, friendly staff
author: Kathy S.

description: Wow! Was awesome! Great place, beautiful people ang good music. Me and my friends had a great time... Defiantly will come back soon (((:
author: Sonia S.

description:
Its a relatively small space but the music is usually pretty good...  If you are doing bottle service and get a table upstairs you have a private bar and dance floor.  Girls for girls night out bottle service in the loft lets you party and see everything and keep the douchebags out (except for the specifically invited douchebags. lol)

The main dance floor can get quite crowded making dancing difficult but there is always something interesting going on from the go-go dancers (not sure I would call them that as they didn't dance they just posed in suggestive poses where tight red latex outfits) to the random club goers jumping up into the recessed windows dancing until they fall down or security kicks them out.

I'm not sure if I would recommend Harlot as the destination for a couple of guys looking to have a good time and chase girls as this place is not big enough for the odds to be in your favor.  I see Harlot as more of an event destination birthday, company outing, or celebration of some sort where you can take advantage of the loft bottle service tables.  otherwise there are bigger better choices...
author: Antoine V.

description:
I came here on Saturday night with my boyfriend and seven friends. We arranged for bottle service to celebrate my 25th Birthday. After reading the reviews for this venue, I was worried that my friends and I were about to endure a complicated evening. We even had alternatives picked out in case we experienced any poor treatment. 

However, my friends and I had an amazing time here! We arrived around 9:45p; there was no line, all of the bouncers were friendly and Sarah was an AMAZING host. She was extremely nice, welcoming, and helpful; she helped me secure a great table on the main floor. My group and I had absolutely no issues the entire night.

The music throughout the night was awesome! Loved that I could dance to "Call Me Maybe". The decor is also really nice. 

Overall, I had a fabulous Birthday at Harlot! I had a blast here, and all of my friends had a great time.
author: Melissa W.

description:
My good friend was looking for a new club to go to with good music and this place came to mind. 
The bouncers were really nice to us 3 girls and 2 guys and let us in for free on a saturday night. Is understandable that they want a higher ratio or girls to guys. 
The music was really good and the decor inside was nice as well. 
My friends had a blast here. 
This place is a nice change of pace compared to the Marina or Polk st.
author: Smiley H.

description:
Yes. The guy who looks like MOBY (Jeremy MGR).  As other reviews have already stated.  That dude acts like he is the president.  He works the door.  RUDE, ARROGANT, CONDESCENDING.

My friend warned me about this guy before we got there.  I was told by my friend that he always gives people a tough time.  I didnt think nothing of it until we started to talk to him.  Wow, spot on..This guy is a class act.  As another reviewer said he is "EXTREMELY RUDE and condescending".

As the reviewer before me mentioned "racist".  That could very well be a possibility.  It would explain a lot.  

He is like used car salesman trying to FORCE us to buy bottle service bc we had more than 10 people with us.  He would not let us in, unless we bought the downstairs $950 bottle service.  Supposedly the other tables were taken which were much cheaper.  THERE WAS ABOSLUTELY NO ONE IN THE CLUB....Why cant you let Young, Properly Dressed, 50/50 male female ratio, professionals in????

He continued being very rude.   He asked why didnt we call to get a table.  I didnt know its required to get a table to go into the club.  Especially when we were pretty much first in line and no one was in the club...EMPTY...Jeremy kept pushing the tables, like he gets a bonus or something???  

Done with Jeremys arrogance, decided to move all the people to JOHN COLLINS just down the way on Minna....WAY Better.. Pls people do not be a patron to this place. 

Jeremy is mentioned many times in the Yelp reviews, all which so far are all negative.  I am surprised he still works there.  Owners must not care about the reviews and the people who represent them.  I actually read the reviews previous to going here and its all true.

Final Review on Harlot:  Boycott
Alternative in the Area:  John Collins a block away.
author: Andrew J.

description:
HARLOT AND JEREMY HATES ASIANS!


After reading reviews and checking the place out for myself, I would confirm that this place is very suspect for being racist.  JEREMY the bald guy with thick rimmed glasses, treated our Asian group like crap.  Rude condescending, and not helpful.  He made every effort and excuse to try to deny us from going in.  Bottled serivice required....pfffft...no one is freakn in the club..let us just buy our own drinks.

While caucasions head right on in, with no problem.

They might as well have a sign that says "NO COLORS ALOUD". 

Boycott this racist low class place.
author: Andrew J.

description:
First night in SF for a weekend getaway and my girlfriends took me here. Their friends got a table here for the night but by the time we got ate, got dress, and pre-game, it was already past midnight. So we stayed on the 1st floor of Harlot the entire time, didn't bother with the table service upstairs. Very nice bouncers! They were super sweet and funny, getting in was no problem. +1 star for NO COVER! :) 

The dancefloor leaves something to be desired. Can be bigger, more spacious with a higher DJ spin table. The bar was my favorite, just because the bartenders move fast here and we got our drinks within minutes of waiting. There are seating areas across from the bar, which I guess can classify Harlot is a lounge but definitely less lounge, more club.

The DJ sucked that night. Definitely check their website to see who is spinning. DJ went from 80s to Top 40 to Mo-town. Sorry, that does not get me going but with a great group of friends, I still had a blast at Harlot!
author: Qui C.

description:
I literally gave these directions to my friend to find this place:

"It's on Mission street, but not really on Mission street, between first and second street. You'll see a huge blue corporate building. You see that shady alleyway, yeah that one, go in it, wrap around the block, past the construction yard, and you'll find a dark door."

Indeed, this place cannot be more hidden from the public. But it is worth the find because The Harlot offers a unique experience that is filled with a black-accented interior, sexual paintings and ornaments, and a spacious dance floor which I'm sure gets quite wild in the late evenings. 

Being the happy-hour baron that I am, my visit was limited to the bar and couches which was pleasant and casual, despite the raucous surroundings.

Tap was $3. Don't mind if I do.
author: Nick A.

description:
zOMG this place needs an ala Gordon Ramsey makeover!!!

I happen to come by for a mixer event in the evenings. We got a cool lively crowd for the event. That's the good part. The downside is the place for the event. It had a somewhat outdated goth ambiance, not the Rick Owens kind of goth, more like a DIY, random, distorted dark ambiance. 

I do get that the place is supposed to mimic underground looks for a financial district, but it somehow had a few random attractions such as the Florescent lit lounge bar sofas, cowhide vintage chairs, antlers sticking out, a modern rustic bar section, a little smoking patio, a section for dance performances on the corner, and a quasi-ok painting. 

So far I did like the mezzanine, had nice furniture and was well lit whereas the rest of the place required night-vision goggles to chat with  guest and friends.

 As for the DJ who played for our event, I think his playlist was not right for a corporate mixer, nor was his volume control; people are like trying to raise their voices just to converse with each other. I was opining to myself that the DJ seriously needs an overhaul makeover; a few of my friends thought the same too lol. He should consider following SPIN, Pitchfork, Kitsuné Maison, Beatport, SoundCloud, or any music hub that's ongoing with trends.

Overall I think the place needs a makeover. The good thing is the party ran smoothly, but it would be cool if Harlot did read my honest feedback, since it was quite hard to distinguish the ambiance for their place.
author: Pierre B.

description:
Always love this place because of my fav hostess in SF is here. She always took good care of us, got us good table, and made sure we were always happy. 

Small club, lounge like, VIP upstair, 3 stalls washroom for the ladies is a plus! Reasonable table charge compares to other alike. Definitely a nice place for celebration.
author: Manda Bear B.

description: Celebrated my 30th last night at Harlot. What an amazing experience! The club is very nice and bottle service is my recommendation. While it may be pricey, it's worth it. We were doted on all throughout the night with refills of our mixers, constant wipe downs of our table and frequent check in's from our cocktail waitresses. I'm coming back again soon. Thanks Harlot!
author: Mandy W.

description:
I've been here a few times after work for a quick drink, but some of my friends and I decided to come here on a Friday night out on the town.  It was busy, and it was funny to see a coat check and "VIP" sections.... But, then again, the whole club scene in SF is a little bizarre to me. 

At any rate, I went to the bar to buy a round of drinks.  I ordered a Kettle One gimlet, a Kettle One and soda, and a Makers on the rocks.  The gimlet is where we really started having problems.  She gave me a Kettle soda, and a Kettle tonic instead.... so I asked her again for a Kettle One gimlet.  I watched her make it, and there was no basil, no lime juice, no mixing.  After TWO times of asking her to remake it, I gave up and just took whatever she served me.

It was a fun night out, and the venue is pretty cool.... it's really dark with provocative art, and antler chandeliers.  The music was pretty good too, but I was just so turned off by the bar tender.  It's not like I was asking for a specialty cocktail. 

Maybe if you're going to put new bartenders to man the bar, try it for a Monday or Tuesday night, when there is room for error.
author: Taylor L.

description:
Extremely pretentious management and staff, who are inexperienced at operating a lounge/bar/club. 
Uniquely and well decorated, very cool in that aspect.  
Patrons are not permitted to sit in any seats unless they purchase bottle service. 
Staff is rude. 
Would not recommend.
author: J L.

description: Although I thought I was going to like this place after stopping in for their happy hour one day after work, I found out yesterday that the happy hour is apparently unpredictable -- they want your business when they want your business -- and if you happen to walk in when the door is open but they aren't serving, they are pretty rude about telling you they aren't open.  Unfriendly is how I would describe it.
author: Paul S.

description:
Harlot is alright. I have been here quite a few times for various events, open bars and for a friend's birthday. The times I've been here for a free event or open bar were great! I really like the decor.

FREE Nights:

"The Rumble" used to be held here one Wednesday a month before they moved locations. The vibe was chill and relaxed. I even won an ladybug ipod docking station one time, but that's more props to The Rumble than Harlot. During these parties, usually two bands would play and there'd be a DJ. It was never too crowded either. It was a really intimate spot to see a live band!

I've also been to a Metrowize open bar party here. It was super crowded, and one (actually two) of my friends got way too trashed. The indoor club security were actually pretty cool, and helped me get her to the back area to chill out for a bit. One security guy offered to get her water, but forgot, so then one of the managers came by and gave us some trouble for being in the back. My friend was crazy drunk and making a scene, and the bouncers really didn't give us any trouble or hassles. Major props for that because honestly, at the time, she did kinda deserve what she could have had coming to her.

Typical night:

Now, the only time I've been here for a typical night, was on a Saturday for a friend's birthday. This was our last stop of the night, and we rolled in pretty deep. No cover charge. Everyone got in fine, but it was *way* too crowded. 

The layout of this place is weird. There's tons of big chairs and low tables in the middle of the floor, so there's not really any place to move. This is fine on weeknights, but on a weekend, when it's packed, this is really obnoxious. There's nowhere to move, nowhere to dance and you're tripping over people and furniture constantly. 

The DJ wasn't very good either. His transitions were awful, and halfway through a song, the music would just abruptly stop, there'd be a long pause, and then an entirely new tempo/genre would come on. Come on, it's all about beat-matching! Or at least, continuous music. My ipod can do a better job.

I don't know. This place isn't bad considering it's got no cover charge, but I'd skip it on weekends. It's nice chill bar for weeknights or private events. The drinks are kinda pricey too, but it's the type of place where'd you'd expect that.
author: Rebecca G.

description: I love how small and intimate this place seems compared to a huge club.  The music was great and my friends and I had a fantastic time.  The venue is much more manageable than some of the other clubs. You don't lose your friends here and the dance floor doesn't turn into a mosh pit. Will definitely be returning!
author: Alice Z.

description:
Thanks to all for saving me the aggravation of coming here. J must be
roommates with that blonde hippy fat lump over at the Fillmore. Ugh!
SF deserves better..
author: Michelle L.

description:
Ok, came here for Halloween cuz it was free to get in....definately a white bar, thought it might have just been that first time I was here, nope, even with costumes on, I could see everyone but my friends and I were white. 

And what the hell is with the bouncers, they were letting in a ratio of 4 guys to 1 girl.....isn't it suppose to be the other way around?? Was definately a sausage fest. This bar is kinda out of my way, so there's a very good chance I'll never go back. What can I say, I like diversity.
author: Megan L.

description:
Regarding the negative reviews:

I didn't look at the reviews closely but I'm surprised at the negative reviews. Many have stated that table service was required to get in (but if Harlot actually does it, they really only have like 5 tables in there... so it'd definitely IS lame if they did that). Also, regarding the racist doorman, my girlfriends and I did not have a problem getting in and we were probably the most ethnic group in there.

My experience:

My coworkers and I decided to go here on Friday night for a girls night. Got in super easy. There was no cover charge at all! Drinks are around $10 for a shot. There's a bar on the left when you walk in and the lounge area to the right. At the end of the place is the mini-dance floor. LOVE the ambiance of the place - great gothic decor.

The DJ was amazing (whoever was the DJ on Jan 27) - please bring him around often! We danced all night. The bass to the right is hella loud so if you don't want your ears to die, dance closer to the bar. The crowd wasn't at all pretentious and no one gave us a hard time. 

By the time we left, which was around 1:30 AM, the place was still packed. We all had a really great time there and plan to bring our friends there, too. Harlot, I hope all the negative reviews are wrong because us girls would love to be regular customers!
author: Angela K.

description:
Harlot is one of those unique places in San Francisco that I think caters to a lot of people.  You have the professional crowd, they host A LOT of Happy Hour events, then you have the trendy a little "I am too cool" scene that pops in from time to time, but mostly I feel that the crowd is pretty diverse and looking for a good time.

Bar : The bar is a good size if you include upstairs and the drink costs aren't horrible for this type of place.  I haven't had any bad experiences with the bar tenders except maybe in the speed department when it's really busy.  

Music : They always seem to have good DJs rolling through this place.  I have had many a good night dancing on the crowded dance floor (a little small) and enjoying all the good music.

Overall : A spot I definitely like to go to so long as the line isn't horribly long :)
author: Ed F.

description: Olander last night was amazing! Venue is a little small and gets a little sweaty. Quickly. Drinks are expensive but that was expected. Great sound system. Overall good first impression of Harlot. Be back soon for another show!
author: Ruthie G.

description:
Harlot
SF: SOMA
December 31, 2010 - January 1, 2011
3 Stars

This is where I spent my new year.  $40 at the door and there was a wait.  The Drinks were $11 a piece for a plastic 12oz drink (expected).  One Bartender was pouring me thick drinks though.  The music was great a times and awkward at others.  The table service section is not well placed.  It is really hard to navigate thorough without running/being pushed into Victorian chair.  If I have a bar, I am going to have caged pathway to the bathroom.  There was a champagne toast which was nice and easy to get.  Also they gave out Voss water at the end of the night.  In Totem, the $40 cover was almost worth it.  [aside] The smoking cage is not a good idea.
author: Leonard L.

description:
LOL...oh man...all I have to say is "DOOR MAN!!! DOOR MAN!!!"

Oh god the douche at the front...you know the guy who's balding so he shaved his head and now looks like Moby? And since he looks funny he feels he has to dress funny to play the part. Spray painting his suit with random colors. LOL

Listen here Jeremy, I know 23,432 persian guys that are 5 foot 3 come up to you each night and make you feel important in hopes of walking into this jail cell of a lounge, but most of us have traveled the world and partied at actual nightclubs. So please take that iPad you look at while you're standing at the front and slap it over your face. Oh and the "part-owner" that walks around and looks like Bob Saget trying to be cool hoping to God a hot young chick would give him attention, you are a douche as well. LOL Go home and raise your kids Danny Tanner  =)

HAHHAHAHA on another note there is only a 10 X 10 area to dance...but the bartenders and the security guy Renee are nice people. 

PEACE!!
author: Sawltee F.

description: I asked around for a high end (non ghetto) club/lounge for a friends birthday party. I was pleasantly surprised at how nice this club was and how the people that attended were at  a different level. They were people that had real jobs and wore pants that didn't go below their behinds.. needless to say we all had a great time. I booked a table for a very cheap price. Their special events department was super professional and provided great service. I will definitely be back and I always recommend this to friends.
author: Eva Y.

description:
A few months ago, I wouldn't have batted my eyelashes twice at a chance for free drinks; I had no rent and a stressed out work environment that enabled me to rationalize my sporadic drinking habits, because they almost never happened. 

I made a special reservation for WWDC in the beginning of June, as I am a total nerd and love them just as much as I love to play video games/WoW. Beau G. asked if I wanted to crash their parties for free booze and possible appetizers, which just added to how awesome this all was. I'm not an iPhone application developer, but dammit I will drink like one. 

On the first night, Monday, Harlot hosted a big party. Beau and I got in, no cover, received drinks and went upstairs to observe all the geeks and nerds that either tried hitting on girls or spoke excitedly of various technologies. I guess you could say we were nerd-watching. 

Other than the fact that it's an alright space, I'd much more prefer it for a cocktail party for a wedding or something, because at least then you can control the amount of sweaty individuals invading your personal space...good LORD it was hot in there. Not just because of the gorgeous bartenders, but let's just remember that: enclosed spaces + people who more than likely haven't showered in a week = bad.

Then I walked into the smoking area to get some fresh air, borrowed a cigarette from an unsuspecting, obviously unlucky guy, and left. 

That unlucky guy later turned into being my boyfriend. See what smoking does to you? It's not just your health you should be worried about anymore! You'll start dating crazy women!

3 stars.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Harlot is my place of choice when going out. Yes I've been there more times then I should talk about, but I keep coming back for these reasons...good service, good music/ambiance and good crowd.  Once you become a regular you're treated like VIP all the time! 

The place runs the gamut from Hell's Angels to Saudi Sheik...literally. i think that gives it some fun diversity. Security is always on top of it, so don't be worried. I've never experienced a problem there. The door guy can seem like an ass at times, but come on people, it's his job to be selective. After all, you don't want every East Bayer or bridge and tunneler in the place or you wouldn't come. Am I not right? Probably helps that I'm a girl, but hey guys, it is what it is, bring a girl with you and you wont have a problem. 

I've had several tables here and the girls are hot and always on their game! 

I've been to all the clubs in the city and I'm never disappointed at Harlot. They continue to bring in new promoters and events, which keeps it fresh.
author: Yvette C.

description:
Clubbing isn't really my thing, but when my friend wanted to have her girls' night out birthday celebration here, I put on my dancing shoes and got drunk. 

I view all clubs the same and this one definitely filled the stereotypes: a douchey bouncer (complete with iPad), pretentious vibe, slutty girls, overpriced drinks, and crammed dance floor. 

That said, I had a blast losing my hearing and dignity on the dance floor. As the night wore on I was convincing myself that I was a good enough dancer to climb into the window sill and shove the other girl out (really just a ribcage in heels). Thankfully I got sidetracked and it didn't happen.
author: Meg I.

description:
- $10+ drinks

PROS:
- Ladies can get in free w/ relatively no questions/hassle
-  Dance-able top-40 jams playing
- Interesting artwork all over (depicting an appreciation for the female form)
- Crowd dressed nicely, I saw some men clad in suits

CONS:
- Drinks = not very strong
-  Small dance floor
- With 30 minutes until close, guy friends could not get in for discounted price, still $20 entry
author: Stephanie T.

description:
What can i say - i'm a sucker for plush couches, dark arts, and an attractive crowd. This place had it all every time i've been here. Very cool design, with dark sexy art on the walls, tall ceiling, leather and plush velvet couches, and beautiful people. I love that i can come here for an after-work drink and stay for a late-night dance... it starts off loungy with nice talkable level of music, and winds up to a club-like level later in the night.

The place: perfect location; great design and ambiance
The staff: hard-working bartenders; grown-up crowd
The bottom line: i like
author: IkkI K.

description:
Every time I want to dance all night, I go to Harlot!
Every time I want to hang out with beautiful crowd, I go to Harlot!
In general...if I want to have a fun night out, I go to Harlot!:)
And even if I go somewhere else, I end up in Harlot to finish my night in style!
Harlot is an upscale yet comfortable place that offers both fun and sophistication - perfect combo for the nicest SF crowd. The music is great and no crazy lines at the bar - all you need for non-BS night! :)

And if you happen to have a table service here, double all the nice things said above and add great people that will take care of you both at the door and the best service at the table. I love to bring my brides-to-be here for their bachelorette nights and we are always guaranteed to have an unforgettable night! ;) YAY for HARLOT!!!
author: Anna B.

description: 20$ to get in, nice nightclub !
author: Julien F.

description:
After years of clubbing, my days of waking up Sunday mornings with a stamp on my hand are pretty much behind me... unless 1) the club really is hot or 2) it's a special occasion. Last night was a special occasion.  We went to Harlot to celebrate my sister-in-law's birthday.  I haven't been to San Francisco in years, and never as an adult, so I was eager to see how the city's nightlife scene panned out.

We got there sort of early (around 10:30 p.m.), but the club was already starting to fill up.  Inside, Harlot was medium sized with three large, strange paintings prominently featured: one of two women with strange feathered headdresses looking at each other and wearing undies; another had with a gladiator-meet-viking dude standing ominously in the foreground and a woman sitting in the corner with her hand outreached slightly behind him; a third painting on the main stage area was that of a naked woman covered in what appeared to be blood and a bird leering behind her.  From the ceiling, antler chandlers hung and on the floor, people with glowsticks, glow bracelets, and various battery-operated jewelry danced their hearts out.  At any one time, you could catch at least four to eight brides-to-be determined to cash-in on free drinks for the night and their girls equally drunk.

The music at first was questionable at best.  As someone who loves club and techno music, I still wasn't sure where the DJ was going with his choices.  It seemed disjointed. He even played a version of Tupac's "California" that was so sped up, it made me feel like I was suffering from tourettes. Watching people dance to it immediately made me feel I shouldn't be there. It felt more like 2001 than 2011 and I longed for a chill lounge with good wine rather than a club with wack versions of former hits and pushy people who didn't mind knocking my drink around.
To add insult to injury, they didn't even knock my drink for a good reason.  I mean, if your going to bump into me, at least bump into me on beat. My word!  At least the drinks were cheap and the bartenders were fast.  That was a plus.

I had all but written the club until I got to the second floor which was roped off for V.I.P.  It was much less crowded and decorated with pristine white chairs and couches in further-roped-off private lounge areas.  On the white walls hung fresh, fun artwork of various city skylines that completed the space rather than overtook it like the giant paintings did to the first floor.  However, from that vantage point looking down, even those paintings looked better.

Right around midnight is when the chicks in sailor-suit bikinis (complete with sailor hats) got to work.  Slathered in glitter lotion and wearing cheap, wide fishnet stockings, they 'danced' in faux window ledges on the first floor.  And again, I use the term 'dancing' loosely.  It looked more like  vogue-ing or what I imagined Vanna White would look like if she had fallen on hard times and needed a new gig. 

The bright side is that once they came out, the DJ completely stepped his game up.  In fact, the DJ single-handedly changed my night from a 1-star night to a 2-star.  At one point he even mixed Beach Boys "I Get Around" with Tupac's "I Get Around" and it actually worked.  That takes some skills, my friend.  Who would even think to attempt to mix those two? 

No, I didn't like all the music the entire night, but the crowd did. And, since his job is bigger than just pleasing one club snob like me, I would say he did his job well.  By the end of the night, I was dancing and having a good time (and no, I was not drunk... only had one drink the entire night). I am glad I didn't leave early like I wanted to because in the end, it was an ok night.  I am definitely going to have to check out more of San Fran's nightlife though because if this is it when it comes to clubs, I'm not impressed.  I've been to better in even smaller cities.  I definitely expected more.

PROS:  By the end of the night, you will have an ok night
             Drinks are cheap
             Bartenders are quick
             Nice V.I.P. area

CONS: Cheesy... even has the cheesy lady in the cheesy outfit selling cheesy items in a tray (at least there was candy in there)
            Can get crowded
            Pretty much no one can dance here (and that goes for the patrons and the paid dancers)

QUICK TIPS:  Get there early, but bear with the DJ until at least 11:30, because the music won't be really good until then.  Try and get the hook up on V.I.P. because at least you can breathe up there and people watch the folks below.  It's pure comedy watching them.  LOL!
author: Elsa M.

description: Came here for New Years, had such a good time so I came back a second time for DJ Spider. Both times they killed it with service, music, and great energy. We had no problem getting it at all, but probably because we're girls. But it did seem like there were a lot of unhappy dudes waiting. I don't do the club thing often in SF, but Harlot is well-worth it even if it's not your usual scene, for amazing DJs, dancing, and fun crowds. I'm from NYC and it definitely has the feel of a NYC club (but better music!)- really nice inside, super high ceilings, great service, and personally I think the tables upstairs are sick, if you can get them.
author: Hannah E.

description:
I guess if your club is named after another word for "whore" then the place is bound to be kind of sleezy.

If anyone has ever watched the one Smallville episode where Granny Goodness had an underground training center to turn women into ass-kicking machines...Harlot kind of felt like that. It's dark and dungeon-y, the music was some kind of house that I think would compliment cage fighting really well, and there was this glowing picture of a naked woman right behind the DJ.

As the night went on, the DJ started spinning a mix of house/top 40, which I really enjoyed, but then it turned into weird house that my friends and I couldn't get into. Also, the go-go dancers were...interesting. They weren't really dancing...more like striking a pose, stare seductively out at everyone, then strike another pose.

There are a lot of creepers here, or at least the night my friends and I went. They're OLD too. Ew.
author: Kei H.

description:
Dont remember all that much. But some random chick started making out with me. Wow. 

music was pretty good. best if on a guest list and on ecstasy.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
came here on industry night so it was an interesting crowd.  everyone was way older than i had expected!!  

getting in was easy - there was no line.  the place was SO crowded.  we got let into the vip area because our friend was djing, but it was also super crowded. 

there's nothing that really stood out about his place to me.  i probably wouldn't choose to come back, but i might because it's so close to where i live.  it kind of felt like a bar with bottle service.  

one thing i DID like about this place was that the girls and guys bathrooms are ACTUALLY separated... unlike the bathrooms at infusion and vessel which annoy the shit out of me.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Made it to 150...WHOOP WHOOP!

Hmmmm, been here a few times now and still apathetic.

It's definitely a scene.  To me it's sort of a marina-ish type crowd (not judgin', just sayin').  If you want to get dressed up, look fox-a-fied good, and stand in line to get in, then by all means do it!

Inside definitely has a certain somethin' going on.  It's dark and sexy, and I love that semi-private upstairs area with the bar.  The music is decent, but for some reason I haven't felt the urge to shake it up.  I'd much prefer to lounge or mingle in this place. 

Not really the best place to meet new people as it's so crowded.  But if I have a bunch of fierce girlfriends that want to do it swank for a night, then Harlot would be top on the list.
author: Angella S.

description: Harlot: great club, great DJ- I really like the music here. Drinks are ok and the crowd is better than in other clubs in SF. Usually my go to if I wanna dance and have fun!
author: Paula C.

description:
If I had to wait in line... I probably would not come again.

Why? Because I do not like to wait in line, and I like to pretend I'm too cool for school, and should be escorted in by a personal VIP host.

Some have said this place has a "LA/Vegas vibe" to it... which isn't a bad thing, unless you're a fugly.

The one time I came here, I quite enjoyed myself... accessibility to the bar as not a major issue, the dance floor was packed, I didn't have to wait in long line for the bathroom, and the music was dance-able... it didn't feel very sausage-fest to me, but then again, I wasn't on the prowl either.

I give this place 4-stars because I had a good time, didn't have to wait in line, and I got to drink as much as I wanted to... if you didn't experience all three, you may knock off a star (or two). 

That is all.
author: Victor C.

description:
Well it is named "HARLOT" so why wouldn't I expect to see a buncha whorish, crazed, drugged out freaks running a muck around this creepy-ish establishment? Silly me for expecting any different? 

But after I got past my initial judgemental phase, I tore off my good girl appearance and jumped into the madness to end the night with a bang. If you can't beat em, join em right?
author: Saralina B.

description:
BEWARE OF THE BARTENDERS!

Got a drink and was told that it was 7 dollars, gave the bartender a 20, and she gave me back my change saying, "there's 11 dollars", and quickly moved on to the next person waiting to be served.  

You do the math. 

Having had 2 drinks prior to arriving at Harlot, I thought maybe I heard wrong or was a little drunker than I thought. 
The next morning, I spoke with 2 friends I went with, and they said the same thing happened to them.

Pros: No cover
Cons: self-tipping bartenders
author: Jane L.

description:
creeeeepy ass naked lady painting behind the DJ...

Besides that, this is a cozy little club/lounge that I wanted to try out for the first time.  I came here last weekend and got the feeling that everyone was in their upper 20's and above, so I definitely was the youngest person there.  The decor was really unique and I liked the deer chandeliers and the ambiance.  I'd recommend this for a more chill/dancing night, not some place to come get wasted or crazy at, but I had a great time here!  Def more upscale and I liked that.
author: Liz W.

description:
Decided to give this place one more chance. Should have known better. 

Actually called ahead and reserved bottle service. Arrived at the club and they had messed our reservation up - same jerk bouncer in the deuche glasses said our table would be $500 now instead of the original $250 which we had agreed upon earlier in the day. Told him no way and that were canceling it then. Gave me this strange look like I was crazy for canceling on Harlot, the greatest place in the world in his eyes. He said with a smirk that even though I was canceling they would still charge my card the full amount. He was definitely upset when I told him I never put my card down (how dumb does he think I am?) and that we were leaving. To hell with them.
author: Justin J.

description: I'm sure that there are people who love this place.  Me, I was not nearly drunk enough to enjoy it. First, it was like a sauna in there.  Second, the place was filthy, with every surface covered in confetti. Third, the music was weird - not quite house, not quite EDM. Then, when a waitress offered a glass from bottle service, the glass was clearly not clean - it still had contents and a lipstick mark on the side. Really? Props to the VIP guy with the British accent  at the door. Still, his courtesy is not enough to bring me back, ever.
author: Annmarie L.

description:
I liked that this place had folks who were mostly over 25 and the guy:girl ratio is pretty even. So pretty mellow, did not feel like a fight was going to break out any minute. Might be a result of the screening that they do at the entrance. I saw them turn away quite a few folks at the door.

Another advantage is that they don't charge cover. It is pretty cozy in here but the dance floor could be bigger. The smoking room bugged me since the smoke leaks out. Another thing I did not like is the music. Tonight, it felt like all the songs had the same beat! Every 5-6 songs, they would throw in a oldie like Thriller. I would go here more often if only the music was better!
author: Sunil R.

description:
02.24.11

Harlot (n): a prostitute or promiscuous woman.  But don't expect to to find harlots at Harlot.  The patrons are classy ladies ;)

I was here last Thursday for a hosted bar party.  Three hours of free booze...I couldn't say no!  Because it was a rainy weeknight, Harlot wasn't as packed as it usually gets.  The bouncer is nicer than in events past.  They actually let people in in Chucks this time around.  And the girl:guy ratio was definitely not enforced.  Maybe they're just not as strict during weeknights.

I love the atmosphere of Harlot.  It's got elegance, even if there are nudie portraits on the wall.  The bar is small, but chock full of bartenders so you never have to wait to long.

Back soon!
author: Jenny L.

description:
I barely ever make comments about places but I changed my mind last night when the bouncer decided to screw up my night (and not for free!). They believe they're like celebrities and unless you're hoping off a limo or a Lambo you might have to wait longer than your patience can handle--like they rather you living the place--while pushing you back (as if you were an animal) and letting other people in right in front of you without even charging them any cover (humiliation). If you can take all that, then they proceed to deal with you and your group (not even in a friendly matter). Now, you have to be in pairs (male + female), have cash for the cover and be well dressed so you can come in or they'll ignore you right away. Awesome. Now, let's say you're finally in... You see a nice place with nice decoration with nice music aaand... That's about it!. The place gets packed really fast because it's small, the drinks are expensive and hard to get and the staff is not like super customer friendly inside either. 

Overall I give it 1 star and that's just because of the nice environment and vibe inside, but almost a casualty made by the people, not by the place. I wish I could give it minus something stars to make it even.

I would never go back there, it's not for me.

PS: Parking is expensive too.
author: Jose David A.

description: Biggest complaint is the ridiculously overpriced & weak drinks and glacially slow bar service. Arrive early and be prepared to part with $$$ if you want to get a buzz there.  Crowd can be kinda guido-dooshy, like perhaps some take the name too literally or are there to impress their friends with how much money they can spend. Even when my favorite DJ plays at this venue I usually take a pass. There are many better venues in SF.
author: Derek G.

description:
I went this past friday for a friend's birthday and we decided on this place because you could sign up online for the guest list and get in free.

I came with a total of 7 guys and 5 girls, and while we had all signed up online they almost didn't let our two guy friends who didn't have dates in. i know that keeping a ratio is important but we signed up online and that's kinda bull**** if you can't get girls to your club on your own.

So we get there at 1030 -11 and while the place is just starting to fill up there is no room for our group. so we ended up deciding to buy a table with bottle service for 500. the service was ok and we gt two bottles for that price. if we had not bought that table we would have been screwed on space and it would have been impossible for us to find somewhere to kick it

The real thing that made my night so horrible is having to fight off guys that were trying to hit on the girls we were with, it was ridiculous, they were totally inappropriate and as the night went on it was a very consistent thing among the whole crowd. i found the people who attended to be very rude and inconsiderate.

The DJ was terrible. it went from pretty bleh house ( i like house) to terrible mixing of old 90's songs. the room had no vibe or rhythm going on at all.

meh
author: Andy C.

description: The rudest security in SF, I love the place but will NEVER go back due to the horrible service provided by the security.
author: Amilia S.

description:
I've been here countless times with co-workers for happy hour and it doesn't disappoint. The atmosphere is great and the setup is nice. However, Harlot has has really taken a beating after new bars and lounges have been popping up all over the place. The Transbay Terminal construction happening right across the street doesn't help to the appeal of Harlot too. 

The prices are reasonable and the lounge at night definitely gets more rowdy than its peak times for happy hour. The sound system is great and there is typically a DJ. However, like most bars and lounges downtown they don't play hip hop. The crowd is mainly workers from the area and the bartenders are pretty attentive to your needs. 

Not sure if Harlot is going to be around much longer after the completion of the Transbay Terminal but it is definitely a great place to grab a drink with a group and just relax.
author: Javier G.

description: This is one of the nicer clubs in SF.  Nice interior, good looking crowd of different ages , nice mix of music one can actually dance to.  Recommend getting a VIP table upstairs, gets you a ton of alcohol and nice private area.
author: Olga R.

description:
NOT a fan of this place.

I am usually generous with my ratings but I wish I could give them double negative zero's. 

We went there for a birthday party - Awful Host/Manager ( some tall girl  and the bouncer) - we got a table and we were late, already had someone there, and not only were they rude to our whole group, but pushed some of the girls around as well.  Terrible!

Never been back since!!
author: ThuZ W.

description:
From now on I will automatically give 1 star to any establishment that doesn't let me in because, as the bouncer eloquently put it, "there's too many dudes in there."

Unless I'm in Vegas.  For some odd reason I'm ok with this concept in Sin City, but not in San Francisco...

So me and my guy friends waited outside for about 20 minutes while they let in groups with both guys and girls in.

I would have left if my group of friends (which ironically was about 50/50 guys/girls) weren't already inside.
author: Brian A.

description:
I went here last night for a networking event, so I didn't get the "real" Harlot experience- hence my 3 stars only. 
I liked the overall sexy vibe, the furniture, the pictures, the bartenders, the color scheme, the almost porn video playing near the bathroom, and the strong drinks. I think I would've liked this place much more if I was actually going out and able to dance, not just sit around and talk to random people. So it has a lot of potential! I will definitely return with my girls for a fun night out.
The one random part was amongst a crowded room of business suits, stood a girl wearing basically nothing w/ an ipad. I'm not sure what her purpose was, but she wasn't talking to anyone there. Then when i was in the bathroom, she stumbled in and practically fell into the stall...um okay? Maybe they needed one girl w/ a harlot-esk style to stand by herself in the bar?  Who knows!
author: Sonya D.

description:
Although there are tons of negative reviews about this place, I feel that it is a pretty legit club that reminds me of clubs in Hong Kong. Sure its pretentious, expensive, and the bald doorman can be a dick, but he's just doing his job. If anything he's trying to keep the scum suckers out of the club and let more females in. I'm a LITTLE sorry that your ratio didn't work out, but maybe your group of 10 sleazy dudes shouldn't come in and crowd the dance floor and bar with your investment banker suits and egos the size of a blue whale. 

I liked the bartenders, the music, and the fact that the club reminded me of home. Spectacular? Not really, but for now, I think I'd say I'm a fan.
author: Tony W.

description:
Are you kidding me people? I cant belive this place has only 3 stars.. its a joke right?
This is by far the best spot in the city.
I love the service, the music and the croud.
SF is kinda sucky on good night clubs... (definately this is no Europe), however I feel that harlot is as close as it gets to a good times on your night out
author: Diana R.

description: I never usually give clubs 5 stars but I really enjoyed going to Harlot and the smoking cage. Granted I did spill a lot of glasses and the bartenders were so nice about it even though I spilled around like 5-6 glasses :/  Thanks Harlot for being so patient with me! I also enjoyed the vibe with chandeliers and cool paintings. :)
author: Ann X.

description: I've been here several times and never had a problem getting in.  This one night in particular the doorman was being a complete douche bag to my girlfriends based on their looks.  He basically said I can go in for free, but my two friends had to pay $20 each.  We stepped out of the line to discuss this and he let another good looking girl in for free.  He has prescription glasses I should have gotten his name and report him to the manager.  That was not cool at all.  We left that p,ace and went to 111 Minna which had a way better vibe.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I just took a sneak-peak at Harlot, and all I have to say is wow, wow, wow. Gorgeously provocative - and evocative - interior. I'm talking gigantic paintings covering the walls, sexy tables whose surfaces are giant photos in themselves, a smoking section a la Rye, plenty of seating to cozy up on while checking out the beautiful people.

And that's not even mentioning the upstairs lounge and bar,  surely to be a coveted pole position amongst all kinds of hipsters and scenesters. 

The name Harlot in itself conjures up a playful yet sexy image, and they've done a really super job in capturing that feeling and atmosphere.

Sounds likes they'll have a choice wine list as well, and being connected to Salt House is just another bonus. Look for me there at happy hour coursing into the night.
author: Nish N.

description:
In a very short time period we've seen the launch of a number of hot new venues (Harlot, Ambassador, Vessel). And as an avid partaker in drink and dance, I'm pretty happy about that.

Of this new crop of hotspots, the gold medal goes to Harlot. Sure it's super, duper new so that has something to do with my excitement, but the decor is amazing. The gargantuan steel beams have "Carnegie" stamped on them (pointed out to me by Martel the proprietor, they are authentic). There is an upstairs balcony with a dedicated bar and seating, great for crowd scanning and/or private partying. Downstairs are several booths and a good sized dance floor, but this is no mega club... think intimate.

Vodka sodas were $7, about the city norm and a bargain in the context of the great crowd. The staff was excellent, one of the security guys watching the upstairs was more than happy to chat about the venue and it's launch - really nice guy.

My only complaint? The DJ - Dude why must you play GnR mashups at midnight? I know the ladies love it, ugh. Damn them.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Went here for NYE! I have never been to such a huge party! Amazing people here! Amazing bartenders that know their stuff!
author: Lauren R.

description: So, I dropped in to hear a couple DJs I know recently.  Hadn't been in here in a while.  Small Venue, but plenty of space for the place to get booming.  Worth notiing it's done really nicely, good design, dark, not divey.  20s-30s, natch for the city..
author: Vincent M.

description: Horrible experience - bar tender charged two extra drinks on my tab and once she was caught she insulted me and threatened to expel me from the club. The bouncer was so ashamed he aplogized for her behavior. This bar is shady - do not go unless you are vigilant about overcharging and malicious bar staff.
author: Alexander A.

description:
Harlot rhymes with scarlet, and the only mark outside distinguishing Harlot's presence on Minna Street is a single, scarlet letter H. Clever, clever!
 
The first time I came to Harlot, I was pretty impressed by the ambiance and space. The worshipped/condemned dichotomy of the whore is done tastefully, with that huge painting of a naked chick dripping in blood (nice.) and tables matted with photographs of models, all sultry and seductive-looking. I quickly realized, though, that because of its swank nature, Harlot tends to be the kind of place where people like to sit and stare at each other in their nice clothes and sparkly hair; not the kind of place conducive to a kick-back happy hour or even a wild night out on the town with the girls (dancing is limited and very NON-dropitlikeitshot). In other words, meh... most of the time I can go someplace better.

However, for Halloween this year, my girls and I were scouring about to find a venue in the city hosting a nice, FREE party. Harlot was the only place where we were able to find one, so we signed ourselves up on the guestlist. Though initially I was a wee bit disappointed at the choice (I had wanted to stay away from the pretentiousness of the downtown danceclub and actually have some fun this Halloween), it turned out to be quite a nice time at Harlot. Per our confirmation email's instructions, we arrived early and were able to enjoy the club before it got too crowded. It wasn't hard to get a drink, and the dancefloor was poppin' with good, dancey music (they normally only play loungey or house stuff).

We left and moved onto the Castro when it began to get packed (and when my poor friend who arrived just 20 minutes after us called me from the line outside saying she didn't think she'd ever get in). But despite Harlot's minimal departure from its VIP-vibe this Halloween, I really appreciated the free event, seeing as how most other places downtown were charging 30 bucks and up (oh heeeyell no!).
author: Kate V.

description: Celebrated my 21st birthday here. I reserved a table for bottle service and the staff of Harlot helped me have a great birthday! the service was great, all my friends had a great time. Harlot has a really nice setup and its two floors. The main dance floor is a little small but dancing is enabled everywhere because its just everyone's bottle service table. Great place to have a celebration with affordable prices and the servers are attentive.
author: Allie B.

description:
Hands down this place has a nice sound system. I was there a week ago. I can't remember most of the night lol but from what I remember they played nice music and had reasonably priced drinks. This place has a mysterious vibe cz of the dark lights and dancing girls. Place was packed when I was there. If you are looking for a place to go drink with your friends and dance your butt off then Harlot won't disappoint you. 
Only downside is it's located in an alley so it's bit hard to get there and find a place to park. Get a cab!!!
author: Manula H.

description:
My last 2 visits to Harlot have been disappointing. Why? Bad DJs... 
Came here on a recent Saturday and the music kept turning OFF! The music would just go out intermittently. The DJ was terrible, both in music selection and with the random pauses. I don't think it was a sound system thing, but a DJ thing. Who knows... regardless, the music blew. 

Then came back on a Friday and this time, DJ kept playing the same beat over and over and over for the first 2 hours. Ruined all the good songs by mixing it with the same repetitive beat. Terrible. He later started playing straight up hip hop around 12 Midnight and this time, he just left the songs to play and didn't mix which was waaay better. Still though, pretty disappointing. 

Only salvation is no cover, no lines, generally nice staff. Crowd is okay. Parking can be tough. Bass is really really loud inside.
author: Veronica H.

description:
I say all of us who were discriminated against file a class action suit against this place! 

Check this out: 

My friend was celebrating her 21st birthday this past Saturday, June 11th. She arrived to Harlot with her brother about 30 minutes before my friends and I did (around 11:15pm)

As soon as we got there, we texted her to let her know we'd be in shortly. No one was in line so we assumed we would see her soon, order tequila shots, and dance the night away! 

The Moby lookalike immediately informed us that if we're not in the guestlist or buying a table, we can't get in. Upon hearing this, all 3 of us began simultaneously texting away on our iphones to confirm this information. The birthday girl walked out of the club, with her Tokyo Tea still in hand, to the velvet rope where we were to say neither was the case. 

Long story short, the guy completely ignored us and when we confronted him about it he began arguing with us. We witnessed him letting scores of melanin deprived people in (without even taking a second-hell, a first look at the "guestlist") The birthday girl ended up leaving-didn't get a chance to finish her drink-and we went to EVE where we ended up having a pretty memorable night. 

Needless to say, but I'm gonna say it anyway: racism still exists and was in full effect that night..
author: Julie J.

description:
YUCKY YUCKY POO POO.

No hot girl (me - seriously, I was smokin' that night) should be forced to wait (even if there were a "few" males with us) in line along with her friend, the birthday girl Sonya T. for an hour.  Especially when the club was not even full.  

Unacceptable. 

I've over these cool "hip" clubs coming to SF.  Please go back to LA & stay there.  BLEH.

For a better, less crowded place with FAR nicer doormen...try John Collins around the corner.
author: Helen F.

description: Was here on a Friday night. Small but enough room to dance. Whiskey and cokes were $11, Fireball shots were $11, really expensive drinks for a not so hot place.
author: Susan C.

description:
Gorgeous. Chic. Sexy. Enigmatic.

No, I'm not describing a woman, I'm describing Harlot. I don't frequent clubs very often anymore, but this is one that deserves a second look. And a third. 

Small spot with the capacity to fulfill big expectations, great expectations even. The space is decked with floor-to-ceiling Mannerism-era art. Very New York. The music is well-mixed, HOT (must love mash-ups).

If you're going the bottle service route, ask for hostess with the mostest, Christy K. You can't miss the 6-foot tall statuesque beauty, not that you would try. She handles last-minute reservations with ease and anticipates blips in advance... so you never see them happen. She's a superstar, this one. She helped me with my birthday party for a 100 last year at my then loft and let me tell you... no small feat coordinating between the bartenders, DJ, catering and my guests!

See you here, I'll be dancing my heart out :)
author: Jelena Z.

description:
Get your strapless, your backless, your heels, your sexy ON!  Now sit back and get ready for Harlot to tantalize ALL your senses.

You'll SEE . . . red lights, dark walls, glowing candles, sensual pictures of women all around you. 

You'll TASTE . . . luscious cocktails poured by the bartenders upstairs and downstairs.

You'll HEAR . . . laughter, the DJ getting his groove on, "what's your name?"

You'll FEEL . . . smooth faux crocodile sofas, soft cowhide chairs, a hand pulling you onto the dance floor.

You'll SMELL . . . musky cologne, pheromones, and the seductive whiff of possibility.
author: Amy C.

description: Good drinks and music. Crowded venue, especially on weekends.
author: Tatyana N.

description:
This review is for HAPPY HOUR only!

Nice spot to grab a couple of drinks after work. Beers on tap and well drinks are $3 during HH. They have a decent selection of beers: hef, Sierra, guiness, pilsner to name a few.

My co-workers and I got here at 5:30 on a Friday and were able to snag 2 tables with comfy couches.

Not a bad spot to check out.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I was so unimpressed with this place ... despite hearing my girlfriends rave about it. I liked the decor and I think someone put a lot of thought into giving it a look and a feel.  Someone willing to pay a premium price for just the right art, just the right fixture ... I do appreciate that.  I might be willing to give this place a second chance but outlook not so good.  First off, the guy at the door was sort of a dick ... is there a cover or isn't there?  Don't get all condescending on me if I don't laugh at what wasn't very funny in the first place.  

Yeah I get it .... Saturday night is crowded and there is a line to get served at a bar.  But then I get shoved out of the way of the VIP section - there weren't velvet ropes when I got there, but suddenly I'm in your space?  Then you drop shit on my feet and it's my fault?  Where do you think you are, the New York subway?  Oh right when I did finally order... I ordered a Hefeweizen and got a Sam Adams instead (though I won't dock you points here because it was an honest mistake and you fixed it ...)

The DJ has ADD ..... the music wasn't bad, but no song lasted more then 30 seconds and he did consistantly switch it out right before the chorus of every song worth singing / dancing to.  My party people and I stood there rolling our eyes and getting increasingly pissed off.  Not cool.

Maybe it was an evening of bad luck ... that's what I'd like to believe.  But it really is disappointing when it's the establishment that ruins a night and not some random drunks.
author: Kathleen W.

description: I came here I think two weeks ago for a happy hour event organized by some folks at my school. It was very fun, the place looks like a club (spacious, small couches, low lights) but it was early so everyone was lounging around and having a drink. I enjoyed the company for sure. It was kind of weird to get to though because it is located on a back alley (at least from where I came from). It definitely was not bad but I think it would be a better venue for a night party. There was not enough seating, so it would be a more appropriate clubbing scenario.
author: Dodi G.

description:
I felt a bit like I was in the old boys club coming in here and seeing the antler chandeliers and black walls, but I thought the space overall was quite nice. 

I was here for the launch party off Sake2me a super yummy drink (you know the lightly fruity kind where you can have about 8 before you notice you're completely drunk because it's just so fruity and delicious), so I am sure that helped my perception of the place. I remember plenty of places to be able to sit and carry a conversation, and being able to retreat to the balcony (more plush seating up there) to escape the loud crowd.

I'll definitely return!
author: Nikki M.

description: Good music but a small place. Absolutely don't get bottle service. If you are a sucker to get bottle service, definitely don't do it upstairs. The place is never crowded enough that it makes sense, and they "dump" your bottle at 2am, without warning. The "manager" is a total tool and will rip you off. There are much better places to go in the city. The good looking girls don't show up till 1230am, so don't get there before then. Even then it's still a sausage party. Honestly, go elsewhere, don't pay a cover, and enjoy a better place.
author: Badr A.

description:
Horrible experience!
Even though we had no problems to get in at all, but there were no guys in this place!!! I saw pimped out females with HUNGER in their eyes! Of course all guys were turned down!!! Beeeeeh, never again -- I was ready for flirty night, and Harlot SPOILED it!

And their DJ and his music selection sucks!
author: Anelya S.

description:
This place is BULLSHIT.  Yelp sure doesnt lie!  My friend picked here to celebrate a birthday (and surprise engagement she didnt know was coming!!) and because it was a celebration thang, i didnt mention my nasty feeling bout this place after reading yelp.  Long story short:

Our black friends and the white friends who arrived at the door with our black friends had to pay cover.  The white people who showed up in groups of white people did not pay cover. 

A few of our party refused to enter due to their racist principles.  Since we were celebrating, and we had brought ~20 people to the club with us (HELLOOOO how much $$$$$ do u think we're going to spend inside?!) the groom-to-be went out to try and reason with the bouncers/our friends.  He was told he could not stand in the rope area and must step outside.  He was then refused re-entry to the club, since he had stepped outside the door (oh yeah....also, he's black).  

Drinks are expensive.  Coat check is expensive (especially when u have to collect your coat 5 min after checking cuz you find out jim crow law is in effect an your friends cant come in so youre moving youre entire celebration ELSEWHERE)

Screw you, harlot.  There's a lot of fun clubs in SF, dont waste your time here.
author: Maia V.

description:
This place truly blows. 

Even clubs in Vegas aren't this pretentious. 

Oh, and they are racist against Asians. Even the good looking Asians. 

Oh, and the short bald guy who is the bouncer is the biggest prick you will ever meet. He probably hasn't gotten laid in years, why else would he be so ANGRY all the time? 

The end.
author: Jay W.

description:
THE REVIEWS ARE CORRECT - DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AT HARLOT!!!!

A good friend of mine had planned to celebrate her birthday here . . . she got a guestlist and was told everyone on the list could get in.  

Before her birthday night, I read a bunch of Yelp reviews that said, "Harlot ruined my/my friend's birthday!" I was SO close to saying something to the birthday girl about what I had read, but decided to keep quiet as it seemed she had her heart set on coming to this club (no idea WHY though).  I thought maybe it would be different for us. Well I thought wrong!!!!

When we got to the club (at a decent time ~10.30, and with the "correct" guy/girl ratio), the Moby-look-alike at the door told us there was no list with our names on it and that we couldn't get in, although there were maybe five other people in line.  We were on our way down the street to find another club, when we were told to just wait in line and we could get in in five minutes.  After about ten minutes of waiting, we finally figured out that we would never be able to get in, so we decided to find somewhere else to go.  

We ended up bar-hopping down in SOMA, ending up at XYZ at the W.  If we had known that Harlot would be SUCH A HORRIBLE INSTITUTION, we wouldn't have wasted our time to come all the way down to Market and 2nd.


DO NOT GO TO HARLOT!!!!
author: Emily L.

description:
This place is managed by the most extremely rude and unprofessional manager that I have ever encountered in my life.  Other reviewers have referred to him as Jeremy.  

I was with a group of 25 other individuals (a group consisting of more girls than guys) who waited for our reserved table service, when he told us that he would not allow any guys in our group to enter the place. When we told him we had bottle service, he said: "it does not matter, no guys." 

When we tried to tell him that we had a reservation and table service, and that it was never mentioned that guys might not be allowed in, he replied: "I do not care, I am telling you no guys, and nobody can help you." 

What is strange is that we were trying to be polite to find the rationale behind the way we were being treated. If there were too many guys in the club, or this was a policy under certain conditions, we would have been fine and simply left. Instead of any answer, he gave us a dirty look and said: "because I say so."

Wow! I have never been treated this way in my entire life. A few individuals in my group had told me that this place was infamous for being racist. I did not believe them, since it is a severe allegation to make. Our group was not caucasian, and I find it unfathomable to believe that our appearance was behind the refusal for entrance.

After I heard this, I saw several small groups of caucasian (which had guys in their group) walk right up to the place, and Jeremy let them in. Amazing.
