We left the place and spent a very large sum of money at another location. It is obvious that Harlot does not want your business, if you are of a certain appearance. What is really astounding is the fact that I read previous reviews, and other Yelp reviews have mentioned this same practice! Do the owners not care that their business is being horribly reviewed and losing future revenue?!

My friends and I are all successful, and work for a multitude of different companies. We will never visit Harlot again, and we will make sure that none of our friends and co-workers ever do business with Harlot. 

Please do not visit places where they do not have the decency to treat you with respect. We are in a recession, and this manger's behavior clearly shows that Harlot does not care about its business.
author: Steven N.

description:
Surprising that yelp deleted my earlier review...that doesnt seem right team YELP!  dont expect that from you guys.....Request you not to.

Harlot was one of my favorite places for years but the last few visits and the experience myself and few of my known friends have had with this select one individual makes me to take this time  and place this review..... my review here is not reflection of this club or its other staff but of this particular individual by name Jeremy .The bald guy. Never heard of or witnessed such a   rude, arrogant and disrespectful manager ever. 

My first experience was for a booking that was gladly expected for few of us at $ 600 for a table and all seem to be going well as a bunch of guys ahead of us  went in easy and while me with my 4 south Asian friends were held back and asked to pay up $ 1500 dollars for the same table which was $ 600 a minute back. 

The rude reasoning by this guy  Jeremy was that we were too many guys and hence the price now is what it is. While we understand the reason we did mention that we were confirmed $ 600  on phone and we had mentioned we were 5 guys coming in. He turned rude and disrespectful instantly and mentioned the price is what he says take it or leave it. We are a group of valley professionals leading medium to  large businesses and face numerous situations on  day today basis. We chose to move on feeling a little surprised on his un-provoked rude reaction. Giving him the benefit .....felt he might have had a bad day  

We returned a month later  as we had friends and family visiting us from overseas and again joined by my Asian friends and their wives ( this time more girls than guys). We were escorted in by a nice lady and the table was  given to us at $ 1000 overseeing the dance floor. Once in and settled for few minutes our old friend Jeremy came by and asked us to move to another table at a dead corner and when we asked him why... he came back as his usual self rude saying he wanted to make that change and asking us to cancel and leave if we didn't like the second table he was offering. He didn't have the basic courtesy to behave well in front of ladies even.

This was really embarrassing for my guests and their family and this time around .....we left vouching  never to come back here and I encourage all my friends reading this  not to patronize this place while such a rude behavior is displayed.  I have told my teams and few hundred employees working for my organization to patronize the nearest clubs like Temple, Vessel, Infusion . I have conducted 5 corporate events in the last 3 months in these clubs and I would rather take my business elsewhere than give it to an organization that encourages such rude , irrational, un professional and arrogant individuals as Jeremy.


While I see many comments here showcasing him to be  a RACIST I am not sure but planning to seek some advice here.  The behavior of this individual is not what is representative of a beautiful city like San Francisco or its citizens and in fact I don't think the rest of the employees at Harlot are to be held for this behavior too. But somebody needs to get this on track. The world's most loved city doesn't need such a clown of a  character who can't treat women and diverse nationalities with respect and regard.

I see he has been given one too many chances to redeem himself as a professional now but he fails...... I encourage through this note that the Harlot Management  take these reviews seriously and do the needful lest you damage your own reputation as one of the most preferred places.
author: Master B.

description:
Such a bad experience this weekend.  Here's the summary from the disappointed birthday girl herself - way to go, Harlot.  What in the WORLD is the appeal of the 1:1 ratio rule?  What are you, a sordid Noah's Ark?  Gross.

Veto!!

"Harlot ruined (part of) my birthday!! :( It was so awful that we actually left and went to 5a5 instead. After an hour of frustration (despite having bought bottle service, signing up for the guestlist, and showing up well-dressed with the appropriate male/female ratio), we actually gave up and left to go elsewhere. 

We had pre-reserved bottle service and a table, yet when we got there, they actually made us wait in line for an hour and then said "Oops, sorry... we're out of tables now" even though we had payment ready up front.  What's the point of reserving bottle service if the club is just going to give away your table? Also, if they're going to give away your table, why not say so immediately, instead of making the birthday girl + all of her friends wait outside in the freezing code for an hour?? 

We were promised free entry for our group of 80+ people and had emailed our list (and received confirmation that everyone was on the list). However, while still at dinner, I started getting calls from many of my friends saying they were there and apparently weren't on the list (although we had received supposed "confirmation").....

The staff was rude, even though we arrived dressed to the nines (girls decked out in cocktail dresses, and we had some guys in suits even) with the appropriate guy/girl ratio AND had bought a table (until they gave it away). I was literally near tears and about to cry from dealing with the rude staff (who were NOT helpful nor even apologetic about their screw-ups)... seriously the worst experience I've had on a birthday or ever in SF."
author: Shay F.

description:
I have been here on several occasions with my Caucasian friends in the past. I then decided to celebrate my birthday here with friends by reserving 2 tables with a minimum tap of $1,000 (gratuity not included yet) and will probably end up spending more. Below is a summary of my disappointed experience with Harlot or more so with Jeremy, aka the so-call bald looking manager that discriminate and/or racist. I despise referring anyone as racist since it is a harsh accusation but it wasn't hard to labeled Jeremy that way since it is the truth.  

DISAPPOINTING EXPERIENCE:
Even with table reservation and advance guest list, Jeremy will not let any guys in (in my case Asian male) even though we were with more than 15 girls and few guys that dressed appropriately and willing to spend over $1000. The venue was absolutely empty at 10:45 pm. He immediately let other Caucasians male in that came right after us.

Reason for not letting us in...Jeremy exact word is "because I am the manager and I am not letting you guys in."

OVERALL COMMENT:
I am hoping that the owner will read all the negative reviews on Yelp because Jeremy is the way he is because the owner allow him to be, in this case extremely unprofessional. Like other reviewers have mentioned, owners must not care about the negative reviews and the people who represent them. The funny thing is Harlot is trying to promote themselves as a place to host corporate/major events which they will have to realized that some of the people that Jeremy discriminated against are actually working professionals for fortune 500 companies and//or in the public relations/media industries that do have final saying/influence in where they will host their next event, which will not be Harlot.       

Based on my recent experience, I will never come back here for any reasons unless Jeremy no longer work at Harlot or at minimum he's not allow to be the voice and face that represent your venue.
author: K N.

description:
I went to see Dave Seaman here last Saturday, and this was the first time that I've been here.  I go out to clubs to dance, and their dance floor was PATHETICALLY tiny...  They filled nearly the whole place with bottle service tables, leaving almost no room for dancing, or even standing for that matter...  Ok fine, I would have been OK with that, until I had to argue with the bouncer to let me up in to the VIP area in which I had PAID tickets for!  Not sure if it was the fault of the folks at the front or not (maybe they forget to give me a wristband or the right wrist stamp), but in any case, the bouncer was extremely rude and ignored me as best he could until I got (politely) aggressive with him to actually GIVE ME SOME INFO as to what I actually needed have to get up to the VIP area.  After about 10 minutes of waiting after he said "give me a few minutes" while he proceeded to play with his cell phone, then another 5 minutes of arguing, he finally, and begrudgingly let me into the VIP area.

Giving them 1 additional star because:
The bartenders were cool and gave us STRONG drinks (they better anyway for that price).
The decor was pretty sweet.
The sound system was good (but not great).

I would come back here to see another favorite DJ, but only if there was NO other local venue that they are going to play in.  And I also now know that I have to make sure that they actually give me what I paid for at the front door before I go in...
author: Eric M.

description:
I hate to give it a "Meh" ... but "I've had better."
Although a great space for functions, I found the drinks to be unreasonably expensive, which is understandable given its location.  

It is a very classy, sexy joint which is nice, but I didn't find anything out of the norm for your regular lounge.  
I did like the lil videos near the bathroom door...very cool idea.
Try out and see.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Found this venue clean, fun and good music. Not their fault there were dancers that were all hips and elbows on the crowded dance floor. 
Generous pour of my single malt scotch.
author: Lhm M.

description:
The worst night I have had in SF in 3 years! (If I could give negative stars I would.)

My friends and I waited in line for over an hour waiting to get into Harlot. We had 4 very attractive women and 3 guys. When we finally got to the front of the line we realized that they were not letting anyone in from the line we were in, and only letting in people who were on the list.

What club has people stand in line for over an hour and does not even bother to tell the people in line that it's guest list only? Harlot.

Specifically there is a short bald guy who holds the guest list who is a complete prick on a power trip. Multiple times he yelled that he was not letting in "Lawyers, Scandinavians or French people." After waiting for over an hour, when I politely tried to get his attention he just looked at me and said "it doesn't look good buddy." WTF. After an hour of waiting, we left and went to Temple, which let us right in.

During the time we there, we probably saw at least 100 people yell at this guy and storm off. I have never seen a bouncer/host incite so much anger from so many people.

I will never go to Harlot again and I'm guessing that most of the people who came to Harlot tonight won't be coming back any time soon either.

If you want to have a good night, I would recommend Temple, Eve, 330 Rich or any of the many better clubs in SOMA.
author: Dan S.

description:
So I'ma go head and give them a solid 3 stars. We attended this plush club on Xmas's eve. We had bottle service and had over 10 plus on our guest list. No problems with door guy which everyone seems to bitch about. One of our guest had a small problem but they quickly fix it. 
Bottle prices seem about the same to other places in the city.
Parking here is tough we park on Howard and walked it. But there is street parking. The dj was mixing all types of music so keep a open mind. So I say it's worth a visit to see if it's for you. 
I doubt I would return, not my crowd or sound! Late.
author: Y r.

description:
Decided to come check out a different club for Sarah Y.'s birthday on Saturday, and Harlot really let us down. The promoter we worked with to secure bottle service and guest list didn't even show up, and they strung us along for over an hour while we waited outside before telling us that they gave away our table. 

Went to 5a5 instead, and Steve really took care of us there, getting us in without cover and letting us in despite us not wearing white to a white party.
author: Bryan T.

description:
Can't stand the music here...the DJ on Saturday nights can not spin!  You know the kind...you get into the song, dancing and grooving...and "BOOM", he switches it to a completely different genre of music. Hello? Like how did you get from Hip Hop to Country? 

Too crowded..drinks are expensive...and they have all the faults of a Vegas club.
author: Alice H.

description:
This place would have gotten 3 stars if the bar weren't so expensive and if one of the bartenders didn't suck so much. Ultimately, a bartender opened a bottle of champagne, and sprayed me down like I had entered a one woman wet t-shirt contest. Which I didn't for the record. I expected an apology, quick service and a comp drink at the least. Well...I apparently had high hopes. I had to complain to the head bartender, and even had to ask for a comp drink. Lame. I have low expectations of this bar now. I won't be spending money here again. 

Other than that the music was good and the crowd kind of douchey.
author: Chia C.

description:
I had the most amazing time time at Harlot.

Best nightclub in the city.
author: Evan T.

description: This place is in a bad part of town, no parking, idiot bouncers, and does not admit Gay or single men.  This is a place not to be seen.  Bad energy.
author: Bret H.

description: This could be a nice little venue, but they've managed to screw it up. The drinks are outrageously expensive, $13 for a top shelf mixed drink. The doormen are inefficient and vaguely dickish. And worst of all, there is far too much emphasis on table service, leaving very little room for dancing. Both times I've been here, I've left after an hour for a venue with more dancing space and reasonably priced drinks.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I feel like I am being waaayyyy to generous giving this place  two stars but, I am giving two stars because of their clean bathrooms and okay DJ's. Overall, my experience here was horrible. I came here on a Saturday night hoping to have a great time, but as soon as I entered the building I wasn't even able to walk without grinding up against every sweaty person there.

It was extremely packed, unbearably hot, and there was liquid dripping from the ceiling. I dont know if it  AC condensation or sewage from the pipes, but thats just fuckin gross. Whatever it was, it was constantly dripping on my face. PLEASE FIX THAT HARLOT! 

There are much better clubs in SF than Harlot. Dont waste your time here.
author: Miguel R.

description:
one word to describe this place: PRETENTIOUS!!!!!!

The only good thing was that there is no admission fee and the decor is fabulous and very unique. We went on a friday nite, i hear they usually have mixed music, but the particular nite we went, it was mainly house type music. It's a good thing i went with a bunch of girls. They won't let guys in unless they were escorted by a girl. Makes you think you were in vegas or something. We couldn't even sit down on the couches bc they were "reserved" except they really weren't. We ended up going across the way to john collins...better laid back atmosphere, and better music!!
author: Gina N.

description: Worst club I've ever been too. I didn't know it was grandma and grandpas nights on Saturdays nor did I know it was so lenient on the dress code, they literally let anyone in.  Waste of time and money I will NEVER EVER be back!!!
author: Alyssa F.

description:
I went here last night (Thursday) under the impression that there was an open bar from 9-10pm. Instead they tried to charge a $10 cover and give me a drink ticket for 1 Sveka vodka drink. Considering the place had 5 people total inside I turned to leave. After trying to charge me $5 he eventually agreed to let me in for free.

The main reason I give this place 1 star is because the bar manager was extremely rude. When I told him I thought it was open bar he said "It is. You get a ticket for 1 free drink" After telling him 1 drink doesn't equal an open bar he shrugged me off. 

Looked like the place has potential, but bar managers being rude when the place is empty is never okay.
author: Z H.

description:
My suggestions for this place:
-Don't listen to the other reviews. Go for yourself and try this place out. It's not super bougie, but the crowd is older. 
-I wouldn't come here to look for hot guys or girls. I mean, if you're into "older men and women" then come here.
-The music was ON-POINT!
-Get there around 11pm and you should be fine, at least if you're a girl.
-Call ahead of time to get on the gueslist just in case.

I've been wanting to go to Harlot for almost two years now and last night my wish FINALLY came true! A friend of mine highly recommended this place and she's always out and about in SF, so I couldn't wait to go. I was a little hesitant about coming here after reading the reviews on Yelp, but can I just say....none of the below reviews are true...well at least for me.

I arrived a little after 11pm with my two girlfriends and we got in no problem. I did call earlier that day to see if I could get on the guestlist and a nice gentleman on the phone put me on, then told me my last name meant "black eye liner" in Arabic. 
Umm....okay...hey, at least I get on the guestlist! 

He then suggested I should arrive at around 10:45-10:50 because at 11pm it begins to get crazy. Well, since I'm always fashionably late I showed up at like 11:15pm and there was NO line. The bouncer didn't even check to see if we were on the guestlist. We got in no problem. BTW: This was a Saturday night, too.

I was expecting this place to be much bigger....and it was actually pretty small. Not as fancy as I was expecting. The DJ that night was DJ Sam Isaac and he was amazing. He played almost all my favorite songs, so after that night...I wanted to marry him.

The crowd on the other hand......not very aesthetically pleasing. Let's just say a bunch of Santana Row cougar and craddle-robber rejects frequent this place and a bunch of nerds who don't know how to dress. 

Picture this: You're listening to "No Hands"-Waka Flocka Flame and dancing next to you is a 40 year old woman who is probably a friend of your mom's raising the roof and doing some kind of dance routine from a Richard Simmons video. It's just odd.

Seriously, some of the ladies that night were wearing what I wore to my 6th grade graduation 14 years ago. And these ladies were NOT in the 6th grade! 

From the Yelp reviews I was expecting everyone in this place to look HOT and there were NOT. I wasn't discriminated against for being a minority and I never felt like they favored the better looking people because none of the people who were there were cute and some people were just wearing graphic tees and jeans. 

Seriously, I felt that none of the previous Yelp reviews were true in my experience here.
My friends and I somehow befriended a bouncer who looked like a cute Gucci-Mane and he helped ward off crazy hipster dancers from bumping into us and WE DIDN'T EVEN HAVE TO ASK HIM TO! He stepped right in to make sure we had a good time. It's like he saw that we were irritated by the annoying crowd and he helped us, no questions asked. 

The crazy hipster woman dancing like she was having a seizure? She didn't like him so much.

The kind man then brought us some Voss waters because he saw that we were really hot bc the dancefloor was so crowded. (You know Voss water is the shit and you want to buy it when you're out because the bottle looks cool, but your cheap ass ends up asking for a glass of H2O because it's free.)

Needless to say, I had a great time! But this place isn't all it's cracked up to be. I felt it was a little overrated. Would I come here again? Sure, but it wouldn't be my first choice.
Whomever that bouncer was THANK YOU!
author: Christine S.

description:
Great experience at Harlot last weekend. I was a little wary after reading a lot of these unflattering reviews. Luckily my group didn't have any problems getting in and everything for our party went smoothly.

The music was just awesome. Clubbing and lounging days have long been past me, but I danced my little heart out all night and had a fantastic time. We had a table reserved with bottle service. It's pricey, but they treat you like VIPs for the money. Probably also helped that our group was a bachelorette party with 15 ladies dressed to the nines. Got to the door at 11, checked our names and were inside within minutes. The service was great, and so were the bouncers. The DJ was on fire and got everyone pumped up and dancing. It was great to have a reserved area with some space to dance. The club dancers up on the ledges didn't add very much, but I was too busy dancing to really notice. The table next to us was also full of friendly, fun people getting down to the music also. Fastest three hours of my life. I couldn't believe when the lights came on at 2. Such a fun night and a good venue.
author: Tammi H.

description: This is one of my favorite places to dance in the city. I always have a lot of fun over there.The music is great; every weekend different DJs. In addition to great atmosphere, the staff are friendly and the prices are average. Strong recommendation for girls night out!
author: Natalia N.

description:
I've been to Harlot a few times last year and it was pretty decent then, abit small though-

Recently however, a lot of mismanagement really drove my rating of this place down.

They have a strict 1:1 ratio (if you're a guy you need a girl to get in).

1) If someone gives you have a guestlist, you don't lose it - many people depend on it
2) If you mess up, you accomodate that person - you don't give away their table
3) If your place is full, you tell the people you're sorry and to go somewhere else - the only thing you gain by having a line outside in an alleyway is angry people who want to get in. You don't make them wait for nothing.
author: Chun-Hui W.

description:
Me: "What do you want to do tonight?"
Friends: "Let's go clubbing"
Me: "Well it's 15 min to 11pm, and even though we're on the guest list for Temple and Roe, I doubt we'll make it in time! I don't want to pay $20 to party"
Naoko: "What about Harlot? We'll get in for free"

FREE?! You said the magic words. The venue got changed to Harlot in a heartbeat!

So we cut through the back area behind Temple and head on over to Harlot! The bouncer had no problem checking out my booty as he let me in. When my friend gave him a weird look he said "What? Us black men love booty!" 

Little did he know my brown friend has mad jungle fever and was cursing her petite frame. I almost slapped a ho. What I would do to be as skinny as she was once again!

We walk right in and walk up to the bar and Kris helps us out. She was so great! I went to her all night and she gave us strong drinks. Drinks were pretty well priced there and we had a blast with the crowd.

Then we realized "Holy crap. There's a bachelorette party going on over here. ARE THOSE STRIPPERS?!" Man, did we get a free show or what! Talk about interesting.

The DJ was on point, couples were making out everywhere, bathrooms were clean, and drinks were slammin. Two of my friends then got kicked out for intoxication around 1AM! We stayed for another half hour so that our friend could hit on the bouncer Justin, and then bounced out to end the night.

Overall, Harlot was full of hilarity, harlots and high times. Great night you guys, thanks to everyone who attended on Saturday night for the fun!
author: Tisha G.

description:
im actually giving the place negative stars....why u ask?

US - "we have 4 girls and five guys"
THEM - "i can let the girls in, but not the guys. we have too many guys inside"
(dude the place is empty and people are leaving telling us the place is whack)

wtf is up with that? who do you think buys the most drinks? people, do not give this place your money. let them go out of business.
author: Craig I.

description:
What a terribly run place. Bouncers couldn't get a line formed at the door, everyone was just standing around out front. I was trying to get into a friends Bday that had table service, the bouncers didn't seem to care until we said we'd pull the party if we couldn't get in, they let us in. 

Ok now I get that people want to go out look good and have a good time, but the crowd, eh. The music, eh.  Crowded, small box for a smoking room, bottom line, another posh wannabe SOMA lounge.
author: Christopher F.

description:
Harlot is like a friend that I don't know well but somehow feel very comfortable and safe around.  

I've been several times spanned out within a few years but most of my attendance has been within the last six months or so.  The decor remains the same...painted dark so the accenting lighting of the art really pops.  This may be why the art work is somehow mesmerizing to me.

My very first time at Harlot it seemed to be some sort of drag queen night, it was so fabulous...but I don't think I could keep up with their dancing (nor their attire...I was so underdressed) so I smartly stayed near the bar and jus drank while watching everyone giving the glance over to everyone else as they walk by.  Wasn't the party companies scene so didn't stay long.  And every time after that has been mixed...an asian night, an after work affair, a fundraiser, and just a mixed night with everyone and anyone.  Usually when I'm in attendance there's a DJ, but I've been once when there was a live set so that's pretty cool.

Service here is great!!  The drinks are heavy handed so I'm lovin the bartenders, and I've never had a problem with the bouncers (they are actually quite pleasant and engaging).  Even the ones guarding the questionable "alley" type walk to the restrooms...strange!!  I'm not usually the kind of female that goes to the restroom in a group (as a matter of fact, I try to avoid that specific stereotype all together) but here it doesn't seem like a bad idea. =/

Strangely, I've never been upstairs...I think out of all the times I've been here it's only been open once.  But maybe that's because I'm usually here either in the beginning of the night or the end of it (shrug)...IDK.

I'm sure I'll pop in and out of Harlot whenever I'm in the area...they're A-OK in my book! =)
author: Ninja H.

description:
The only thing not pretentious about this joint is the security guard. 
However, the $3 dollar beers for happy hour ain't bad either. 

They have this piece of artwork right beside the bar that has a picture of one of the bartenders. Bizarre.
author: Earl G.

description:
FAN-SHAY! FAN-CY!

At first I wasn't too sure where this place was located.. it was in a big alley way, with a parking lot in front of the place.. I think some of the buildings were under construction also.. so it made the place located in a not such a great environment to be walking around.  parking can be a pain around there. Street parking was what we found.  I came here for a friend's birthday.. It was free guestlist.

I must say the inside though is very classy compared to other clubs in SF.  Very Nice decor. the people that were there that night were in very nice dresses.. high class yuppy crowd.. the music wasn't going on that much though.. two floors.. bars looked nice.. black couches to hang out on.. we didn't stay here long.. and ended up migrating to Mr. Smith's which I didn't enjoy myself that much there... 

Maybe i should give Harlot another try sometime soon :)
author: Kathy D.

description: Who knew that I'd have fun here? We danced, drank happy hour drinks, and my friend did the worm and cut her chin open. They need to have better cleaning up of the floors! Glass on the floor--not safe!
author: Julia D.

description: Came here last week for my sisters birthday. I called in ahead of time and reserved a table. They said its a 300$ minimum...ok, no problem!  We get there at about 11:30, place is pretty empty.  The host takes my Id and credit card and We get seated at our table(which they chose where to put us)Waited for about 30 minutes, no one approaches to ask what type of bottle we want. So I fetch the bus boy and he goes and grabs the host. She walks up and the first thing out of her mouth is: "it's a 600$ minumum". It's not like I said I want just one bottle or anything.  So clearly they intentionally wanted to f**k me. This is why I hate bottle service.  They try to fuck U EVERYTIME.  So I said what happened to 300$ minimum and she said there aren't any 300$ minimum tables left, they're all reserved. Ok fine. Order a bottle of goose and patron and 4 red bulls and cranberry juice. Comes out to 850$ including the 100+$ that they automatically tip themselves. This waitress poured us like 5 drinks and bounced and we never saw her again. But the bus boy guys were on point and kept coming by.  Like this is a cool spot and like the vibe... But I don't like being f**ked! And the whole night there were only 4-5 tables that were actually sold so they clearly were on a mission to shaft their customers that night.  So to the owner or management of this place, I understand U got expenses and rent is high, promote ur shit properly and pack the place rather than shafting ur customers.  Actually, from my experience here I think they still would do the shafting even at full capacity.  Not coming back here again, but if I do I won't get a table and I'll sneak in a flask of vodka so I can f**k U guys a lil bit. Hahaaha.
author: David S.

description: Guys beware...they might not let you in even with a table reservation.
author: minh h.

description:
Harlot is the most stylish club in San Francisco! Cool vibe, cool dancers, especially the cool crowd. People go there are mostly respectful fidi professionals, both males and females are quite stylish and chilling, not trying to hit on anyone. As an attractive girl who loves dancing, I found this place safe and fun than most clubs (full of guys like vultures). I gave it four stars because there were a few times Jeremy let in a few bad souls whose behaviors were just disruptive to the vibe. Jeremy, please keep up the good work to keep out these who don't belong there.

In short, Harlot is one of the few upscale clubs in San Francisco, if you don't have the confidence, you won't have fun there.
author: Jo C.

description:
Helloooooooooooooooo Harlot. I like, I like.

This is an excellent, intimate venue that I can easily get used to. You can sit, have space to dance, mingle and even get really up close to the DJ and get some good photos or videos. I have a feeling though on the weekend that this place may get too stuffy or crowded to handle. But so far, I like.

Harlot and I had our first rendez-vous this past Thursday night, with DJs the Shapeshifters all the way from the UK. I was amazed to see at how intimate the venue was, because in my mind they were fairly big talent. I know there was also a party here a few weeks ago with Steve Lawler, which was super secret and underground and the venue wasn't announced up until the last minute. I couldn't go because it was a Sunday night, but wow, now that I've been to Harlot, I would not pass that up given a second chance.

Decor is dark and moody, with a little bit of funk with fur trimmed chairs and couches and deer antler chandeliers, and a lot of sass with sexy pictures of girls for tabletops and erotic art on the walls. Classy.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
It would be a drastic understatement to say that last Friday was my worst experience ever at a club in San Francisco.  Holy crap, this place has their priorities upside down.  Profit over customer service?  Yeah, that will sustain a business!  

If you're looking for a place with bad music, bartenders that would rather stare at you than serve you a drink, managers that split hairs just to make a point about the size/gender of your party, ownership that reneges on promises, and vastly overpriced low-grade vodka, then Harlot is your place!  A little taste of LA in the heart of SOMA.

If it were possible to give this place zero stars, I would give it -1 stars.
author: Matthew D.

description:
Booked a table with friends last weekend.
From the start the service was great. 
Linda and I handled everything through email which made it easy.
I had multiple changes to the guest list in the days leading up to the reservation, and there was never a problem. 
We arrived a bit before 11:00 and Linda met us downstairs to take us up to our table. The waitress provided great service once we were all seated and was very proficient at her job. 
Comfy table fit our group of 12 with more than enough room to spare.
$ well spent. 
Pointers: 
-Check calendar to see what Djs will be spinning before booking.
-Tables upstairs are far superior to those on the main floor.
author: Kia B.

description:
More lameness on a Thursday night:

DJ kept spinning obscure hiphop that no one wanted to dance to. Some reluctantly and/or petulantly tried. A handful left.

His replacement spun more danceable music but transitions were slow. More dancers.

And then...

The music stopped due to technical failure. Dead air for ten minutes. The place emptied.
author: Inigo M.

description:
I've had better drinks and service before. 
I don't plan on coming back.
author: Mariel F.

description:
The worst nightclub in San Francisco by far. 
Unnecessarily rude bouncers, pretentious crowd, expensive drinks, poor service. I can go on and on about how lame this place is. 
I can't believe people stand in line to get in to this dump.
Not really sure why their bouncers have such a chip on their shoulder. It's not like this club is anything special. 
I can't think of any redeeming qualities of this place. 
This place is best avoided.
author: Larry J.

description: Love this place! Came here on a Sat night with group of girls and got in easily. Dark decor inside that's reminiscent of clubs in NYC.. minus the sexy go-go dancers! Small, upscale & intimate spot with sick music and crowd.. lots of VIP tables & upstairs balcony too. My new fave spot in SF!!!
author: Michelle D.

description: I have seen just one bad thing that the club is so small. Otherwise everything was good. And Drinks are expensive than temple but not too much. For instance there is 2$ difference on Long Islands.
author: İbrahim S.

description:
Back to the BAY!!!!

This place is rock'n....valet out front(check) no line for me(check) & inside looks like a castle(check, check) ; ) 

The decor looks like a living room to a castle & upstairs the VIP area is all white with a balcony over looking the entire club. The decor is just gorgeous & other worldly. 

Music was amazing & the crowd was a mix of young bloods & 30+ somethings...and the 1 crazy guy kicking like a donkey(no joke.) He was sitting at a table with his friends & would get up and hold on the the arm of a couch and kick his legs back like a donkey....weird looking let me tell you. 

There's a live tree up in the place with branches reaching out & it adds to the atmosphere. The restrooms were super clean & never busy.. BIG plus. There's also a glass smoke room..the place is a visual masterpiece. 

Gooooo check it out....you'll love it here.
author: Vanessa X.

description:
669 reviews?  Bill and Ted are calling....

In my profession, I've grown comfortable with the wisdom reflected in the old saying "where you stand depends on where you sit."  Clubs are as susceptible to this reasoning as precedents.  A mere two bills secured me and 30 of my closest friends lux accommodations in the VIP section, where the view is quite a bit different than that afforded on the floor.  And I was not the only one enjoying the view of 2 gals in French Maid outfits dancing (a bit unenergetically, if you ask me) in the windows.

Final thoughts on the matter: as Mel Brooks said, it's good to be the king.  Harlot is a passable bar, but it is really only excellent if you can get upgraded to first class.
author: Ben P.

description: Did not expect there to be a lounge/club on Minna St., looked like a creepy ally way at first. Went inside, and was surprised, even though a smaller venue, the use of lighting and space made it seem open and the dancefloor was the perfect side, tucked away in the back of the club. The music was good, top 40 with a little dubstep, perfect feeling of EDC meets Bay Area. I really liked this place, the drinks were decent, $11 for a Jameson and Sprite. Go Figure. Anyways, music was good, people were young and dressed nice. I enjoyed my time, too much alcohol had be leaving early, but a majority of the group I was with stayed and partied the night away until last call.
author: Briana W.

description:
Oohh  la la..This place is sexy indeed. I'ts also very upscale and classy without being stuffy. The decor ooozes manhood...and it is no coincidence that barendress's were all hot--dressed in minis and high boots. 
I look forward to coming back when this place officially opens
author: Mimi T.

description:
This is an ok spot if your bring the party with you.  People stick to their own here.  The DJ is decent, the drinks are not watered down and are fairly affordable.  The hotties are few and far between here as well.  The bartenders and waitstaff are pleasing to the eye which helps, but when the employees are the hottest thing in the bar, I can't give it more than 2 stars.  The worst part is the doormen still act like it's an exclusive happening place to be.
The "go-go dancers" kinda just stand there and strike poses.    Some of them are hot enough to pull it off, but after a few seconds, it still is disappointing.
author: KJ C.

description:
I don't go clubbing that often and going to Harlot made me realize why.

9am, pouring rain, and they make 30 people get soaked.  We get in the club and it is only half full.

The club itself is pretty small and as the night went on got unbearably crowded.  Trying to move through the crowd with a fresh beer I got more on the floor and other people than in my mouth.

Never again.
author: Jude G.

description:
I WILL NEVER GO THERE AGAIN, AND I WILL SPREAD THE NEGATIVE WORD AROUND

The baldie at the front door was rude and arrogant. Dude, this is San Francisco, not the some small town in the middle of nowhere. We will take our business elsewhere.
author: Dr D.

description:
Harlot is the worst club in SF. The bouncers wouldn't let my friend and I in because we were male. Later my friend on guest list couldn't get us in because you can't have male +1's.  Finally got in on guestlist for another friend's table service. Still however the sincere lack of respect made it so unpleasant. I will never go back again. Harlot, if you want people to spend their money show people a little more respect!  Total waste of time. Next time start a club in LA of you want to act elitist.

Also to add. I know that there have been allegations of discrimination at this club.  Just to add to the list. My friend and I were, respectively, African and Asian American.

I feel that any club that discriminates, whether based on gender (male) or based on race, should not be frequented.  While I am unaware of Harlot's internal policies, I have to say that tonight, an African American man and an Asian man were turned away multiple times by very rude bouncers.
author: Robert U.

description: Best club I've been to in San Francisco. Hands down, man down! I've heard from a few people that it can be different from night to night, but what club isn't. I went on a Saturday, so maybe that's their good night.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Call it sinful, but this place has converted me forever!  I will never prepare Thanksgiving dinner on Wednesday nights again.  It is wayyy more fun to shake my booty and sip cocktails with beautiful friends, than to stay home and bake a pecan pie.  

What can I say, I don't have a sweet tooth, and I've never been the type to stay home and bake cookies on a Friday night...why fight it?
author: HY L.

description:
I was at this place for a private party so I can't comment on the crowed on a normal night, but the atmosphere was very condusive to lounging, dancing, drinking, and people watching.  The place is dark, but as I looked around the artwork on the walls was nice and sexy, definately had that French feel, the couches were spaced out nicely and decent room to sit.  The  upstairs is completely different, it's white and bare but it give this place a nice character.  

The drinks were good, al though the barternders were a bit slow, OK that's an understatement but they will speed up with time, I hope.
author: Inga W.

description:
Lots of negative reviews here but hell, I had a great time when Miguel Migs was spinning on 7/22/10 (Thurs)! First off it was a FREE event before 1130 so how can I complain? I know it's not usually free so okay, this review may be a little biased. But whatever...I'll continue:

Not sure how often Harlot brings in house music, but if they continue to do so then I'm all in. It's on the smaller side but there is a nice upstairs space where you can hang out and overlook the sweaty crowd down below. Drinks are standard prices, probably a little less than $10/mixed drink. IT WILL GET HOT. Ladies, bring a coat but definitely check it or hide it b/c you won't need it. 

Harlot management: hope you can bring Miguel back again!! Good times.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description:
After leaving Perry's we headed to Harlot to continue a fun night of drinking.  If my review was based on decor and bartender alone, it would get five stars.  Loved the ambiance and gothic theme of the place.  Exposed metal girders, black painted branches artfully attached, and super cool paintings.  My kind of place!

Kris, the bartender, was really cool too and was very nice and helpful, offering to make drinks that were no longer on the menu and free Pop Chips to everyone.  No pretense and she made everyone feel at home.

Sadly, after that, the place just didn't do it for me.  We were there early, so the place wasn't much of a scene yet (hey, we don't need a scene...we can make our own!), but beyond that the place had an oddball clientele.  Certainly not  goth or 'the beautiful people', yet not quite douche either.  More than anything, it was nerd geeky (as Seinfeld would say...not that there's anything wrong with that!).  Then again, it was early and we didn't stick around too long so I can't say if it changed for the better or the worse.

Drinks were tasty, although the prices were steep!

Another disappointment was that I was under the impression that the place had a downstairs or was bigger, but such was not the case with Harlot.  Now that would have been cool if there had been another room and dance area with another bar on the level below a la NY or for that matter, Washington DC!

Sadly, I thought the name Harlot was appropriate.  Like a true harlot passing by and slipping into the darkness of the night...at first glance, great to look at and lust after, but not much substance once you take the time to try and get to know her.  Some things are best left as a beautiful and sweet memory of the moment, just like Harlot.
author: Roy N.

description:
I've been here twice - once for an industry event, and that was awesome, the company hosting rented out the whole place and had an open bar.  The lounge itself looked good, lots of leather couches and pretty nicely decorated.

So when one of my friends decided we should head out here on a Saturday night, I thought it was a great idea.  Wrong!  It was terrible.  My boyfriend and I got there before the rest of our group, and checked it out -- at 10PM on a Saturday night, it was totally dead.  We thought it might've been reserved for an event again, so we asked the bouncer/doorman (other Yelp reviews say his name's Jeremy & he's the manager?) and he said nope, it's open.  So we decide to head in and wait for our friends inside, and he asks, "Did you get on the guest list? If not, you're going to have to get a table".  Granted, we had six friends coming and probably COULD have gotten a table... at a completely dead lounge.  Yep, sounds like a lot of fun.  I end up calling my friend and letting him know that what's up, and as soon as my friend showed up, the guy started giving him lip too, telling him "We're really busy, you guys NEED to get a table/bottle service".  Er... we're not blind... there is literally NOBODY in your lounge.  Anyways, after my friend argued with the guy for awhile, he let us in, but was continued to be rude to my friend's boyfriend, who was running late and whom we told to meet us at the lounge.  We had to send a few people out to argue with the bouncer-doorman-manager to get him in, and the b-d-m mouthed off to them, telling them "Tell your little friends that this is the LAST person we're letting in from your little group, nobody else gets in". Sheesh, you'd think they'd be glad to get some customers... we pretty much just got a drink and left.  

In retrospect, I don't even know why we bothered.
author: Joyce H.

description: Glad you didn't disappoint, Harlot.  For a seemingly "house" playing club, you delivered all the popular dance jams for a bachelorette group - even the bride-to-be's request "Single Ladies". The dance floor was crowded with maybe 1 or 2 other bachelorette parties and more females than males, but that's ok. The dance floor was crowded, but didn't need to be. All the VIP seating was all open and could've been pushed back to make a larger dance floor.  Everyone liked Harlot better than Temple and would go back. A great night at Harlot worth the anticipation - yay!
author: Tara A.

description:
Pros: nicely decorated club, decent music

Cons: Racist bouncer who looks like Moby, Racist Manager, Racist table service

Bottom line: Filed complaint with better business bureau and put in the call to civil law attorney. Enjoy :)
For those thinking about going that aren't white, please read other similar complaints below.
author: cool g.

description: If I could give negative stars I would. This is probably the worst club in the city. My boyfriend and I waited in their stupid line for 45 minutes waiting to get in when finally we get to the moby wannabe bouncer tells about 1.1 ratio guy/girl.  Really in S.F. he then preceded to tell us that if we dated girls we would be in.  I'm telling everyone I know to boycott this racist homophobic place
author: James R.

description: I always heard about this place, but just tried it (I know I'm late).  Got here early around 10 and no line (and we found GREAT parking).  Ladies are free (even if you came later) and we got a VIP stamp for upstairs.  The DJ started around 10:15p and the lights dimmed.  It got totally packed within the hour.  No place to move or dance.  But we enjoyed the place since we moved on elsewhere after seeing our friends.  Employees were friendly.  Drinks are moderately priced.  Wouldn't come here any later than 10:30p since it gets so packed.  Decor is like Left Bank Steak sort of - chandeliers (antler though), dark wood, faux cow hide chairs.
author: Chris L.

description:
I heard this place was soooo hard to get into....that it was like Vegas; if you don't look hot, you get turned away.  Seriously?  Wow!  Not that I was on the prowl but the people there were not what I expected at all, at least not from what I had been told.  Turned away if you're not hot?  Um, that would mean the entire place practically?

The crowd was ok, a little on the snooty side, but really had NO reason to be...so if this is your favorite place, sorry, that would probably be you I'm talking about.  My girls and I were there for my bacherlorette party and had these cute slightly enlarged rings on that shined to a minimum.  It was nothing obnoxious but the so called high-end crowd was not too keen on the fun we were trying to have, asking us to turn our rings off.  Sorry if the lights made you uncomfortable dude.  We know you look your best in the DARK!  

The music was bunk, at first.  I expected this though b/c I was told that Saturday played a good amount of techno.  It wasn't the techno that turned me off, it was the fact that they mixed in too many different kinds of music.  I mean if you're going to do 8o's and techno, stick to a flock of songs at one time, then change it up.  Going back and forth between New Order and Guns and Roses, and then OMD and Van Halen was not hot.  It was only after midnight that they started to play hip hop. 

The bouncers at the front were nice I must say, security was not harsh like at most clubs.  They ask you nicely to move along and don't shine those gawdy flashlights in your face.  The bouncers were well dressed and for the most part blended in well with the crowd with their headset pieces tucked inside the back of their suits.  

Didn't have drinks at the bar so I can't comment on the costs or whether they were watered down or not; we had bottle service and our server was very nice.

This place gets three stars b/c although my girls and I had a great time with our own clan, I'm knocking off two stars b/c the music was bunk (at first) and the crowd was too snooty....at least for my taste.
author: KC C.

description:
This place is cool if you can get in. At about 9 or ten, they bring the clipboard out and if you're not on it, you're not getting in.  This of course, all depends on the night and what party is happening there.  Therefore the nights here can be inconsistent; you never really know what is going on in here, unless you are really in the know.  

Came here for the OM party and it was cool.  DJ was working it out and the place was packed.  The people was a diverse mixture of hipsters, marina-ites, and happy hour looking people.  

Damon Wayans came in for a second, but I think he left cuz it wasn't Hip Hop.  I don't get star-strucked, but dam he's a cutie!
author: Debbie N.

description:
WARNING ON THE DRINKS

Went on a Thursday and the crowd was great, energy was great, staff was working their asses off.

Unfortunately, when buying $12 drinks, they seem to pour using the cheapest, most low end alcohol they could find.   Result = massive all day hangover.

I don't get hangovers from three drinks, but Harlot somehow managed to make that happen.

Bottom line: $12-15 dollar drinks should not be from the bottom shelf.
author: Chad P.

description:
Sooo... this place I just happened to get invited to this past week because a friend of friend was doing a live art installation that night soooo not sure I would love this place so much if not for the event it put on. I will say that the art work is AMAZING and the DJ wasn't bad (but that could have been the free Singha beers I had that night). I also love how non descript this place is on Minna. I do think that places like this pack too many people into it which is why I dont go to places like this that often... but other than that... the guys were better looking than the girls... and better dressed. 

The Harlot could benefit from not letting so many people in... I ean if your going to have such a beautiful place... make it a little more excusive.... might as well, right?
author: roderick h.

description:
I made a Yelp account just to review this place after getting worried about previous reviews.  After inquiring about bottle service for Harlot, we were contacted by Sarah.  She was extremely professional and patient.  With only two days before our planned birthday event, I agreed upon two bottles (2 bottle minimum) for a Saturday night.  I let Sarah know I would be paying with cash just to make things easier.  I made sure everyone arrived early, right before 10pm.  I was greeted at the door by Sarah and was shown our table options.  We chose a corner away from the dance floor and we were taken care of all night by our server.  I ordered two bottles of Vodka at $250 per bottle, plus the 20% gratuity made my bill $600 total.  I ordered several shots as well and ended up spending another $200.  I NEVER was asked to move or to pay for a better table like some people have been saying in their reviews.  

After reading previous reviews I was a bit worried.  However, my experience here was nothing but great.  I'm Asian and had no problems like I read from other Yelpers that keep making "Asian" references.  I walked right in and talked to the bouncers a bit, my friends and I drank a whole bunch, we danced our butts off to hip hop, and left with nothing but smiles on our faces.  Service was superb and I even got a follow up e-mail from Sarah thanking me.  Would I come back here?  No doubt.  The laser lights alone would make me come back.  I felt like a stoner staring up at the lasers every 10 seconds.  My only suggestion is to get here early to avoid any lines or waiting.  The same goes for any club really.  It is hard to find since it's in a narrow alley way and you'll probably think you're lost. The service, music, and Sarah rock. I recommend this place to get your groove on and to have a good time, cause I had a blast.
author: Durty D.

description:
It's a bit annoying really, but whether you're a 'hot' item or not, male or female, rich or poor, I don't think anyone would ever deny that Harlot is doing their best to act as if they were in LA on Sunset when it comes to the door entry.  Even if you're one of the 'chosen ones' to get past the ID checkers, you probably witnessed some poor schlep at the door getting denied or forced to wait in line (for an unusual amount of time) with almost no one ahead of you.  So regardless, unless you are at least one of (or more likely a combination of) the following - Hi...you'll be known as 'Schlep' here.

* Female
* Beautiful (subjective I know)
* Rich

This time was no different.  We even came early to get 'stamped' so we wouldn't fall victim too.  We were the first people there.  When the door guy finally got around to us, he asked, "Is it just the three of you tonight?"  We replied yes and that we were meeting a birthday celebrant here.  The guy damn near flipped - "Wait, do you have bottle service?!"  We said 'no' and asked if there was a problem.  He said, "Yes, especially if you have 20 people showing up."  Our jaws almost dropped in disbelief  - especially in this economy...you want to segregate?!  We told him 6 girls will be here after dinner if that's ok.  He proceeded to grant us entry.  Twenty of us showing up unannounced like this must have had questionable belong at such an upscale 'public venue' like Harlot.  Wow. 

Harlot only gets an average of 3 stars on Yelp yet the place remains seemingly popular.  I've been here a few times prior to this one always hoping that it will get better.  The only reason I was here this time because a good friend was having a 'thirty something' birthday and chose Harlot for her celebratory baptismal because she's never been there.  

It's really a decent spot once you get in - but the stink of 'pretentious club' looms all about the outer perimeter...
author: Derik P.

description:
hah...hahha...hahahha....

The bouncers out front of this lounge act like they're guarding the doors of Pure or Jet in Las Vegas....at least, when I went.  meh, but I guess that's not the most important thing.  

Friendly bartenders, plenty of couches to lounge/chill on, unique/disturbing? artwork to glance at..., and good drinks.  Can't say too much about the mixed drinks cause I stuck to good ol' Guinness and .... beer.... but they did make a yummy sea breeze :)  

Only came for happy hr. so not sure how it is when they play music and when it's crowded.  Nice atmosphere but I prefer John Collins for Happy Hr.
author: Kat C.

description:
Do NOT go here. We reserved a table and the douchebag guy at the door said nobody else on our guest list could come except the 12 people who were with us at that moment. We were expecting a lot more people to join us. Why bother having a guest list when they will not honor it. I had a few friends who were already inside and they said the place was empty?!
Why turn down business? We were dressed pretty sharp so I wasn't sure what the problem was. There was about 15 guys standing outside telling us they wouldn't let them in either. 
And to top it off the douchebag was giving us the worst attitude. Since when does standing outside of a club with a clipboard give you a right to be an asshole?
author: Maureen D.

description:
This isn't a "get a well crafted pre-prohibition-style whiskey sour" type of place. This is a "get a jack n coke in 5 seconds, and go hang with your friends or oogle at people" type of place.

The crowd is thankfully well blended (in both ways) and it's always an interesting night. Music selection varies throughout the evening, but keeps you in the party mood.
author: Jason L.

description:
Very dissappointing. This place used to be a hot spot two years ago and I came so much that I actually have a Harlot sticker on my license. 

Never throw a party here, they like to rip people off. We spent $600 on a table for two bottles only to have our friends turned away at the door. Ironically, if they DID NOT mention they were with our party, then they could get in. If they DID mention they were with our party, they were sent away after we hit our 10 person quota.

Ridiculous. If you're going to a party here, don't tell them you are on their guest list. I do wish they were nicer, I have recommended this place to a lot of friends.
author: Madhu P.

description:
The first thing I thought when I saw the velvet rope and the sign with just an H on it was pre-tentious.

The interior is black with high ceilings and paintings everywhere, I think they were trying to go for a high class brothel motiff. I did like the big aquarium where you can observe smokers in their natural habitat.

In all seriousness this place is a little too hot, the music is a little too loud, and I thought it was low class the way they ignored us at the bar trying to order while they let clock run out on the happy hour specials.

I had a good time here but mostly because it was full of meetup people, I don't think I'd like it on a normal night.
author: Manny F.

description:
Harlot is gasping for breath, in its last throes

The door policy here has simply become laughable - here's why:

1) Harlot used to be less well known, and it used to actually have an inherently "good" crowd (cute girls, guy/girl ratio in check, not ghetto).
2) The good crowd has left / become smaller, so they need to fill the club with the "riffraff" now

So now, in order to defend their dying rep, they get uber-strict at the door, which just turns off more of the good crowd - its total b-team now and they don't know what to do.

Seriously, it is more of a pain in the ass to get into harlot than it was to get into the best meatpacking district clubs in NYC in 2006-07.  The difference is that once you got into Bungalow 8, you were rewarded with beautiful people dressed to kill ... here you get cankles
author: Anthony L.

description:
Nice place and the location is starting to gel. The upstairs area is very nice and more intimate if you can get close to the fire place.. nice touch. Also going when they are serving free sushi makes for a nice evening.
One thing is the Cosmopolitan was not mixed well and quickly discarded for a different drink.
author: Lawrence T.

description:
Please God, let this place still be around and still be this amazing by the time I get back to San Francisco in a month.   (shelf life seems to be about 4 months on these places, but I can pray that Harlot will beat the odds)

The bartenders are well trained (heavier drinks for girls) so it's overkill to get a table, especially with Harlot's minimum/maximum requirements and price, just have your girl friends "boob their way to the bar" (citing Kelly E's review) whenever you need a refill.

What really makes this place amazing is that everyone is so damn relaxed and comfortable. Everyone's just happy, not posing, not people-watching, not wall-flying, not creepily staring at you from two tables over until you start worrying that they might have dropped something into your drink when you got up to dance that last time.

Worth any wait.  And don't bother waiting if you don't plan to dance.  

First rule of White-Boy-Dance-Club: "No one cares if you can dance, just get up and dance."
author: Mike V.

description: It's a good place to go on Sundays and Thursdays! Not that crowded and as far as I remember there isn't any cover charges!!! Just make sure you get on guest list since the doorman is a bitch! He might not let u in!!!
author: Golazin R.

description: I celebrated my milestone birthday here and booked two VIP tables ($700), which resulted in a disappointing experience for me and my friends. The pretentious staff - especially the doorman and the person in charge of the "list" - were rude, apathetic and negligent. I wouldn't recommend celebrating a special occasion here, but I do know some promoters host events here, which can be fun and worthwhile.
author: Kim H.

description:
Although the club is pretty inside, the beginning of the night sucked because of the "Moby" look a like at the door. You need some customer service skills esp. if we (the customers) have table service and end up buying 5 bottles. He was a rude a**hole! The staff inside kinda made up for it with their attentiveness to refill our ice buckets and clean up our tables like every 5 minutes. ( just a tad bit annoying since I had to tell them on two occasions, "I'm not finished with that yet please) but still, good service. Oh and the bathroom attendance was a really nice lady. As for the music, they played Miley Cyrus...come on seriously? That's something I would play at my 2 year old's party.  Oh and they played Rick Astley...why?? (the redhead one hitter quitter from the 80's) nuff said...

1 star for the look of the club
1 star for the bathroom attendant
author: Bj S.

description: My company rented out Harlot for the going away party of one of our executives. The venue pretty cool, we had the private party area upstairs, and below the happy hour crowd seemed to be having a good time. I would like to come back and check out the happy hour that they offer. They have a little dance cage area that you have to climb a latter to get into, DO NOT ATTEMPT this. My co-worker, who was fairly intoxicated, tried to get up there and the bouncers threw him out. Obliviously i do not blame them, it was a total safety hazard, but just remember you are not allowed in the cage!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
NEVER been in before and most likely never will. My brother in law set up a party for my sister at this place. We went to dinner at MoMo's and we were supposed to come here after. When we got to the door they said they weren't letting anyone else in anymore. Though my brother in law reserved 2 tables. Then they changed their mind saying that only girls could come in and if guys wanted to come in they would have to be paired up with a girl or girls. A few seconds later they said that no one was allowed in even though we had a guest list too and TABLES. Since they wouldn't accomodate our party though they still charged my brother in law $150 we ended up going to the sports bar around the corner and had way more fun there! 

This isn't freaking Vegas....i don't understand when all of a sudden going to a club/loung became so elite! I'll stick with bars if that's the case.
author: Jazmine S.

description:
It's a shame when you see a place with so much potential suck SO MUCH.  Harlot has very cool dark art and lots of seating. I've been pleased with the music, but the staff is poor.I believe the bouncers and tenders have been imported from LA.

The bartenders will look at you in the eye and take an order from someone standing behind you...look at you in the eye again and take an order from their "friend" standing next to you.  Tenders like that don't deserve a tip in my opinion. 

boo.
author: Jay S.

description:
From the last time I actually partied in SF was when lounges really didn't exist.

Lounges are perfect because it gives a smaller setting, a better and inviting ambiance  and the crowd is a bit more mature. 

Harlot describes all of this. It may have been crowded, but only because it's small.  

Two things I like about this place

- mixed crowd
-mixed crowd! 

and that's very rare in SF!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Attracts a douchebag/bitchy pretentious crowd.    

Interior is nicely designed, but the space was small.

DJ was terrible--worst part was he mixed a TI song with some random house beat. 

Thank god I was drunk but when you're this aware of how bad a club is when you're drunk, this means it's a pretty damn bad club.
author: Donna M.

description: This place was so disappointing.  We went for a friends birthday and I intend to make that my last visit.  Why didn't I like it?  Let's start at the front door.  The door man was smoking a cigarette.  He blew smoke all over me and my companions and by the time I entered the club I reeked of tobacco smoke.  If I wanted that, I would smoke.  Next room seemed to be filled with catty girls and sleezy guys, all of whom were drunk and bumping into one another.  The floor is too crowded to move around because they dropped the VIP area into the middle of the passage way between the bar and the dancefloor. The decor was boring (black walls with a few sad paintings of women in lingerie) and the dj played nothing but over-bassed house music.  I don't go clubbing often, but if I do, I expect it to be a classier experience than I had here.
author: Jim S.

description:
This is reason number one why I should never go somewhere without first reading Yelp.  Two-way mirror in the bathroom, WTF!  a) someone or a sign should warn you of that before going into the bathroom b) people who have been drinking don't pay attention to signs so maybe....just don't do it!  

Can't provide the most accurate review because this night was a forget-my-life level of alcohol consumption.  We came here after another event and got right in and then decided on table service after a round or two.  The good treatment may have been due to the fact that we were all couples and dressed up.
author: Maria D.

description:
Boys, do I feel sorry for you...this place gives you the hardest time getting in.  But...since I'm not, I've had no issues with that and find that the bouncers know how to treat a lady.  Love the fact that there's no cover either!  

Pro's about this place: Good, diverse crowd with a balance of guys and girls. Cool layout and upkeep is good.  It's not so big either that you can't find your friends at any point in the night.

The con's: Expensive drinks. Music selection is unpredictable-either really good hip hop or awful electronica mixes. (Last time I was here the DJ played a country version of Gin N' Juice! SO wrong!) Also, there's hardly anywhere to sit if you've not ordered table service.

Overall, been here a handful of times and will probably keep coming back.
author: Shree R.

description: I've only been to Harlot during the week for happy hour or events.  Harlot seems to throw a LOT of special events and they're usually pretty good.  It's also free to get into and they have pretty good dance/top40 type music.  They have an indoor smoking chamber for the smokers.
author: Dipesh G.

description: This placed is located in the corner of an alley reminiscent of a modern day speak easy. But when you walk in you see a clash of classical arts mixed in with modern chic. There are painting of roman greeco drawings and dark cynical paintings . Really random decorations let leave it at that. But after you get over how crazy it looks you see that it's not a bad place to talk to people. The music isn't super loud and there are plenty of seating. It sort of remind me of a really weird mix between a brewery and a lounge. The happy hour here is so damn cheap it also blew my mind. $3 for beer ?! Wow that is less than most of the tips I give at bars in the city for a beer. If you want to save a couple bucks and actually get to talk to people in a lounge setting this place would be the best to go to. Just don't get lost.
author: Kyaw L.

description:
"Renaissance hillbilly" best describes the art that lines the walls of this venue and this sets a nice tone for newcomers.  This intimate venue doesn't hold a very large crowd and that adds to its quaintness.  

The bar area is small and near the entrance.  This is perfect.  It allows one to get down to business as soon as one enters.  Sometimes I'm not in the mood for that large venue that "everyone" goes to.  You know what I'm talking about; that venue that is so large you have to find the bar.  I mean, you can't really go straight to the bar in larger venues because you'll look like you're there for the booze and not the show.  The Harlot takes this worrisome possibility off your hands by having the bar near the entrance.  By thoughtfully placing the bar here, I kind of have to grab a drink as soon as I enter since it is on the way to the happenings.  It only makes sense to do this.  In the end this will save me time and I think we all can agree that you can never go wrong with time saving.

I came here to see some electro house jams performed live.  The crowd was a pleasant mix of the young and not so young, as well as those who were down to get down and those who weren't.  

The aesthetic charm of the Harlot alone has me anxiously awaiting my return.
author: Jaime L.

description:
My first thoughts upon entering were this place is hecka small for a dance club!  It's more a lounge with a small dance floor, but good times were had none the less! It's a trendy spot, translation for hot youngsters and tourists.

DJ was good but no vibe. I just wasn't feeling the energy on the dance floor, like I have at other spots.  Maybe because it was Friday night and 95% female up in there, but all-in-all a cool spot with upstairs area to people watch, comfy couches to sit and look pretty, nice bathrooms, rad bartenders, nice bouncers, and a smoke room.  Word.
author: Michele O.

description:
Harlot is the one place downtown that seems to hold some sort of strange mystique for me. When I pass by, I always recall moments I spent inside, which really are hazy at best (they serve alcohol here). The most memorable moment was when a friend and I were fortunate enough to catch a free acoustic performance by Dido. If that's not an ambient memory, I don't know what is. 

But, given the lush crowd it attracts, I feel a bad experience here is overdue. Like the Airbus A380 or the Octomom, it's only a matter of time before someone builds a bigger plane or pops out more babies, respectively. Until then, I have to say my past three experiences at Harlot were nothing short of wonderful. With a beautiful interior and a convenient location, I really just can't complain.
author: Keane L.

description:
I have not been to a club in AGES. That should tell you a little bit about me! Having said that, I think this place is quite nice.

I went here for an exclusive birthday bash for my cousin Justin and I was not disappointed. The music was a great mix of club, hip hop, and old skool jams (which I found myself and my hub the only ones dancing to-go figure).  You could definitely tell the DJ was over 30 since most of the songs playing no one around us knew, so then he had to switch back to the pop-ish, new skool R&B-ish stuff. (small boo)

Bartenders look overwhelmed but you could always trade a smile in for some service and I find that always works well. 

Chic, earthy environment (branchlike lighting and dark walls/low lighting). 

Upstairs VIP section is nice to look over and people watch. gets crowded so make sure you reserve some tables ahead of time.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Damn sexy inside, but star five could be 'cause my awesome girlfriends kick ass to party with, or maybe because hiding out in a dark echoey bathroom with groups of friends and strangers is fun.  
Also love the giant paintings.
Also love the white VIP loft-lounge overlooking the dark velvety musky decor.
Was a great place to hang, drink, hide out in the bathroom, just swim through all the peeps and dance to the fun loud house-hiphop-80's dj-mixup.
author: Today Y.

description:
Been here a few times - but last weekend the music sucked!!!
Earlier in the year when we had come here the music was good and fun crowd. But it seems the dj  on Saturday was playing old remixed music from 1980s!
Also no place to sit as they have set all tables as table service. 
Not sure I will return.
author: S B.

description:
This pretentious little club thinks it's something it ain't.

They say it's guest list only... on a case-by-case basis.  That's a load of horseshit!

Tried to go here twice.  

Once, I was let in.  The interior is done up really well and succeeds at creating a 'sexy' vibe.  A lot of hot women, a lot of guys with chest hair popping out of the top of their striped shirts. As I stood outside with/waiting for friends, I watched the asshole bouncer turn away group after group of people, male and female alike. What a fucking buzzkill.

The other time, I was denied.  I can't blame them for their little guy/girl ratio-fixing policy, but really - who does this benefit?  If a group of 5 attractive girls aren't going to go in because you won't let their lone guy friend in with them... uh, that doesn't make any sense to me.  Besides, we all know that women don't pay for their drinks - they find chump guys to.  And if you keep the chumps out, who's paying for all that alcohol? 

If you're a girl and you want to get in, hike up that dress.  If you're a guy and you want to get in, when they let your hot female friend in - hold her hand.  But I wouldn't bother anyway... this place is WACK.
author: Gary L.

description:
Harumph. I've been here several times, and it was always sort of a nondescript experience, so I never bothered to review . . . however, I believe recent events need to be brought to light. 

Last month, I was at Harlot, and I decided to check 2 items: one s.w.o.r.d. leather jacket, and a marciano blazer. These were 2 of my wardrobe favourites, so I specifically asked them to put each one on a separate hanger and give me 1 tag per piece, or 2 total. they seemed fine with that, no complaints or odd looks. 

Lo and behold, this little piggy overindulged, and went home with coat check tags still in her wallet, but sadly lacking in outerwear! I was traveling out of the town the next day, but the following week I called up the place and told them I wanted to see if they still had my items. The gentleman who answered the phone was incredibly rude! (I called on a Wednesday early in the evening, so I doubt they were ridiculously busy at the time). Before I even finished my inquiry, he cut me off and said "we have an entire BOX of stuff that's been left in coat check, you have to come and look through it yourself." 

O-KAYYYYY sorry mr. high & mighty! sheesh. so, i schlep myself over to the H-lot . . . . when I asked the nearest bartender where I should go if I were looking for some lost & found items, she asked me to describe them, then said she'd go look for them! 

???? What happened to having to look through it myself? at first i was pleasantly surprised that i'd been saved the trouble of looking for it. until she came back up and said, "no, sorry, we don't have anything." 

{insert incredulous piggy stare here} "ummm . . . . but i still have the coat check tags and everything . . . so what happened to them, i know someone else didn't claim them?" 

at which point she gives an exasperated sigh and says, here, why don't you just come take a look? so, we trundle down the stairs and she leads me into a room which looks like the office, and on one side of the room there's one of those wires people hang laundry from, and it's got some hangers with jackets hanging from it. there, hanging right on the end, was my marciano blazer. one down. 

btw . . . . where's this big box of stuff the guy on the phone was talking about?? 

once again i reiterated that there was also a leather jacket . . . . at which point the girl says "ok wait, let me check one other place . . . " 

WTF IS GOING ON HERE?!?!? how difficult is it to gather up all the stuff that was left in coat check at the end of the evening and chuck it into a box?!? if the bellagio security can rescue my clothing which i only remember 2 weeks after i checked out, sure the much smaller harlot can deal with a single lost & found box?!? 

oh yea, and they couldn't find the leather jacket. when i asked them what could have happened to it, given that i still had the claim ticket in my possession, i just got a sort of shrug and a blank stare. 

um. not acceptable. i don't really care so much about the jacket, i can buy another one, but there was a pair of gloves in the jacket pockets that i'm devastated about losing. 

so, if you happen to see a female with hand size ~6.5, wearing the most exquisite pair of black suede driving gloves with 
*lightly perforated fingers 
*an opening in the back of the hand 
*silver hardware (a long flat bar with one rectangular link on each end) on the back of the wrist 
*silk lining 
*and a single black metal snap on the inside of each wrist 

ask her if she works at harlot, or if the person who gave her the gloves works there! and when she goes "hey, how did you know?" you can tell her it's because you know she (or her friend who gave them to her) EFFING STOLE THIS LITTLE PIGGY'S $800 LEATHER JACKET AS WELL AS HER GLOVES, WHICH WERE SPECIALLY AIRMAILED TO HER ALL THE WAY FROM NORWAY. 

then you should avoid coming in close proximity to her if at all possible, as karma's a bitch and you don't want to become collateral damage when something horrific inevitably happens to her as a result of her shady, underhanded thieving ways. 

places that hire dishonest employees with bad attitudes who don't have a set policy for anything, it seems, do not get good ratings in my book.
author: Vicki Y.

description:
I came here on a Thursday night after a recommendation for a friend.  We showed up fairly early (around 10) and getting in was no problem.  I got the impression that later on in the night, they might have been a bit more strict, but it never really got "full."  I understand that on Fridays/Saturdays its a completely different picture.  

The vibe inside is pretty cool, but I was surprised how small the venue is.  The dancefloor itself is probably only 30'x30' or so.  There are a number of tables upstairs and downstairs, which can give it a more of a lounge/club hybrid feeling.  I loved the theme, which is kind of goth-like, but in a classy nightclub sort of way.  It's got some sort of bizzare artwork on the walls.  All the lights are redish-orange and the supports are steel and riveted -- very cool. 

I danced a bit, but mostly just enjoyed chilling on the couches and having some good drinks.
