The drinks actually weren't too expensive, which was nice -- about $12 for a beer and pineapple fruity drink for my lady friend.  I was surprised, though, that they couldn't make a mojito, which seems to have become a pretty standard drink at a nightclub.

Regarding the comments about the bouncers, I, personally, thought they were fine.  The bouncers in the front were a little bit "club persona", but still courteous.  The bouncer we talked with a bit at the back entrance was super nice and made us want to come back again soon.

All in all, it was a cool experience and I'm glad to have added Harlot to my list of places I've been to in SF.
author: Alex M.

description:
Me and some fierce friends headed over to this place to enjoy a brief night of dancing.  We were a little apprehensive when we realized that our destination was nestled away in an alley way.  It was just a little creepy.

To our pleasure, there was no cover charge and it was quick and easy to enter into the club.  However....once we got inside...we realized that the website description and the hype from other people was SOOO not up to par.  I would've probably noticed all the details if there was actually some LIGHT up in there, but all I really noticed were the antler chandeliers and some naked woman painting.  

The drinks were expensive!!! $20 for two drinks?!?!  

Anyway, I was REALLY pleased with the DJ.  It got us on the dance floor, and we stayed there (well...there isn't really any other option unless you have reservations) for the whole time we were there.  The music was great; mixing those hyphy tunes with even a little Journey! Awesome!

Overall, it's just okay.  But with the right people, I'm sure you can make it great. Definitely one of the better straight bars/clubs I've been to in the city.  And OF COURSE...I found the only other gay boys inside the club...it's like we gravitate to each other.

Oh well....meet me at the pot of gold at the end of the rainbow??
author: Vince S.

description:
Interesting place!!!

Let me start off by saying my friends for the first time in my life took me bar/club hopping.  Never have I done it before and only heard about it and saw it on tv.  

Right before going to Harlot we were at John Colins (loved it, check out my review)

The was the complete opposite of John Colins.

Huge ass line out the door with folks waiting to get it.  Luckily my friends had the hook up and we slide right on in :)
When I got inside boy...it was a full on club.  I haven't been in a full on club in YEARS.
The music was playing so damn loud that I could hardly hear anything when I walked out the place.
The bar was soooo damn packed.  It was jammed packed with people.  I can't even count how many times my toes got trampled.  In fact, by the time I got home, I had no polish on my big toe.  LMAO.  That could be a bad thing or a good thing depending on what you're into and what you were trying to accomplish that night.

Totally not my type of setting but I must say it was fun.  The music was surely not my kinda music but I had a great time watching my friends have a great time and watching the other folks jamming to what appeared what their song.  lol

Also, it wasn't quite diverse.  I was surely the only black girl in the place.  

The best thing of the night in that place...OMG...Was this totally HOT guy with an accent was jocking me.  Thank GOD by the time he was shouting his conversation in my ear I hadn't gone deaf yet.  I found out he was from Scotland.  I made a mental note of me having to get to Scotland one day before I die :)  As we were leaving to continue our bar hope I said my goodbye to the Scottish guy.  Unfortunately I didn't get his name cuz I was loosing my hearing by then.  Right as I was going to shake his hand saying nice meeting him, he reached as though he wanted to hug me, no harm done right, so I hugged him, and then...HE KISSED ME.  Dead smack on the lips and seconds later I found myself tongue kissing a stranger!!!! OMG...not only has that never happened to me EVER before but that is the first time I've come remotely that close to even being near a white guy or his lips.  LMAO!!!! 

Like I said...Interesting place :)
author: Sandra S.

description:
Okay, so update from my first review. My first review was kind of bias..I went really late so there just drunk people all around and also I'm from Manhattan so I set the bar high..
Anyway, I'm updating this because this time around the DJ was better, the prices..well I didn't pay for anything- you know the right people things are free..and location is great! The doormen didn't give my friend and I any troube. Just walked up and velvet rope opened quickly, the music was hot- the DJ was so nice!, and the crowd was sexy. When I visit San Fran again, this place will be a spot I will always come back to, so definitely come out and check this place out!!
author: Maria T.

description: This place is simply awful -- I am convinced the bouncers here have serious racist tendencies.  I see them turn away minorities all the time.  It is really pathetic in this day and age.
author: Chaz N.

description:
I had no idea prostitutes had such huge egos and senses of entitlement (and I am not just talking about the clientelle, as the employees are competing for the prize, too). 

One extra star for the drinks and the decor, its pretty swank and they make some tasty cocktails. I guess this place was going for the high class prostitute thing.
author: Drue C.

description: I remember when you were the new spot in town.  My friend Josie loved you or was it Anya that loved you.  I don't remember but you are a naughty girl.
author: Suz L.

description:
Breezed right in, shook our tail feathers almost until they kicked us out, had a few drinks, and enjoyed ourselves immensely.  This was the third stop on our girls night out, so I cannot tell you a single thing about any of the people there (except some little girl that thought she was gonna be tough and start a fight with me until she realized I was just drunk and stumbly and also that I outweighed her by like 100 pounds) and some guy that was bummed he couldn't officially break into our group and get any of us to dance with him rather than each other.
I've always loved the interior and the fact that their drinks aren't insanely overpriced like they are at some other clubs.  
Hell, I don't think we even had to pay a cover.  Score.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Only been here twice. The first time was perfectly fine. I should've stopped there, haha. Night before thanksgiving this year was horrible. The place was hella packed, which was probably because there weren't many other parties going on. Parking was horrid because the lot is still closed and most parking garages were closed due to the holiday. We got to the door at 11:30 where we promptly got charged by a really mean Harlot employee to get in (the event was free before 11:30)... Come on... we drove all the way from SJ, parked about half a mile away, ran as fast as we could, almost got ran over... Only to get charged?! 

As if that weren't annoying enough... a fight broke out. WTF? Who fights to house music? There was pushing and hair-pulling. It was UGLY. The floors were wet and some parts were even sticky. The music... Oh, don't even get me started on that. If the music were any good, I'd think this was all worth it. But no... I guess that isn't Harlot's fault... So that's a review for the Salted crew (who delivers on most occasions, but sadly not this one). Oh well, chalk it up to experience... At least the bouncer was nice.
author: Loe M.

description:
I was here about a month ago and I liked the ambiance of the place. Only problem was, I didn't like the DJ. I can lie and say he was good but his mixes weren't  good at all and just because I was drinking and dancing doesn't mean that I can't tell if the DJ is good. I'm there to have fun and I'm not letting the DJ ruin my night. 

The staff there were genuinely friendly and helpful. They came by and made sure if you were finished with your drink they were going to take the empty glass. I actually like the fact they wanted to keep their place clean. 

If it wasn't for the DJ I would have given this place 4 stars easily but who mixes in old tv show themes into their music? His mixing was bad. Dude, you're mixing was just plain bad.
author: David G.

description:
So came here on a Saturday night to meet a cpl friends - it was list only.  we got in after the "list guy" made a stink about my bf's t-shirt.  The list guy was wearing a zip up heather grey sweatshirt...  uumm ok
So we get inside and the place is packed and tiny.
Mostly dudes and not the good kind - lol
DJ was playing random top forty "hip-hop" and rock music from 5-10 years ago.  We had a buzz goign from dinner so made the most of it and got our boogie on long enough to each have a cocktail, but then high-tailed it as soon as were were done.  Thank goodness we didn't pay to get in there.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Forget this place i got on the guest list early that day i got to the club and in line at about 1030 i was in complete dress code and there were about 5 people in front of me when i got to the front they verified my name and was told i was not on the guest list. I showed the guy with the ipad my email verification and was denied again, so i asked if i can pay the regular admission price and was told i had to be on the guest list to pay there was a group of four of us all guys.  i understand that there is a ratio that they enforce but not at 1030 when the place was empty. We asked to get bottle service and they told us it was a 2 bottle minimum which came out to $1000.  It was my friends bday so we waited around for the rest of his party to get there, the bouncer said the only way we came in is if we were with girls.  A group of four girls from my friends party finally came through but we got denied again for not being on the list.  while i was standing there for like an hour i kept noticing that they were profiling people and certain people were told that they were not on the list bunch of haters.
i finally got in the place was half empty even though this place is really small. The music was good just because it was a well know DJ but the over priced watered down drinks were not very attracting but the place and decor are pretty good
author: Milton G.

description: Not the biggest club, still a fun crowd both times I've gone.  It's definitely a more intimate venue for when seeing a choice DJ.    They had an area you can climb up into and dance and when we did they told us to come down, why have it and have it open if you can't use it... place was more of a tease for me than other clubs in the area. Drinks were $10 vodka mixes, not too bad but not a real drink special either when two drinks buy me a bottle at home. If I have a better experience in the future I'll update this review.
author: Jo A.

description:
Tired and way past its prime... 

It takes a lot for me to get off my lazy behind and actually write a review, but our experience at Harlot last night was so horrid that I feel it only fair to warn folks. Sadly, I was the one to recommend the spot to my 25+ friends who made the effort to show up because I'd had fun there several times before. 

The blond female bartender gave me and all of my friends so much attitude that we were honestly taken aback. She spent half the night texting rather than serving the crowd and when she did actually pay attention to folks she seemed totally put out. If you seriously hate your job or yourself that much, you should just stay home. 

First drink: Makers and ginger. All seemed fine to me. 

Second drink: my roomate brought back a Makers and soda. So I went up to the said "bartender" and asked her for a fix. She pulled out the gun, threw in a splash of Coke and 7up and said 'Now you have a Makers and Ginger.' I responded, 'well actually it isn't.' She very argumentatively responded, 'well we don't even have ginger.' 

Perhaps you should have mentioned that when I ordered my first drink? I tipped her what I would have if I'd received decent service because I find it hard to punish idiocy. 

The DJs are the only redeeming feature and if I were them, I'd get outta that place and find a real spot.
author: Clint B.

description:
For immediate and corrective referencial sourcing of this omnifactual review, please see: http://youtube.com/watch?v=n1sZLSO9va0

I've got the power. Or so I thought.

On Thursday night, at Harlot, like the crack of the whip I snap attacked in my vest/tie/pinstripe combo outfit. 

And I came to realize what? Harlot got the power.

Harlot got the power to make me spend TWO HOURS working away at the cutest guy ever: flirting, batting my lashes, pursing my lips, demurely touching my neck, his shoulders, his powerful arms, stare coyly at his beautiful face. 

And like seven to fourteen wise divine, I was all, "OMG, he seems to be okay with this, and heavens, could he actually be interested back? Maybe? Sort of? Potentially!"

Karen K (in all her gay glory, while drunkenly whipping about her Infamous Purse of Innocence and Purity Gone The Whitney Crack-Is-Whack Route) was all, "YEAH, MAN, TOTALLY GO FOR HIM! GO! GO! GO! I'M GAY FOR MYSELF, ETC. AND SO ON!" (She's the lyrical Jesse James, FYI) and I was all "Okey dokey, Karen K. I will!"

And then, a little while later, I casually make a comment with the ever-divine Shatangi O. present: "This is totally the gay corner."

And the man of my dreams? 

"Oh, I'm actually straight.

[Wait for it]

and married."


OUCH.

He's gonna break my heart. He's gonna break my heart of hearts.

Imagine my mystifed molgertation. It was mollifyingly mortifying. Do you dig what I am saying like a shovel rhyme devil??? On a heavenly level????? If so, please hand me said shovel so I can bury myself 4eva.

Harlot got the power.

Snap.
author: Joshua L.

description:
What is an old fart like me, doing in a place like this? Um, yes, there are days when I'm almost too embarrassed to tell you of the places I'm visiting. It's a good thing the shameless hussy in me ends up Yelping about it anyway. 

The Decor = GOOD! 
I like the decor in this place! It reminds me of Disneyland's Haunted Mansion! 

Staff = Cool Beans 
I got in quick. I got my drinks quick. Quick-quick-quick! I LOVE that! 

The Music = WTF? 
What in hell is up with the music at clubs and bars these days? Are you freaking kidding me?? Songs come in with no rhyme or reason. One second I'm dancing to ghetto hip hop, the next Madonna, then house, followed by Heavy Metal... WTF? You are confusing me, Mr. DJ. I mean, you are displaying a massive case of music-genre-schitzophrenia. You are causing my body to twitch out of rhythm -- perplexed at the music going from E-40 to Depeche Mode. "WTF?! PUT DOWN THE CRACK PIPE!" 

The Dance floor - Aggravating 
Oh, you know the feeling of being excessively pushed and shoved and backed into by an off-beat shaking butt? Yeah, I'm not so sure that I wanted to dance after a few minutes on the dancefloor...however, "BAR FIGHT!" kept echoing through my head and clenched fist. Of course, old farts have no business getting into bar fights -- lucky bastards! lol 

Overall, the place was okay. If you like random music and crowded places where the space is so tight you can rub your back and  front package on strangers, definitely check it out.
author: Ladi Da A.

description:
Alright alright, lemme speak right now after gettin' home from this place.  I'm still a bit tipsy but lemme write this out before i forget......

I have never seen a surplus of Marina chodes all congregatin' in one spot until TONIGHT.  Accompanying the Marina chodes are the titty girls servin' up they shit like it's on a hoisted whores d'ouevres platter.... and i saw this private party with a hoochie havin' her poon wavin' up in the air like it just don't care!  I'm all about the flashing of your proverbial ( | ) coz that's empowering and hot.... but... uh.... with the weather bein' how it is lately... shoooooot..... i'd recommend random chickenhead ho to use up more layerin' up in that bitch.  I KNOW it's humid and shiett up in that club, but DAYNGGG!! DO YOU REALLY NEED TO FLASH ERRRBODY YOUR FLIMSILY COVERED POON?

And wassup wid yo homeboy with the thin ass V-neck undershirt and gold necklace? Muthafucka had more cleavage than me... I started to get jelly.  Seriously... NO... srsly... is that even hot?  *I dunno*

And what the hell was that random dude tryin' to be his boy's wingman outside talkin' to the bouncers telling him, "HAVE YOU READ THIS GUY'S YELP REVIEWS?"  muthafucka WHO GIVES A SHIT!  You ain't Keane L. nor NOBOO K. nor Ed to the M., bitch!  I ask you this,.... How many fans DO YOU HAVE muthafucka!

And to that random ho who bumped into me, spillin' my drank all over my damn clothes.... yes, you with the pinkish flesh tight long sleeved, v-neck shirt, long, blonde curly hair... oooh... you're lucky i didn't get Stockton on your ass and KNOCKED YOU THE FUCK OUT!

The bartenders made my Jameson/Ginger Ale hella Jameson and not much Ginger Ale..... the bouncers are super nice and were making sure the ladies watched their step and didn't fall on they'z hoochified selves nor walk into the sketchy alley up ahead.  The space itself is pretty, and even the bathrooms come with a lady sitting in the corner who hands you paper towels and a tip jar next to her so the whole scene was to suggest that you tip her... uhm.. it's all good, i got no money to tip you lady, so thanks for the paper towel.  Music was bumpin'.... but srsly.... SRSLY.... 

wassup with these chodes (Asians and White boys alike) going up on these girls by just thrusting theyz hips, thankin' that shit is dancin'?  WHAT THE SHIT IS THAT?  shit ain't cute.  so you need to stop.  EPIL STOP.
author: Grace M.

description:
Fast bartenders, strong drinks, good old-time music. What was it?  80s?   

This is half an office building in one big room with a balcony overlooking the floor.  The famous painting on the back wall was OK, but I was much more impressed with the pictures in the table tops.  

Now, when a living legend declared the end of one of the most famous happy hour gatherings in America, the DYL, whose name is known coast to coast, I decided to show up.  I felt like I might be attending the last Monday Night Class with Steven Gaskin, or something like that.  

It turned out the room was spacious enough that we could all walk around, and the music was just turned up to a point where we could still hear each other.  I also found that in the glass smoking cage the music was shut out well enough that we could hold conversations at normal voice levels.  

What was nice about walking into this spacious lounge was that I immediately recognized about 1/3 of the people.  It was great to have a starting point of kind of knowing each other; that broke the ice really quickly.  Social comfort led to honest dialogue, and I found my inner child talking directly to other persons' inner children.  At times I was brought up to a more intellectual conversation, sometimes about multiple relationships and sometimes about the value of honesty in all interpersonal communication.  Along that line, I got a lesson or two in how jokes can be misinterpreted, and how when I don't get the joke my perception of reality is seriously distorted.  I'm one of those people who can dish it out, but can't take it.  

The crowd was reserved, for the most part, and there wasn't much for the bouncers to do except repeatedly ask the ladies to stop making out with each other.  

As the happy hour wound down and we drifted to other bars, I thought this was a very nice bar to have right downtown.  The insights into other Yelpers' lives were more than worth the $5 price of the well drinks.  

P.S.  This bar is cash only, and their ATM was out of order.
author: David D.

description:
I'm usually least interested in marina bars, or even slightly marina'esque bars. Seriously. I heard harlot was one of those punks, until I found five reasons why I loved it:

1. Decor. swanky, but classy. Wall colors are great. Cellophane translucent cube at mezzanine bar is attractive.

2. Within five minutes of jaunting in, I found a Marc Jacobs, a Gucci and one semi-exclusive D&G flaunting. Not the cheapo Marc by Marc Jacobs I remind you, but the real shebang.

3. No bullshit rock music, or "sit on me" rap music - but real good breaks with a lounge tone on the turntables. Good feet and shoulder exercise.

4. Good looking bartenders with charming service. This is no fucking Toronado or Zeitgeist. No snake tattoos or zombie industrial pants, or crazy people with deranged ear piercings, but friendly hotties serving you with youthful haircuts.

5. Excellent crowd. No hipsters, and very few dumb marina people. Also very few bridge & tunnel'ers. Good amount of eye candy. A lot of people are here you want to be seen with.

But why give 4 stars with all above said?
-- The drinks need to get stronger for the price.
Friday evenings and weekends are probably the best times to go.
author: Sav B.

description: My BFF and I had our bday party here last Saturday and the service SUCKED. They were pissed at us because we had 50-60 people at our party and didn't reserve a table.. FIRST off, i did call Thursday afternoon to inquire about a table, but no one called me back. They turned down so many people at our party. I don't think I'm coming back here anytime soon! Wouldn't it makes more sense if you just let people in? You do get more business that way instead of turning them down! It's not like the club was crowded that night! UGH, so frustrating.
author: Jojo N.

description:
Harlot is dark.

I look good in the dark.

You probably look good in the dark also.

That's the reason I am going to stop going to Harlot.

And drinking vodka.
author: Rachel G.

description:
WHAT...THE...FUCK...is going on here.

I don't know if I'm going to have nightmares or really sweet dreams after spending a Wed night here. It was both exciting but also extremely disturbing. If you want to pay $10+ per drink and watch demented european-vampire-bondage porn, by all means go.  And the music?  Totally awesome-ly strange.  If you want to recreate the Harlot experience in the privacy of your own home I reccomend the following:
-box of Franzia
-cds - She Wants Revenge, 80's, techno
-download alot of foreign porn, dogfights and rotating disco ball footage

note: I only noticed these things because I was sober.  You probably wont.
author: Katie H.

description:
"Intelligence arises when you realize you are fallible" - J. Krishnamurthy

In the past, I had a tendency to label any Bars in SOMA as "LA type" and give it a low rating. However, over the past 9 months I am realizing that our judgements are clouded by our perceptions and in order to be truly objective, we need to eliminate as much of our mental biases as possible.

Hence, even though Harlot is not my kind of place(as I don't like Bars in SOMA) I will still rate it 5 stars due to the following:

Star 1: The name Harlot conjures an era of hoary whoriness; brings a touch of elegance to our basic instincts.

Star 2: For the harmony in the layout of the space; subtle touches like the mysterious staircase to the upstairs bar abound. I was stoked by my experience of being shown the iron pillars embossed with turn of the century "Carnegie steel" by Jeremy, the Carnegie of cyberspace.

Star 3: The elegant decor from the cowhide chairs to the pictures of Harlots from different cultures, subtly appealing to the archetype of Harlot embedded in our collective unconsciousness.

Star 4: For the choice of drinks and for the choice of those who provide the drinks a.k.a  hot bartenders and staff. I casually complimented a staff on the taste of a piece of chocolate and lo and behold, she tracked me down after half an hour and gave me another piece.

Star 5: Harlot is located at 46 Minna(which, along with Jessie St, is also named after turn of the century harlots). So basically, Harlot within Harlot is a metaphor for mankind as most of us have an inner Harlot as we are selling our services for money. 

Nish, in his State of the Union address, pronounced that Harlot is going to be THE place for Happy Hour from Wed to Friday. For those wanting to let their inner Harlots come out and play after a hard days work, Harlot's proximity to the FIDI will surely make it the watering hole of choice for the after work party animals.
author: Kaustav C.

description:
I haven't been here since the Yelp Event, and it was an amazing time. It was definitely fun catching up with everyone and celebrating the last DYL with Todd and the gang. It seems like those drinking days are over for me. 

It is the perfect place to get drinks after work especially with their happy hour prices. They got live dj's, plenty of room to sit, dance, and mingle. 

They have a top floor if you want to get intimate, by that, I mean, you don't have to rent a cheap motel and hotel room. I Kidd....OK?

By all means, come here, it's the only place to be.
author: Stanley K.

description:
IF YOU ARE THINKING ABOUT GOING HERE, READ THIS:

I have been to Harlot on a couple occasions in the past. It has always had decent music in a pretty good setting. Apparently, they are trying to change the vibe.

After reading many reviews about the place which mentioned that it was impossible to get in if you have an unbalanced ratio of guys to girls, I figured that we should get there early. It was my birthday, so I told everyone to make it there as close to 9 as possible. 

How early did I get there? 8:45

The bouncer told us, EVEN THOUGH THERE WAS NOT ONE PERSON IN THE CLUB THAT DIDN'T WORK THERE YET, that there was no chance that we would get in without purchasing bottle service. Extortion, without a doubt, however that was not the worst part of it. The guy then went on to tell us that his brother works in the music industry and that this is just the way that it works. 

We looked past the fact that the guy was a complete douche, realized that it might actually make sense to order bottle service since it wouldn't be that much more expensive, but realized purely on principle that we were not going to be taken advantage of by this complete tool.

I ended up texting everyone to go to the HiFi, and I guarantee that we had a much better time than we ever would have in Harlot. 

Seriously, unless you like being taken advantage of by a sub-par place that thinks that it is a posh NY club, stay away.
author: Kyle M.

description:
Weirdest thing.  We came here tonight, Wednesday pre-Thanksgiving, there was a huge line and no one was allowed in.
I walked up to the bouncer and asked him how long the line was taking.  His friend looked at us and said, "they're next. let them through. they shouldn't be waiting in line."
WTF?
Then, we went to the bar and the bartender removed the rope and ushered us upstairs, apologizing for the wait.
WTF?
Then we stood alone in the upstairs area, watching pumas learn to be cougars.  
WTF?
Then my friend decided it was time for us to leave.
WTF?
Great time was had by all.  I'm not sure I'll be back here, because I'm not a..well... harlot.
author: Janney B.

description:
Shatangi thinks Harlot has a lot of potential!!! Great decor and sexy staff.  Fill it with a bunch of sexy Yelpers and it could make for a great Happy Hour spot as well as a club. I'm down for a try whenever jay h is ready.

Shatangi told you...
author: Njon W.

description:
I don't go "clubbing" all the time.  I enjoy this spot when I do.  I've never had a bad time here and the music always seems to be good.  Saw Chris Clouse last night and had a great time.

I would recommend getting on a list or getting their early (10pm) or bringing a gaggle of babes.
author: Travis M.

description: Harlot is a joke. The door man was incredibly rude. No line but they wouldn't let us in without a table reservations! At 10pm!!
author: Cheryl L.

description: beautiful venue, amazing crew, and my oh my the LIGHTING!!! I've never had a bad night at Harlot ever!
author: Eye K.

description:
Let's talk about whoring for a minute, kids. It is really hard to be single in San Francisco and not get your harlot on every now and again. This place did NOT inspire me to hush my inner whore. No, in fact, it made me want to unleash that hussy all over the place. And boy did I ever. Friday, Saturday, AND Sunday! Top that, Divine Brown! I hold Harlot responsible for all questionable behavior in the past three days.

Never mind that they named this bar after me, the place is hot. It's happening. And the bartenders (boys) were so incredibly delicious. The lady bartenders wear adorable burlesquey outfits and were kind enough to tell me where I could purchase one of my very own! Hot asses abound!

Drinks were strong and reasonable, the upstairs area is very, very white. And very, very sexy. Or maybe it's just me. There's also a smoking cage and well, we all know how much I like a cage. All the staff here are great- no attitude at this venue. If you're me, anyway. Plenty of space and seating means you can do your pimping, hoing, and drinking comfortably and spacious, clean bathrooms mean you don't have to leave to get your nasty on. Not that I would know. I'm not that kind of girl.
author: Autumn K.

description:
As far as "clubs" go, this place isn't so bad. 
Didn't have to pay cover, no line, good mixed crowd, wasn't too big or too small and was clean. Our friend got us a table for the night and service was attentive. Music was pretty good for the most part, lots of old school tracks mixed in with current beats. Wasn't drinking that night so don't know how the drinks are, but I'll make sure to try them next time.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Walking into Harlot feels like walking into the parlor of a goth beauty queen from a Tim Burton movie.  

The walls are black and hung with lush naked velvet bodies in lustrous wooden frames.  The chairs have been covered with cow hide and paired with dark leather love seats.  Moody lights hang from above at provocative angles and cast a glow on strange fronds and flowers.

Going to Harlot makes me want to wear my corset.  

Three reasons I don't:
1. The crowd is unpredictably fickle.  You never know whether you're going to get corporate or indie types.
2. Upon arrival, you will quite possibly realize it's closed.
3. There is a slight chance the bartender will look better in her corset than you do.
author: Nicole G.

description:
I'm really really torn with this place.  I really enjoyed the DJ and the music he was spinning last night...from current club bangers...to old school hip hop and 80's party jams...to rock and house.  He played it all and his skills made the genre shuffling seem effortless.

HOWEVER...I am not a fan with how this place is laid out or how crowded this place is.  I think they let way too many people in.  The dancefloor was SO packed that you couldn't move without bumping someone.  Luckily it was a pretty chill crowd.  Also, the line at the bar was at least 6 deep.  Later on in the night a guy mentioned it took him over 20 minutes to get to the bar and get a drink.  Ridiculous.  Luckily we had VIP tables with our own liquor.  (more on that later...)

So as I was about to say...trying to make your way through the crowd was nearly impossible without running into seemingly random pieces of furniture.  I wish I could have seen the set up before the club got packed...maybe it would have made more sense.  They also had their "VIP" tables all along the dancefloor which made the place even more crowded.  

And speaking of the VIP table service, we were a large group of about 17 women on a bachelorette soiree.  We were supposed to get the upstairs VIP section...but were "bumped" into one of the ones on the floor which was **entirely** too small for our group.  Ya, we weren't happy about that either.

Overall, this place wasn't terrible...but I don't know if I'd be in a rush to get back here either.  I'm with OBM's POV...not really my scene, but it's cool.  The extra star is really because the DJ was on point.
author: Angela N.

description:
This is probably my least favorite place in the SF. I've been here many times - mostly for bottle service - and the front door is absolutely horrible. Think "Knocked Up" club scene x100, even if you're with a group that has a table, even ration of guys:girls, etc. I feel bad that the bouncers have to hang with the douche extrodainaire out front for the whole night. 

The decor is cool, the upstairs is the best area of the entire club, music is awesome and drinks are good. But, abslutely not worth it in any terms.
author: Adrienne C.

description:
For a shorty* such as myself, the xth number "opening" party of Harlot was a little bit like being trapped in a thick of trees.  Like a dark forest.  In the Carpathian mountains.  Of Transylvania.  The only thing missing was a colony of bats.  So you can imagine my surprise when I had the honor of running into the Count himself.

Me:  Mister Dracula!  How do you do?  What brings you to San Francisco?

Dracula:  Vell, you know, they put me on the VIP list and my agent advised I drop in, at least make an appearance.  I'm horribly cranky though since I haven't yet had breakfast.  Vhat's a vampire got to do to get a stiff drink around here?  

Me:  Well, I just had dinner at Salt House so I'll probably be too salty.  I hear you're on a low sodium diet.  May I recommend one of the many attractive 5'11'' blonde Swedes out tonight?  What about that one in the corner?  She's so passed out drunk anyway, she won't even feel you bite her.  

Dracula:  Vhat vould be the fun in that?  Besides, I'm on American soil, I came for American Grade A, not euro crank heads -- I can have that anytime.  You know vat?  Forget it, I'll settle for a bloody mary.  

Me:  The pours are weak, but if you're buying, I accept.

With that, I barely managed to avoid having a claustrophobic seizure as we sat squished at the bar while all the trees danced and drank the night away.  Until midnight, when I turned into a pumpkin.

* 10. shorty (noun) - short or small lady.  a person of small stature.
author: Irene S.

description:
UPDATE: 5/11/07: OM party last night was so so good. I'm appreciating the decor more every time I go. The attention to detail to everything from the cocktail waitress outfits to the art to the sound system is outstanding. 
____________________________________________________
UPDATE from 4/25/07: Music improved. I'm sure they will continue to have proper DJs on most nights. The bartenders are so damn nice, drinks stiff, decor sumptuous down to the red-lit bathroom. Upstairs couches and low white stools perfect for catching up with your peeps. 
_____________________________________________________
If Martel & Nabiel were a publicly-traded entity, I would be the largest stockholder. I have been supporting their businesses in this City almost as long as I've been old enough to go out, and will surely be frequenting this newest iteration, Harlot. 

It's dark in a sexy way, with corsetted bartendresses and a lot of black. The layout, with couches, small dance area, bar stools, and a second level that overlooks it all, lends itself to mingling and lingering for a couple five or six cocktails. I assume the DJs will improve when they officially open--last night was an eclectic mix of top-40s type songs that I didn't expect to hear there. I'll be back next weekend and will report back on the music front. 

Nice job, Martel! If it weren't for you, I would have had to move to NYC years ago!
author: Gretchen T.

description:
Came here last Saturday with a couple of friends, and was pleasantly surprised. Security was a little rough but didn't take long to actually get inside. LOVED the coat-check lady...super nice and helpful.
The music was honestly hit or miss. Great songs accompanied by awful pop remixes that have just been ridiculously over-played.
The drinks were ok, no complaints about that. I definitely enjoyed the furninture and decorations...made the mood more enjoyable and more intimate. Great little balcony for ppl to overlook the downstairs area and dancefloor.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
Oh Harlot. 

You are so beautiful indeed.  I love the excruciating attention to detail and the uncompromising quality you've put into your appearance.  Black brick walls, large oil paintings, antler chandeliers, leather and cow hide couches and chairs, tables with beautiful images on them.  You've left no detail overlooked.  I'm not going to lie.  You're hands down the coolest looking bar in San Francisco.

But your attitude, your elitism and your attempts at exclusivity are a joke.  You make your mezzanine a VIP area, and won't let anyone without a wristband come up to check it out, even though there are only 5 people up there?  You keep a line outside when you are at half capacity?  And my personal favorite - you have to pay to reserve a seat else you're left standing?  Loved those empty tables with reserved signs on them while the remaining parts (other than that VIP area) were packed.

Nice work Harlot.  So now you'll be left with those who think they're better than everyone else, and those willing to pay for it. Have you forgotten what an antielitist city San Francisco is?

You were so close to being my favorite new bar in town, but instead I've got one bit of advice for you - get over yourself.  Unfortunately, I already am.

If anyone wants a Harlot VIP wristband, I've got a pile collecting dust at home.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Dear Harlot, 

It's hard to imagine that it's possible to review a facility I have yet to step foot in, but oh wait, it is possible... 

Perhaps it is because I got to spend 45 lovely minutes out in the cold?  
Or perhaps it was because women, appropriately attired to grace an establishment  whose name essentially translates to "woman prostitute", were promptly escorted in?  Or perhaps it was because everyone waiting in line had at least one boy with them, thus the basis of our exclusion?  

No, for me, the best part was when people were leaving your club at 12 am because "there were no boys inside", and was "half empty club".   

So essentially, the dog and pony show, was simply to make everyone believe that the club was bumpin'.  When in actuality, you're really like those people on the Internet who put up a really hot picture of themselves--- but it's a picture circa 1999, a time when you didn't have the spare tire around your waist, and your boobs were strangers to gravity.  

False advertising is never a good thing.  

Love, 

Grace 

PS.  the bouncer with the 70s porn star hair was also a nice touch.  he reminds us that kiddies, it's important to stay in school!  otherwise you'll end up a 40 year old bouncer who's major role in life is to look pretentious for 3-6 hours a week.
author: Grace C.

description:
It's definitely not a comfortable setting.  With mostly black walls and vintage and nude paintings and coffee tables around the place.  If the objective of getting a drink after work is to drink while still maintaining  a certain image, than this place is great.  I applaud the decor, very interesting and fun to look around when your girls are in the bathroom.  But if you want to unwind and drink a beer, this place is too fancy for that.

I guess it's a club.  

That's what occurred to me after sitting on a faux-snakeskin couch for an hour.  And when it did dawn on me that it was a club, I remember how I'm not a club person at all and ordered one more drink, as it was after all happy hour, drained it, and left.  Even thought the happy hour goes until 9pm, the drink specials are not that special, it's $3 drafts, and $5 well cocktails.  I may not be back here actually, just not my style.  Maybe I should spend a little more time on Yelp reading the category line?
author: Kelly H.

description:
I've only been here for happy hours and I'm basing this review on events that happened a while ago, so take it with a grain of salt. My experiences here were pretty good. Beer on tap always good. Cocktails are alright. It depends on which bartender you have.

Decor is a bit dark. Everything is black and there are some weird paintings on the walls. It can be hard to find a place to sit. It can get pretty crowded. At times, there is only one person behind the bar which makes things frustrating. 

If you're looking for food afterward, salt house is next door if you don't mind spending the $$.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
The DJ showered the dance floor with Top 40 hits all night long. What's the point? A 10-year-old, too, can press play on a MacBook. 

The interior looks and feels like the lobby from a W hotel. Too many tables. Drinks were weak. 

The doorman actually mustered the audacity to tell me I was "underdressed," although, upon entering the place, I saw dudes wearing everything from trucker caps to thermals that looked like a 2 for $10 deal at Old Navy. My underwear that night cost more than some of those whole outfits put together.

Girls: Bring asshole repellent.
author: Joseph K.

description:
If you are white you will have no problems getting into this place. If you are asian, hispanic, or black... GOOD LUCK! 

I had heard rumors from my asian friends that this place is overtly racist. I didn't believe it until I went myself and experienced and saw it. The bouncer (the old bald one with ugly rimmed glasses) was denying groups of minorities in and letting white ppl walk right in... very obviously. Our group was able to get in after we agreed to get bottle service (getting bottle service is another story...). The music was decent and the club was popping around midnite, but it was popping with old white sharks and cougars!!! Holy crap, it was very digusting. I had a lot of fun despite it all... b/c I was with a great group of ppl. But in all honesty, I feel like the racism is dripping in this place...
author: J K L.

description:
This is a relative review.  Relative because I am not a clubby kinda girl.  But I thought I'd check Harlot out because it was the second week it had been open, and everyone said it was different, and  I  knew someone who knew someone and was promised I would not have to stand in a long-ass line waiting to get into a club, feeling miserable about myself.  

So while my tendancy is to rate these places on the lower end of the absolute audrey scale, I'm an open-minded chick and on the relative clubby scale, Harlot does score some points.

First off the decor actually has some flair to it.  The NY-wannabe modern minimalist look is so overdone.  Come on SF clubs, let's get some character, some diversity!  Represent your awesome, unique, free-thinking city!  While I can't say the giant paintings of multi-racial  harlots on the walls delivers on that cry for diversity, I can at least say that the effect was evocative.  

Second, the entrance is pretty neat.  Not the valet-only massive parking lot outside, but the convenient coat check and swank smoking room just inside makes you feel like the owners put some thought into what their patrons might need.  Even though I don't smoke, the coat check was a nice touch.

And third, it's a small space but it doesn't seem crammed.  It feels like you've walked into a SOMA loft converted into a bordello.  It almost feels intimate which I thought was near impossilbe for a club.

On the down side, the hip-hop-ish music was quite crap that night, and the people were extra pretentious, even for a club.  And no, I don't like being stared down at by "VIPs" in the balcony.  Really guys, that's just creepy.
author: Audrey T.

description:
I love the ambiance of this place. However, the crowd was a total miss.  As my compadre Vijay said...it was an effing scene!  Obnoxious frat boys, creepy dudes staring down every girl as she passed by and my personal favorite...the middle aged couple dry humping in the middle of the joint.  

This type of thing makes me never want to procreate.  EVER. And the bouncers needed a reality check.  We're in SF guys, not L.A.

I will likely NOT come back here on a weekend ever again...but during the week I can imagine, with enough friends, this could be a cool spot. The DJ spun great tunes that were purrfect for gettin' my groove on and the drinks were stiff.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Going there tonight for the soft opening. I completely forgot about the opening party last night. My friends went and told me it's very cool with a gothic design + Martel is the nicest club promoter in San Francisco so there's a plus

I'll add/edit this later
author: Thömas F.

description:
I don't usually review places where there was an Elite Event thrown until I've experienced it sans Yelp.  

Harlot, however, was snazzy and the bartenders where gorgeous and the general vibe seemed super chill.  Even though I knew a lot of the people there it still seemed like it could've been any old weekend at Harlot.  

Good vibes, good drinks, good times. 

Upstairs bar is cool...I dig the white furniture. 
Downstairs has a dance area...a little small but I don't' think they were going for a mainly dance venue thing anyway.
author: Jay H.

description:
For my 30th birthday I wanted to celebrate in style - what I got was a birthday from hell.  I booked a VIP  table at Harlot through friend's recommendations and what the heck you only turn 30 once. I was told I would be taken care of.   From the moment that I set foot outside the premise it was the birthday from hell.  Here's the recap:

At the door- they wouldn't let my guests in who were part of the guest list.  They claimed they were at  'full capacity.'  Ugly trolls walked by and got to go in without a problem?  The doorman knew it was my birthday and I had reservations for a VIP table and yet yelled at me and treated me rudely.  By the time we got in my blood pressure was already up - I don't think that's a great definition of being taken care of.

In the club- we had these uninvited  'girls' sit at our vip table.  I don't know if they were part of the ambiance of the place or what not- but if I'm shelling out money to for a table and we don't want you there- LEAVE.  We didn't get the receipt.  We did have some fighting words for the bouncers, waitresses and all.

The only pro I would have to say is that they did play good music.  Ladies - there are no hot guys here so don't bother.  Guys - if you can't get a girl to talk to you on a daily basis or don't have enough cash for a lap dance or hooker - then this is the place to be!

If you want to go all out for an occassion, don't spend your money or your time there.  I'm sure there's other clubs in SF that would have provided better service.  I wouldn't even go there on a weekend - with the long line.  Even with the VIP table it took us a good 30 minutes to get in.
author: Johannah P.

description:
Thanks yelp for having a really fun party here last night.

I'm still drunk from all the gin & tonics I consumed.  I danced, I CLAWED, I had a super time.

The decor is nice.  The black on black filigree on the walls is subtle.  The paintings are sexy.  The pony fur chairs need to be in my house, they are that luscious.

And the bartender ladies are super fine sex kittens in their corsets with a red 'H' embroidered onto the boob area.
author: Alice S.

description:
Dark, sleek and architecture that completely rocks! The drinks aren't so bad either...

With open spaces and a cool looks, Harlot is the kind of place that I've been waiting to find for months. The place is gorgeous, the crowd well-mixed and fun and the open dance floor gives plenty of room for those who want to shake their thing in front of some great SF dj's. The upstairs balcony level is quite nice with it's own bar and contrasts the rest  of bar as it is designed in off-white while the rest of the club is in black-on-black. The furniture is tasteful and well designed and adds that touch of sophistication that I really appreciate. 

A great place for your happy-hour get-together with friends but may get crowded late at night as any hip new place will. Plus, if you're an old guy like me you might not want that scene anyway. 

Overall, this place is wonderful and I look forward to hanging out here a lot in the future.
author: Gabriel R.

description:
I met Baron Davis here last night and it was F-ing awesome...if only Stephen Jackson was there with him, it would have been a perfect evening.

So my friend Allison and I are waiting at the bar to order our drinks and these guys next to us start talking about how Baron Davis is at the bar.  I start to get really excited and then I look to my left behind the bar and I see a thickly bearded profile that can only belong to one man...Boom Dizzle...

So now I am really excited.  I mean Baron Davis is standing like 3 feet away from me. OMG.  I am so star struck.  So Allison and I order our drinks and start waiting till he gets up to leave so we can talk to him.  While we are waiting the following conversation occurs...

Guy: (after we get our drinks) "I'll get those for you."
Allison: "Really?" (I mean we know we are really sexy, but we just got 2 of the most expensive drinks and we haven't even talked to you yet)
Guy: "Sure." (as he pays)
I slowly put my cash away, say thanks and turn to Allison...
Allison (to me): "What do we do now?"
Me: "Let's talk to them, I feel bad."
Allison (to guy): "So where do you guys work?"
Guy: "Look, just because I bought you a drink doesn't mean you have to talk to me."
Me: "Rude."
Allison: "Um, ok."
We talk to him anyway...we're sexy and really nice.  The entire time we were talking though I was batting my eyes and making kissy faces at Baron Davis....JK I am not that crazy.

So finally Baron gets ready to leave and as he's walking up to us I make my move and go up and shake his hand and tell him how cool I think he is...I am spaz.  Allison plays it much cooler and shakes his hand and introduces herself.  I'm like, F-word, why didn't I do that, so I shake his hand again and introduce myself and he smiles, but really he probably thinks I'm really crazy...which would be true.  I don't care though, I met Baron Davis and you didn't so be jealous, be very jealous.

Oh yeah, besides meeting Baron Davis here, this place is ok.  The only thing is that it was definitely still light out and they were bumping the music like it was clubbing time...

The only reason this place gets five stars is because they have Baron Davis as a patron and oh, yeah if you didn't hear I MET HIM...yes, I know I am obsessed and I need to calm down...100 Stars for Baron Davis
author: Katherine C.

description:
If you bring in 11 girls and 2 guys, you don't have to wait in line, pay cover and you can go upstairs to the VIP.  Also the bouncers are really friendly towards you.  But that typically is a given at any club in San Francisco.  

Still, the music here is good, at least to me, since I recognize it and can therefore dance to it.  VIP is fun, being upstairs and being able to move around with ease, but in all reality, all the action is downstairs on the dance floor.
author: Denise B.

description:
This is a true piece of  trivia, the song "Le Freak" (AKA "Aaa, Freak Out") by CHIC was originally intended to be "Aaa, Fuck Off," because members of CHIC were pissed off  after they tried unsuccessfully to get into the New York nightclub Studio 54 (they sang it as they walked down the street after not getting in).

Given my similar encounter at Harlot I would like to improvise my own version
"aaaw, kiss my a$$"
or maybe
"aaaw, suck my dxxx"   
Now if I could just play that guitar riff as I walk down Minna St.
author: G L.

description:
We went there for a Tuesday night business event.  I won't mention the name, because the business has a lot of smart, talented individuals and I think they just made a bad nightlife choice.  Must not read Yelp. :)  This place doesn't deserve to be called a San Francisco Harlot.  I mean, it's not lush, sumptuous, tantalizing, erotic, inviting, or flirtatious in any way.  I mean, it's just two levels of lots of black, lots of sheetrock, lighting that is not creative or flattering to anyone, (Cougars noted below, take note!) and general pretension.

     It starts with the bouncers outside clad in thick black leather jackets that might also have body armor under them, who knows?  I felt like I was trying to get into @17th in downtown Oakland.  We were carded, had our bags checked on the way in - I almost expected to be frisked.  Good thing I left my piece at home! ;)  Felt like security overkill for the area and the event, and like they were trying really hard to impress somebody. (the club)

The paintings were semi-interesting, but that was the only visual relief.  It felt so low-budget and not creative at all in the decor.  Lots of black used in the interior, chairs, etc.  It looked like someplace the vampires in the original Blade movie would hang out.  Or someplace vampires go to bore themselves to death.  hardy har.  Bar service was OK for me, bad for my girl.  If you go, see if they'll make you a Comatose Vampire, which is maybe a bloody mary laced with morphine or something like that.

some cool people work there, though, apparently, so I modified mine to 2 stars. :)
author: Joe B.

description:
I have been to Harlot many many times and I always had a good time. i liked the music the smoking area, the bartender and the crowd. 
However one thing is a little bit annoying: It is hard to get in as a bigger group especially when you bring male friends. Obviously every group consists of female and males - should we leave our guys outside while we girls go in and party?
Otherwise I like the place. Good times!
author: Sonja S.

description:
I like to go to this place because it's entertaining and the bouncer, Tony, is the man and is probably the most polite person there.  I like the semi classy goth/dark brothel motif. Different. Also, one of the main reasons I like going there is because I see a lot of familiar faces, although it is mostly the young professional bar-hopping crowd. 

 It does feel like the Vegas club of SF. This means all the advantages and disadvantages that comes with a small vegas club. It will be hard to get drinks. The 1 bar on the 1st floor is crowded. Harlot has 2 stories. The 2nd level is the VIP section. I threw a party in the VIP section once, it has white leather-like couches and tables with a full-body picture of some sexy model. The service is ok, not especially friendly. There is a smoking room behind some iron bars conveniently located in the bar so thats a plus for the smokers. It does get crowded. 

 I guess it is one of those places where if you are single and ready to mingle then its the perfect meat-market for you, but if you just want to enjoy some good music and converse with some laid-back people that are not mostly trying to get some action that night, then you may want to try another place. ..maybe the Mission bars =)
author: Shayenne G.

description:
Going to Harlot on Wednesday may be the perfect night for it.   There isn't a line, but there are a healthy number of people inside.  Many of them are dressed well, some too well.  (I'm talking to you Mr. Light Grey Suit with firehouse red tie.)   The dance floor is active without being a sweaty mess.  

I do like the upstairs.   You can either peoplewatch the goings-on below from a comfortable height ("He's about to be denied."  "She's trying too hard." "Oh, they are going to get it on tonight." "You know, I thought walking up to a strange girl and grinding against her butt wouldn't work on women, but this girl has proven me wrong.")  or make out with your girl (ssssh, I'm won't say who) and be reasonably certain that fewer people are making similar comments about you.
author: Beau G.

description:
I'm tottally suprised at all the awful reviews this place has received. I actually had a really nice time when  I visited on the 23rd of Jan. My fiance and I were going to a party at  private party NV and realized that was NOT where we wanted to be so we crossed over and looked at Temple where the line was long and they were acting as if it was Studio 54 or My House in LA had picking folks to com ein.. we decided to shake the neighborhood and while walking back under the freeway towards our car on Mission we heard the soothing sounds of Snoop Dogg pourind out of a corner venue, our eyebrows peaked and we decided to go investigate. as we walked up there was no line and two door hosts.

We asked about cover , which was non existent.. we entered and was surprised by the atmosphere,.. now I'm 3/4's vampire so  I was right at home by the decor and the crowd was nice..

the drinks are just as expensive as any downtown nightclub should be and the waitstaff was just as hurried as any bartendering would be with 100 standing at the bar ..

I had a surprisingly good time and enjoyed the DJ and  the environment. I wasn't expecting whithouse treatment but was throughl pleased by my experience..


I'm definitelyt going again...
author: Kym G.

description:
Let's see...

-1 star for too many bouncers at the door
-1 star for not having anything at all resembling a line for orderly entry
-1 star for not letting in the complete group from our birthday party
-2 stars for suggesting with a straight face that the girls in our party could go in, but there are "already too many guys in there"  Umm...hello we're the ones who brought the girls here!!!  Now we're out'a here.

Is that 0 stars?  Unfortunately that's not low enough.
author: J. O.

description:
This review is just for the door man. A caucasian man with glass, omg, unbelievable rude and makes troubles every time I visit. Of course this Halloween night was just even worse. Got there about 9:45pm!!!! SOOOOO early for a party don't you think? Anyway, after about half an hour wait, he only left 2 out of 7 us to get in as "a favor". Even everyone is on the list and I actually pulled out my phone to show the FB page and email, to prove the fact we signed around noon. His response was "I don't care, it's not on this paper." WHAT THE F**K? Over heard he yelled some other customer "I can't find you on the list, just go home and sleep!" Ha... Really?! Meanwhile the table service VIP entrance didn't seem like in order as well... We were waiting over 1 hour for everyone to get in.... (Luckily they did eventually, not from the gate tho. lol) 
A piece of paper which might print out the day before the party, with no RSVP deadline what so ever, and such disorganized service... Come on, a big events can tell how the management go, you guys could be done better. 
Music and drinks are good tho. Thanks god the rest of night we had great time!
author: Flora F.

description:
Just another club - i went here for a friends birthday and while i had a great time and definitely enjoyed the music the dj was bumping, i was not impress with the level of service for someone who had purchased a bottle and table service. Their tables were practically in the middle of the dance floor, so you had people climbing into their table area and dancing and falling over. it was just over-crowding for 'table service' - there was no real separation between us and everyone else. This 'theme' kind of continued in the 'vip' section upstairs. It didnt really give me a very 'vip' vibe, it was also over crowded, unorganized.. although it did have a nice view of the downstairs dance floor.
I might go there again, b/c the dj played some fun old school tunes, but i would definitely never pick this place to buy a bottle, b/c you just dont get your money's worth.
author: Shadi N.

description:
Clubs in Vegas should stay in Vegas.

If you walk into this place you will be approached by a complete douche bag, maybe more then one. 

Even for private parties it over packed and smelly. The only good thing about this place is the booze!
author: Dee C.

description:
Oh Harlot, I love the way you tease.  Your bartenders are beautiful...and friendly...and pour a stiff one  (drink silly, get your mind out of the gutter)
The space is really cool-narrow, white hot balcony upstairs, wide open dark space downstairs and a glassed in smoking area so we can mock our friends as they smoke. Partying with Yelpers was hot, I can't wait to come back on a normal night.
author: phil h.

description:
The "it" downtown lounge of the moment.

Harlot joins Slide, Ambassador, Otis, Roe, Frisson, Matrix, Vessel, bla bla bla, as the ascending generation's answer to Starlight Room, Top of the Mark, Harry Africa's.  If Wilkes Bashford, Harry Denton, Willie Brown, and Herb Cain were thirty years younger they would have a favorite booth here.   If you don't know what any of that means, welcome to San Francisco.

The historic brick building sits on an alley amidst skyscrapers.  In front is trendy new restaurant Salt House and directly above is one of San Francisco's better online porn companies.

The latest venture from San Francisco party promoter / restaurateurs  Martel & Nabiel & company, who teamed up with designer / architect / furniture designer (among other things) Jacek Ostoya.  Here more than ever before the team demonstrates their chops for service, scene, music, door, vibe.

The crowd is sophisticated, moneyed, dressed and a little older, say 27-45.  Bartenders with more personality than attitude quickly make $9 top shelf drinks, a considerable accomplishment given the women are squeezing varying body shapes into matching lace up bustieres.  A food and fresh fruit drink menu, they promise, is coming.

With deer antlers, mirrors, one way glass (by a fortuitous and hopefully irreversible miscalculation looking into not out of the women's bathroom), a cheeky talkative men's lounge attendant in a well fitted suit, artistic naked women artwork, the place pays tribute to bordellos and speakeasies through the ages and continents without overtly copying them.  It's sophisticated but not subdued.

With all the private launch parties it's hard to know how it will all settle out.  It almost didn't.  A divided Board of Supervisors approved the liquor license on a 6-5 vote.  But given the opening and the people involved, this may well be be the one that lasts as an institution.

Some day in 2057 or so when our grandkids are all getting sloshed over martinis they'll shake an olive to Martel and Nabiel and Jacek and Robert (the other partner) and say about a new "it" club named "Skank Slut," if they were kids today this is where they would hang.
author: Gil S.

description:
5 stars for the hot cocktail waitress working last Friday while we were there for DYL.

Skeeviest review I have ever written...
author: Luis M.

description:
Put aside the pt that I used to go to the harlot every weekend in 08 w/  crowd of min of 8. avg four to nine hundred/night. The music was great, drinks were okay. My first time back to the harlot in 09. The well-dressed door greeter with earpiece behind their ears were all on a powertrip. HELL, they dont even come close to making the money I spend a night. Well, they decide to play GOD once, twice in a week. Making minimum wage and push customers away. Have it your way. My friends and I will not be returning to the Harlot
Thanks for the good times in 2008. 2009 is not so great for you guys
author: James L.

description:
Wow, this place deserves the asshole of the year award....

OK, I am not usually compelled to write reviews--i really respect many yelper's writing abilities and use this more as a "research" tool...but I do know nightclubs.  And I am compelled to write about the fact that Harlot isn't worth a penny of your money or a minute of your time.

--The bottom line is that customer service goes a long way, especially when you are paying upwards of $500-$1000 for a table...but, like similar reviews:

*our guest list wasn't respected--trust me, don't even try to get in and be prepared not to even if you are on the list
*the bouncers were not only rude, but condescending, and 
*the management accepted no accountability for our complaints or the complaints of another table's group.

Our hostess, Dee Dee, was clueless throughout the reservation process, from being unresponsive via cell phone and email until about 3 days before the party... to giving us a different bottle minimum 3 times...and to, finally, on the day of the party, having no IDEA that there was going to be a comedy show the night of our private party, leading to an hour and a half of NO MUSIC.

The Door manager, Jeremy, who I can only imagine had his misogynistic tendencies swollen from years of being rejected by both men and women, "coincidentally" (?) turned away both an African American friend and a Mexican American friend (one of whom was on the list) due to "fire codes"....only to then usher in very quickly a couple of Caucasian men who were not on the list.   This is what I witnessed as I was outside speaking with him about the people on our list they were turning away...

At the end of the night I was barely given 2 minutes to ask for, receive and sign the bill before one of the bouncers physically pushed a friend out of the table, where she was sitting waiting for me to sign as we summed the bill up--and no, no one was obnoxiously intoxicated.

All in all, avoid having your parties here...there are better spaces, DJs and bartenders for less money.
author: M. t.

description:
the word Harlot stands for "prostitute", and it really does identify the owner, the doormen and the people they let in. They're all harlots, only caring about 1 time relationships for money, oblivious to other things... 

Don't let them treat you as one of them, If you have a special occasion, have a girl friend, or girl friends next to you, save the embarassement both for you and your friends and just go somewhere else.  The people at the door just don't know what they're doing and they will aggravate your night by not knowing how to handle the situation and you will have to wait in line for unreasonable amounts of time and you will for sure have a bad night or a bad start. 

Supperclub 2 blocks up is much classier than this place. W is a much better bar. Redwood room makes much better drinks and Ruby Skye has better and bigger DJs. Temple across the parking lot is much bigger and hungrier to let you in. The bars around the area have cheaper drinks and friendlier atmospheres. You can totally avoid this place. Heck even Circa or Matrix Fillmore all the way in Marina are better. 


the decor is not bad, but the owner is obviously an inexperienced club owner. the place is too small, the dance floor doesn't exist (it's as if you were trying to dance at a restaurant by pushing the tables away to make room for a makeshift dance floor). the bartenders don't know how to make good drinks. The place has no cover, but the music is often bad, if they don't have any 3rd tier djs visiting. (1st and 2nd tiers don't fit in this venue.)
author: Honor G.

description:
I'm definitely not a regular here, and I don't think I ever will be.  The first time I was here was for an Elite event, and I liked the place a lot.  Open, spacious with cool decor - antler chandeliers, cool tables with pinup-like pictures on them.  But since it was an Elite event, I don't really know how much drinks cost, and we were there in the early evening on a weeknight - not a regular clubbing kind of night.

I went last Friday night with a couple of guy friends - nobody out front and deafening silence from the inside.  One of those moments when you know that a club is empty inside.  The bouncers fumbled about at the door checking lists to see if they could let us in...all the while a mob starts to form at the door.  It turns out they couldn't let us in or at least not at that moment, so we could "take our chances" and just wait in line.  Although on a much smaller scale, the scene at the door was reminiscent of what happens in front of Pure in Las Vegas every weekend night: people were jockeying for position to talk to the bouncer, people trying to bribe the bouncers here and there.  Ugh.  It was going to be an absolute pain (or impossible) for the guys to get in, so they bought bottle service.  Yuck, yuck.  Call me old fashioned, but I just don't think bottle service belongs in San Francisco.
author: Wendy L.

description:
I reserved a table here for my birthday last year and was piffed at the lack of customer service from booking the table.  The person I booked it with wasn't very attentive or thorough as she should have been and I got the impression that she just didn't care.  For the price of a table (at least $500) I expected much, much more.  

I would go to Ambassador next time.  I have also spoken to Ambassador recently and they were first and foremost- thorough, enthusiastic, extremely attentive, and service-oriented.  They even offered to throw in a complimentary bottle of champagne.  Luv 'em.  They really know how to treat a customer right.
author: Jenna V.

description:
My friends and I have been to Harlot many times and it used to be a great venue for a good time, until Jeremy the bald guy became the manager.
I have never seen a rude and an arrogant manager in San Francisco who dislikes any one other person other than Caucasians. My experiences in the last 2 visits has been the reason i reactivated my yelp account to help others.
1. We were willing to pay the promised amount that was committed over the phone, but in the door we were quoted twice the amount leading to a discussion and Jeremy's arrogance did not help  us in thinking we will have a good time even though we pay that amount. 
2. second visit - there were more girls than boys in our group and we took a table for $1000.00 as quoted, the girl working in Harlot set us up with a table upstairs with a view of the dance floor. But Jeremy came by and asked us to move to another table with no view and near the restroom. One of my friends argued and Jeremy said "then we can cancel your reservation and you can leave immediately"  . We ended up in vessel and had a good time.
I am not a lawyer, but i am not sure how to prove he has racist intent.
author: Dee D.

description:
Harlot is pleasant, but it doesn't live up to its name.

I was expecting a luxuriously sexy space that would make me want to get as naked as possible and dance on a table top, or lounge in a plush booth with some gorgeous boy I just found on the street... but no. Not here. 

That said, it's a very good club. Harlot is sleek and well designed - I like the matte/glossy black wallpaper and the occasional antlers [although at this point antlers and deer are the end of their spot in the design limelight as the IT animal/thing], I like the white upstairs with the beautifully classical chairs... I like the red and black bathrooms that are practically outside... Hell, I like the drinks and the light and the bartender girls [although they are slightly snarly, but they always tend to be in new hip clubs]... I like all of it, really, but it's just not a SEXY space! 

I guess this is my usual reason for taking away stars - I am taking off a star for DISAPPOINTMENT. I thought a place called Harlot would be soft and intimate, with a myriad private dim corners to sneak into for tete a tete moments... but no. Not here.
author: Liza P.

description:
Let me be upfront.  These dance/club/pickup bars are just not my scene.  And you know what scene I am talking about.  30 something  dudes trying to score with 20 something girls.  The guys all look the same and the girls just put my lazy casual ass to shame.  

That being said the two times I went to Harlot I enjoyed myself.  The dance floor was crammed but I was still able to get down with mybadself.   And I find the decor to be pretty rad.  Cool gigantic-nudie-eve-lookin' photo with purple backlighting and big black antler chandeliers that I would love to have above my dining room table if I were a vampire.  

Now even with this lovely decor would I normally stop by Harlot.  Hell no, but if you have friends visiting who love this type of thing, I say it is a good place to take them while keeping your sanity.
author: Alexis M.

description:
I have to say, Harlot is a special place.

It's the kind of place that leaves a lasting impression on you.  It's the kind of place that speaks volume on its beliefs and shows no restraint.  It's the kind of place that would bring a Yelper out of retirement.

Cause first, you gotta love where their location is at.  Across the street from a shady parking lot where it would be so awesome if you got mugged there.  And 20 yards away is a sight to behold, where lies about 20 homeless people trying to get some rest while Harlot thumps their music all night.

But that's not the best part.  The quintessential aspect of Harlot is the service.  Get ready you line waiting lovers.  You will wait long here and you will be ignored out of existence.  If you suffer from too much attention, then you should go wait outside in this line without a reservation.  But I correct myself.  Whether or not you have a reservation is a moot point.  I came with a group of 20 and after some shuffling around to make the regulations to enter this mystical place (more on that later), we were finally able to get our table reservation that we put money down on (about $300 I think).  We waited and waited, then were told to move over to the side of the building where the bouncer could no longer have eye contact with us, then waited and waited some more... oh man, it was great.  I just kept staring at that neon H sign for over an hour until that image got burned into my retinas.  Then as the party planner went up to ask the guy about how come we haven't been seated to our table yet and the guy tells us that they gave it away and told us and the rest of the remaining guests to go back in line or leave.  Don't you love just getting dicked around because that was one of the greatest I've experienced.  At that moment, I was hoping to see Ashton or Snooki or The Situation walk right into the place, but alas they did not.

And back to the regulations here, you can't forget about their 1:1 ratio policy.  Harlot doesn't f*ck around.  You can have 100 guys, 99.5 girls and that will not let you in.  Because Harlot is the sh*t (and I mean sh*t).  I don't swear in my reviews very often, but Harlot is that special case where I'm at a loss of words; absolutely speechless.  They put Las Vegas clubs to shame.  In fact, LV should be stricter cause there is no way SF clubs can out-douchebag LV clubs.  That's almost insulting especially since naturally there are more guys than girls in SF than there are in LV.  Time to step up your game, Vegas, if you want to play with the real big dogs of Harlot.

After all that, and almost 2 hours worth of being outside, I never did step foot in there.  Well, I have for happy hour before, but Harlot doesn't have the balls during that time period to be douchebags to not allow people in.  Which is underwhelming.  Why couldn't they just have a bouncer outside 24/7 whether or not it's closed.  Or better yet, have bouncers on the corner of the streets to stop people from looking at the place.  I'm disappointed that its not even harder to get inside, they could have attack dogs that chase you for wearing certain types of colognes or have trap doors open when a camera detects your shoes of not being worthy or a big Indiana Jones boulder that chases your group when you don't meet the ratio.  If you want to be even more efficient, why even have a door?  Just replace it with a brick wall instead.  Plenty of missed opportunities here.

Whenever I want to feel used, punked, trampled, defecated on, Harlot will always be on the top of my list and it will be on top of yours, too.  Sorry Suite 181, you got competition.
author: David Y.

description:
These, among other things, can be found at Harlot:

black marble
a pretty good sidecar
a smoking cage
leather upholstery
a white chaise lounge
well dressed, attractive people
a dance floor that may or may not be empty
cleavage
freaky paintings

If you're a fan of any of these things you should check this place out.
author: matthew r.

description:
What? A bad review for not even stepping into the club?  That's right.  This establishment runs some sleazy business practice.  I checked out their website for pricing on bottle service before I contacted them to get reservation for a party of 20 people for a birthday celebration.  The price was confirmed when I received the email from their alias tables@harlotsf.com.  
*Basic table on main floor: $500 (2 bottles) up to ten people
*Roped-off table on main floor: $750 (3 bottles + complimentary bottle of bubbly) up to 15 people
*Upstairs VIP area table: $1,000 (4 bottles + complimentary bottle of champagne) up to 15 people
After several emails exchange, it was agreed that I would have to spend minimum $1250 + 20% gratuity to reserve an upstair VIP table for the 20 people.  So I assumed, the extra $250 was to cover the 5 additional people.    Spending $1500 for 5 one liter bottle of alcohol is a bit steep.  Hesitantly I emailed back one week before the date of the party to confirmed the reservation as didn't want to try to find another place to accommodate 20 people.  3 days before the party, I received an email from a different person in response to my reservation stating that the price quoted is wrong and that their VIP table on seated 10 people and that I have to reserve 2 tables and each table is $1250.  What? Not only the number of people per table changed from 15 to 10, the price went from $1000 to $1250.  I emailed them back thinking that this is a mistake as who would have thought of enforcing 2 people per bottle service.  Their response is that the first person that helped me was the floor manager stepping in for the bottle service manager while she is on vacation.  That's seems to be such a bad excuse because that doesn't explain why the price the bottle service manager quoted is inflated and the maximum number of people were reduced as what was posted on their webpage.  Funny thing, I went on their webpage today and on their "Table Service" link there is no more listing of prices or table info..only an email address.

It's hard to think that with all the internet savvy people and online reviews, a business would still try to cheat customers to bring in a few extra bucks.
author: Vu T.

description: Came here with my friend on the random. It was ok, good music decent ambiance but I am sorry they waaay overcharge on the drinks. Catch a buzz before and come here to top it off haha I sound uber cheap but seriously those drinks better change your life . My friend got an Adios.Like really $15? This spot is in a good area though with lots of little bars around ...
author: Mariangeles C.

description:
Christmas Day dim sum in the Richmond, New Years Eve with a crowd of Swedes in the Mission, wild nights of gay partying in the Castro, even a day spent on Union St in the Marina... never have I felt like such a foreigner as I did last night at Harlot. Girls in tiny dressy dresses, hitting me in the head with their Prada and Louis Vuitton bags. Every guy but me wearing slacks and a fancy shirt. The raw themeyness of the venue screaming out for more pieces of flair, perhaps a corset or two. Is this really San Francisco? Did I get somehow teleported to the East Coast? Perhaps New Jersey?

Ahh, my apologies, that last bit was rather unfair. I am simply unused to nights in the Financial District. Why did Harlot evict us from our table, placing a Reserved sign on it?
