Do people really reserve tables there? Why? So many questions, so few answers. The bouncer at the door, asking some incoming visitors if they are having table service... it doesn't compute. The place was more than half empty at 10 on a Friday! Perhaps the terrible music was to blame.
author: Will A.

description:
Call me an elitist!  I love being whisked away from the front of line, behind the velvet rope to a private balcony and served at my own private table!

Frisco j. just call me a high priced - high end ho.  My love don't cost a thing, but if you gonna pay me then pay me in EURO!
author: A P.

description:
If I could give negative stars, I would.  ANYWAY so it was my birthday and a bunch of us went there and waited for a long ass time only to not get in because 1.  we had boys   2.  we didn't buy bottle service  3.  we had a large group.  I am not complaining about the ppl that got in with bottle service reservations and I didn't think that the bouncer or the table service guy was too rude -- the bottle service guy actually did keep me updated frequently on status of a table he was going to give to us but he said his manager put people there so he couldn't accommodate us for table.  (this was when we were actually considering doing it)  

I know how it is, I've been in the scene long enough, I know how to get into a club.  It was just frustrating that half my friends were already in there and 8 of us were still left outside waiting...but what can you do.  I'm sure Harlot is a very nice lounge and I was surprised that the front door people were so friendly even though they weren't letting our big group in, but whatever.

ACTUALLY the most entertaining thing of the night was watching some guy bring a baby in there.  What the hell?  Are you that desperate to go out that you're going to take a baby to a club?  And the door people, didn't notice I guess....but everyone in line was all, "a baby can get in but we have to wait?"  HAHA!!  Then the manager or whoever got really pissed and had someone go get that guy to kick him out and he shows up a few mins later with his baby and people in line started chanting "Let the baby stay!  Let the baby stay!"  with fists in the air like it was anarchy or something.  Hilarious.
author: Sonya T.
Tadd L.

description:
The first time I went was a Saturday night and immediately thought, L.Aish. I stood in a long ass line (the only reason I stood there by the way was because I HAD to show face at a friend's birthday.) and when I finally got to the door the doorman told me that I couldn't get in without a girl. Rrrrr! So I called a couple of my friends from inside to fish me in. After paying my $20 cover, which of course I expected, I looked to check my coat. What I didn't expect was the $4 charge, for coat check? Ok I know it sounds kinda picky but, believe me, I am fine with paying for overpriced drinks AND an overpriced cover BUT an overpriced coat check! I felt like drop kicking someone in the forehead. Telling myself, "Shake it off Ro, shake it off." I finally got over to my group. 

This place's only saving grace is that it has a really cool decor and feel. It has a sexy, kingdom of the underworld thing going on but unless you want to butt heads with pompous door guys, LA attitude bartenders, and overpriced drinks, don't bother. 

Unless, of course, it's your really good friend's birthday. DAMN YOU!

Oh ya, and the DJ sucked ass... (just had to slip that in.)
author: Rodney V.

description:
I regret not going to opening night on Wednesday: April 18, 2007.  I was on the guest list, but had to attend another function so I was a bit disappointed.  Since I know one of the owners/designer/architect of Harlot and his wife, I was able to get into the special guest list any day I wanted.  Friday night is when my friends and I decided to go.  We arrived a little before 9p.  

The space is nice.  Dark, yet sophisticated and very classy.  Beautiful interior design with huge paintings on the walls.  I especially liked the tables with portraits of women.  2 floors of fun, a smoking room and two bars.  Sexy bartenders and a good mix of crowd.  Dance floor and great music -- techno earlier in the night mixed with 90's pop hit including Snoop Dog and Warren G.  The place was packed after 11pm, but my friends and I settled upstairs in the corner booth right across the bathroom.  This place is cozy and perfect for people watching.  Check out the cool bathroom downstairs with the one-way mirror.

One of my friends and I were making our way outside to smoke when she realized that she needed a lighter...

Friend: "Do you have a lighter?"
Random Guy: "No, but you can check the smoking lounge."
Celeste: "Hey, that's... what's his name?"
Friend: "I don't know..."

The Random Guy turned out to be...former Mayor Willie Brown.  I can't believe that my friend just asked him for a lighter.  It was awesome!  

Left the bar a little before 1am and people were still trying to get in.  It was truly a wonderful night and I'm really glad that I was able to check it out.  I'll probably be back here once or twice again before it finally opens to the public in mid-May.  Harlot is surely a great addition to the nightlife in the area.  It's a very unique place and I know it will become a popular hang out.   

Miss Celeste's Alcohol Count at the end of the night:
2 Vodka Gimlets
2 Kamikaze
1 shot of Fernet
author: Celeste M.

description:
I realize Harlot needs just one more review. 
I love this space. I am hoping my company will have a party there in the near future. It is an amazing room. 
The bartenders are cutie cutes cutes. Chis was making stellar drinks at the DYL. 
The staff was over all friendly and attentive. 
I just wish they had drink menus.
However, when it is not so busy you can ask the bartender to make you one of their specialties. 
The DJ's were good. The music has been really great the few times I have been there. 
Good crowd good times.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
My friends and I went on Valentine's Day for the Christian Louboutin shoe drawing.  We were very excited!!! They asked for our shoe size and gave us bracelets to get ready for the drawing...  and guess what?  There was no drawing!!!
I do have to say though, that during the early part of the night, pinky vodka was providing free vodka drinks...and  they were great!!!!
author: Marvelous V.

description:
Soooo I'm not a HUGE club person, but this is where everyone was headed to that night so being that I was on vacation I gave it a go and to my astonishment I dont really have any complaints.  It was super fast and easy to get in, the bouncer was so nice and it wasn't ridiculously packed which is always a relief especially since we were there on a saturday night. The dance floor isn't too large (but there is a VIP section on top) I guess for more dancing, I wanna get up there next time.... I cant give any info on drinks since I was the DD that night, but I heard they were a bit pricey.  Non the less it was a very chill, no stress club and I wouldn't mind going again.

oh wait. DUH the music was amazing-- top hits, old school hits from 8th grade like TLC and they even mixed in oldies from the big bopper!
author: Julie W.

description:
It's one of those places I always envisioned to live up to its name...I mean, it's Harlot--and it's situated in SF, San Frisky if you will, city of sin and sensations.

You expect Betty Page-esque bartenders, voluptuous female bodies to stare at, pin ups and thick rich wine poured into amber glasses.

It is nothing like this. Went here as a date to a work-related event with my man, and I'm glad I didn't plan a night out here otherwise, on the weekend, let's say. 

Of all the reviews I've read, I can see where they're coming from. The door guy is a little brusque , as doormen should be, but come on, at 7pm on a Tuesday, how  "tough" do you really have to be...I mean, those pinot wielding art lovers from the galleries down the street or the after work FiDi crowd gets realllllly tough when the ties come off I guess. A night of crazy carousing must be stopped at the entrance!

One of the bartenders (the female) completed ignored me. The other ones were quite nice. 

I wanted to love the decor, but maybe they didn't pull out all the stops that night. Maybe bc you could still see 2 hands in front of your face that meant you could also see how bored the DJ was, how bland the furniture is, how unflattering the lighting is in certain corners and how bland the upstairs was. The photos of women splayed out on the floor tables looked like something out of an American Apparel ad, not Beauty Parade, as I had hoped. 

Maybe I'm not cool enough. Maybe I don't care enough. I'm a bigger harlot than Harlot will ever be.
author: Jessica P.

description:
I had a great time here, but I think it's a matter of mindset and the company you keep.  If I had been there with a different crew, it might have been a different experience.  At one point we felt like the token brown chicks.  

The DJ was friendly, and but his music kind of sucked....He told me that he's been having computer problems and lost a lot of music...That's why I prefer DJ's with vinyl.  The staff here are some of the friendliest I met anywhere. 

As others have mentioned, there are a TON of chicks here.  And to get in, the guys either grease the bouncers, buy a table, are somebody, or know somebody, etc.

If you are a girl and want to have a great time, dress like a Harlot.  You will get in quickly.
author: Nikki c.

description:
It's not really my scene...like at all. I think I was the only fag in the place. But I was there with friends and had to oblige. But seriously...ew. 

In reality- It's not much different than some of the cheesy Castro gay clubs I've been to. Everyone's out to get laid. 

Ladies- I had a big problem watching you practically give away the mystery of your nether regions. It was not classy. I felt like I was in the Red Light district in Bankok. Your skirts were frighteningly short I practically saw butt-cheek in every direction. Girrrrl, it was 40 degrees out! I was cold just looking at you in line at the door.

Men- You gotta learn to loosen up. Drink more or something. Relax. You do not have to have your muggin face on all the time. Do you really have to look tough at "the club"? Jeezus. Try not to bump into people on purpose and watch for the small ladies in a group travelling in a line. Come to the dancefloor with some moves too. The ladies were not and will never be impressed by the dude that only pumps his fist in the air and nods his head to the beat.

The Beat? Oh god, the music was atrocious. I found better music at Pink that night. It was the worst blend of pop/electronica/house/top 40 I have ever heard. 

I'll leave this club to the heteros. Glad to know places like this exist. But, I won't be back (lucky for you, Harlot!)
author: Matthew M.

description:
This new bar is sleek and features an intriguing theme: what appeared to be gothic brothel.  Why three stars then, you ask?  The art (rad naked lady paintings) and the all-black walls with antler horns were interesting, but did they really have to make their female bartenders dress in black vinyl corsets?  It gets to the point where it's past parody and into objectification.  My impression was that this placing is trying way too hard and that it lacked organic, natural hipness.  

Overall, I had a decent experience here but it didn't meet the hype and I found ten bucks for a drink during happy hour to be high (esp. b/c i ordered a crown and ginger ale, and instead of ginger ale, they gave me coke and sprite mixed together).  I'd rather go somewhere like Rye and get some high quality cocktails in a more effortlessly cool atmosphere (or John Collins or Zebulon if I was in the SOMA area)
author: Sid D.

description:
Harlot gets two stars for a variety of reasons:

1. It is overpriced and crowded.
2. I went there and they over charged me by $5, called them left a polite message what this was concerning and requested a call back. Waited 5 days, with no responce from them I was forced to open up a dispute with my CC company.
3. Besides the billing error I've never had bad services, but I've never had good service. To me the seem mediocre at best.

It earned its second star for carrying St. George Absinthe.
author: Kelly O.

description:
Five star night! I did end up Saturday with a Harlot Headache but think I must take responsibility for that.

Not open yet but so many reviews...Perplexing. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They explained the history of the bldg and why it's named Harlot. The group I was with had a couple tables so that may have helped with the kindness.  Our glasses were never empty. 

I liked the space and the decor but not a huge fan of the antler chandeliers....Good dance music, excellent people watching, The crowd was a good mix and very little attitude present,  no 'kids' either Yeah! 

Ladies be forewarned, there is a one way window looking into not out of the women's bathroom, unknowingly you might just find yourself being the entertainment.
author: Sarah B.

description:
I felt like I was in a new York nightclub, down some random alleyway in the meatpacking district. Really- this place is SO speakeasy stylie, on a cutty downtown SoMa street, amongst a parking lot and a messy construction zone. Wonderfully odd. Perfect for a yelp! event... 
You really wouldn't even know it were there, if it weren't for the bouncers outside (who were surprisingly friendly and kind). Even the sign itself is a tiny black square with a stylish red "H" on it.  If it weren't for the "Elite" event there last night, I might have missed it altogether.

The inside is swanky spanky, dark, gothic, hip, and liquidy lovely... INCREDIBLE art from floor to ceiling (literally), really impressive decor all around; sparkley floors, sweet DJ area, clean and gorgeous bathrooms (a MUST for the buzzed night-crawling woman).

I liked the 2-story action the best, with the darker themes on the bottom, and the white theme upstairs. The empty, lable-less bottles lined up behind the upstairs bar were a visual delight, as was the painting and the white sofas.

The service was smiley, young, friendly despite the utter business of the night, professional, and FAST. A rare and faboulous find. 

LOTS of cleavage and corsets, worn by cute and smiley women. That's a plus. 

Free gin? Plus + (yes, that's 2 pluses).

Free SUSHI!? Plus SQUARED.
author: Lauren S.

description:
so there are really three types of clubs; dj-oriented clubs, "meet people" types of clubs, and hybrids of both.

harlot definitely falls into the second category, so it's beyond me why they would spend money on a high-quality DJ like marques wyatt.

this place is dark. and i know that clubs are supposed to be dark, but this place is so dark you can barely recognize anyone.

the sound system is also kinda crappy. what's the point in booking a great DJ if you're going to put his sound through crappy speakers. this could be a pretty incredible place if they spent half the effort on the sound system that they did with the club. the whole time i just kept thinking, "this would be so much better if i were listening to him at mighty (where he is playing a week from friday).

and like most clubs that are more designed to meet people, it closes at 2, even though SF does not mind staying out late on a thursday for good music.

then again, i think i was probably the only person there that came there for the music.

on the plus side, there was no cover, which i always like.

i might go back to this place on a thursday, but i have no interest in trying to get in on friday or saturday where they hold the line to make their way too tiny club look special.
author: Mark A.

description:
If you stuck me in a bustier and made me serve drinks to a bunch of loud lushes all night I'd be one pissed off (albeit still gorgeous) woman very fast. But, the bartenders at Harlot are always so very nice and full of smiles through it all. 
 Scantily-clad lady art on black walls, super nice bartenders, going out to the smoker's cage to feel like I am in the zoo or a sound proof box...what is not to like?
I have been here a few times now, always starting at happy hour to avoid this "you are not hot enough to get in here" thing everyone talks about.  I'll be sticking with it mainly for happy hours, but I will be back and I will be drinking too much and I may grab some more people inappropriately.
author: Lilly O.

description:
Last Saturday was 2 of my best friends birthday and they got a table to celebrate. We were really excited and had heard good things. They told us to get there early to work out the details of the table, but when we arrived there was a private party there and they wouldn't let us in for about 20 minutes. The manager, Jeremy, was EXTREMELY RUDE and condescending to us the entire night. He wouldn't let some of our guy friends in (no explanation only that they are picky about who they let in) - and were particularly rude to the guys of color. There was no reason to not let in more people since the club was not even close to capacity.

The DJ was amazing and we had a blast once we were not interacting with Jeremy anymore, but we were all extremely disappointed with the way we were treated, the service, and the fact that many of our close friends who had traveled from the East Bay were turned away at the door - especially since we were paying so much money for a table. Don't go there if you have guys in your party! Or if you don't want to be treated like crap at the door.
author: Laelena B.

description:
an update to the prior ... everything pretty much still goes from the prior, meaning its proximity to the gold club makes it a prime location for off-duty "entertainers" - it does much for the eye candy in the place and since the non-entertainer girls try to keep up with the strippers as far as being in a state of undress, it makes for a nice night of perusing the merchandise. 

this review is particularly for halloween night.  i didn't feel much like going out since the bizarre meltdown of the ex but i got roped into it by a gaggle of friends that i hadn't seen in a while.  i guess it was all worth it.  made me realize that the whole ex-relationship didn't end just because she was a mess of mommy issues and mental problems, but because she was a ... well ya know...  whatever..  anyway, i digress.  i put on a tie and face-paint and went as an Evil Clown James Bond.  i even ordered a martini to go with the costume.  the line was OUT of control.  they had an uncapped and FREE guest list on facebook so a billion more people showed up than could fit inside.  fortunately, we had a girl with us that "knew people" and they slid us in after some futzing around.  the babelicious bartenders were slinky and the costumes were kinky so it was a fun, fun night.  

the downside wasn't harlot but trying to get food at the end of the eve.  note to self: do NOT try to get food after the bars close on halloween.  you will not like the wait and no matter where you go, it will be overwhelmed and a mess.  so while, waiting, our crew narrowed to just me and a gfriend, which turned out to be a good thing.  Was a bummer not leaving till 3am but had much more fun getting home with my guest.... even though I didn't get to sleep till 530am, i was terribly exhausted.  got a little sick staying up so late but SO worth it.
author: dan h.

description:
Not bad, but definitely not memorable even though we were treated pretty well compared to some of the stories here.  If "no complaints" is the best thing I can say then, given the choice, I'd choose somewhere else.  

It's not so much *harlot, seductive temptress* as it is *eh, I'm here, you're here, there's a dark corner, why not.*
author: P J.

description:
I hate this place...

I came here last Thursday for a birthday party; I had a LONG ass day at work and trained at my gym for 2 hours.  I did NOT have the patience to dress up so I came in a T-Shirt and jeans.  

When I got there it was super early; the dumbass bouncer shoots me a crooked ass look and goes "You on a list?"  

Me: "Yeah" I said "I'm on Steve's list"

Bouncer:  "ok...there's no steve here"

Me: "Its either steve or greg"

Bouncer: "no greg either, you fucking with me?  You better get the fuck out of here before I..."

Me: "What are you going to do fat face?" as I'm about to take my muay thai skills from K1 fitness to this fat asses' knee.

So I walk over to the wall where everyone's smoking through the fence inside and I wave at these these chicks and they realized I needed some help (PS if y'all are reading this, I love you all!)  so they walked up to the front and told the fat face "He's with us"

Fat face (that's his name going forward): "oh he's with you now?  What's his name?!?"

At this point it gets funny...you know how people do the Y-M-C-A dance?  Well, I started doing the N-I-C-O dance between the dirty looks from fat face...

One girl goes "yeah he's with us, his name's miso" 

Me - frantically shaking my head while pointing at my knee

"Nico!" one girl yells while I jump for joy.

and the fat face let me in...

drinks were ok i guess, +1 star...
author: Nico M.

description:
Harlot is the latest ultra lounge & bar to hit San Francisco and it is arguably the most beautiful. 

As nightlife in "the city" attempts to make a resurgence in the wake of the depressing dot-com bust, the Ultra Lounge craze is leading the way, bringing sophistication and sometimes confusion to the 415. 

While many new clubs attempt to mimic the styles of yesteryear, or duplicate the crowds in other cities (such as Los Angeles and New York), Harlot stands out as an SF original.

This unique feel illuminates throughout the venue as co-owner and architectural visionary Jasek Ostoya has helped to create an elegant yet haunting facility that works to mysteriously consume each and every partygoer, leaving one temporarily unaware or unconcerned with the outside world. 

This undeniable allure, coupled with the fact that Harlot is also owned and operated by veteran club creator Robert Nunez (Dolce, Air) and infamous party promoters Martel & Nabiel, makes for an unforgettable combination.

Although new clubs will continue to pop-up in attempts to garner the city's "in" crowd, if Harlot treats its SF clientele correctly, with its distinct decor and superior music, this venue will no doubt whether the storm and continue to shine... limelight and all.
author: nate m.

description:
I had the most unpleasant experience at Harlot some weekends ago. Harlot is a nice space, music is good, crowd is classy, but there are some bad apples working there that spoil the entire experience. 

My story. It was about 1:50am on a Saturday, and I was in front of the bar on the left lower floor asking for a drink. This girl that was bar tending  kindly told me that they stopped serving drinks, and only shots were available (as in small glasses with liquor). I turned to talk to my friends to check if they wanted shots, and they said yes. I tried to get the attention of the waitress again, and a few seconds later, she told me shots were not available any more. I then decided to just order a red bull, since I was feeling pretty thirsty. I tried to get the attention of the bartender again, but she was pretty busy, so I called another bartender, a guy this time, that was nearby. I asked him if they still served alcohol and he told me no (even though he was drinking a shot).  He then moved to another customer. I tried to call him again to order the red bull, but he completely ignored me, I then asked rhetorically if he spoke English, given that he was just sitting on the back of the bar ignoring my request for a red bull. I gave up at that point to order anything and decided to close my tab. I tried to call the same bar tender again signaling I wanted to close the tab, but he completely ignored me.  I then started talking with some of the friends I was with, and suddenly the same bartender approaches one of my friends (that apparently knew him), and asks her (in front of me, without even looking at me): "Did this dick head just asked me if I speak English?". I completely ignored his comment despite being insulted in front of my friends, since I didn't want to create any drama and just wanted to close my tab.  The bartender was Asian, and I was told afterwards that apparently he decided to take my comment as a racial insult. This doesn't make any sense to me because 1/ I'm not racist and I don't do racial comments and 2/ my comment is pretty common in the context of someone that is trying to express something and not being understood, it does not have any racial connotation.  

In any case, I finally managed to close my tab with another bartender and left to meet some other friends close to the dance floor.  About thirty minutes afterwards, this tall security guy grabbed me and said "I need you to get out of the club". I didn't know what was going on, and I asked him why did he want me to get out. He didn't reply and started to forcefully drag me out of the club. I told him my friends were still there and I had to grab my jacket that I had checked in. He completely ignored me and he managed to drag me out of the club, despite my protest and my request to pick up my jacket that was still inside. I had no idea of what was going on. I had never been thrown out of a club in my entire life, and I'm not exactly young. I tried to talk to the bouncer at the door to see if I could get some sense of the situation, but he rudely told me that he was just doing his job. After insisting several times with him that I had to pickup my jacket, he finally went inside to pick it up. 

I then asked to see the door manager - Jeremy -  that I had met the previous week at the club. (one of my friends had an accident and broke the leg inside the club, and Jeremy drove us to the hospital at the time). I told Jeremy that I had just been kicked out of his club, and I had no idea of what was going on. He was very rude and unprofessional to me, and his first response was "You are very lucky not be permanently banned from this club. If you talk to me again you will forever banned and will never get in Harlot again". I was stunned. This was the same guy that last week had been so nice by driving us to the hospital in his own car, but now he pretended he didn't know me. It was already late and I was tired of the entire situation and didn't want to create any drama, so I just left. I was perplexed by the entire experience, I seriously had no idea why I was kicked out of the club, and I was disgusted by the behavior of the people working in this place - very rude and unprofessional, and treating customers bellow animals frankly. The ironic part is that I heard from a friend that Jeremy expelled me out of Harlot because of a racial comment, and there are several reviews on Yelp calling Jeremy out because of his racist behavior (and for being rude and nasty as well). Needless to say I'm not going to set foot on this place again while people like Jeremy or that bar tender work there, and I strongly encourage people to think twice before going to Harlot.
author: Ricardo O.

description:
Went here with some friends and always been by it but never in it. 

So this place is GREAT in my eyes! Bouncers dont have that serious asshole look on their face at all times, the bartenders smile and dressed appropriately to the theme of the club ( just think of the moulin rouge kinda deal with a tackiness taste of safari life ) door guys will talk to u if u joke around with them and not keep asking " WHEN DO I GET TO GO IN! " (if ur a dude) 

DJ was AMAZING! 80's hits to current hip hop, mash ups, etc.... 

The crowd is great compared to all the other places I've been to, its a really good mixed of the more mature partiers I would say. U dont see those tacky Ed Hardy folks, or girls with painted on dressed that you would do for a night and leave, and then worry if you got something, or many tourist folks because this place is pretty hidden from the main road. 
The guys that go seemed pretty chill, laid back, professional men that keep themselves groomed with a genterman quality....while the ladies look sexy and sophisticated, where u can take em home to mother. 

This is probably one of my fav straight clubs to go to (YUP! I'M GAY! YAY SAN FRAN!) due to the decor, music, atmosphere and crowd. 

The only downside I would say would be lighting when you walk in. You know when you see someone from a far in the dark and you think they're amazingly hot and you get closer and closer and you go "That was a waste of time" , but other then that,  ITS A BLAST!

Drinks- Avg price, pretty fast, and accurate with their counts
Staff- Professional and friendly ( to me they were but maybe cause I go 2 gay clubs where you always get looked up and down before u walk in and then that eye roll happens) 
Music- AMAZING!
Decor- yeah naked painting of chicks on the wall! Great change from the naked crappy porn that plays in gay clubs

Overall- A BLAST!
author: Charlie D.

description:
Harlot is like walking into a Lori Early painting or a scene out of Pan's Labyrinth:  gorgeous, dark, lush, flawless.  Every piece of this lounge appears to have been chosen with care.  Absolutely nothing is out of place, unnecessary:  from the focus, the giant painting perched atop the brambles mounted above the DJ stand to the candles secreted in the recessed shelves in the exposed walls; to the cowhide sofas and glass table tops showcasing sexy harlots (a la Latrice Barnett); to the antlers affixed up high evoking death and re-growth; to the choice of paintings bedecking the ceiling and surrounding walls; to the black iron gates of the smoking cage.

The same discriminating care seems to have extended to selecting the staff, as they are the most courteous and professional lounge staff I have ever encountered -- the doorman, servers and bouncers.

Harlot is exquisite.  It is vampy and enticing with its come hither, around the corner wink of red "Harlot" sign veiled in an otherwise nondescript alley.  I never expected a lounge to capture sensual and aesthetic holism.  Harlot does.  And we get to be her lucky patrons.
author: Natasha S.

description:
So I was supposed to go here for a birthday party and the organizers of the party reserved a table and made sure to get everyone attending on a guest list. i knew it was hard to get in, so i purposely tried to get there early so there would be no problems. I got there a little before 10:30, and there was no one in line. Three of us (2 guys and a girl) walk up to the promoter and tell him we're on a bday list. we tell him our names and he casually glances through the stack of papers, and then he tells us we're not on the list. I ask him if he's sure or if there's someone else I can talk to, and he says no. Okay. so i call my friend who organized the get together and ask him whether they put us on the list. They said they put us on 3 lists. We were on 3 lists and the promoter was unable to spot our names. As i'm talking to my friend on the phone, the promoter tells me not to block the line when there's no one behind us. We ask the promoter to check one more time and he gives us so more attitude. So we decide to just wait till the rest of the party gets here. when we come back a little before 11, there's a ton of people in line and they won't even let the people on the table reservation in. At this point, we decided to just take off and go to another place. Later that night, we find out that the table reservation was given away. Lets just say that out of the 80 people that were trying to celebrate a friend's bday , not one person from that group of 80 ended the night at Harlot. Thanks Harlot for the memorable birthday celebration! 

I just don't understand how Harlot and the promoters can run a business like this. Why have a guestlist if the promoters can't even read the list? Why take a reservation for a table when it is given away? I understand that Harlot and the promoters can choose who they want to serve, but how do you make the offer to host a party for 80 people and think that it  is okay to just disregard a customer's reservations and plans? Reservations and organization that were done with the actual promoters. Harlot and the promoters essentially defecated on 80 people. They will continue to get other customers, but this is really bad business. What ever happened to customer retention?
author: Kevin H.

description:
I came here for a friends Birthday Party on a Saturday about a month and a half ago and I had a blast! They had VIP Service so we got seated right by the dance floor. I have actually been having dreams of coming back here because I just loved the music. I always love it when DJ's mash and mix songs together. The DJ was playing a lot of my favorite music and putting an electronic feel to it. I loved it and me and my friends all had a great time here.

The club isn't that big but I like the Dance Floor area and it got busy early and stayed busy for pretty much the whole night!

I also like the decor, their are lots of fancy chairs and couches which is always a big plus in my book. I love clubs with nice comfortable couches. For some reason I always end up lying down on them towards the end of the night! HAHA! The whole feel is very sophisticated with kinda a goth/dark feel to it. I really liked it. I like all the paintings on the walls as well and the way the tables are decorated.

I will be trying to convince my friends to bring me back here, until then I will continue to dream about it.
author: Luis Q.

description:
Fiiiinally made it to the much buzzed about Harlot. First of all, let me say that I had a really fun time overall. But there may have been some "laughing at" along with the "laughing with" if you catch my drift. 

Do they bus people in from like Paramus, New Jersey to fill this place? I have never seen so many men with schelacked hair, bedazzled t-shirts and flared desginer jeans in one place. What's more, who seem to GENuinely enjoy dancing to Britney and Rihanna but also believe that the song "Return of the Mack" applies to them. Automatic three stars for playing Return of the Mack.  

Also, for a club called Harlot, it struck me as oddly...PG. The music was pretty bad, yet inoffensive, like what they would have played at my (CATHOLIC) high school dances. The bathrooms were oddly clean and not crowded. The security guy was...kinda nice!? I can't put my finger on it. Maybe I've just been going to the wrong places. Maybe I have developed a hostile personality disorder meaning that when I go to certain clubs I expect to get into fights and go home pissed.

One big extra star for the awesome chick visiting from LA who declared that I was "too hot for SF" and allowed me and like 20 of my friends to crash their table, drink all their vodka and mingle with their posse of ibankers. Seriously, thanks! 

Minus one star for the lame list guy who resembled an aging member of Creed. He left my beautiful friends standing in the cold for way too long. 

All in all...moderately good. Thanks, Harlot!
author: Annie G.

description:
New review:

Originally I had given this place 3 stars - but after waiting in line for 25 minutes on a Saturday night (at 12:30) with 2 guys and 1 other girl, the bouncer rudely told us that he "wanted us to go to a bar, but we won't be getting into this one unless we lose the guys" - first of all, why the FUCK didn't you tell us this 25 minutes ago, and second - why the FUCK are you letting in people on the other side of the line?? If you come across the douchebag bouncer with shiny fucking plastic shoes and ugly 40's-style rimmed glasses, get the fuck away. Oh wait, unless you're a group of ugly ass scantily clad White girls.. Anyway don't expect to get in here if it's past midnight and you're a guy or with a guy.

Otherwise, here's my previous review, but I'm keeping it 1 star:

Went on a Saturday night - nice since there was no cover. Definitely an older crowd... Upper twenties. Apparently the upstairs was VIP but I somehow managed to get up there... multiple times. Basically if you're a girl and you smile at the bouncer, he'll happily move aside the velvet rope - no convincing necessary. I actually spent most of my time here staring down at everyone, since that's what you're supposed to do when you're VIP. But really, it was just OK - I wasn't a big fan of the random music, but that's just me. Everyone else seemed happy. Just annoying since there was literally no where to sit.

Also - just FYI, it wasn't THAT pretty. It's also kind of small.
author: Leily P.

description:
I have retired from serious nightly clubbing for a few years now, but it's funny how little things change.  The young'ns with hot bods giggling and flirting with the bouncers, slurring speech, uneven steps.   The dudes, while witnessing the short skirts in groups stumbling inside, wait anxiously outside, half hating not knowing the owner, half hating having to bribe the power-tripping bouncer.   Even then, one dirty look, one pair of sneakers, you are out. 

Inside, shit will happen.  Someone will serve you a weak drink, someone will step on your already in pain toes until they bleed.  Someone obnoxious will hit on you, someone pretty will reject you.   You may get elbowed, you may get into a cat fight.  You snicker at the quality of the clubbers there: too ugly!  You complain about the ladies dancing in a circle who are oblivious to the social aspect of a club.  Go mingle!

But all in all, you can't really judge a club on these aspects.  As much as they want to promote their club as a fantasy venue where all women are gorgeous, all men are rich and sophisticated and occasionally modelesque, they have no control over the crowd.   The irony is that the clubs don't provide the people, yet that's the single most important thing on which people judge. 

What you CAN judge though: is the line speedy?  Is the bouncer letting people freeze outside to create an illusion there is a line?  Did the bouncer let in creepy perverts? are the bartenders speedy?  is the space good for moving around?  Is there a smoke room so smokers don't scatter outside and take over the sidewalk?  Is there good ventilation? Does the DJ play good music? 

I think Harlot does well on these marks.  We went early and weren't on the list but got in for free quickly.  Although we are a group of attractive women for a bachelorette party, I have known clubs that would reject us or make us pay.  I especially appreciate the fact that it was airy inside.  I was sweaty and I had 20 drinks poured on me, but I wasn't dying from suffocation as I normally feel in other clubs.  

As for the crowd, it's older and diverse, which I liked.  I didn't feel like an ultra old bachelorette amongst a group of underaged hookers.
author: Candice B.

description:
Snooty bar/club/lounge that refuses to let guys in without some hot chicks (think slide).  But I likie cuz there's no cover or guestlist, fun place for girls' night outs, we never have to wait in line, and we've never been hit on by creeps.  Also, love their Tim Burton-esque decor.  A+ in my book.

FYI: music is never consistent.  One minute they're playing some hyphy bay "tell me when to goOOoo!!!!" music and right when you start getting into it, they play some YMCA remix... but when you're drunk, you can dance to anything, right?
author: S L.

description:
My boyfriend surprised me with a surprise birthday party at Circolo and when we walked outside, a limo was waiting for all of us to go to Harlot. Very cool. Man, he so got laid that night. Anyways...

We had a table and bottle service! We had a great time and the DJ WAS AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!! I just loved the music and we danced the night away. 

I'm only giving it 4 stars because they let too many people in and it was too packed. Also, two stalls for the bathroom was not a good situation. When I started to feel sick from that Kobe beef burger at Circolo, I ran to the bathroom and politely asked the two bouncers back there if there was another restroom because the line was 30 girls deep. They said, "NOPE!". I very nicely said I was going to be sick and they directly me to the alley and told me to get outside. How classy.  When I asked if they would let me back in, they said yes but proceeded to leave their post and left me outside in the cold. Bastards.

Overall, I had a good time. Was upscale (minus the alley part) and I def recommend it to anyone looking for a great night out. I do recommend getting a table if you have a large group...it gets too busy to enjoy more then one friend while hanging out here. Oh, and they had very cool go-go dancers!
author: Kristen C.

description: I saw a lot of girls labias hanging out of their barely there dresses. There's some weird forest motif going on .The music is good though I'll give it that. The patrons are pretty snotty , and jocky.
author: Lauren V.

description:
I'm in harlot at least once a week! A great place, awesome crowd - everyone's enjoying their time and very friendly. Most of the time has a great female/male ratio thanks to bouncers at the door. Music is pretty good there most of the time, and the place itself looks stunning!

The downside... is that it's very very hard to get inside unless you're with a girl and dressed very nicely. But that's what bouncers do, and thanks to them, it's a much better environment inside.
author: Serge U.

description:
You know after all this time I'm still a bit ambivelent about Harlot. I've been there for several private events and for the club and here's what I have to say about it:

Private Events:
Drinks - Watered down
Service - Decent
Music - Shitty
Crowd - Nothing to write home about

Club:
Drinks - Not bad
Service - Average
Music - Horrible. The DJ should be banished to the gates of hell...or south jersey. 
Crowd - A bit better but still ok. 
Decor - Great. I do love this space and they went outside the box with the decor (ie - naked women on the walls). 

On a side note, I went a while back for a private event and the bouncer actually had the gall to insult the patrons inside. He said something to the affect of 'glad you're coming in, the chicks in there are ugly'. !!! What kind of jackass says that about the place he works at, and to another patron?! Highly unprofessional. Then he tried to tell me I should call him. I asked if his number was 1-800-I-SWEAR-THIS-NEVER-HAPPENED-BEFORE! and that pretty much put an end to our conversation. 

Overall this place is hit or miss. The decor is great, the crowd is ok, drinks are average and music is horrible. Visit it to appease your curiousity but if you're looking for a good place to dance you're probably better off at Apt 24.
author: Shreya C.

description:
Harlot conjures back to its root meaning- when it was used to refer to a man:- a wanderer of no fixed income.  Today Martel and Nabiel redefines Harlot as the self made man of irrefutable taste and personality.  
The main floor  is done with a blue black bracade walls (sorry for the quasi pun) adorned with lifesize portraits reminiscent of nudes by Ingres-echoing onto the table tops framing reclining portraits of 'models.'   Black sectional divan leather sofas were plush and comfortable...A staircase leads up to another bar done with dark scarlet red walls flanked at the ends with the VIP lounging areas- all done in an immaculate white from the walls to the matching leather sofas ,captain chairs and the fireplace.  One is able to appreciate the view from here- but ladies be aware that people from downstairs might see up your skirt- the ledge is made of see- through glass ;-)
The drinks were well made and served by gracious and prompt bartenders- dressed in corsetted bustiers...just lovely.
This review ends with praise towards the gracious and hospitable 
DJ Donovan- whose party ignited the revelers with his musical talents.
This evening was certainly one of the best I've had in a while- and people that didnt even include a shag!  Will definitely be back for more ;-)
author: Arissa C.

description:
me likey!  I loved the decor, the paintings, the darkness, the cool fixtures.  I'll be honest, I don't remember what the drinks tasted like since I'd had quite a few before my arrival, but I do remember the bar was accessible and not overly packed, which is enough to drive me bonkers.  

Great music, nice sized dance floor.  Not too many creepy people...just enough, because there are always some, no matter where you go.  I'll def. go back to get my groove on.
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
The bouncers were super friendly!  I flashed him a smile and we were ushered past the rope.  What?  What's wrong with that?  I have a nice smile ... ;)  Hey listen, if the bouncers were all bad they would have only let me in, not my date.  He was after all, a dude.  All things are not created equal in the eyes of the front door at a club.  They deserve kudos here!

The bartenders served up some mean martinis.  The crowd was entertaining.  After all, how much more can you ask for.  The music was a blast to dance to.  I'll be back.
author: Nicole Rynee B.

description:
It is what it is. If it's a weekend, go with a group of at least 8 and get bottle service. If there are guys in the group, reserve the table in advance. It's a decent happy hour spot if you want to check out the decor without the pretension at the door. 

My experience: I went with a group of 8 other girls at 9:30 on a Friday night and walked right in to a mostly empty club. We got bottle service at a table (sans reservation) because it was the only way we would have a place to sit and put our stuff (all the tables are reserved weekend nights, it seems). The hostess and cocktail waitress were very sweet. We had a  great time dancing to just the right blend of cheesy hip hop and pop. Dudes (mostly douchebags) pretty much left us alone, though we made friends with other groups of girls with the same dance party agenda. I've also been to happy hour there a couple of times and enjoyed myself.
author: Jasmine F.

description:
I'd probably give it a couple of stars if the door guys weren't such dicks.  My friends took me here this weekend for my bachelorette party.  It was a large (more than 20 people) group with all women and one guy.  The guy, my man-of -honor, dropped us off and went to go park the car.  The door guys wanted to let us in right away.  Well, we asked about our "male" friend and they said they would let him in right away to join us when he got there.  Well, they totally didn't do that.  He showed up with one of our other friends who got there a little late and they would not let them in.  I went to the door and and tried to talk to the guy who had promised us.  The guy got a major attitude with me.  Finally, when I was about to go round everyone up to leave because that was just not cool, they let them in.  

Dude, I understand that they don't like to let guys in here, the the ratio here is pretty ridiculous.  I went to an all women's college and I felt like I was back in school.  My new sister in law was with us  and she was also noticing that the only few guys there were pretty old and short too.  So, if you like to dance with a bunch of chicks and a few skeevy old guys, Harlot is your place.  

The decor is ok and the dance floor not too crowded.  It really wasn't anything special though.  I had a great time because I was there with my friends,l but this is really isn't my scene.  I like to get my groove on, I just don't want it with a side of attitude and pretension.  

This place's 15 minutes will be up pretty soon.
author: Kate B.

description:
I went here for a bachlorette party.  wowee!  they made us wait quite a few minutes freezing in our sparkly feather boas even though we were on the list.  when they did let us in, we still had to pony up 20 bones.  

the coatcheck is on the right.  if you can push through the sweaty striped shirts soaked in cologne, and frizzy curls in hoochie tops, the bar is on the left.  

i asked the bartender for a redbull and vodka and i got mostly cheap vodka and a splash of redbull for 9 bucks.  the ladies pushed our way some more into the back towards the small dancefloor.   Thankfully they have chairs since the music wasn't that good.

i put my drink down after making a face from taking a sip and it was whisked away by a busboy.  the bathrooms are on the left of the dancefloor through the curtains.  2 stalls in the ladies bathroom is a luxury for bars and clubs of sf.  i hate when you feel obligated to tip a dollar in the bathroom when there are no hairspray, deo , mints, etc.  but there was a poor chickie handing out papertowels for her dollar tip.

the layout isn't bad, there is a upstairs balcony area where the guys check out the action downstairs.
the only decor piece that isn't great is the giant disturbing picture of a harlot behind the dj.  i prefer a more empowering vision of a "harlot."  women can be portrayed as sexy and powerful without being demeaning. anyhoo....

the guys were respectful on the dance floor.  the ones i wanted to throw my drink on were the ones not letting me pass through to exit.  

i wish they could spin better music because the brief moments when they had a good song on, i did get groovin' on the dance floor.

*******update
so an invite to the upstairs area for a private table...i have upgraded harlot to a fab four stars.  sipping a cocktail mixed by my own server overlooking the crowd downstairs?  hmmmm....heaven.
author: Anh V.

description:
Isn't it weird to go to a club across the street from your school? Yes. 
Doesn't it feel like you are probably in your high school auditorium? Yes.
Doesn't it make you feel like you are in your high school auditorium even more when you are on the dance floor and there's water dripping on your head from some pipe above? Yes.
Doesn't it make you feel old when a college guy comes over to you and hits on you, especially when you just got married and feel old anyways? Yes.

Doesn't it sound like I won't be returning to this place any time soon? Yes.
author: Radha S.

description:
My first experience at Harlot was amazing! Honestly, all I remember from this place was that it was dark and there was good music. I had such an awesome time here with my friends on my 21st birthday. I think it would have been better if we had a table, but it was okay since we were club-hopping anyway. The bathroom was very clean and spacious which is important because I absolutely HATE being in nasty bathrooms with crap all over the wet floor. 

My second experience at Harlot was a little confusing...my friend and I wanted to head back there for a night of dancing. I looked on the website and it didn't say anything about a private event being held there...of course there was. I was confused because it didn't say anything on the website about the event and I was pissed because I was dressed up and just paid 15 cab fare to get over there. The bouncer and some guy in a suit said that they wouldn't let us in even though the place was pretty empty minus the people having their event UPSTAIRS. 

I guess Harlot is really hit-or-miss...call in before or check the website before you waste your cab fare and get dressed up for nada.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Guys, you're not getting in, and quite frankly, the girls that do manage to get in are nothing out of the ordinary.

The bouncers at Harlot are extremely unprofessional.  Last night I waited in line for an hour w/ my group of friends -- 3 girls, 3 guys -- and the 40 year old virgin bouncer refused to let us guys in after he let our girls in when it started raining.  We were on the guess list, but he said we were not.  Seriously, I have never witnessed this kind of douchebaggery from a bouncer before.

We texted our girls, so they came back outside and told us that it wasn't even crowded. We went to XYZ and the night was saved.

So unless you actually happen to be a prostitute, don't bother with Harlot.
author: Ryan P.

description:
WARNING WARNING This is to everyone thinking of having a party at a pretentious place called Harlot.  The people at the door and the Party Planner need some education in customer service and a little something I call CLASS. Our friend planned a 30th birthday event for his wife and reserved a table with drinks a month in advance. We arrive at 10pm, no line and nobody inside, and the doorman said they were fully booked and would not let any that was not on a guest list in.  Needless to say that was bullshit as it was earlier and nobody was inside. As you can see through the comments below, Harlot is does not care about their patrons and thus will go out of business as their TRENDY theme is flushed down the toilet. I will never recommend or go back to Harlot again. 

I GIVE HARLOT A 0 STAR.
author: Customer R.

description:
How do I start reviewing this place? I had heard a great deal about this place and how cool it is filled with hipsters and blah blah blah. From my experience this place is not only NOT worth it but WAY below par. If there were negative ratings I would give it a -5. For some reason the owner and door people thinks they are living in New York City or Paris for their crappy attitude towards people that are coming into this bridge and tunnel bar to spend their hard earned money. esp in this economy. WRONG ATTITUDE!!  Also, when you have your name on the list, for some strange reason, your name is NEVER there. When you try to figure out why, they refuse to speak to you. What kind of customer service is this?  ARE YOU KIDDING ME?!?  I've worked in the club scene for many years in New York City and I know what works and doesn't work esp with regulars. 

I don't recommend this place. The decor is ok.. dark walls with couches thrown about. Nothing special. The bartenders can't make any good mixed drinks beside rum and coke and vodka/tonics. The sound system sounds like it needs an major overhaul .... It's doesn't sound good just by making the music super loud. The bridge/tunnel folks inside are too busy trying to look good rather than just chilling out and talking to others.  Not worth your hard earned cash.. go elsewhere.
author: ayesha a.

description:
Really awful experience. If you brave the corridor of scary homeless people leading up to Harlot, you get to stand in line for an hour while the bouncers push you around: "Stand over here, no, stand over there. We don't care that you bought a bottle, why don't you line up girls and boys over....there! No, actually let's move you to the other side of the building. And by the way we're cutting off 3/4 of the guest list we promised could get in"

After standing in the freezing cold for an hour, and having various members of your party trip and fall into a huge and suspiciously puke-colored puddle, you overhear the bouncer tell his buddy that they are out of tables (i.e., they gave away the table you had reserved with them a couple days ago). Were they ever going to tell you? I just don't get it.

Overall, I'm sure it's fine if you have a really small party, like, you go by yourself. And you're a girl in a mini-skirt. Otherwise save yourself the drama and try another establishment.
author: flying p.

description:
5 Stars for the nice bartenders and the friendly bouncer who carded me on my way in (hey, I'm approaching 30, I love it when that happens)  and fabulous time I had here,  one star off for the kinda expensive drinks.  

The art on the walls was fascinating to me, especially after a couple of drinks.  The space is dark and interesting with out being overly moody or emo-feeling.  Loved the sparkly floor and the comfy couches.  Next time I want to check out the balcony, seems like an ideal people watching spot.
author: Renae H.

description:
Incredible staff, and beautiful interiors make this new Minna street addition a definite plus in my nightlife! I've been waiting to see the final creation for months and now the day will have arrived tomorrow!!! 
But from what I've seen already.... there won't be any disappointment. Harlot is attached to the popular Salt House restaurant, and shares a corridor and bathroom space with them. There are two levels, furry bars, uber high cielings and pony skin chairs..... seriously posh.... seriously. 
Can't wait to see the final results tomorrow!!!!!!!!
author: Marina K.

description:
Got to check out Harlot the other day. Decor is dark with cool zebra print couches and chairs - you get the feeling that you are walking into a burlesque show especially since there are these tables with full length women printed on them. There's a nice smoking area because it's a room inside Harlot with clear walls, but it opens up to the street with some bars in between. The upstairs is a complete contrast as the theme is white. Tiny dance floor, but I guess this place is more of a lounge. 
I went to check out the bathroom per K's recommendation. Very nice! But, when we got out, the boys pointed out the one-way mirror. So..listen up boys, you can see what's going on in the girl's room from the first floor. Girls beware of what you do in the bathroom because there really is no privacy!
Drinks are ok - not the best bartenders around. Sushi from Sushi Groove was served! That was mmmmmm good.
author: Vanessa W.

description: Wants to be pretentious and exclusive yet they let a guy in who had lights on his shoes.
author: Rommel D.

description:
Bouncer:  Unless you're on the list, I can't let you ladies in, private party tonight.  

Me:  There's only 5 of us, we won't take up much room.

Bouncer:  No you won't, but it's a private party.  Sorry.

Me:  Okay.  

...girls and i walking away...thinking in my head, this guy is so lame, just doesn't want to let us in, there's no private party, those other yelpers were right about this place.  ugh!

Bouncer:  Hey! heeeyyyyyyyyyyy!!!!  Come back.  You know what, I don't want you to have to walk around looking for another place.  Just come on in. 

Me and girls walking back:  Oh really...ok, thanks!

INSIDE:  It was a private party!  AWKWARD!!  Everybody knew everybody.  Felt like we were crashing a company party or a wedding reception....hehe.  Oh wells, it was cool inside and there was a ton of room to dance, set our purses down, and drink.  DJ was decent, but got kinda odd towards the end.  All in all, good times!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I had the worst and weakest drink in all of bar history of SF, and that's pretty bad. More than just the full-ice glass effect, boyfriend put a dabble of Jack in my $6 drink. and pathetic enough to give me a half-glass of water?! the front security guys were cool but the on-dance floor dudes were  a bit too macho for the all woman crowd.

I actually thought it bad that the Fem Bar continues to have their party here w/ such poor attitude to dyke looking women by the bar staff. (all except their sole female bartender, that is). While the space is dazzling..and that's why I agree to 1 star, it lacks ventilation to make dancing more than 3 songs enjoyable.
the dj was great, but it's always better to have ladies dj for the ladies, YO.
i'm not sure if I would go again aside from the fact that it was packed....
author: shanestar h.

description:
Harlot gets 4 stars from me. I would say 3 for the Staff and 1 for the Venue. I wish i could give an extra star but i can't because of the music.

As a DJ in SF i think the music program needs to change! (NOW)

The music is good on the weekdays but the weekends, oh boy! Bridge & Tunnel! Mash-ups.....what a waste of an amazing sound system!

My advice to the people who compliant about everything is, get to know the staff, the door guys, and the bartenders and stop acting like little babies! They put up with a lot of sh*t all night. They are working, so try not make their jobs and lives more difficult. It is a night club not a freaking coffee shop. They need to control the crowd, and keep the ratio even (guys & girls). I hate walking into a club and see 4 girls and 500 dudes! so don't expect to show up with 5 of your "hommies" and get in with no problem.

The Place is sexy, modern, clean and i think Harlot will stay on the map for years to come!
author: Nima G.

description:
I want to start off by saying that I did have an amazing night here during labor day weekend.  But I had a lot of fun not becuase of this venue but because of the people I went with.  Harlot is definitely a nice venue, very nicely decorated and some awesome table hostesses.  But the attitude of the people who work there, rude bouncers and bartenders really made this place subpar.  Its a shame because a club like this that tries to redefine SF nightlife gets so over its own head that it fails to remember that the customer is the most important aspect to a business.  If only management realized that the NY attitude just doesnt fly in the west coast.  If only they realized that a venue like this with nicer individuals and no bs wannabe exclusive attitude would go a far way, this place would def. rock.  
Finally, this place is stuck in the middle of no where.  A little creepy.
author: Charles C.

description:
WEDNESDAY IS THE NEW SATURDAY (Thursday's still Thursday), and boy am I suffering now at work. I'll definitely need to take a nap to re-energize for Kickball drinkathon today (Go Suck My Kick!). So last night I went to the Involver pre-launch party. Involver amazes me with how successfully it brings a great crowd together, they are amazing! (Take a break, goto involver.com and sign up for an account. Now! You won't be sorry). Onto the review, this is an amazing venue! I made a brief incursion into the same party as Nancy W. (Go Sharks!) but she's right it was super-crowded. Downstairs was a perfect mix of busy, but not to busy.

The amazing things here are small details. Antler Chandeliers, a systematic shift between Black and White motifs  from upstairs to down. The DJ didn't ruin the night, and played what I would call my favorite club song (Lovemakers remixing 50 cent, YEA!).

I did do some key research for my soon forthcoming book, "Stand next to the photographer stupid!"  Idea is cute girls like being photographed in clubs. You get a disproportionate amount of photos with cute girls, and instead of looking like a drunk donkey stole your 2MP Kodak to snap the pic, it looks like Ansel Adams was following you around all night because, hey, you're just that popular!  That's basically all I got, but I plan on fleshing it out to 90 pages with silly reiterations, pointless add-ons, and the occasional small experiential insight (i.e. doesn't work as well when he's moving around a lot, definitely works better when your buddy knows to suggest putting you in the photo, "for composition").

Anyway the event was great and the club staff was friendly (one off-duty worker volunteered to give me a tour!) I'll definitely go back, it's a great trip!

Thank you involver for a great invent, Specifically Matt, Rahmin, and Simon. Ya'll made this all possible, can't wait for the next one.
author: Tyler W.

description: Beautiful venue not to mention very professional yet friendly staff. Excellent place for special occasions or even just a girls night out! Awesome heaven and hell themed upstairs and downstairs areas, two bars, and of course a dance floor. Highly recommend and by far one of the best high end night clubs in San Francisco!
author: Jesika I.

description:
Martel and Nabiel RULE!!!  This place is PURTY!!!  

Granted, it was one of the first weekends, but EVERYONE looked DAMN GOOD!  In case you can't tell by all the caps!
author: Amme P.

description:
I've been nothing less than halfway to smashingly drunk every time I've gone to Harlot so my review may be influenced by tequila or champagne goggles.

Harlot is fun. If you are in a group of cute girls, you will not have to wait in line to get in. It also helps if at least one of those girls has mistaken her black leather belt as a mini skirt. And that's all I have to say about that.
author: Deb I.

description:
Heyyyy!!!!! I really liked this place.  

Bouncers super friendly....to me anyway.  Always nice to experience when out and about in a 'foreign' city.

Caught Fred Everything at this well-decorated, clean spot.  Bartenders were friendly.  Good sized dancefloor in conjunction w/ the size of the lounge (never seemed empty or overcrowded). 

Smoking area could be a little better ventilated.  I know it's a smoking area, but still.

Great place to start OR end your night.
author: Abby T.

description:
My first time there, I'm in a limo by myself (long story) and the creepy driver pulls into this sketchy alley. I swear I'm gonna get raped, shot and killed. Nope, just going to Harlot.  

There was a long line - that I was able to bypass, thank god. The place was packed, and the crowd was a mixed bag. The second level was VIP only. Pretty cool because you can look down at the whole room. People prefer tables on the first floor by the dance floor though - where you can see and be seen. 

Music was good. Drinks were strong. Opt for bottle service.
author: Erin M.

description:
AVOID!!!  RUN!!!  Pretty much the same stuff others have been writing and I knew I shouldn't have gone but some friends wanted to check it out.  Anyways, we waited for about 40 mins outside with the line moving only as people started to leave.  Finally after letting in a couple in their mid 40's in, they look at my guy friend and me and said only I could get in and that he would have to leave.  I just don't understand this at all, the place wasn't full, we were dressed well and the bouncer didn't even give us any options.  It's not like "Hey you're free but guys need to pay a $20 cover".  It was simply, go away.  

Please, please avoid!
author: Miranda L.

description:
I had to wait almost 45 minutes to get in...there were three lines, none of which I understood at all since there is no cover and one wasn't for bottle service. Despite the wait...

Inside there was a band/DJ, I couldn't really tell what they were. They played a REALLY random mix of music, most of which was difficult to dance to.

The crowd was very mixed, which I liked.

Overall it was too crowded and just weird! I'll go back again, maybe it was just a weird night!
author: Elaine S.

description:
bad stuff first: went on a saturday night (not sure how it is other nights)... the guy running the door, which i believe was the owner or manager as he claimed he was, was a dick.  Very discriminating in who he lets in.  I'm from LA and i've been to all the various clubs in LA and vegas, and i've never experienced a guy who was blatantly hypocritical on who they let in.  Basically, he tells me and my friend that we could not go in because we didnt have girls with us DESPITE us saying we had about 5 girls inside for a bday waiting for us to get in.  the hypocritical part was that as we were waiting to see if he'd budge, he let in 5 other dudes simultaneously!  f- that... so eventually he let us in but he still went against principle and his word.

Good stuff: the decor, the people, and the music was pretty entertaining.

peace.
author: mark s.

description: 70% of this place is table service with couches, it seems the space is used kinda poorly.  Ok music, ok drinks, there seems to be a lax dresscode, one of us had flipflops and was let in.  +1 for no cover saturday night.
author: Yingjue C.

description:
Looking for a place to spend the late night hours, we hit this spot upon a recommendation from a friend. She had said it was the closest spot to LA she could find in SF. I wasn't too thrilled to go to a place that resembles LA spots but wifey wanted to give it a try and so we did.

Interior was really nice with enough light and a nice ambiance with all the decor. The place was pretty empty as we got in but got filled with a nice crowd of people by 11pm. The DJ got in at around this time and the music started picking up. The DJ was one of the best I had listened in mixing old school with new stuff. Too bad, their website doesn't list his name on their calendar.

We stayed till around 1:30am and had a lot of fun drinking and dancing. The drinks were pretty good size at a much lower price than LA hence I would consider the pricing moderate.
author: Volkan S.

description:
*This review is strictly for the VIP area*

I know that if you're a dude, and you didn't buy a VIP area, chances are you got rudely turned away by the doorman. I think it's lame for any SF club to be pretentious, but with a space this small, I kind of understand, and appreciate the discretion.

But I digress. VIP area is perfect for a small group party who wants to keep to themselves in a fairly upscale setting. It's not LA or NY, but it's solid for SF. Nothing but top shelf service, from the VIP coordinator to the busboy who personally retrieved several nicotine-addicted people in my group cigarettes. That was impressive. The night was a drunken haze, so I can't comment on the caliber of the crowd...and I was almost never down on the main level - I just know it wasn't LA/NY level, but as aforementioned, this is SF. Music got better as the night went on. Taking off a point for not having the fireplace on in the upstairs mezzanine. That would've been nice. $250 for top shelf liquor (keep in mind, 1 liter bottles)

In summary, if you got a VIP spot in the mezzanine, and you're with a small group of good friends, I don't see how you cannot have a good time at this place.
author: Brian N.

description:
Love the space and its decor.  The happy hour crowd there was what's to be expected.  Drinks were expensive but barkeep was super friendly and very sexy in their lace up corsets.(Must go to Haight Street and get one.) My friend tipped the DJ to keep playin 80s for our group.  Yes, I love my cheezy 80s.

Dee Dee, the VIP manager was very nice in trying to accomodate our group for later that week.  There are a quite a few requirements with table service.  Minimum 2 bottles, "balanced ratio" of girls to guys sitting at the table. 

So we came back on a Saturday night and it was freekin packed.  Guess that's good, but I'm too old for that shit.  I just want a nice lounge with good atmosphere where my friends and I could drink.  Harlot was way too much of a scene, which is probably good for those 20-somethings out there.
author: Joyhan S.

description:
Eh.  This place underwhelmed me.  DISCLAIMER: I am particular about the qualities of reasonably good dance floor, and some of my opinion of this place might be directly related to the DJ who was spinning last night.  That being said...

The place was crowded, but in that annoying-crowded-kind-of-way. Everyone always seemed to want to be over there, or right where you were standing while you were standing there.  Maybe this is related to the unoriginal faux-mashup, genre-confused soundtrack provided by DJ A to D. There were three guys messing around with the DJ set-up.  I'm not sure who was the "real" DJ, but the guy with the white hat seemed to play the least offensive tracks. Oh, there I go, talking about the DJ...

The friend that told me about the place was with a group who had a table.  That area was a little less trafficked, so it might have been more pleasant.  But again, I actually like the dance floor.

The crowd itself was decent and reasonably attractive; I wouldn't go so far to say that it was eclectic, as the the dress code was pretty consistent.

There were no issues at the door, as reported elsewhere in this forum, though we did arrive on the EARLY side sliding up to the velvet rope just before 11.

Overall, I'm not sure I would run back to this place as the music coordinator clearly has no idea about  good club music.  If you're going to be an 80s DJ, be an 80s DJ, if you're going to be a psuedo-mashup DJ actually follow thru with it, don't make me listen to a mega-mix of your favorite songs that have no consistent rhythm ... And if you're going play good dance beats, play them, don't build up for 2 hours with some lame, over-played, mainstream top 40 tracks.  Again with the DJ...
author: Social E.

description:
The music of Harlot, at least on the night that I went, reminds me of both Holy Cow in SOMA and Beauty Bar in the Mission. It started out wonderfully with recent Hip Hop and Top 40 hits, but then took an odd turn when the DJ started beltin' out Journey, Guns 'n Roses and Bon Jovi.  I do love my 80's music, but I just wasn't feelin' it at the time.

I enjoyed the chandeliers made of antlers. Very Abercrombie and Fitch. Which was fitting, because most of the people there were white. And older. My friend and I, having just entered our 20's, could feel the eyes of quite a few of the much-older men giving us a little look-see. 

Near the end of the night they went back to Hip Hop and redeemed themselves.
author: Jen O.

description:
LOVE IT...

Dark interior with great design and excellent cocktails...this is going to be Babmi's new hide out.
author: Teddy d.

description:
Incredibly decorated venue.  And that's where Harlot's charm ends.

There was no line out front.  But the bouncers asked if we had "a table."  And then told us to wait.  After about 10 minutes and over 2 dozen people had walked out of the club, they decided that we had done our penance.  Inside, the music was worse than awful.  Embarrassing even for a frat party.  The drinks were mediocre.  A cosmo isn't that hard, people.

If you like douchebags, bridge-and-tunnel bouncers who think they're hot, and music that will take you back to that Sigma Nu party you hardly remember in college, please go to Harlot.  They want you there.
author: Mark J.

description:
Premise: Boys night out
Solution:Harlot

For those of us tired at looking at hippies hipster and the unfashionables we call most San Franciscans (Shit I have been living in the Haight too long) Welcome to a little slice of good old fashioned pretention to remind us there is a world outside of San Francisco. 

I am saying this as I miss pretention, hot superficial girls, and cool campy decor every once and a while. The door guy Matt is a badass. He is also a personal trainer at Diakadi here in the city, I only know this because I train there and he recommended  i come to play.

As for Harlot. Small, hot club, I thought I was in Miami forat least 3 minutes throughout the night which wasa first for me in SF. The talent in this place is as high quality as I have seen in the Bay. This is a venue that is built for bottle service and as a few have mentioned in the past..the mezzanine is where it is at. Not to mention the array of corset wearing cocktail waitresses... I must say the eye candy was plentiful. 

I have no comment on the drinks, as we were being served our own having paid up for the bottle service which is solid. I highly recommend the bottle servicefor a number of reasons. 

a) the place is small and packed, in fact you can barely walk when it gets popping. 

b) You get your own table, own space and own seating, as well as own server. So there is much less discomfort with tryhing to hang out and you don't have to wait for drinks. 

c)This provides for a great place bring 21 year old sorority girls that are stuck with the masses, on this particuliar night I believe I rounded up 8 such patrons for my single friends to mingle with. Sorry ladies , I'm taken.

Dance floor. Good stuff. Cheesy toons,  not alot of space, but very fun. 
 
All in all, one of the best night out I have had in San Francisco.
author: D M.

description:
This place is pretty cool. Dark and goth decor that includes some interesting paintings (of harlots, of course). The bartenders seem to be pretty big on themselves but the clientele that I have met there are pretty cool.

The DJ's spin pretty good music. And, they have free drink offers every once in a while and sometimes even a full open bar (if you RSVP in advance). Once we were there on a night that they were giving away free lemondrops in any form: as a shot, on the rocks, or straight up. Messy night.

Another time, a blond raver chick was dancing provocatively by herself. People were just standing there and gawking, but she was hopped up on goofballs and kind of stumbling around. That was weird...

It's well worth a visit (on the right night), but I wouldn't wait more than 5 minutes to get in.
author: Wes F.

description:
I came here with a few friends since one of our friends just moved into the Infinity. We came with 50/50 guys/girls and were able to get in without cover or too much fuss.

The decor is best part. It looks like a club that might be part of Versailles, except a little more modern. There are a chandeliers hanging from the super tall ceiling, interesting paintings everywhere (although the one in the back by the dance floor is kinda creepy), and a little VIP area on the second floor to spy on people.

It was really crowded though, and totally packed with Euro trash guys clearly looking for some easy American girls. A lot of the guys were very pushy too. The music was kinda random, it was some 80s stuff when we got in, weird remixed tracks later, and finally some songs we actually knew. The dance floor is kinda small, but it's nice there's some seating and small benches adjacent to the floor to rest a bit or put your drink down.There was a bachelorette party there that night, and I think they took up probably a third of the dance floor.

I would probably come again, but wouldn't go out of my way. I definitely wouldn't pay cover to get in. I'm getting too old to be hangin at the club too often anyways. ;)
author: Kenny J.

description:
In the ever continuing quest to find my bestfriend someone suitable to date, we met some guys here after work one day. 

It was a nice space to lounge around, talk and drink. The decor was goth, with a large portrait of a topless woman as their centerpiece. The balcony was a nice feature. I can imagine a packed night, would spill onto the sidestreet, especially with the bar smack right when you walk in. 

And the bathroom is in the same direction as the backdoor exit, so if you ever need an out, there's a quick getaway.
author: Sara D.

description:
Been here a few times. After work for happy hour and a few times later in the evenings. All in all, I can fairly say I've never had a bad time here. The bartenders pour the drinks stiff most of the time and the music is alright.  It's not the biggest place in the world and the whole bathroom situation is a little awkward because it's attached to a hotel so basically you exit in the back of the place through a velvet curtain and are hit with blaring fluorescent lighting which is a total buzz kill and then a usually rude bouncer type guy making you head directly to the bathroom and not hang out in this awkward lobby/entry way for the hotel. 

In conclusion, go to Harlot, preferably for happy hour when you won't get blinded by the hall lights if you have to pee or.... just don't have to pee!
author: Amy B.

description:
This is a great place to take a friend from out of town to show San Francisco's version of a swank, loungy yet dancy, posh place.  Does that make sense?  I'd give it 5 stars but sometimes it gets too packed!

I don't want nobody, I don't want nobody baby!
author: Justin C.

description:
I had a great time at Harlot last weekend! I came with a group of friends for a birthday party, and we got table service. They let us right in at the door and made sure we were well taken care of. The tables were blocked off in such a way that you didn't have a bunch of randoms trying to get drinks from you, which is a major plus!
