Lots of clubs try to squeeze every inch of space to get too many tables in a small area causing everyone to bump into your table, knock over your drinks, knock people into the table, and finally--- a club that let's you feel like VIP when you get a table! They were on top of making sure we had enough glassware, mixers and liquor! 

There was a themed Winter Olympics party going on that made it really fun! They had a sno-cone machine, a Tequila Ice Loge for shots, decorations and snow everywhere--- very well planned out-- I can't wait to see the next theme party! Extremely well executed! 

As for everyone else's comments on the bouncer, Jeremy-- THANK GOD he was out there to keep out the riff-raff. I really appreciate that they are selective with who they let in. He kept it a good looking crowd, and I think it's becoming harder in harder in SF to find a club that isn't...B&T, or sketchy. 

I definitely recommend this place- great for dancing, great looking people and great bottle service.
author: Alexis V.

description:
I have very mixed opionions about this place.  It's really a hit or miss.  Be sure to have back up plans everytime. Here's my last 3 experiences

1) I went with a 50/50 girl to guy ratio we were let right in (8 of us total). After about 5 minutes we walked right out because the average age of the crowd was 40+

2) 100% girls and we were let right in and had a blast.  great music, great crowd .  we couldn't have asked for more

3) We went straight here after dinner with 50/50 girl to guy ratio to just grab some quick drinks, they let 2 girls of the 6 of us in.  The rest had to wait outside for 20 min when there was NO ONE else inside?!?!?

My recommendation: John Colins right across the way.
author: Stacey L.

description:
Not a bad club, though a bit too dark for my taste--everything was painted matte black. The decorations were of 3 eclectic styles with the common thread of naked women everywhere--goth wall paintings, pin-up table tops, and classical Rubenesque ceiling paintings. Now, I like the naked female form as much as the next guy (artistically, of course), but please! One style at a time!

The drinks seemed almost too strong...at least until the 3rd one when I stopped noticing. From 5-9pm, well drinks are $5 and beer is $3, but be warned: they have no well whiskey, as a new friend discovered to her shock. The bartenders were pretty attentive but hyper-focused, displaying no personality.

Music that night was a DJ spinning classic 80's hits. They have a pretty good layout of couches and chairs around the tables, creating a very sociable arrangement.

Trivia: While "harlot" today is generally synonymous with "prostitute", during the 13th century it meant a male beggar or vagabond. Briefly, it also meant a juggler or jester of either gender.
author: Bill B.

description:
Definitely attracts a good-looking crowd compared to other SoMa destinations. I suspect it's due to some sort of face control, which I have mixed feelings about but have seemed to benefit from for one reason or another. I mean this isn't Vegas or LA after all! 

The space is quite small, but laid out quite well with a lofted lounge area/bar and dance floor with more seating on the main floor. Good balance of lounge and club in a dimly lit, red and black setting. Plenty of paintings of voluptuous women scattered throughout, but isn't that expected for a place with such a name?

I've been here for both Happy Hour and after 10pm on a Saturday and both times I had a good time. The line is kind of a drag, but it's worth it in the end. It's not obnoxiously loud so you can choose to either dance the night away or talk to someone on a couch if you so desire. Plus that have a little outdoor smoking patio that bears a striking resemblance to a dungeon and is really amusing. Harlot is definitely unique and worth checking out.
author: Natalie T.

description: The drinks are expensive, definitely keep that in mind.  But their music/DJ is AMAZING.  Easily my favorite place to go dancing in the city-- seriously-- you have to rip yourself off the dance floor.  You can usually get away with no cover and no line.  I'm hungover just thinking about it!
author: Taneen J.

description: Beautiful venue. Warm ambiance. Unique and lavish furnishing. Fridays are their most packed nights. Sometimes hard to get in, but well worth it, no cover. Thursdays have a cover charge, but a much more relaxed and loungy environment and feel. 3rd Thursdays are the best :)
author: David P.

description:
I was so poised to find this place cheesy, as I like to pretend I'm "over" the whole sceney thing (especially because sceney + SF tends to equal poser).  I mean, growing up in LA, I did all sorts of stuff I shouldn't have when I was way too young to be doing it, and consequently got tired of clubs by the time I turned 21.  

But secretly, I still like swank, design-y nightspots like Harlot, IF they are done right.  And Harlot is.  I like the gothic, perverse sexiness - very appropriate for a good-girls-gone-bad night out with the ladies.

So I've gotta try that.  Because this time, I came here for a work event at happy hour.  It was hosted upstairs in the VIP section with an open bar, so that was great, except Harlot doesn't exactly have a happy hour vibe.  But no matter.  I contentedly sipped my well-mixed elderflower cocktail and pretended it was 11pm.

What legitimately blew me away was how NICE the doormen were.  All of them.  Smiley, seemingly genuine - never has a doorman made me feel so welcome.  And I wasn't even wearing a boob shirt (coming from work, I rocked the complete opposite - button-down, almost no makeup, and sneakers).  

Can't do five stars, cause I didn't get the opportunity to judge the real (ie nighttime) crowd.  And a few signs did point to sleaze - namely, the group of short/old/balding men that slithered their way into our party.  But future judging is imminent.  I have high hopes for this one.
author: Melissa B.

description:
A little small dam and crowed. BUT loved the atmosphere and the people.
Real Pricey.... So another drink please  men. 
Went here with my favorite girls for my Baccalaureate party. Best night out.
Besides the amazing women I was with the night was great itself. Met some real fun people. Some people from Dubai. How cool is that. Seemed very upscale once the night got stated and it got packed. Dress to impress. And don't waste your money on VIP or a booth. Over rated. Not much room but more then enough room not to pay those prices. The best party of the night. Is for once I didn't have creepy guys stocking us but just business men out for a drink and some out of towners looking for a hot spot. I'd go back. BUT only for a special occasion. Not an every night or weekend type of place. Age range was women mid 20's men upper 30's. I had fun I can't complain. I think if your looking for an excuse to get all dressed up (not a slutty look night) but super sexy sophisticated this night ladies this would be your spot. Men bring your wallets. No one really gets you a drink most of the time and the prices are BOOKOO. Open Parking is right across the street and a Parking Garage is only about a block away.
author: Cori M.

description:
So I noticed that pawapreet G, on 12/01/2007 described Harlot as a place that would be entertaining if "you're in your late 20's and beyond."

Oh snap.  That's me.  And Harlot WAS entertaining.  Gotta go back and drink my old sorrows away.
author: Liz C.

description:
Fellas, it sucks to have a hetero dick in this town.  If you're not gay, good luck finding a sensible lady.  If you're not well-connected, good luck getting into a club.  Specifically this one.  The ladies will have no problem getting into Harlot, but the door staff is just plain cruel to the gentlemen.  Guys:  get thee on a guestlist!  Or if it really matters to you, receive a blessing from the owner, then drop his name at the door.  But I think this only works if you're a huge douchebag.

I want to love Harlot, but it just won't let me.  They're in the business of generating an exclusive atmosphere and reputation, but the result is something so chintzy that I don't want to come back.  Though the space, drinks, and music were good, the exclusivity created this really REALLY odd crowd that, to echo another reviewer, was too concerned about ruining their hair/makeup/clothing to have a good time.  For real: everyone on the dance floor was step-toe, step-toe-ing side to side in zombie unison.  I kid you not.  To a pretty solid hiphop mix.  I was amazed.

The club wasn't at capacity when my girlfriend and I arrived, but it was a huge bummer when my boyfriend and his male friends weren't allowed in when they arrived, so I gladly peaced out.  Nice space, good drinks, terrible door staff, boring crowd, and strictly vagina-friendly.  You've been warned.
author: Andrea U.

description:
As one of the purveyors of "euro cool", I like to hang out in spots with many many (many) well dressed classy ladies. Such locations come and go with the seasons, but if you want it here and now, Harlot will be the place to get it. 

I would give this place 5 stars, as the venue itself is very nice. The lighting (all important) is light enough to see who you're talking to without losing that "sexy glow" vibe. The decor is edging toward aristocratic, but not too much so. Where Harlot loses its star is in its layout, which makes it very difficult to move from the front to the back. The spaces next to the bars are just too small, and it can be frustrating squeezing past everyone just to get back to your friends. Or maybe that's a good thing, depending on your perspective...

I'll be back here for sure!
author: Kevin R.

description:
Happy hour review. The only reason I went there was someone I knew was playing that night. 

Nothing special about this place except for the cute modern/European classic decor and super comfortable couches. Unfortunately, they didn't have good vibes...weird mix of people. 

As for drinks, they charge $9 per glass of wine for the kind that goes for $9 per bottle in stores, for happy hour. The bartender was awful. I really wanted to go somewhere else if I hadn't been obligated to stay for the music!
author: Judy D.

description:
I can sum this entire place up in one word. Really.  From the staff, drinks, music, venue all the way down to the "we're like that cool hole in the wall club you went to in Prague during your post-college backpacking trip to find yourself over in Europe"  vibe.

Fail.

One star for the "generic bouncer #1" wearing a tuxedo and a leather overcoat. hahaha!
author: Maec W.

description:
This place has a warm, sexy, vibe, with a comfortable lounge-y area that segues nicely into the dance floor. Loved the antler-esque chandeliers; the portraits of young, promiscuous ingenues; and reddish lighting. The dance floor was CROWDED. I tend to enjoy space when dancing, but it was refreshing that people seemed to come here to DANCE. The crowd was young and fun and I would definitely go back.

There was this one girl, however (there always is) that managed to climb atop this window sill and hump the air for a few minutes before the security removed her.  The bouncer kept on flashing a light on her to signal her to get the hell down.  She got so into it she thought the light was part of her show.  She nearly pulled a Britney getting down and the whole episode nicely capped off my night.
author: Erin E.

description:
THIS CLUB IS AWFUL!!! The staff is so pretentious and rude! We had a table and people on a guestlist. Our guy friends that were on the guestlist were turned away even though it was early and the club was empty! We tried to get the guys in and the bouncer just tells us, "You need to go back inside!"

At the end of the night the club started to let people know that it was about time to close up. Most clubs give people a chance to finish their last drink. Instead one of the staff just takes a full beer out of my friend's hand and throws it away!

And then they totally target specifically me and my friends to leave the club even though everyone else was standing around the place. This was before the 2AM closing time and the bouncer stated that he needed to get people out of the club so he could catch a flight to Vegas.

We complained to the manager that we were treated so rudely and they offered us free passes but I wouldn't even want to go there again.
author: kimy l.

description:
They might as well have gone ahead and named this place "slut" or "hussy or "wench".  On second thought, "Harlot" sounds better.

Glancing at the other reviews, it doesn't seem like this is a choice place to hit up during the weekend for several reasons.  However, stopping here to take the edge off during the work week is a good idea.  Three dollar beers, mixed clientele, grooveable music, and creepy pseudo-eduardian/goth decor a la Etiquette make Harlot more than another notch in my happy hour belt.
author: Momo R.

description:
This place has the potential to be great. Nice yet subtle decor, the right interior and  there is no cover.  The crowd is good looking although might be a little pretentious on certain nights. 
The bad part is the music - it's either mainstream hip hop that you hear on the radio all the time or 80's. One would expect something more eclectic and exciting from a place that purports to be the ultimate hot spot.
author: Arkady I.

description:
Here's a conversation you may have at Harlot:

"HEY! GOOD TO SEE YOU! HOW'S IT GOING?"

..........

"WHAT?"

..........

"WHAT?!"

..........

"I CAN'T HEAR YOU!"

..........

"FORGET IT!"

The music is uber-loud at Harlot, but eardrums are overrated and who goes to a club to have a conversation anyways? Hopefully your non-verbal communication skills are on point or the girl you're trying to cozy up to is fluent in american sign language. The music itself is not too bad, although I would say it varied quite a bit.  

So we showed up before 10pm for a friend of a friend's birthday and the place wasn't open yet. No big deal, we'll just hang out outside for a bit. 10pm rolls around and the club manager comes out with his iPad and asks us if we're on the guest list. Apparently eye contact and a cordial demeanor are not this guy's strong suit. But attitude sure is. Might want to take it down a notch, guy. The doormen are pretty laid back, though. We walk in and the place is empty (glad we were on that guest list). We order a couple of beers ($5 apiece), the bartenders are pretty cool, although one of them seemed to have some issues with pouring the draft beers. Look around, no place to sit unless you were one of the lucky few to drop $500 for a reserved table. Luckily we were with one of those groups. Table service is probably about the same as others around: 3 bottles of vodka/jack/something else with all the mixers. There is a smoking patio with some stools, so that's ok. Over the next few hours, the place fills up quickly. Fairly mixed crowd, guy/girl ratio seems pretty decent too. Probably agree with others that the crowd can bend toward the older side. Dance floor is big enough for a small crowd. There's an upstairs too, although I couldn't figure out how to get up there. The decor does live up to its name, though. 

Good place to go if you just want to dance and drink, not so much if you want to talk or sit.
author: Saunders C.

description:
Best club in San Francisco in a very very VERY long time.  

Thank you so much M & N.  

Bravo!!!!
author: Yelper A.

description:
My friend has a crush on one of the blond bartenders so we were persuaded to check this place out on one of our nights out.   Unless you're on the guestlist or know someone I recommend you bring your coat.  Do not try to brave the cold; just coat check because it's at least a +20 minute wait.  After the bouncers were done letting a flux of guestlisters in, he asked us our ratio (3 girls/2guys) and let us all in.    

The decor rocks and so did the music. We danced all night long. Songs that would change every few minutes between top hits, hip hop, rock, house, 90's, and the much loved 80's.  Turns out the style is called mashup and DJ Solomon the DJ that night is a master at it.  

We all had a good time and will definitely be back to dance some more!
author: Karen Y.

description:
I recently ventured to the Harlot and was impressed with the decor and overall atmosphere. 
The selection of booze made mamma very happy and I ordered accordingly.
 I must say that the lighting was a bit too bright (Although it was still early on a friday night) Perhaps they are trying to help the "late out of work'ers" but "early to get their drink on" set from making the drunkin' mistake of taking home a less than desirable mate for the night. Maybe?
The staff were quick and friendly. I usually can only get away with having my water refilled like two times, but I pushed the limits here at Harlot and the bartender totally hooked me up!!!!  Three times is the charm when it comes to hydration.
I really liked the art! I stared perhaps too long at the painting behind the dj. Oh well!
author: Andie F.

description:
Talk about SNOTTY!  The place was pretty empty, me and my friend got in no prob.  My guy friends came 30 min later and could not get in and this is at around 10pm.

"Nope, not letting in any more guys" is what they said.  The place was EMPTY.  And what fun is that for the girls?  Someone said you have to bribe the bouncers.  YUCK. Totally ruined the night so we left.  

The club itself seemed ok.  Better looking crowd, but too snotty.  Come here for a girls night I guess, but if you have guys in your group, I suggest going somewhere else.
author: C A.

description: Meh it is what it is. My coworkers and I always come to the coffee stand right outside here. And I was told I wouldn't like this place too much but I thought I would check it out all the same.  First off, Friday's 5:30 - 9PM there is a taco truck outside and they will let you bring the food in. However once inside it sort of looks like it was built up as a goth lounge or something. All that was playing was 80's music and it reminded me of just a dance club in SJ. Not my thing but hey people are nice.
author: Greg G.

description:
Invited here by Pookie W. and ended up meeting Jamal G. too...both cool ass folks.  I've now seen 3 yelpers in person.

Best part about this place was the two yelpers above and the DJ.  His music was cool (not the greatest) but his DJ skills were tight.  He also was more energetic than most of the crowd.  Crowd was majority White and Asian and stuck in their small groups.  I just kicked it with Pookie W and AKA G or watched the DJ do his thing...

The place is free so go stick your head in and see if its your thing...wasn't really mine.
author: One Black Mans POV.. ..

description:
I don't go to bars too often, so many of you will instantly skip over my review.  But I wasn't impressed with the place.

I went to a private party that occurred before it was open to the public.  The art displays were OK, kinda weak and uninspired and they didn't really add anything special to the decor.  But the place's main problem is the noise level.  There were only about 20 to 30 people there, and with the music blaring I could scarcely hear anything anyone said to me.

The drinks were modestly priced I thought.

It's definitely not a "San Francisco Bar", more like it belongs in LA.  If they take care of the noise situation by padding the ceiling or curtaining the walls a bit, maybe I'd like it more.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
The decor was lovely, dark, mysterious, sexy....the patrons...not so much.  Not a friendly face in the crowd.  Way overcrowded with females, and the bouncers were NOT very friendly at all.  We went in a large group, didn't get table service, and was basically told at the front door that next time we came, we HAD to get a table or else they wouldn't let us in....why does it matter?? we're still spending a grip on over priced drinks! so anyways, our friends were coming later and couldn't get in as they were guys...so we ended up actually hanging out at the salthouse across the way.  

  From the rudeness of the staff, the over priced drinks, the over crowded FEMALE based dancefloor, it wasn't really my bag of tea...the music was mash ups and not my taste at all either.  

  oh well, you make it what it is. Still had a good time.
author: Lulu C.

description: Eh....A lot of sleazy guys come here, ladies beware! Otherwise, good music and vibes, I would probably come here again.
author: Annika K.

description:
I don't think this place deserves any stars what so ever! Approached this place on a Saturday with some good looking folks. Just 3 of us and low behold you have this greasy new jack city looking doorman that has to speak in his little FBI agent mic to larry, curly and moe to see if 3 brotha's can get in. I remember this same dude before way back in the day from the old DV8, if any of you can remember that club! 

The same dude (promoter?)told me there"s a guest list. So I'm thinking to myself, what club or bar has a guest list ? REALLY!!! Dude didn't give me a price to get in nothing.I wonder, would they let OBAMA in? Probably turn him down too, sorry OBAMA, you gotta be on the guest list. This place sucks, oh yeah, walked by there on a Wednesday night one day. Greasy door man was working, said $10 to get in. WHAT, on a Wednesday night, ok dude is really smokin on the pipe with his greasy face!!

My thing is, are they really trying to re-segregate again? Gonna have a word with the Mayor about this place!!
author: P B.

description:
Seems like PRETENTIOUS has been the overall theme of the reviews and I totally AGREE!  First time we went, we had a guy with us so they would n't let us as well as 20 people who were standing in line in because um.. we had men with us!  How ridiculous.  Is this an all female club?

We went early the second time just to beat the crowd and left at 11pm because the crowd was so dead.  As it turned out, the bouncers were holding up the line outside to build up they hype.  How dumb!

Overall, nice decor, nice story about the club, and no cover - but that's it.

Too small and too pretentious.  I'd rather go to vegas to get treated like this.
author: Lis Y.

description:
What's this attitude you guys? Looks like you have to "know" someone in order to be considered . I go to a club for the music an for the nice people : this place looks to me  like is missing both. A bunch of cocky door guys that feels like they can judge who's cool and who's not: yak.
The place looks nice, that's it.
author: Tracy N.

description: This place has great music and a really unique design. It is small enough to give it a bit of a lounge feel but the 2 stories and dance floor maintain the club aspect. Guys will usually have trouble getting in at the door but if you send a pretty girl to reason with the door guy they usually cave and let all the dudes in. Admittingly I have not been here for a few months, I am worried about my beloved SOMA area turning into such a bridge and tunnel destination zone and only pray that this place does not fall victim. The dozen or so other times I have been Harlot has not disappointed me though and so it is worth checking out.
author: Marie C.

description:
Nice idea here. A bit crowded on the event I attended, but it is to be expected for a venue opening of this quality. Upstairs and downstairs levels are alluring. The layout of the staircase / bathrooms led to a bit of bottle-necking in front of the bar and along the wall, given the level of patronage, but hopefully this will subside somewhat as the spot settles in to the SF nightlife scene. Positives are great DJ's and nice bouncers, good service and neat smoking room (clearly a homage to the Rye "smoking cage", but in this case executed better with clear walls inside). The service in particular was astounding given the crowded and boisterous crowd -- no lip from the bouncer, attentive bartneders, and very friendly (and attractively corseted) waitresses.

While it currently has the "ultra-lounge" feel of a Mr. Smiths, Dolce, etc., albeit with a much improved decor and layout, I hope it will settle down some and become a bit more of an intimate lounge in the near future. If you're into the crowded/dancing scene, this is a great spot right now. Personally, I look forward to the more relaxed atmosphere that may loom in the future after the initial buzz, at which point this will be one of the top-tier in SF.
author: Aaron H.

description:
I like soooo have a place to wear my bustier / garter sets to!

Fabu staff. Intelligent layout. Great use of space...Plenty of capacity but comfortable spacing and nice little areas to sit. Upstairs design was easy on the eyes without being to stoic or too san francsico mag page 37 spread. I didn't drink, but everyone commented on the balanced drinks.

Hot place as a whole worth coming back to. Does anyone know where I can get one of their bustiers? But I want T on mine  ;)  or a yelp starbust thingy.
author: Tanya P.

description:
This is a tale of two bars in one night - both kinda similar but oh so different.  Our first stop was the second night of the soft opening of Harlot...

So wow, I'm not really sure I qualify to even write this review because I am so obviously not part of the beautiful crowd this place is targeting.

However, I will applaud the decor - LOVE the paintings, the blcks walls and sexy tables.  The bathroom is very cool and I appreciate the little touch of the TVs by the doors.  So fun to watch swimming sperm as you wait outside!  

The staff was really great, very personable and of course, totally HOT in the corsets.  Once thing I didn't get was the guy at the front while I was on my way out asking us to exit out the back because "there's a major line and cops outside."  No way in hell was the group of 6 of us going to slug our way through the crowd to end up on another street, so we waited for only a minute or so and he let us out.  To no line, no cops.  Huh?  Lame!

Anyway, though I love the decor I can safely say you probably won't see me air kissing or rubbing elbows with the anorexic elite there any time soon.  Just not my kinda crowd.

To be continued at my posting for Etiquette......
author: kerry l.

description:
This is a bad ass place for people who are not bad ass.

Like most reviews have mentioned the inside looks awesome. Like something out of modern tim burton movie.  

The bartender with the tatoo chest is awesome, i asked for mind eraser but ended up getting a madras.  i made similar mistake bartending at the Lion Pub (name drop) .   she was cool enough to make another drink but booze is booze so why waste it? 
Beforehand i ask one of the dude bartenders for a vodka tonic he changed me 7.00 then i went to another one later on and he charged me 5...shit happens

 They have cool dance floor and area for a live band to preform.

But the people that are inside that night were just squares.  It felt like i was in a loud church where no one was alive or dead.  

I dont smoke but the most interesting part of the night was hanging out with the cool kids in the holding cell they have as smoke room.

overall people there were too afraid to sweat and smudging their makeup or wrinkle their shirt.  

a waste of a really beautiful lounge.
author: douglas b.

description: Visited Harlot last night, a friend had put his name on the guest list with a party of 8. We were told that somehow it was just his name on the list and that the rest of us would have to pay a cover charge. When we tried to show them the email with the reservation the manager, an obnoxious bald guy came out and rudely said it was a take it or leave it situation. We chose to leave it and suggest you do too!!
author: Sona V.

description:
Tons of reviews for this place so I'll keep it brief:

1) Been here four or five times; can't say I've ever had the time of my life here, but definitely a welcome addition to the SF club scene.  We need more NY like club venues to kick it

2) Like the ambiance and the intimate layout of the club.  I like how dark the club is.  Bar downstairs, fun people watching from balcony and bar upstairs, small room to smoke in for those of you smokers out there

3) Look good and you'll have no issues getting in

4) Not a lot of seating when it gets crowded.  Book a table for a get together / night out if you need a place to recline

5) Kind of hit or miss on the music and the crowd.  On the music - I am way more impressed by places with stellar DJs that can mix it up beyond the radio hits / 80s dance music.  Not the most innovative / creative music, but serves the purpose for a fun night out.  On the crowd - sort of a mixed scene.  Not as exclusive as their door policy would lead you to expect.
author: Emily C.

description:
3.5 stars...Authors Note: this review leans toward the positive because of the DJ's - A wesome ness to the extreme!  I think George Michael, Pink Floyd and Hall & Oates were mashed in there at one point which to me is pure bliss. 

Crowd is a bit on the young side but not obnoxiously so - and kept the place lively enough.  I went for HH and I can imagine how a night time experience could be better (Dancing!!)  - but at least I got a good look at the cool decor.

I think I once saw a reviewer on Yelp state that they would like Harlot only if they were 21 and Asian - I'm neither and I enjoyed it so what does that mean??...mind boggling to say the least.
author: Melissa H.

description:
One word: Pretentious. 

I checked out the website and was intrigued by the dark nature it presented. When a friend from work suggested we go there for happy hour, I was more than happy to.

After an hour of having to listen to top 40 hits, I couldn't take it anymore. I stayed in hopes of finding at least one person of a mysterious nature to come in. I hoped that the DJ would at least play something more, I don't know, industrial perhaps. 

Side note: What is it with DJ's who don't use two turntable decks? How can you call yourself a DJ with a computer, watching/waitingfor the beat to match up and then mix in the new mp3? You're ruining the art of DJ-ing! Damn technological bandwagon jumpers.

Anyways, I gave it 1 star because apart from the polo wearing sea of men, there was one bartender that kept it real. He was sincere and polite to our group and even chopped it up with us until he had to go back behind the bar. Even then, despite how nice he was, Harlot is a place I will not step into.
author: rosemary m.

description:
Nice decor and painting, but really nothing out of this world for someone who is used to New York or even L.A.  But for those of us stuck in SF, this place is a serviceable facsimile of a cool NY lounge.  The service was quick, but the drinks were small and weak.  At least if you are going to skimp on the quantity, give me some quality, right?  The crowd did seem to be a little on the older side (30s and up), with plenty of single older ladies trying to desperately to get attention (e.g. showing way too much cleavage, especially the fake kind), but seemed not too full of themselves.

If you like to dance, don't go here, the  DJ sucked on the night I was there -- the music had no flow or coherence. But if you only like to dance when you've had too much to drink and suddenly think that the Pussycat Dolls are the best group ever, you've found your home.  And the very fact that this place would play Pussycat Dolls tells you why it is worthy of only a limited amount of praise.

UPDATE FROM JULY 14 2007:  This was my third time to the place and I still cannot say what the hype is all about -- I'm cynical that way I guess.  I will say that the music was much better, although the DJ was so busy showing off his mixing "skills", that he never let a song play long enough to really enjoy it:  just when your head starts bobbin' to the beat, the song changes.

Also, my friend was drinking a drink and set it down at our table.  The overworked but overzealous busboys cleared her drink before she finished this.  I pointed this out to our waitress who said "hey, sometimes that happens." No, I'm sorry, no let me fix that for you, just attitude.  She did get a replacement drink after I protested loudly, but if you are paying ridiculous prices for a table, shouldn't you be treated -- even if it is make believe -- like your comfort matters?

The situation at the door to get in was chaotic to say the least -- even though we did have a reservation.  Why is it so hard to manage that process competently?

The women did look good -- if I could have convinced one to go home with me this place would've gotten a full 5* ;)
author: Eugene W.

description:
Drinks aren't stiff and they run about 6-8 bucks a pop. 
Crowd was very mixed the night I went there for a DJ7&Bo show (11Dec08). I found that very refreshing. I appreciate multi ethnic, age and style. Hell, I even saw a suitcoat in the crowd... but then there was also that supah cute messenger boy lookalike. Where the hell did he go?

I thought the music started to pounce nicely after midnight and people were unpretentious in their dancing. I was able to chat with the folks near to me without feeling like their laughs and smiles were a result of years of bad acting. 

The art was yummy, esp the pic of the full nude with full um, below the navel population of hair follicles. That's sort of a changeup. And its right behind the DJ booth. 

Seating is set up nicely to give you the chance to interact or not and the bathrooms were clean and well stocked. 

A smidge high end ish but hell, I was wearing nothing fancy and I didn't feel weird at all. 'Course the Rudolph Nose always makes people smile, HAH - I wish. 

Careful where you park if you go on a weekend.

p.s. DJSeven & DJ BO mix progressive house and they drop very tastily.
author: Miel H.

description: Ok I went back and it was tolerable. Upstairs (VIP) makes things better. :)
author: Hanan H.

description:
Great Decor
Friendly doorman
Friendly bartenders - Kris, she'll take care of you.

It seems like people have trouble getting into this place so show up early or get on a list, especially if you are a guy.
author: Po L.

description:
This is one of my fave clubs in SF. Getting in can be a hassle as you have to be "hand picked" to get in. So you may wait awhile if you dont "personally" know the door guy. But once your'e in, it can be worth it. The people are very attractive, the music is good, the bartenders are cool, but the dance floor is a bit small. I suggest getting bottle service, pricey but worth having your own area to sit and lounge. Ive been to EVERY club in the city including after hours. I recommend this place but be prepared to wait in line. 
If you can afford it get a VIP table!
author: JESSICA S.

description: I stand by my previous post. This place has gone down hill.
author: sarah m.

description:
Meh.  I had a good time here, but I have a good time pretty much anywhere where there's booze.  The DJ played mainstream hip hop, the bartenders served mainstream drinks.  Nothing special, but not bad.

One of the doormen was a prick.  While making us wait for no apparent reason, he kept bragging about his "fresh" new Dunks.  First, the Dunks were beat.  Second, you can buy them at Foot Locker.  If you are going to pose as a sneakerhead, at least get some decent shit.

As an aside, you would be more likely to see Wilkes Bashford in a Lauren by Ralph Lauren suit than this joint.
author: David C.

description:
This place is a total effing scene.

Elite LA club wannabe especially with the jackass bouncers who almost didn't let my friend in because they had a "dress code" and didn't find his jeans or jacket appropriate.  then they told him that he could have a special pass for the night because he had a girl with him.

Who do they think they are?  Rest assured that Steph W. let the manager know about this little situation (after seeing several poorly-dressed hoodlums) and he promptly came over and apologized for their actions.  + 1 star for that

good sized dance floor, decent hip-hop / pop music, and ok drinks (they do have Hangar One Kaffir Lime which might be my new fav).

+ 2 more stars for the entertainment gained by watching several older women getting DOWN with their bad selves
author: Vijay N.

description:
Yeah, it's cool design with lots of details... The requisite antler chandeliers.  Glass smoking booth.  Girl bartender uniforms are a little overkill.  Whatever attracts the guys and tips!  Electro smashups later on... good stuff!

They seriously need to limit the number of people in there.  It was sardine-packed.  Not fun that full no matter how 'cool' the club is.

ps Salt House is stoked to have it on its backside...
author: Melanie C.

description:
I expected this place to be good. And it is. At least the decor is. The energy is tepid and the music is so so. I went on a Friday night so it wasn't surprising to see it crowded; perhaps a weekday would have been better. The VIP area upstairs was roomy, so it made for a great escape to move around and liberate your extremities without excusing yourself.  The downside and the reason for the 2 stars is that there are way too many guys, many of the dudes don Affliction gear like they are advertising they are training to be future MMA fighters.  San Diego, my hometown, has a plethora of fighters, but don't peacocking at clubs with fighting branded apparel.

With respect to it being racist to Asians, I didn't experience it nor did my non-white friends - not to say they don't practice it at the door. I met the owner and he's not white, he's was actually a pleasant chum. I would be leery to draw any conclusions from a few accounts. Sometimes clubs in general, (especially posh ones that want to retain their exclusivity) discriminate large groups to maintain a balance.
author: James C.

description: Get rid of your rude doorman and by rude I mean the old white, bald man.
author: A D.

description:
** update  **
"in a dark alley she waits"
Its not creepy, it is actually a promise!  +2stars.

I was leaving a work event and in the alley walking up towards Salt House...  I hear a girl say, "Excuse me"
She proceeds to hit on me for five minutes.
(I was there so long to get ideas on dealing with objections to see how she would overcome them in her "sales call" (see Morgan Stanley cold call yelp review).

Then it gets better cuz her friend comes out and they tag team hit on me.  I am sooo telling all my friends to go here.

Note: its not cheating if you only stay and listen.  Errr!  wrong-O.  Cheating is when you don't run away from hotties hitting on you.
****************

I wanted an alternative to 111 Minna for corporate parties and here comes Harlot.  Upside is the space that makes small parties not seem awkward.  Downside: It's CougarTown USA.  Its been cougar, cougar cougar 2 of 3 times I've been there.  (UPDATE make it 2 of 6 times I've been there)

The Population: old and getting older.  Who has a gmail account?? No one.  Its all AOL -lol.

The Neighborhood:  Bring a nightstick (or large Chinese bodyguard named Chang, Wang or Tang -is that onomatopoeia?) cuz walking a block and a half east on Minna is rough.  There's plenty of parking which should make the bridge and tunnel crowd happy.

Notes stolen from my twitter account (in reverse chron order)...

larrychiang Avg age just dropped below 40. I'm importing / exporting about 10 hours ago from txt    

larrychiang There's a chance of horny moving in thru soma with a possibility of arthritus in this current venue about 11 hours ago from txt    

larrychiang Avg age is 40++ Rated Yay! for mature audiences about 11 hours ago from txt    

larrychiang Harlot has another opening tmrrw about 12 hours ago from txt    

larrychiang Harlot is completely empty for their "opening". I hope they make it cuz their space is cool! 

 ** end Twitter notes **
I text a lot at clubs
http://www.yelp.com/biz/vrG6yY24OQXFUpsSqMGQEQ
but need a strait to Internet from brain widget

SECRET TIP: Hungry or need a scene freshen upper??... use Salt House side door.  It connects!

KEY staffers
Nabiel the owner 
Bob Nunez (the other owner)
Ricky Dardanelle - Front door *host* aka bouncer - he carded me! thx Ricky
Irena - hostess (she's uber cool)

NOTE: This review is influenced with alcohol.  My not drunk rating is 2.5 stars.
NOTE: I am a Yelp slut

** update  **
"in a dark alley she waits"
from
http://www.harlotsf.com/  
I have the hibbie jibbies for giving you three stars
Creepy slogan
****************
author: Larry C.

description:
Update 9/21/07: Came here last night (a Thursday) for a private event upstairs and had a wonderful time.  It was a great crowd and very friendly and attentive bartenders who served up wonderful drinks.  It was fun to look down at all the people dancing and one of the best points - it was air conditioned!  So often the upper floors of places get hot and stuffy, but not here!  Thanks to everyone for a wonderful time!

Original Review: I have to give the bouncer credit for letting our large party in last weekend.  We showed up with a group of about 20 people, only about 5 of whom were on the guest list.  Granted, that's our own fault for not putting more names down, but he did let all of us in fairly quickly, and that is including all the guys we had with us (who had to pay $10 cover, but that's not too bad, right?).

Anyway, once we were in, the subdued red lighting and great music quickly put us all in a good mood.  It was fairly easy to get up to the bar, and the drinks were made quickly by the all-female bartenders outfitted in black corsets and red bras.  I have to say that I have no idea how much drinks cost, because it was one of those wonderful nights were I didn't buy myself one drink and still left the bar quite intoxicated.

I have to give the DJ and his guys a huge thank you for letting me and my friend dance on the stage next to your booth.  The dance floor (actually, the whole bar) was way too crowded, and having our own little personal space up there was perfect and a ton of fun!
author: Lindsay B.

description:
On the one block walk from Osha to Harlot, Mascarawand L. and I encountered not one, but two roadkill birds on the construction infested sidewalk path. That's when I decided, yeah, this is going to be a classy night in SF.

Arriving at the VIP entrance, we merely flashed our IDs and then left the small line of 10 waiting outside. Walking into Harlot is like entering some scene from Eyes Wide Shut, without too much of the kinky. Cow skin couches, leather miniwalls, antler chandeliers. Mixed drinks were good, neither tasting like all alcohol or juice.

The music was alright, and by that I mean every other song was good. I think the one awesomeness was seeing the glowing Apple from the Macbook at the front of the room. A friend of mine tried to ask the DJ to play some more mainstream tracks, to which he replied to her that there were other places one could go to hear mainstream music. But alas... 2 songs later when all the people on the dance floor literally stopped dancing and started talking, the DJ took his own cue to play some good music, and that's also when some really drunk woman in a tube top decided that dancing was waving a tissue up and down to the beat. lol.

Nevertheless it was fun if you have a reserved table, and I enjoyed it primarily because we left before it got way too crowded.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Harlot's kinda magical. When the combination of company and conversation is just right, you can lose yourself in the seductive glow of this place. It's swanky in an sexy, underground speak-easy kind of way, but it's definitely at its best when it's not too crowded. The drinks are nice (nothing too stellar, but they do the trick and hey--who doesn't enjoy having your drink mixed by a hot girl in a corset?!) And the vibe (and a few easy-to-sip drinks) will seduce you into the comfort of intimacy. Be forwarned that drinking here might lead you to divulging your darkest secrets to new-found friends, or sharing a suprisingly sexy but unexpected kiss.

It's a great place for an after work drink (I've bonded with many a co-worker here) or to get the party started with a group of friends (we went here as the first stop on our bachelor/bachelorette party bus) and took over the VIP seating area in a plethora of sexy drunken fun. As long as you bring your own crowd, your own makeout partner--or at least your own conversation to the mix, you're guaranteed a sinfully awesome time.
author: Laurel S.

description:
Two bouncers - Calculator and kid rock. Kid rock can be bribed, calculator is a huge loser. Calculator is the one with the selix tux and the stick up his @ss.

This place just gives me bad vibes. They pretend to be "upscale" but inside sewage water leaks on you from the roof, the workers act like hot shit (theyre really not) and the crowd is a little weird...I don't go here anymore.

Very cheesy place.
author: G S.

description:
It's a really nice space, dark (well, what bar/club isn't dark, though) and modern...I liked the fact that it wasn't too crowded and we were able to grab a spot in the front to sit down.

But the mash ups they played last nite... YUCKY... I couldn't wait to get out of there.

If it weren't for the mash ups I would've really liked the place (security/bouncers were professional, bartenders fast, crowd was fine ....) if they ever change their music please let me know!
author: Nenette Y.

description:
After much ado my friend and I decided to swing by Harlot one weeknight. We were both expectant yet ambivalent. Getting inside the lounge was a breeze since we had RSVP-ed. The lounge itself is attractive and well done -- seats are plush, music was decent without being obnoxiously loud and crowd seemed interesting and hip. 

Having said that, ordering drinks at the bar was like trying to make the Sphinx smile. The bartenders were incredibly inept, very standoffish and downright unfriendly. I realize this is a predominantly straight bar so getting people to stand in lines (to order drinks) might as well result in a constitutional amendment, but seriously if the bartenders don't even attempt to find out who is next then they need a new job.  

Oh and what's with the stepford guys that all look the same, and have gay undertones? It totally messed with my head. Oh well.
author: Matin N.

description:
Everytime that I have been to Harlot, I have had such a blast!  Is it because of the tight, sweaty dance floor?  Don't think so...  Is it because of the girls who come here looking like Vegas trash?  Not too certain...   Is it the androgenous men that I keep eye balling (until I see him freaking my fall back guy)?  Yeah, probably not.

I know!  It's because of my kick-ass, fun lovin, lady friends!!!  So then maybe this review isn't for Harlot.... my bad.  

MADE YOU LOOK!!!  (muhaahahahahaaaaawwww)
author: Sammi C.

description:
Hot, Sexy, Beautiful People and Great Drinks.

These are the words I use to describe Harlot.  Its not a huge space but a cool one.  The best views are from the open mezzanine looking over (or down if you're like that) the dancing crowd.

If you go wear your best club gear its like that.  Be sure to check out the sacrilegious iconographs on the wall -- kinda cool.

Drink Up!
author: G R.

description:
I've been to Harlot two times. On my first visit, we had no trouble getting since a friend knew the bouncer. I had a good time, they have good and reasonably priced drinks (although for every round we bought, they were different prices...), music was not bad either. Downside- the people there were mostly horribly dressed older women (cougars if you will)...think high waisted white jeans and a tacky sequinced animal print top... and slimey men. Had a good time, but only because I went with some fun friends. 

Second visit.

Went with a much larger group, split pretty evenly with guys and girls. When our complete party arrived, we went up to the front to be told by the scrubby bouncer dressed in faded black jeans and a sweatshirt that they were at capacity. While we stood around pondering our next location, we watched as the same bouncer let a large group of cougars wearing hideous outfits in. 

As a spoiled partied that doesnt pay for cover or wait in line. This place is ridiculous. One star because they have Pear Grey Goose at the bar and another star because the venue itself is nice. Other than that, its just an overrated bar full of ugly people. Save yourself and go across the street to John Collins.
author: lauren j.

description: Smoking inside is fowl. It is. Lets stop smoking; for real. Annoying cheezy dudes, drunken blondes (that includes me) and expensive drinks. But good music. And weird creepy art. Very New York, so I like that. Im a girl so I dont usually have to pay a cover, so I cannot report on that... over all do I think that this is THE spot? No, but it depends on your cup of tea... if you are in the mood to dress up, be seen and meet annoying guys and dance to all the 80's covers and shit on the radio? Then go, its a once in blue moon indulgence ;)
author: Liz C.

description: After a few interactions with the staff at Harlot a few words come to mind: Cold, pretentious, authoritarian, egotistical or perhaps bored... because they seem to have nothing better to do than scour the crowd and hassle people for mundane and insignificant things. These people take themselves WAY too seriously instead of creating a community oriented, welcoming and fun place - isn't this why we come to nightclubs and bars in the first place? Sure, it's trendy club with some sexy paintings of naked women and a decent sound system (which they crank to decibals that could certainly damage your hearing), but there's 20 other clubs in this city with similar ambience and MUCH nicer employees. I will never set foot in this club again.
author: Mindy A.

description:
Harlot...cool spot. Everyone's attractive. Party Party. 

Had fun mostly because of the company that I kept that night, but don't think that I'll be going back. 

Some places are "one hit wonders" for me, and she's one of them.
author: First C.

description:
Very sexy!! 
Tucked away on Mina, with a huge parking lot right in front, I would say this place is the new hot spot. Visiting on a Thursday night, I didn't experience a very packed atmosphere. There was a perfect amount of people inside allowing room for dancing, mingling, drinking... whatever else.  
The best part is the decor. The first floor has dark walls with really provocative art on the walls and tables. I only noticed the sexy women on the tables when I ventured off to the second floor ( perfect scoping spot). 
OH! The funniest is how you can look into the ladies bathroom from a window that goes to the dance floor... oh wait, that's not really funny. That's kinda creepy.
author: Rada I.

description:
Harlot: "prostitute; a person who engages in sexual intercourse for money."

And worth every penny.  Located down an alley with no distinguishable signage, the place is not easy to find but that adds to the appeal.  Walking through the darkened doorways, I felt like I was being led into a secret club.  What's the password?  Lust.

The lush decor, the tables surrounded by beautiful women and well dressed men, the DJ holding court on a raised dais in front of the dance floor beneath a huge painting of a naked woman...what the hell is not to love about this place?  

The VIP area upstairs looks down onto the dance floor.  With a separate bar, its own restroom and comfortable plush white couches, it is my favorite part of this club.  Harlot could be transplanted to Manhattan and fit right in.  This is what a big city bar/club should feel like.  Swanky and pretentious.  I love it!
author: Erin H.

description:
My first official night clubbing in the city!

We came here last night for my friend's 22nd birthday. There was a stupid guest list, but since we had a group of 6 girls and 1 guy, we managed to all get in by the birthday girl playing the "but it's my birthday!" card, and the "but it's my birthday, and it's only my brother!" card. =) Good thing we got her a little tipsy before we left the house. She even had the sad little puppy eyes and tilted head thing going. It was awesome.

it's a pretty small place with a second floor. We got there around 11 and it was pretty bustling. Our bartender broke a glass on the counter and my friend cut her finger, but oh well I guess (she could've given us a free drink though). 

We basically danced and drank the night away. By 1am the dancefloor was pretty packed. We all had a blast, the music was good (but my hiphop-loving friends said the mix was okay), BUT the crowd was not pretty. Most of the guys were dorky looking losers or looked like non-good-looking Marina douchebags. But I guess once you've reached a level of drunkenness, everybody looks fine...all my girl friends danced with (and one made out with) some pretty fugly looking guy(s). Lucky night for them I guess.

Oh well! Fun place for clubbing if you like smaller intimate dancefloors. Don't go with guys. EVER.
author: Angela H.

description:
I'm re-posting my review since my initial review was right after the unfortunate encounter with the managers at the door.  It probably wasn't appropriate or helpful.

Decent setting if you can get in without having to deal with the obnoxious and undoubtingly rude doormen.  Too pretentious with no substance.  If you come with a big group, chances are not all of you are going to get in. Don't leave your night up to chance. There are plenty of other really good spots that deliver and Provide better patron service.
author: Jaymer D.

description:
This place is a classic place that is full of hype, and where they make a point to be as rude as possible to give the correct "vibe." 

My friends came to meet a group for a mutual friend's birthday party, but were told the guest list was "closed." The bouncer was maybe the biggest jerk I have ever met in my life, and was insistent that there was absolutely nothing we could do to get in. 

My friends who were in already said it was overcrowded, overpriced, and had a huge girl to guy ratio, which is probably why they didn't let me and my three male friends in. 

All in all I would say it isn't even worth the cab ride there. Worst. Club. Ever.
author: Crystal M.

description:
I always say I hate this place, but since my girl friends call Harlot their home, I am a frequent visitor. The guys are old and greasy, and the girls dress, hm...how shall i put it nicely - "trampy". But if you're just looking to get wasted and dance to house music in a "i am so nyc" scene, this is worth checking out. 

There's no cover, but to get in, you should either show up at 10pm or keep the ratio 4:1. The bouncers are nice to girls, and stern, but polite to boys. 

Tip: Go on a dead night (week night), become friends w/ the owner and get a harlot sticker for your ID. Oh and it doesn't hurt to be a hot girl. 
Harlot sticker = permanent VIP
you social butterfly you.
author: Rene Y.

description:
Who likes this place?

Thats right, I like this place. 

I think its especially great when its not packed to the gills. 

Its dark so I cant tell if everyone is actually really good looking or if its just the poor lighting. Whatever, I like getting drunk here, swaying around to all the good djs they have playing and then falling down alll over someone on the couch afterwards. 

As borat would say "its niceeee"
author: Tom V.

description:
Terrible place, if you're a guy. The stupid cockroach gatekeepers will sometimes not let you in because you're a guy and let the women in. The girl behind me was like:

You guys are mean, why won't you let them in?

Bouncer: Why do you care? you're getting in.
Girl: Well those guys are with us.
Bouncer: Ok, they can come in.
Me: Go fuck yourself.

And the girls came with us to a better place.
author: Neil H.

description:
The drunken fool leg of my SF trip brought me to Harlot.

Although I have been to Harlot quite often, this visit warranted a review. After spending a day at the racetrack and an evening at the theater, I needed to get my drink on. 

I got there after my friends had already arrived, since they ditched out on the play we were watching early. We had table service (douchebag bankers) right in front of the dance floor. 

Harlot, true to its name, has pictures of nice old-timey hookers on the wall and the its present clientele could be mistaken for a Harlot at times. 
The decor is actually really nice and dark and the bar is pretty large.

The dj plays a good mix and the dance floor is always packed. When I got there the party was already in full swing and I had to catch up on drinking. After about 4 shots of straight vodka and 3 really really stiff vodka cranberries I was good to go. 

The douchey bankers were all sitting down talking business (I hate that), so I decided to grab a few girls and hit the floor - and this is where the night went pretty blank on me.

All I remember is shaking some serious ass and the highlight of the night was when a black guy came up to me as I was dancing with 3 girls and said "damn white boy, you got some moves." End of night for me. 

If anyone saw a dorky like white kid there that night, please fill in the rest of the details of the night for me. Thanks.

P.S. - Harlot is also a good place for a few after work drinks with coworkers and if you stay long enough if become a great place to party for the night.

P.P.S. - the upstairs VIP area is really cool too (first time I was up there was with the always sexy Janney B.)
author: Arin N.

description:
Great music, super dj/music, and fun crowd. 

A good mixture of men and women. 

I've been here twice, and although I've been very intoxicated on both occassions, from what I remember, it was tons of fun!

And..it's FREE. How great is that?!

Two drink minimum for credit card purchase.

Beware of overpriced towncars when you exit.
author: Misha F.

description:
I am a gay man, yet I love this fabulous straight bar. The decor is really wonderful. I love the black wallpaper, black antler chandelier, and photo tables (courtesy of Merkley??? who I adore), and the animal print chairs. Sounds crazy and funky, and yes it is. 

LOVE IT! The crowd may be older, but what bar downtown doesn't have that. 

Beer on tap was $3 when I went at 8...that's great.
author: Kris B.

description: Sex, sex and more sex! No, I didn't have sex in the bathroom or in a dark corner. Way too cliche (though I won't judge you if you have). This place has got lots of dark reds and overall it just seems like the type of place where Bond puts on a dark suit and leaves with two lovely ladies. The drinks were expensive but it was worthwhile. The dance area is very small. It seems like more of a place to hang out and chat rather than actually dance. I actually liked that it's in the middle of a random alley, but still close to civilization. I don't know if there's usually cover, but I got in for free the night I was there which is always a plus in my book.
author: Carlos A.

description:
I have somewhat of a love hate with Harlot.

Love: 
good danceable music with a good danceable floor
cool gothic and moody decor from the tabletops to the paintings on the walls
neat off the beaten path location
has that extra something to make you feel like you're havin a night out on the town (that something that's hard to find in sf, and that i miss from la)


Hate: 
never know when it'll be an off night, which sucks because when it's off... it's OFF
fair share of sleezy dudes trying too hard and trying to get in
fair share of sleezy women trying too hard (but not trying to get in bc it's easier for us girls at such venues)

All in all, if you're looking to have a fun night out with the girls and are in the mood to dance and deal with a little bit of the nightclub attitude, then for sure come here. It's a fun excuse to dress up a little, people watch and dance into the evening... well, at least 'til 1:30am, which is about the time they start shutting down.
author: Nina H.

description:
Niiice! This place is the jam :D I just hit up Harlot this friday and I was not dissapointed. Happy Hours are great in general, but the venue itself is nice and loungey, relaxed, cute dramatic decor and the best part--$3 beers! Like a Guiness or a pilsner, cool! 

The bartenders seem okay and my drinks were served quickly (well the first one not so much). Fridays seem to be pretty popular so grabbing a seat might be a problem, but the overall environment is chatty and bubbly so standing up and getting into a conversation isn't a problem. It seems that as a late night place, Harlot maybe falls flat, but for a Friday Happy Hour, I was pretty pleased.
author: katie k.

description:
Hey!

This place is nice! It's totally creepy style like the haunted house at Disney land- and it's totally kinda pervy (in a good way) because it has all this pictures of slutty girls- on the tables. Every wall is decorated in this dark and interesting ways. The staircase up to the second level has Edward Gorey type drawings of trees on the wall. The chick bartender was awesome, but the douchy bartender in the glasses was an a-hole. oh yea.... good music- but maybe because i was there on a guest DJ night.
author: Nnekay F.

description:
This bar is gorgeous--the kind of bar that I make sure to show up in heels for. Some nights the music seems off but check the calendar, show up on a good night, and you're in for a really fun time.

It's sometimes hard to get a drink at the bar downstairs so just go to the upstairs bar.

Happy hours, W-F 5-9pm, $3 draft $5 wells. Rock. On.
author: Cindy P.

description:
Wow, the new nightlife continues in semi-SOMA.   This whole Minna alley area should be dedicated to nightlife as it seems to beckon the late night visitors.    
Getting through the door was not an issue, the guy is doing his job.   The space gives off a lower east side feel at first, but the hidden gems are slowly revealed as you drift through.   Custom tabletops, exposed beams, dark but not creepy artwork.    Upstairs is so pure and white.   
DJ was pretty weak to start with, but got better as the night progressed.  
The night got even crazier after a few of the Warriors showed up to party.  
Not sure on the official open date, but it looks like Harlot is here to stay.
author: Dan G.

description:
Harlot, don't believe the bad stuff people are saying behind your back (hell, even to your face).  You're one sexy hunting lodge/bar and you know it. 

Yeah, people have said you're hard to get into, but I sauntered right in, no line, no cover (for the ladies). And your staff? They're lovely and mix some pretty great drinks. It's natural for people to complain about your VIP mezzanine out of  jealousy, but I loved your sultry white leather couches and tables with pictures of be-animal'd ladies on them. 

While your music turned a bit trashy near the end of the night and your art wasn't all that inspired, you drew a crowd ranging from their 20s to 50s and kept them pretty darn happy until closing. Good on you.
author: Carla C.

description:
This place is hidden in the alley and it's a bit smaller than other clubs, but bigger than other bars with sufficient dance floor space. The decor is nice and there are pictures of girls everywhere! 

For happy hour, they have a DJ and the bartenders are cool. I think their well drinks were $5. Good place for groups.

On weekends, it turns into a club. I went on a Saturday and it was pretty popping and NO cover! The bouncer was trying to get us to get a table since we were a big group, but we didn't want to pay the $500 minimum. The music was good and although I got a few drinks spilled on me, I had a great time. Oh and they have an outdoor smoking area for all you smokers.
author: Linda C.

description:
The staff is wonderful.  The owners are warm and involved.  VIP host is attentive and the event manager is accommodating.

This is a smaller venue with great design elements of dark textures.  It's dark and sexy, but don't leave without checking out the mezzanine - striking white walls and furniture.  It's a very modern, uniquely designed space.

The crowd ranges from the "after work" to "house heads" mixed in with a few wannabe socialites.  

The music is always good.  You can count on Thursday nights having the same vibe and same quality music.  The night is never without the girl who has had way too much to drink and her not-ready-to-leave friends are busy propping her in someone's booth or against a wall.  The all too familiar feeling of "if she bumps into me one more time" comes over me at least once a visit.
author: Marsizzle M.

description:
I took me a while to get into Harlot. Kinda felt like it was always too crowded and full of boring looking people. And one door guy with glasses (although I never see him anymore) is really a dicktard.

But it all really changed for me the night me and a group of gfs were there, tanked, dancing on *'stage,' and being given rounds of champagne by one of the owners, which we all (save one friend who still boasts about it to this day) couldn't stop dropping on the ground. Like 10 half full glasses of champagne being smashed on the ground. While we're dancing to fucking Bob Sinclaire (who I love love). And not getting kicked out, let alone off 'stage.' Now how can I have a beef with a memory maker like that. 

Anyway, been here dozens of times, people are still boring looking, but   you can definitely have a fun time. They do play top 40 jams, but they always seem to throw in some old skool, beats, and stuff you hear on energy. 

Plus, Harlot is great after work (I like how I say this like I work- so really, it's great for me to meet friends after they get off work). Much much more chill, pretty cheap drinks, and you can lounge around and admire the funky decor.

*The 'stage' is literally 1 step higher than the rest of the place. Don't worry, I don't think I'm that special.
author: JJ W.

description:
DON'T GO HERE!!!! When I was first reading other yelper's comments, I couldn't figure out what people meant by saying that they were trying to be so LA. Now I know... I've never experienced a venue this pretentious in SF. 

I came here with my friends because my cousin was having a bday party and I was with a group of 5 girls and 1 guy and the bouncer was basically like we'll let all the girls in but not the guy. what? Seriously? My cousin and her friends even had bottle service and they were willing to treat their guest that poorly. It was ridiculous. I could understand if the venue was super crowded or if the bouncer (a tall white guy with glasses who was a complete A--hole) made us wait in line for a while but to completely deny entry based on gender? My cousin was completely stressed out because all her friends are calling her and saying they're getting denied entry etc. Is that any way for a venue to treat their customers? My friend heard people coming out and complaining that there wasn't anyone inside anyways.

If you do have the unfortunate luck of having to come to Harlot for some reason, come from second street because the other way is down a bum infested alley. I will never go back here again.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Plus points: Fun music, pretty quick to get in with table service. Extremely nice staff at the tables. Kudos on that for sure. Attractive crowd.

Minus: Does get very crowded, makes dancing downright unpleasant. Never been stepped on so many times in my life.
author: Vidya S.

description:
We had a wonderful birthday dinner on the other side of the building and decided to have some post dinner drinks at Harlot. Approaching the velvet- roped entrance preventing anyone from just walking in, we asked on which way can we go in. We were responded by Matt the security guard with, "That depends whether I let you in" So we asked, "Do you want us to come in?" He came back with the same response. Of course he was insistent of being the gate keeper and being the decider of who gets in. Mind you we were 4 nicely dressed gay men, think Prada and Hermes, and not some trash from the street and it was really early in the evening. After some back and forth with Mr. Gatekeeper, we decided not to not pursue it and take our money elsewhere. I would never come back strictly for the total lack of customer service that greets you at the door. 

Update 7/22
After posting this initially, we were invited back by management. Apparently Matt no longer works there. On our return, the door man was really friendly. Inside, the design was really thought out particuarly the lighting. The paintings appear to glow as much as the amber pendants with really long fillaments. The color-cycling LCD behind the DJ booth sort of didn't fit in as it was going through too many colors. 

There weren't that many people as we just came from dinner and it was really early in the evening so I can't really comment about the crowd.
author: Clodel G.

description:
This place is a pretty sweet venue... like Paris Hilton in  a jail house thong-it's rich but dirty!

Some of the girls are weak sauce because if you get table service they try to social slut themselves into getting a free drink. Tell the cheap broads to beat it and buy there own damn drink.

Overall, the mood is mellow, the sounds smooth, and the harlots horny!
author: Ray B.

description:
sexy sexy sexy bar meets dark victorian boudoire 
I would want to move in, but with all the peeps, where would I hang up my boots?
This is a place that I could spend all night in lounging and hanging out.  The bouncers would have to peel me off the zebra print victorian faux louis seize styled chairs.
The owners of this little downtown gem deserve three snaps and a friendly spank for creating a stunning yet comfortable place...seems to have good party feng shui too...
author: Yvonne Y.

description: This place is alright. It's a decent size and has an upstairs  for people with bottle service and another bar.  The music wasn't bad but it can get pretty packed so it can get hard to walk around. Apparently the night I was there my friend recognized an NBA player named something or other, I don't follow sports so I didn't really care.
author: Raquel T.

description: WOW! seriously people, im reading your reviews and your complaining that the drinks were strong but not mixed well enough?!?!? ur at a nightclub...be happy u got a drink that isnt watered down and wasnt the price of what 2 drinks cost.  The music was loud and it wouldnt be a talking night....go to a lounge if you want to talk and have a well mixed drink. I had a blast! the music was great, the atmosphere was was awesome, and people were dancing and having a great time.  I live in Los Angeles and the clubs here suck in comarison to the ones in LA and the ones that are even ok here in SF have something that totally ruins it...like no air so you feel like your in a suana, I didnt have a problem getting in and i was with more guys then girls.  I had a blast and would def go back
author: Alexis R.

description:
Omg. I just wrote the most awesome review but... I hate you Verizon wireless, your EVDO connection sucks ass. 

... anyway...

Walking into Harlot is what I would imagine hanging out in Marilyn Manson's living room would be like. Lots od darkness, lots of white and red furniture, lots of metal, lots of mirrors, lots of rich and heavy cloth... I will say something though - the bartenders were memorable and very friendly. I would go back for them, but there are so many other great bars a stone's throw away (John Collins, 111 Minna, Dada) that don't attract (as it was so eloquently stated by an earlier yelper) the girls that look like  vegas trash. I swear, every time I'm heading down to one of those other lovely bars, I see a group of those grotesquely too short mini skirt clans stumbling down the alley on their way to Harlot for a night of Top 40's heaven. Why? Why? It's cold in San Francisco, you should know??!?!
author: Annie T.

description:
Harlot just ruined my BD party!

Saturday night, we have a table service which they allowed 10 people per table. Turned out the party is bigger than that and unfortunately our groups are about half guys and half girls. They wouldn't let any guy in even at 9:15!!!

We tried to talk to them to open another table so that everyone can get in. They wouldn't let us do that even though that night they have many empty tables and the reason was they don't allow 2 tables of same party. How lame...
author: P. L.

description: I like this club a lot, and go there about once a month. It's upscale, comfortable, and has a nice crowd. It doesn't take too long to get a drink at the bar either.
author: Graham G.

description:
A few of us went to meet up with some other girlfriends of ours on opening night.  When we got there we saw this long line, and were saddened, because we hate waiting, ESPECIALLY when it was so cold out!  

Tried out luck at the front, the bouncer was really nice and while he was working the main line he asked another of the bouncers to take care of us.  He turned to us, and wa la...we were granted entry.   Boy was I glad we decided to bypass that crazy line and try our luck!

Once inside, we all agreed that the place was swanky...but it was packed!  I don't know where there's a dance floor though.  The place isn't that big.  VIP upstairs on the mezzanine, and then there is the downstairs, with standing room only and a few tables (which have to be reserved).

I do have to say that none of us really were all that enthused about the music.  Trans, house, electronica...one of those, I get them all confused.  Why is that music so big in S.F.  Can someone tell me why??

Anyway, it was a good time, but not good enough to get us to stay.  We headed off after a little over an hour.  Had the music been different we would have definitely lingered around a bit longer.

P.S.  Interesting art.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
For a place that is located in one of the hardest place to find, Harlot has built up a nice clientele in SOMA/Financial District.  There is a little indoor/outdoor smoking area, polite doorman and a mezzannine for semi-private parties.  The place is nicely decorated and there is ample seating for a lounge.

While it definitely takes some business away from 111 Minna, the music still cannot compare.
author: Laurence H.

description:
SF needs more good clubs like Harlot.  This felt way more like Vegas or LA, than your typical SF night spot.  I loved the decor and artwork, the crowd had very little cheese/cougar/b&t element, and the DJ played great music that had our group of 12 girls dancing for 3 hours straight.  The sweet bouncer in the back took really good care of my friend who had one-too-many until we were ready to go.  Tables are expensive on the weekends, but probably worth it not to wait in line.  Go an enjoy it while it's still the hotest spot in town.  

p.s. thanks JS for the hookup
author: Julie C.

description:
Decor - v. cool
DJ - great, but then I love the 80s
Drinks - excellent
Bartenders - really nice...they gave my friend a free drink when she spilled it all over the place
Smoking patio - nice touch
Clientele - mixture of cougars, cute boys, hipsters and dorks
author: Mi M.

description:
OK, it's official, Ms. Harlot. You are very bratty about accommodating larger groups, mixed gender groups, and big birthday parties. Even with bottle service! Sometimes people run a little late, change their minds- you, missy, should know this. A lady has the right to change her mind!

But oh no, not at Harlot. They get real snarky. My own personal group of harlots? They kinda don't like dealing with this place anymore. Too much of a pain in our cute little harlot asses.

In conclusion: Only good for a night out with a small group of your fellow harlots! Oh, and ladies, try to get their before 11!
author: Katie H.

description:
My company recently secured funding and to celebrate we booked VIP bottle service at Harlot last weekend...  and literally had the worst experience I have ever had out.  When we arrived at the specified time, they made us wait almost a half hour outside (we were on the guest list and had paid for seating). We had another team member arrive (while the club was still empty) and they wouldn't admit him, stating that our "ratios were bad" (they had our guest list beforehand and know our "male to female ratios").  

This all happened about 10 minutes after being admitted.  We requested to go our separate ways - The Harlot "Manager" agreed but then wouldn't return my credit card and my ID.  The story goes on and on - the net is that this place is a joke - it is located under the freeway where the homeless pitch their tents, and it is run by a bunch of amateurs, who are rude, douchey and inexperienced.  

Luckily we escaped, found our missing team-member and recovered the rest of the night at 111 Minna.
author: Joe R.

description:
"If you build it, they will come."

In this case, "it" being a fabulous looking, Philippe Starck-ish club and "they" being an unfabulous mix of LA wanna-bes, B & T folk, and some college-aged kids in Birkenstocks?

No, no and no!
author: BroSauce J.

description:
My organization held an event at Harlot in January, and we were very satisfied with the results. Harlot had a venue rental fee as well as a minimum bar tab, which were both pretty reasonable for the area and the time of year we held the party (other places we investigated had much higher rental fees). Although a ton more people ended up coming to the party than we anticipated and the tab ran out almost instantaneously, the staff there was extremely courteous and completely held up to the huge, unexpected crowd. Irina, the party planner lady at Harlot, was the best. She managed everything gracefully and made sure the whole thing went over well.

Harlot only holds around 275 people, which is fine in normal situations, but some 500-people tried to come to our party (in part due to my own issues with planning). So if you're going to have a huge party like we ended up doing, you might want to look into a bigger venue. Otherwise, I would highly recommend Harlot to anyone else looking to hold an event in San Francisco. I was extremely impressed with the service and pricing, and the venue was really cool. For a party under 275 or so people, I'll definitely go there again.
author: Jacqui C.

description:
I went into Harlot during an off hour... probably around 7PM while killing time after work.  I'm not from the area, but typically I hear it can be a struggle to get in during a bumpin' night.

I was able to get a good look at the interior since it wasn't cram-packed with people (as I imagine it to be during the late night hours).  I really liked the interior, a lot.  It was dark, slightly gaudy, and had a sort of French/bourgie feel to it.  It was very small and intimate but I kinda felt like the shit walking around there!  The aura of the decor really enhances that classy side outta you, but the intimate and trendy nature keeps your mood funky.  I definitely want to check it out when it's a busy night.  Friendly bartenders who gave us all sorts of bar snacks = a plus!
author: Evelyn B.

description: NIce quick staff, no cover,  avg priced drinks. The only thing I dont like about this place is that the crowd is on the older end. I would say 30s-40s yo. Unless you're into cougars, I dont think the playing field are ideal conditions. The drinks were strong though so you dont get jipped there.
