I would recommend this place to the older crowd or when I get a lot older lol. Its located in the middle of a narrow street so it kinda looks shady intially until you go to the entrance.
author: Robert Y.

description:
I've been here on a Wed. and Friday nights.  I had fun both times, but I have to admit that when it starts to get busy, the bouncers do get an attitude.  When there's no one there, they are very nice.  

The club is small and it can take awhile to get a drink.  Intimate/ crowded setting w/ good music (house) and decent crowd, although I think they can get pretentious at times depending on the night.  I fear that a Sat. could be like a DJ Donovon party at Ana Mandara, type crowd.  

I wouldn't stake my entire Friday or Sat. night there (or smack down a $15+ cover charge) as you don't know what your going to get.  I recommend a week day to get an after-work, Financial Distract crowd.
author: Valerie D.

description:
Here's the deal. I dig Harlot. Most people would be surprised because they think I'm an artsy, green, vintage type but like everything and everyone including Harlot...DON'T BOX US IN!

Harlot is your typical night club with summer dress wearing honeys, bachelorette parties galore and lots of what I would call "Tv honies". They look and dress like people you'd see on TV, the real world or TMZ. This isn't a bad thing because I've learned even though that's not my style people in Harlot are pretty fun if you're looking to have some. 

If you came to pick up,  then expect to get spotted from 20 miles away, and shot down from high altitudes. But  if you came to have fun this is a great starter place to go. For me it's a starter because the DJ does his job really well. 

****** note to all people who think the dj is only their to make you dance**
If the DJ only makes you dance you wont want to leave the floor and won't buy as many drinks. The dj's at Harlot change it up all night and you can tell that atleast part of the reason is to drive you to the bar. Good job guys...unless you're looking to dance all night :-)
*****end note*****

With that said, go to Harlots to get dancing started, get a lather going and then transfer to the next stop.
author: Rai-mon N.

description:
This club, gets one star for the decor. This place has awesome art work hanging on the walls. That my friends is the only thing worth coming to this establishment for. 

 The staff at this club specifically the head bartender and the head doorman need to be fired immediately. These are a perfect example of why some people should not be put in positions of power. I hope this review finds someone in the higher ups at Harlot who cares about their establishment. (This is coming from a bar manager by the way guys I ran three bars successfully for years and never would've let this attitude and outrageous behavior stand) 
I (and my crew of models hairstylists and make up artists) were subject to screaming and threats of being thrown out, DRAGGED OUT and otherwise forced to leave this club, by the head doorman. While I was in the process of putting on a show at their establishment.  Apparently the doorman cant do his job without threatening violence on patrons of the club. Well I should add... he wasn't doing his job very well. We were upstairs using the VIP area for a model prep and we continually had strange men and drunk women sauntering up the stairs to gawk at models and take pictures of people getting changed. I was politely asking people for hours to please head downstairs to drink and hang out while the doorman whose job it was to mediate the stairs was nowhere to be found. Around about oh lets say three hours later he comes storming upstairs and begins screaming in peoples faces (the staff) to get downstairs or get dragged there. NICE. That's a great way to treat the people bringing PATRONS TO YOUR BAR. 
As if that wasn't enough when asked to calm down and if it was absolutely necessary to yell at people I was told that I could get kicked out too, then this charming staff member went and got his droog the head bar dude to come and "explain" his rudeness to us and try and convince us  that it was our fault he was screaming and out of control. (This man was also screaming and the last time I was at this bar he was possibly the rudest bar staff Ive ever come across.) Including ignoring me and other customers to hang out with his crew of friends at the end of the bar and shoot us dirty looks.
At this point I was ready to pack up my show and  take it elsewhere because the last thing patrons or anyone wants is to be treated like crap for coming to your bar. 
Drinks here are extremely overpriced,served by people who act like its an inconvenience to take a drink order.  Never at anytime did anyone come upstairs to ask us if we needed anything, or wanted any drinks. Which is traditional for the club hosting your event to do.
The musical talents booked here are lacking to say the least, and whomever is the booking agent needs to get out more and check out the SF music scene post 1998. Disco house and 4 on the  floor is great, but do we have to listen to the same type of music all night long. I swear it always sounds like the same record is on repeat at this place every time I've been there. HORRIBLE
I cant stand the people who come to this place, they are  to say the least a large mob of unintelligent drab office drones. Intent on making asses of themselves and dancing around badly to lackluster musical styling's. Combine with pretentious VIP bottle service people who think they own the place because they bought a bottle of Grey Goose and are sitting upstairs next to the non working fake fireplace. 
 I will NEVER attend any event at this bar again, and I will make sure to mention to anyone in ear shot exactly why when asked. 
HORRIBLE SERVICE, HORRIBLE STAFF, HORRIBLE MUSIC, attracting crowds of HORRIBLE people... Sweet you can keep it. I'm glad your are down a dirty  trash and feces ridden alley next to the greyhound station Harlot, it matches your whole scene perfectly.  STAY THERE where I never have to see you again. 

FYI: I was sober at this event. Two glasses of champagne do not constitute drunk and disorderly. 

P.S. The last time I was here, the door people were in the process of kicking out the girl who was hosting the party. It was her birthday party which she mistakenly decided to have at Harlot. Yeah you heard me kicked out a girl on her birthday from her own birthday party.
author: Charlie B.

description: Had fun, but $20 seems like an expensive cover especially when the club doesn't get crowded until midnight and then closes at 2am on a Friday. DJs definitely had a crescendo but then after the peak couldn't get the crowd back when they went into deep EDM tracks that no one knew.
author: Rushi S.

description:
What is a Harlot? Well, in case you didn't know, it is: "Middle English, rogue, buffoon, female prostitute, from Anglo-French herlot beggar, vagabond."
This is a whore of a club like any other place.  All clubs in SF want you to pay more than you did for your dinner in the form of two $9 drinks.

However, this club differentiates itself by letting patrons in when they go to the door as opposed to making people wait in line for 30 minutes instead of wasting their money on drinks.  They also have a quick bar staff that get you your poison when you belly up to the bar.  

Maybe this place is not a top of the line swanky place, but it looks like any other and treats you like a person as opposed to shuffling you around like other places.  Dress code was all good, bouncers were cool on letting you walk in and out, etc.

I'd advise to get here early on the guestlist, since it got packed really fast.
author: Joey S.

description:
Went to Harlot on Saturday night.  It's pretty small though.  We went to Osha's around the corner.  The food was pretty good.  My friend recommended we go to Harlot for a night cap and some dancing.  No cover, then again, we went there pretty early (about 9:30 p.m.).  The bouncers looked so serious but they were really nice to us.  No attitude to go with the suits:)  The bartender and coat check lady were really nice.  One of the DJs was really good, at least he was hitting all the right notes with me:)  Loved the music selection, he was the one wearing the Obama green t-shirt.  I wish I asked for his name, if anyone knows him, please let me know.  He certainly made me give H the extra star.

All in all, I'm a fan.  Would recommend Harlot.  The downsides are the size, it's pretty small, Harlot gets pretty crowded after 10:30 p.m. and kind of hard to navigate and dance with so many people crowded together.
author: Ros S.

description:
Swung by for the Green Gorilla Lounge party last week, and Martel and crew sure know how to set up a decadent venue.  I saw a few friends hidden inside of the tables, haha, and the bartender remembered my drink every time.

Good sound and some space to shake it.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Pedro B.

description:
I am stuck up as hell, and I refuse to wait in lines when I go out... I pretend to more important that I am... I actually ask people if they know who I'm not... I'm not anyone important... but they should know that I should be treated like I am some one... what?

Anyway, each time I have gone at night there have been redonkulously long lines to get in... I finally made it in for an industry party happy hour, and... yeah it's pretty, but thank wallpaper vendors for having an open tab at the bar. A 14yr old Oban was 18 bucks... really? Seriously? Your daft! I will pay 12 bucks of that anywhere else... The "vip" area is gosh darn pretty though... I will go back when I know them for real real and I don't have to bother with silly things such as lines... Lines! ha!
author: danny e.

description:
Harlot is located in a dark alley next to a construction plot . it was really interesting. It is a small place and definitely more a place to lounge because it isn't a club nor just a bar. Dance floor is SMALL but what do you expect? There were couches to sit when we got tired and the drinks were ok as well. 

The crowd can range to maybe late 20's and up. My friend and I would like to call it more of a creepy vibe, but she and I def can make the most of the worst situations. This is a place I would come back to simply because John collins is across the way and we can alternate so we won't get so bored at one.
author: T. T.

description:
Naked chicks on the tables. Great people watching, especially the bridge and tunnel crowd around midnight, and most especially on the sponsored drink party nights. 

I've done a private holiday party, and two major corporate events, as well as attending the Stoli Blackberry kickoff t this venue. I have not gone to the venue just to 'hang out' (though lots of the girls are hanging out of their outfits around 1am).

I think the door guys are nice to me because of my rack - and not so great if you aren't a hipster or upwardly-mobile-gangsta guy.  

If you want to look down your nose at someone while someone else is looking down their nose at you, and none of you are all that great - this may be your space.
author: Char Z.

description:
I went here with just the girls.  Had fun, but seemed exclusive.  The bouncers freaked when we had two guys meet us there, but let them in.  The crowd seemed late twenties and up, so a bit older for my friends and me.  I don't remember if there are seats of any sort, if there are I definitely didn't get a seat.  The bartenders were nice and could make some good drinks.

I went here on a Saturday night (yesterday) and it sucked.  We had five girls all dressed really hot and three guys dressed reasonably.  The bouncers kept asking if us girls wanted to go in and we kept answering that all of us wanted in.  They almost let us in but then they decided against it.  They said girls can go in, but guys had to be on a guest-list.  The group ahead of us had a good ratio too and got turned away.  they shouted that they were going to "yelp" it and the bouncers made fun of them.

Basically, it's nice inside, but getting in is harder than other places.  I thought that was good before, but seriously it's not fun getting turned away because you're with your friends.  I'll think twice before coming back.
author: Monica G.

description: I got to the door and turned around and walked back to the car.  House music, black-out drunks, 20 homeless people set up sleeping outside, pretentious crowd...this all equals not for me.  If you're 19 and just the idea of going to a club excites you then sneak in here, but I'm sure you could still probably do better.
author: Stacy H.

description:
I went in on a Friday night and they were playing great music.  We stayed up at the "private" Mezz level the whole time, so I didn't get down to the dance floor.  But the service was good up there.  The decor was really hip and well-done.  The patio smoking area seemed like a cage at a zoo - whatever, them folk shouldn't be smoking anyhow.

If I were 10 years younger, I probably would've given this place a full five stars.  As it is, I am now a mom in my mid-30's, so I'm pretty sure I'm not the target clientele.  Why I even bother Yelping about it, I don't know...
author: Vicki L.

description:
Supposedly, this is one of the hottest spots in Frisco? We're from LA so we took a local's advice and came to Harlot. 

Pros:
+ Coat check-in
+ No cover (from what I remember)
+ OK music
+ bar isn't too crowded

Cons:
- The venue is SMALL. Barely any tables for bottles or just to lounge around.
- When music wasn't okay, they started bumping YMCA on the dance flo. Honestly, besides making the YMCA body motions, how the hell do you groove to that?
- People were.... "different"

The only thing I was really excited about with this club was the coat check. But seems like most SF clubs offer it so if you can, try to hit up another club.
author: Debbie M.

description:
This place has been impossible to get in to... I was going to write off this place when last Friday I just walked in without having to pay cover and zero makeup or high tail gear. It was infuriating! After trying to get in here twice and frustrated with the bouncers rejecting my male friends or the hounds of people creating a fire hazard at the door, I was happily surprised but also pissed as hell to know I could waltz in in my tattered Chuckies and a t-shirt and jeans when just a few months ago I was getting the pay $20 at the door treatment all the while dressed to the nines and freezing my ass off.
I'm conflicted... this place was so snooty but the place was actually quite nice since I finally got my random entry. I average out the experience to three stars though it's more of a generous 2.5.
author: Jessica L.

description: I tagged along with one of my roommates at the time to support his dj friend spinning that night. My first impression was: Small, club-ish, trying to be swank. Went to the bar to grab a beer. 1 bottle of Budweiser. Six dollars. Are you kidding me?! I only stayed for the support and because I was already there, but never again will I be back.
author: Kim L.

description:
Although the scene inside is great, I have a strong distaste for the bouncers at the door.  I'm not sure which Bouncer Training school they graduated from, but they could use a healthy dose of Mr. Manner's training.

We get it that it's crowded and everyone wants to get in... but that's no excuse for treating guests with such disrespect.  Other clubs-- slide, ambassador, temple, just to name a few-- are just as busy but still seem to manage the outside crowd with class.  

Perhaps they get off from the superficial power-trip induced by their clip-board and blue tooth set?  Maybe they should consider who's paying for them to be there.
author: Zuzzi E.

description:
I've heard about this place for a long time and finally went...and I likey lots!  The line situation with the bouncers is a bit much (I hate places that hold the line just to build a big crowd in the front), but once you're inside, fun times are there to be had.  The music is good, bartenders are prompt, the crowd has a great vibe, there's a lot of seating and even a VIP section above.  The decor is pretty cool and this would be a fabulous venue for a private party as it is a very nice intimate space.

Harlot seems to be a cross between a lounge and a club so the dress code is a little more upscale than other dance venues...I saw a lot more cocktail dresses and blazers than normal even though everyone still got their usual freak on.  The eye candy is pretty good for both men and women and there is great diversity although the age range is a bit all over the place.  Street parking was actually fairly easy and there's a large private lot right in front if you don't mind paying.

I'll be going back for sure and you should definitely check it out!  Just make sure you have more girls than guys in your group when you go because otherwise you'll never get in.  The bouncers don't seem to let groups of only men in.  But then again, this could be a very convenient excuse for you guys to start flirting with some random hot women while waiting, right?  And ladies, feel free to help those cute boys standing in line get in earlier with you! ;)
author: Helen T.

description:
I have to say that the staff really make this place a lot better than it might be.  They definitely took our bad behavior well.  First the bartender didn't throw us out when my boyfriend broke a shot glass all over the place.  Then the security guard didn't throw us out when we were all camped out in the men's room being bad kids.  Then the manager or owner or whatever didn't throw us out when boyfriend was wasted rambling about god knows what and being (sorry dear) totes annoying.  

I had a good time not being thrown out of here!
author: Coco D.

description:
I can't help it. I keep coming back to this place because it's one of the few venues in SF that have the following factors I want: dancing, loungey for when you want to chat, intimate, non-scary aggressive men, music I can sing AND dance to, doesn't try too hard (but some 'semblance of effort is important!). 
The crowd is a mixed fun group. It's a mid 20s-early 40s crowd so you can find kittens and cougars prancing around together. I like Friday nights better than Saturday. Friday is more of a I want to get smashed/unwind after work local crowd and Saturday has a bit more of the out-of-town want to try a hot spot feel.
The bouncers are polite if you are polite to them. I've only had a problem once and that was with a small bald bespectacled man wielding a clip board.
author: Kelly K.

description:
After having a god awful time at cigar bar and grill we left after one drink and came to Harlot. I've been here several times and it's always fun. The drinks are strong and expensive but every place is the same (even tunnel top now) 

I like the smoking room and the fact you can people watch. The music is a little like Las Vegas where they play some top 40 hip hop but mostly mixing in house and top 40 from the 80s. The crowd isn't as crazy as those mostly 21 year old crowds. From time to time I like Harlot but I prefer Slide or Vessel.
author: elizabeth o.

description:
'Meh. Ive experienced better.' Is a great way to describe this place. Its quite pretentious. Being a guy, or god forbid a group of guys, you better get friendly with some girls in line and just hope they are willing to drag you in under their wings. I havent had a cocktail that Ive thought was good. As well as I havent heard any DJs here which were anything special.

All that being said, Ive also had a good time here. If youve got some good friends and the energy to put up with this place. I say give it a shot, at least once, because it just might be your shtick.
author: Jeshua B.

description:
First off, I agree with most people that the door is something else here... absolutely... but the rest of the night is awesome!

I have the privelage of DJing here about once a month, and it is consistently the best looking, funnest, most energetic crowds I get to play for in this city!

Kris at the bar is the shit! She's awesome! It is a bit tiny, so all you schmuckwads that show up post 11 and want to get in, good luck...at a place this small always show up early cuz 100 people in here already make it look poppin! 

The sound system is top notch! The bass thunders my chest everytime i play, and it sounds crisp and clean in the small space. It's sorta broody, dark, but the music is fun and I have yet to have a bad night here. Sorry about the door, just find out who the dj is and get on their guestlist... is that so hard?
author: Jon G.

description: Its an ok place to unwind after class at GGU. Its nice decoration and chill but not like crazy over the top. The place is pretty swank like SF expects. So come down and get cozy with a some friends.
author: Natasha M.

description: I actually like this place. Went here to celebrate one of my homies' birthday (Teejay Walton) and Ruben Mancias flew in from NYC to spin soulful deep house here. Now they have a monthly party for Devotion! I like the decor and it has a good size dance floor space. This venue attracts a diverse crowd and I like it. Drinks are average although they carry Hangar One liquor and that's always a major plus to support local distilleries.
author: Mika D.

description: Not particularly memorable.  Went around 10ish on a Saturday night with my wife and another couple and got right in w/ no cover charge.  The space is kinda cool and the music was decent.  The dj was playing but no one dancing.  We had a drink each and then split.  Probably won't go back.
author: James H.

description:
Harlot would be our last resort and final chance... Cab driver drops us off and immediately we see the crowd and my friend whispers 'Is this Harlem??' I laugh hysterically and respond "No, it's Harlot"   We were scared to see what we would encounter inside. We didn't have to wait in line as the bouncer immediately allowed us girls in.  

The decor is definitely interesting, not that you could see so much in the dark.  The club itself is fairly small, but again I can't compare it to LA. I remember most of my time was spent in the bathroom, not due to being ill but to check out other girls and compliment them. Don't ask. 

The dance floor is quite compact with awfully limited space to maneuver around. The music was unexciting with a blend of hip hop, 80's, and beats from 80's aerobic videos which actually was fun to dance to. 

I was impressed that even on a rainy night, people would still come out for the night.  There were a lot more girls than guys and the crowd seemed pretty unpretentious...boring! 

We missed LA where there's plenty of room to meet creepy people, dance to good music, and have more stories to tell the next day....
author: Sarah H.

description: Pretty disappointing to get to a place fairly early (11pm) and be told you have to be on the guest list. Other reviews are mentioning the girl to guy ratio has to be good to get in, which is probably true because my other two lady friends got there just a bit earlier and got in without a problem. Definitely the first and last time you will ever hear about me trying to get into this place.
author: Glenn J.

description:
I absolutely had a great time @ the Elite event. The music they played though out the even and on was great. Time just flew by. Bog props to the bartender servicing the upstairs bar. Those Gin & Tonics kept me feel good, not to strong and not to light. 

I was impressed by the decor of the place. The morbid look suited this place well. The tapestry kept my eyes entertained while sitting comfortable on the comfy couches. And the layout made it seem so spacious.

I would recommend this place for both Happy Hour to make a night of it. It's only 2 blocks away from work for me so bet I'm going to be hitting this place regularly!
author: Alfredo N.

description:
I'm not certain this place deserves my deluge. To a muted crowd and silent music I could picture myself standing at the bar, four bicyclists in animal costume spread to either side with intentional symmetry. It's that music video - what's a girl to do, the Gothic strings being plucked away to the overtures of some damaged sort. You can picture this. The over-priced bar waitress wailing, "do you love someone?" - tossing bottles with fashioned dismay, an over-priced drink to your hand. She was a burlesque dream - the scene of money flapping idly to the floor as she dances her dollar worth. It's always a disappointment. 

I'm the scenester, the pure contradiction. Me and us we sit and judge. You with the Marin hair and cougar lips, what's a girl to do? The big kid lumbering about, his balance forgotten; he reaches to a bottled vodka, pouring a fountained center-piece which dances to flapping lights. We like his lousy button down and truck-type loafers, but won't he fall? We'd rather like a show, the slow show - we the marauding hipster types seek solace in his pain, him with our girls and the gamely face when the moment's right. Fuck him.

Bitter and without feet for your music we leave. Perhaps we'll work things out some day.
author: Marc M.

description:
This place was full of beautiful women. Very comfortable place to hang out with couches. Great bar. Definitely going back.

Music was lacking.
author: Randy W.

description:
I laughed when someone below simply wrote "this place is like walking onto the set of 'the fast and the furious.'" and proceeded to give it 1/5. 

Man, that sounds great to me -- where's my blonde Angelina Jolie?

Anyway I admittedly haven't been here so recently (been busy) but I came for an opening party - and I have to say it was pretty fine.

Great looking bar staff - with corsets and drink skillz ("I say!").  Artwork was interesting, DJ was good.  I loved the VIP upstairs and the owners seemed down to earth (and present, which is good).

I do want to make one comment folks, and that is the number of people mentioning the parking nearby.  Now, we all know that most people going to bars are not going cos they want to sample the lemonades and diet colas.  Please, people, if you're going to drink then keep the car at home!

I don't live too far from Harlot and I see drunk drivers running lights when I try to cross intersections all the time - it's getting a real problem again in SF.  Please, I don't want to be a party pooper, but if you're going to 'enjoy the great parking' please stick to the sodas, kthnxbye.
author: Ben M.

description:
Harlot was memorable for many reasons-many reasons that I dont want to post up on my Yelp review-a random but memorable night, none the less.

My friend Preeya worked the door which I'm learning is an evil neccessity in SF clubs, and by "work" for all your perverts, I meant ensuring we had the perfect guy-to-girl ratio at the door not actually being a Harlot

Good music, whatever drinks, however for us ladies on the VIP section..make sure you are wearing underwear-unless of course that's what your going for..because everyone on the main floor was looking up and making comments..
author: Amruta G.

description:
Was heading from 111 Minna toward Harrison for stop no. 2 on a Thursday night when I saw some smartly dressed young men lining up at a place with minimal signage (just an H), so I followed their lead and was I ever happy I did!

You know those bar scenes in the movies that look so cool and classy and you wonder why your real-life bar experiences never approach anything so sexy? Well, this place comes as close as any I've seen. The wall art, the seating arrangements, the dressed up crowd, the dj who acknowledges he's playing to an audience and not spinning beats for his own ego, it all adds up to a sexy fun time. Sure, it's a bit pretentious, but so what?
author: Teddy D.

description:
One of the Thursday night spots...

People might be pretentious but who cares when you're with your girls.

Love the swank, the house music, and the hook ups! (Not physical hook ups but the booze!)
author: Anna S.

description:
I parked my car in the back lot and headed to DV8 with my fake ID to go clubbing for the night. Just kidding . . . I only wanted to give you all an idea of how old I really am. . .  

I love anything and everything that goes up or  near Minna. 111 Minna, John Colin's, Osha  . . . all places I frequent and when I heard Harlot was right in the same hood I thought it would fit in perfectly. 

We arrived late on a very busy Saturday night and walked right in after waiting for about five minutes. The guy who was working the door recognized a couple of us from his days at other clubs and let us in without a cover so that was nice. When I walked in I stood by the coat check stand and just took it all in and I honestly felt like I was in an upscale lodge in some secluded sexy place. I thought to myself that if we were to remove the music, people and turned on the lights I'd be at the Costanoa Lodge in Half Moon Bay.  Service was good and crowd was okay that night . . there were definitely some fugglies ( OMG, that was so mean ) but hey . . . it is what it is ... drinks were priced pretty fairly and the servers were on it and didn't get fazed when the line got crazy.  

The one thing and only concern which I will address is the music because it's my only real reason for giving up four stars rather than five.  Without having a whole debate about it . . . I'm just not that into the whole mash up trend. It would have been nice to hear a song played. Any song really. . . all I remember was someone dropping biggy, over metallica, and then over elvis crespo . . . and though I commend the DJ's creativity I just hope it's something that dies sooner rather than later.
author: Jazzelyn F.

description:
Bartenders need to go work in LA if they are going to have that much attitude.  Oops, they forgot they work in San Francisco.  In SOMA no less...

And this place definitely needs some appetizers added to the menu.  By appetizers, I don't mean black pepper chocolate and nasty cheese plates with wheat thins.
author: Kelsey C.

description:
I saw The Ringers here the other night.  They were amazing and loud.  What a great place to see a show.  There was another band that played after them, whatever they were called, they were not very good.  

Harlot had a special $1 pilsner deal going, which was great.  The cover was only $5 to get in the door.  What a great night.  If it wasn't for the shots of Jameson and the Bolivian marching powder it would have been a cheap night.  Also, they had roller derby girls zooming around selling raffle tickets.  I didn't win anything, but at least it was a fun scene.
author: Ezra Y.

description:
What a shame!  This place has such potential.  The music is OK-good, but they rotate the DJs regularly so if you don't like one, hang around.  The drinks are very adequate, but not exceptional.  The decor is interesting (in a non-blah manner).  What killed it totally for me was the security staff, what attitudes!  There are enough clubs in SF and SOMA that have better music, better drinks and better decor without anyone having to deal with over zealous bouncers.  

I wonder why club owners/managers don't realise that one agressive bouncher can negate the impression left by a dozen good bar staff?
author: David K.

description:
Was here about a week ago against my own wishes.  

This is probably the worst bar/club I've ever been to.  It looks like Tool Academy and Jersey Shore got together and had d-bag children.  The decor is pretentious, the bar tenders slow, and the old women ugly.  

Oh, and let's not forget - the bouncers; an a-hole by any other name would be just as sh!tty

To sum up.  Avoid this place.
author: Tam L.

description: This place has all the elements of a fun clubbing experience. great crowd, friendly bartenders, and awesome music (hop hop/house)! The crowd was pretty fun. Overall, I dig it.
author: Michael T.

description: I asked the doorman when the whipping would begin.  The cast metal iron gate that cages off the smokers is reminiscent of dungeon.  Sexy interior, yupscale 20-somethings.  Ah, to be young.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
So I've been here probably three or four times and the experience has been all over the board. Let's start with general feelings:

Good: Decor. Gorgeous. Drinks. Reasonably priced/made. Music: Great variety.

Bad: Can get VERY crowded. Snooty feel is definitely noticed. 

It's definitely a fine place to go for happy hour. Staff is cool, and the place really looks awesome. Another time, I went late in the evening with a girl and we got in pretty quickly (might have been her doing). But recently I planned my birthday party with well over 50 guests. I didn't get table service but I was planning on a huge event. They neglected to mention until I emailed two days before the event that my party night was to be guest list only (in previous emails they stated that they didn't have guest lists for Friday nights).

Um, bit conflicting? So yeah they basically screwed my plans up though luckily everything worked out in the end (at another club). Definitely not high on my list anymore.
author: Aaron F.

description:
I went to Harlot for the first time last night, and found it to be pretty fun.
The venue was all black, a decent sized dance floor. It has this mystifying-ness to it because of all the black walls, and there's a huge picture of a naked girl on the wall behind the DJ which was distracting me the whole night I was dancing. Not quite sure if I actually enjoyed that. The music on Sat. night was hip-hop, and the DJ was doing alright, until he started putting in his own commentary and playing this underground rap music; that was when we decided we had to leave. 

The crowd was decent. They were not scary, minded their own business, wasn't rowdy. The men all dressed up really nice in suits and everything. A diverse group of people. The security guards were considerate and let us girls in for free. The club was really packed when we arrived at 12:30, which was probably the best time to go if you like clubs that get packed. After 1:30 though the crowd definitely thinned, and there was almost no more people by 2. 

Overall experience here was pleasant and fun - 3 stars.
author: Cindy V.

description:
For decor alone, this is my kind of place - very sexy and dark and carnal, oh, I'm getting hot just thinking about it.

The crowd is, eh, so-so depending on the night.

I took my out-of-town friend here this past Labor Day weekend on Saturday and I think it would have been much better had it been a weeknight, but - that could be because I'm partial to only going out on weeknights as I'm the anti-lines - very little patience, type person.

Still, we got in fast and the bar was surprisingly quick, didn't go upstairs because of what appeared to be an over-crowding.

But, and this was probably the best part, the music!  The DJ could noticeably spin eclectic mixes in a really rare and cool way - I was thoroughly impressed.  We even bared the crowd for longer than we wanted to, to stay and dance - way to go DJ, now that is some serious dance music I would never have imagined possible!
author: Lauren G.

description:
I think this might be my new favorite happy hour spot!

I came her after work last week with coworkers and had a blast!  The space is really cool with high ceilings, erotic artwork on the walls and table tops, comfortable booths with faux snakeskin cushions, bumping music and great drinks - apparently happy hour goes until 9p?!  What could be better than that?!

There's nothing I hate more than going somewhere for HH that doesn't have music going... 

I have to admit, I've been a Jon Collins girl for a while and I like the more laid back vibe there but... Harlot really impressed me.  

I'll definitely be back.
author: Alice H.

description:
Came here Saturday night.  I feel like I'm in Vegas every time I come here.  There's tons of men standing outside while letting 2 girls to every 1 guy in.  I can't say that I mind, but it sucks when you have lots of guy friends.  

Music was HOT, the DJ mixed old school hip hop with new age music.  Good mash up.

The crowd was uhhh...  very nicely dressed with the random 50 something popping up out of nowhere.  

One tip - Don't wear white.  People here love to bring their colored drinks onto the crowded dance floor.
author: Claire C.

description:
I've been here for happy hour, a private event and during the wee-hours of the night, now I'm officially qualified to review. 

HAPPY HOUR - not too great, I like the fact that there's lots of seating but not too many drink specials. My friend ordered a Long Island and I, a glass of Cabernet (tasted like house wine!!) and paid $22. That took the happy out of my hour :( 

PRIVATE EVENT - the only experience I really enjoyed. However I was there for a AskMen.com advertising event so the lingerie fashion show and iPod/Playstation door prizes probably doesn't give me a fair place to judge but the venue played to the event so I can't complain. Did I mention there was a lingerie fashion show? (yah, yah, yah, women look at other women all the time!) 

CLUB - so-so. It gets hot in this club and probably not in the way you're hoping. The crowd is fairly mix, some dress up, some dress down. I'm a girl so what do I know about dress codes? (ahhh.. yes, one of the many quirks of being a female.) 

I like the bar set-up and decor, I have to compliment the way they use their limited space. Just make sure you use main roads if you're heading towards Embarcadero (especially if you're by yourself), otherwise you're a target to get mugged.
author: Jamie Q.

description:
so many whores.

seriously, i am told that prostitutes frequent this place.  to be fair, they're probably better-looking than tenderloin prostitutes, and are probably addicted to prescription painkillers and cocaine rather than meth and crack.  however, i was not here for pleasures of the flesh but to congratulate my friend on getting married.  the doorman told us that he had "let too many people in for that party already."  that sucks.  maybe you should have been more responsible about that.  can i go in now?

tip: if you're a girl, make sure to wear your sluttiest outfit.  if you're a dude, make sure to wear your douchiest shirt to fit in.  also, $18 for 2 cokes with a splash of jack?  do i also get an hj with that?
author: Katherine K.

description:
We got bottle service on a Friday night.

I liked the gothic and provocative decor.

I did NOT like the DJ. Too many repetitive tracks.
author: Oanh N.

description:
My friends came here for happy hour on a Friday. We stayed here most of the night.  They had a DJ, and it became more crowded as the night wore on.

Decor is different. Nice different.

There's this one female bartender with these super cool tattoos on her chest. I kept staring.. you know, because of the tattoos.

She recommended some weird mixed drink, turned out to be fairly strong although you couldn't taste the alcohol. Those are the best and get you in the most trouble.

Four stars because it's a good enough place to come back to for happy hour.
author: Robert L.

description:
When reviewing Bars/Venues/Clubs it is probably best to note what night or event you went to that night. I have been to Harlot all of 3 times for club nights my friends throw. These have all been on Wednesday nights. No table service and reservations weren't necessary ( I didn't know that this existed for Harlot until i read other reviews). The event nights I've been to were Face (now defunct) and Suspiria (3rd Wednesdays) and the crowd for those nights was probably a stark contrast to the bros and hos I picture when reading the other review. 

Anyhoot, about the BAR and not the club event. Overall, drinks are good prices, service is good (thus far), and the decor is in great taste. The bouncers are always really nice to me and have never given a male friend any trouble (at least not that I'm aware of). The owner even tried to help us out when a guy scammed my friend into paying to park in the lot across the way. I guess it depends on the nights.
author: Raquel V.

description: Harlot is the spot to be at when it comes Friday and Saturday nights. I have been to Harlot plenty of time and have made respect for the way they operate. Color/Race is definitely not an issue, since I am African American. I just celebrated my B-Day party last Saturday on Aug. 12th. and got a booth upstairs. Me and my family had one hell of at time. Marcel, the club owner, and Jeremy, the manager, is doing one hell of a good job with its operations. So please disregard the Jeremy haters out there, cuz everytime I am in Harlot, I am WINNING. Keep doing your thing Jeremy. People need to understand that people get turned away all the time from clubs (especially in LA and Vegas) becuz clubs go for certain look, so for cats that steady get turned away... find out wht that certain look is (clothes wise cuz it not based on race). plz believe.
author: lynel f.

description:
Okay.  I'm going to rewrite this review since Yelp is having an event there this Thurs.

We went to one of the preview nights.  It's a very pretty space.  I like nice swanky places to hang out...it's that indulgent side of me. I like the size of it.  It's got that nyc feel to it but we're in SF.  It's got paintings of women in various poses to go with the harlot theme?  Lots of antlers abound, BUT I felt like it has no character.  Perhaps it's the clientele and the bad music? 

The crowd was cheesy- maybe because of the event. Seriously some 50 yr old tried to tell me that his friend is "cute" while I was clearly with a date.  I find the crowd boring.  People didn't look that interesting. We left maybe after 30 min.

Perhaps the name Harlot is fitting...wipe the pretty makeup off and the clothes come off and you'll not find anything...appealing.
author: Julia H.

description:
When it's crowded, dark and loud, the sexy decor is well, sadly overlooked.  Don't get me wrong, the smoking room with the glass walls is nicely done, and the furniture and artwork is definitely unique.  It  just feels like you've been here before but they switched the furniture out on you, and you're left staring up at the antler chandeliers wondering 'what. why?'.  

Same people, same music, but hey, look...better chairs.
author: Kimmie N.

description:
Straight up sexy new club in SoMa.  Been a few times for some pre-opening parties.  I would imagine that it was better then, before all the hoopla and B&T crowds.

Love the decor (minus that FREAKY painting behind the DJ booth).  Makes me feel like I'm at the Haunted House in Disneyland.  Nice layout for those getting bottle service.  Could use a bigger dancefloor.  Love the layout of the DJ booth.  Good soundsystem.  Door staff is nice (if you're a girl, and dressed up).  

Bar is insanely annoying to get drinks from.  Don't even bother if it's a female bartender.  I think their corsets are tied on too tight...
author: Adrian L.

description:
After further inspection (aka many a night at Harlot) I must say I was wrong. . Harlot is amazing. Great djs, great crowd, and great ambiance. Very sexy interior

------------------------------------------------------
So I guess I can't give an accurate review of this place. I went a month or so for a fashion show after party. The decor is beautiful but the place is a bit small. The problem I had was that the music was really bad and it was so packed, then all of a sudden the place cleared out! The place was full of models, and trashy guys trying to pick up on the models. I will have to go back on a regular night and try my luck again.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Word of warning to guys, don't try to come here (on the weekend) unless: 
1. You have reserved a table
2. You are on the guest list
3. You have a bunch of girls with you

I personally have not tried to go there without the above, but I've seen many guys get rejected (or left when the bouncers asked them to pay $50 /person).  What's worse is when I've seen some dudes who are trying to meet up with some girls who are already inside (I think one of them was one of the dude's girlfriend).  That doesn't fly at Harlot.

Generally, I like the layout and overall style of the club but it does tend to get super packed.

Upstairs is awesome for parties but last night the wait for drinks up there was insane (only 1 bartender being bombarded).  People waiting at least 15-20 minutes for a drink.

It also gets really hot and stuffy in there...
author: Sam H.

description:
I've been here a couple times now and I enjoyed both times.  Yet again, another easy place to get into if you're a girl......kinda funny.......I overheard the bouncers saying it was guest list only, to find out he was just saying that to some drunk guys trying to get in.  The girl in line behind us then came back and said he just said that to control the amount of guys going in.  A couple minutes later, the door man came up to us and asked us how many were in our party and let us go right in.  YEAH!  Drinks have always been made strong here for me......so the bartenders are cool in my book. 

 I would have to agree with Cindy B that the music is kind of a hit/miss but I always say, if you go out and just enjoy your company, the music should just be an added compliment.  I like mostly all music so, I thought the music was fine.  I guess it's more of the interesting mix of different genres thrown into top 40's every once in a while.  

 I love the decor.......kinda dark and a little goth but in a sensual, sophisticated way I would say.  The painting of Harlot [I assume] above the dance floor is a frickin trip!  I could've sworn she was lifting off the canvas the first time I saw her.  Kinda weird.......maybe I just had one too many drinks......haha...........I'd go here again for sure.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Definition: HARLOT  [hahr-luht] -noun.  A prostitute; whore.

Snobby, over-rated, overpriced, gothic, and pompous.  

We went there last night for a friend's birthday.  She did not reserve a table. When we got to the door, the bouncer says we can't let anyone else from her party in anymore because she didn't make reservations for a party.  (in other words, she didn't pay us to have her party here).  Luckily, we were the last ones to get in.  

Drinks were above $10.   
People described this as having an LA/Vegas feel...i beg to differ.

In some public restrooms, you'll find stalls w/ a lock broken so one of your girlfriends would hold the door from the outside while you go.  BUT in Harlot's bathroom,  one of the stalls didn't even have a door...ghetto.  If this place charges a fortune on drinks, you would think they can use some of that to pay for a new door.  

PROS:
The dj was pretty good.
No cover.
Fairly close parking.
author: Elaine L.

description:
I probably wouldn't go back... and just because of the bouncers outside.  Ridiculously rude.... I thought I was back in Los Angeles again. 

Besides that, the music was ok and the drinks weren't too ridiculously priced.   No cover, thank god.
author: Michael C.

description:
I give this place 3.5 stars.

I've come to this club once earlier this year because of the good things I heard from friends about this place (NOT because of potential Baron Davis sightings). Also, the owners have been around on the club scene FOREVER (they own one of the oldest running club in SF as well as Sushi Groove) so in my eyes, they know how run a successful business. At first I wasn't sure what to expect b/c I don't go to a lot of clubs that play Top 40's kind of music but... heck, why not go??

The DJ was really good and it kept me and my friend dancing all night. Drinks were considered to be on the pricier side but not expensive by any means; especially when you consider the fact that their drinks were pretty potent. And everyone likes potent drinks. 

In general the club was crowded. It was really hard to dance at all without accidentally elbowing people. This was kind of irritating. I got my friend and I into the VIP balcony upstairs where there was MUCH more room to roam around and dance. VIP balcony area was well decorated and in all white.

What surprises me is the negative comments here from guys complaining that they didn't get in. Clubs in any city you go to usually have stricter door policies if you roll in with a group of guys or if you're in a larger group mixed with guys and girls so you shouldn't be shocked that you were rejected or had to wait in line with everyone else. Having an ego or attitude doesn't help you get into the door. 

I actually found the door men and security people at Harlot to be friendly, nice and without major attitude. If you wanna talk about a place that has serious a$$holes for doormen and security, then go over to The Ambassador and you'll be greeted with serious attitude and egotism.
author: Athena E.

description:
i like this place because everytime i went, the music was good.  I like the DJ.  sometimes it's really snooty and since i hang out with guys mostly, the bouncer won't let them in, just me.  like...why would i go in there by myself?

this really doesn't have anything to do with the review, but i thought it's funny enough to share.  so it was one of those nights when we couldn't get in because the guy to girl ratio was really off, but my boyfriend was inside already since he had gotten there earlier. anyway, mr. bouncer man let me in, but the rest of my friends had to go somewhere else.  so i find my bf, come outside to meet up with the rest of group who had gone to temple instead and mr. bouncer man says "so what's your name?"  i said "sally." (looking very uninterested) and he goes "well now you will never have to stand in line now that you know me."

HA!  okay...so i can go in solo bc i happen to have a vagina and leave everyone else bc they don't?

anyway, i thought it was funny....you might not have but that's ok...i'm in story telling mood...but yeah, i like this place.  i'll go back but my guy friends might have to go in drag.
author: Sally T.

description:
Good happy hour spot.  Spacious and decent drinks.  

Weekends = long lines.  So get there early or wait for hours...
author: Alan T.

description: Wow, this place was incredibly weak sauce if your you're looking for a dance club.  There was no cover charge last night but the music wasn't poppin', the crowd wasn't dancing, it was so dark that you couldn't "enjoy" the decor, one gogo dancer couldn't dance, the club is 90% white like other reviews say.  Long story short, we ended leaving in 10 minutes and walked over to Temple nightclub instead.  Paid the $20 cover charge and had an awesome time.  I would suggest you do the same unless you'd rather lounge standing up.
author: Tang K.

description: Decent lounge/club for SF.  Tucked away in the alley of Minna, you'd never really expect a club here.  Downstairs can get wayyy crowded, and upstairs is for VIP/bottle service.  My days of grinding on the dance floor and being sweated on my strangers are over so I mostly hung out in the main room under the trees and watched sweaty 20-somethings try to get their groove on.  Immediately to the left of the entrance is a smoking room that gets disguistingly full of smoke.  Some douche bag was in there with a cigar stinking it up and a fake Rolex and a silver-plated CZ bracelet pretending to be P.Diddy.  WTF?! Would maybe come back, but certainly nothing to rave about.
author: Maxine S.

description:
Coolest club in SF. The art, the atmosphere and ambiance, the decorum, the DJ and music selection! What's not to absolutely LOVE? If you want Gothic-Rococo decor with a modern SF/DeviantArt twist (tables with photograph underlay of girls shot by SF photog Merkeley??? and original pieces by Camilla Rose Garcia) and the best 80s+hottest beats mash-ups, then Harlot is your place.

It's discretely tucked out of the way on Minna St, so it still has that "best kept secret" feel. You always get the feeling that there is an interesting crowd in here. Not pretentious, just interesting. It makes you want to know who else knows about and goes to Harlot as well. I love it. My girls and I ALWAYS love this place. Dance floor is a little packed, but that's a good sign, right? Exactly. Harlot rules. End of story.
author: Not U.

description: If my friends didn't take me to this place i seriously would have never known Harlot's existence. The entrance is in an alleyway so it's kind of hard to find. But once found, you will be led into a place with gothic interior design that i personally enjoyed. I think what made this night the most fun i've had in a while was the DJ. So many people were on the dancefloor...mind you their dancefloor isn't that big...but regardless it was awesome. I didn't get to try any of their drinks but i'm definitely going back with my girlfriends!
author: Suzan L.

description:
Harlot, located in a Alley is one of the coolest place to be on a Saturday night. Recommended by a co-worker from work, I decided to check it out and was very impressed. There had to be at least one girl to every guy, and the music was definitely jamming. The DJ played all kinds of music from old to new school, house, trance, you name it, he played it. 

The bouncers were cool as he let us in via the VIP line although we didn't sign up for it. 

I almost didn't believe that every girl that was shaking their booties was a patron because they'd parade around the place. The night when we there, 2 bachelorette parties were going on.

There was a high presence of staff watching the crowd, exits, etc. Not sure why, but they were all dressed in trench coats in the club as well.

There is a 10 dollar cover, but well worth it.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
9/10 update: was here again Fri night, and the attitude of the door guy turned us off and got one minus star.  The security guy suggested complaining on their website, but yelp is probably a better forum for passing on this info.

Friend recommended this place, but it didn't happen for a while b/c it's just that much harder to round up dancing partners currently.  Wait, or am I being dissed? :P

Fortunately, happened upon some nice people at a house party, and they convinced me to head over here on a Friday night.

Plenty of parking given after hours, and it's smooth sailing into the place at 1am.

Not too well-known yet, but that's the perfect place for a dancing queen.  If you need to be seen or need the crowd to hide your lack of moves, then this isn't for you.

Ahhh, but for those of us who need the beat and love to shake it, this will do just fine.  Would be curious to find out the vibe at happy hour...

Best place to dance: the spaces between the vip tables.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I love the decor at Harlot. Happy Hour prices are pretty good as well at $5 for well and $3 for draft.

After work is ideal, because light streams in and the place is not so dark. There is DJ as well. 

Only wish that they had table service/cocktail waiters. That's why I only gave them 4 stars.
author: Darwin D.

description:
DAMN SHAME, we had heard good things but had a really bad experience.

We had planned to have 3 birthday parties here on Fri, Nov. 9.  The party organizer emailed weeks ago and NEVER GOT A RESPONSE.
Ok, so maybe they're too busy, BUT we show up on Fri night to be told that the club is CLOSED until 12am for a private party that was NOT POSTED ON THEIR ONLINE CALENDAR.  

Very uncool.  May I ask that Harlot respect the people who would like to bring their business to the club and make an effort to post private events WHICH WILL CLOSE THE CLUB on your website and email people back when they make an inquiry?

Sux to be disgruntled on your birthday.  :(
author: Suruchi K.

description:
Great Decor .... GREAT music on Thursdays..... The weekend crowd is a little BnT but still one of the best places in the city.
 
This place is not too big .. not too small and it has a smoking section. 

Also within walking distance to Temple and Supper Club
author: Jeremy R.

description:
As my friend Kellie P points out, the bench did break, and I had nothing to do with it. 

Strange little bar, odd decor (we were careful to choose the sexiest table, but the antlers and inadvertently dorky 80's vibe got to me), and odd mix of people. There was a softball team (I was not hitting on them! I just wanted a tshirt!), some stuffed suits, and some frumpy looking office types. I'm sure they were wondering why our geeky selves were bringing down their date night vibe, but whatevers...

If the other drinking spots are full, we might end up there, but it's as likely that we won't.
author: eliza w.

description:
3.5 stars.  

I love the name.  The decor was as good and bad as everyone else described.  It was fairly crowded and since Golden State beat Utah on Friday night there were some Warriors there celebrating.  They roped off an area for them to hang out in, but some how their area kept expanding outwards.  All good but leave some space for the little people.  There was also table service right near the dance floor but if you're going to go big, learn how to handle your alcohol.  Obviously I don't get out to night clubs too much anymore but we had a good time.  The music kept changing so there would be moments of great music and then not so much.  I do like the sexy outfits the bartenders and servers were wearing and the bouncers here are the coolest ;p.
author: Mabelle A.

description:
Were we all at the same place??

I loved this club.  They played great tunes.  Yeah there were a bunch of people, but it was a good crowd.  It wasn't too crowded and the dance floor was perfect.  The decor is fun, and we got into the VIP room.  How can you not love a Marie Antonette chase lounge, loves it!!

We got in no problem even though we wen't on the list, all we said was that our frinds were already inside.

Can't wait to go back.
author: Becky A.

description:
Really fun bar/club.  The owners did a great job taking a disjointed space (entrance area, smoking cage, steel beams), and organizing it in a way that flows really well -- and almost turns all of those potential negatives into positives (as cool as steel beams are, they can rarely be a positive).  Don't know if they are real are not, but the beams still show the "Carnegie Steel" stamp.

Bar service is prompt, smooth, and polite.  Drinks are well poured (plenty of alcohol, without tasting like gasoline), at reasonable prices, and they have a wide variety of brands, including some of my new favorites (Lotus Vodka, Hendricks Gin, and the new flavored Tanqueray Gin), some old favorites (Effen black cherry), and a decent selection of wine & scotch.

The dance floor is big enough to accommodate a good sized crowd, without overwhelming the space; and is well partitioned from the bar such that you can always see one from the other, yet neither causes the other to get all jammed up (I'm looking at you, Vessel).

Also, really like the upstairs space.  There's another bar, and the balcony gives a *prime* spot from which to scope out the crowd and people watch.

If I have one nit, it's the fact that you actually have to leave the club to go to the bathroom.  Couple weeks ago I had a friend go to the bathroom right around closing, and they wouldn't let her back into the club (where we all were).  She had to go out the side doors by the bathroom area, come back around to the front and wait for us -- and then one of us had to get her jacket from coat check since they wouldn't let her back in... kind of lame, but probably just a timing/communication type issue.
author: Maneesh B.

description:
The space and decor are really cool. We caught no attitude from the bouncer, but it was about 7pm on a Friday. There were lots of after-work people there. We were a mixed group (in terms of gender, sexual orientation, and race) and the vibe just seemed very straight and white. The music was 80's-90's top 40, which seemed to encourage the bad dancers to hit the floor. I had a really bad glass of wine. The music was too loud to hold a conversation. One of the benches broke (and my friends were doing nothing more than sitting on it. No crazy dancing or anything.)

I am not really a "club girl", but it was kind of cool to sit in a group and have some drinks. I wish the music was quieter. Overall, a solid "meh".
author: Kellie P.

description:
Harlot is pleasant, but it doesn't live up to its name.


 I was expecting a luxuriously sexy space that would make me want to get as naked as possible and dance on a table top, or lounge in a plush booth with some gorgeous boy I just found on the street but no. Not here.


 That said, it's a very good club. Harlot is sleek and well designed - I like the matte/glossy black wallpaper and the occasional antlers [although at this point antlers and deer are the end of their spot in the design limelight as the IT animal/thing], I like the white upstairs with the beautifully classical chairs I like the red and black bathrooms that are practically outside Hell, I like the drinks and the light and the bartender girls [although they are slightly snarly, but they always tend to be in new hip clubs]... I like all of it, really, but it's just not a SEXY space!


 I guess this is my usual reason for taking away stars - I am taking off a star for DISAPPOINTMENT. I thought a place called Harlot would be soft and intimate, with a myriad private dim corners to sneak into for tete a tete moments but no. Not here.
author: lizok

description:
Are we in Vegas? Crap, we must not be since my two guys friends couldn't even grease their way in at $50 per head. Were they obnoxious and drunk? B.O.? Nope. Asian? Yep. Hmm... come to think of it, I only saw like one Asian guy up in the place. Interesting. Super negative stars for bald Moby wannabe door guy who was on a total power trip. Puhlease, why you tryin' to keep it all exclusive if you let these other d-bags in? This place is worse than Vessel in how they try to create hype outside for a sub-par population inside. We were more than happy to roll up to J. Collins for a happier vibe instead.

So a warning to the bros out there, you better arrive with a girl guy ratio of like 3-1 and then be willing to be uber nice to Moby if you want a chance to get in. More than likely, he'll turn you down and try to sucker you into buying a table. Lame.

One star for the friendly bartender upon my arrival and one star for servin' up Hangar Lime.
author: dianne l.

description: Went to this place for the first time the other night even though I've heard about it for a while now.  It was slow, but the music was good, the inside looked cool.  I liked the high ceilings and class decor.  The bartenders were on point and  I'll definitely go back sometime soon.
author: Sean M.

description: I applaud this lounge for an overall proper evening. I have been on their email list for over a year but finally decided to go. It has a burlesque vibe with antique-style paintings and mirrors. I think the walls are actually black velvet. couches and antler chandeliers very chic. The dj played sweet electronica! the energy was very Euro (dress and dancers). a nice variance to hip hop and marina scene. blah ! the bouncers were very respectful. the bartenders seem a litlle alouf but still attended to our requests. will defenitely return in the near future! My date loved this place too. snarf snarf!
author: Alex S.

description: i read a lot of bad reviews and i can relate to what a  lot of people have experienced especially at the door and it wouldve been 5 stars if it wasn't for that guest list ipad drama at the door with that specific vin diesel wantta be , but harlot still the classiest lounge around and has the best vibe with a little overpriced drinks ..
author: NAEL K.

description: I showed up to this place in a group of 9 ppl, 4 girls, 5 guys. My 3 friends had just walked in as we arrived, but since we weren't on the 'guest list', and since they were expecting the place to get pretty full, we could only get in if we bought the very last table in the empty club (at midnight) that cost $500. The bouncer (bald guy with emo glasses) was unnecessarily rude and also was unusually bad at making up stories not to let us in. The three people that actually made it inside said the place was pretty empty and generally lame.
author: Tyler C.

description:
Racist owner. Tells you lies at the door in order to get you to either leave or buy a table. 

I've gone with different mixes of nationalities and 10:1 girl-to-guy ratios only to hear a variety of lame excuses. Basically they turn people away in order to make an empty bar seem exclusive. Before you assume this to be a sob story, I've been inside multiple times...only to be disappointed by poor music, sleazy guys that try pathetic lines on women, and an overall space half the size of a 5th and Folsom loft. 

Bartenders are nice, the only plus I can see. Avoid at all costs.
author: Timothy H.

description:
I can only rate this place from a happy hour standpoint.  It is definitely one of my fave HH places and is super close to my work.  They make one strong vodka gimlet and always have my fave Effen Black Cherry vodka on hand.  I started going here pretty much as soon as it opened and have seen the crowds escalate in the past 2 months. The bartenders are really cool - and I am talking about the guys who seem to work the HH circuit.  I think they save the corsetted ladies for the night shift.  And I never make it to the night shift since I will have already consumed 8 Effen Black Cherry and Sodas and will be sure to pass out by 9:00 pm. And that is what I love about this place, it keeps me in on Fridays and ready get up and go on Saturdays.

Pros - Stiff drinks, good bartenders.  The last time I was there with co-workers they gave us cheese plates.  They don't give everyone cheeseplates, but if you ask you may get lucky. Oh, and it is connected to the Salt House which makes for an easy transition for some yummy dinner.

Cons - I think this place gets super L.A. at night and is gaining popularity so may get super crowded for HH too.  Black toilets - I don't like black toilets they are too 80's. . . and not 80's in the good American Apparel way, 80's in the bad double breasted suit way.
author: Lia W.

description:
This place was kind of a joke, I showed up Saturday night, there was no line, the place was half full, and some tall lady who woks the bottle service told us that it was a $500 (2 bottle) minimum to get in.   We ended up getting in through "other" ways.

Once inside, the music was pretty good, but as someone else mentioned, the places you'd expect to sit in an "ultra lounge" or sort are all reserved for bottle service, leaving very limited corridors to walk around that got really crowded really fast.  

Dancefloor was ok, but overall I think the owners and operators are a little to into themsleves, I'd choose fluid over this any night.
author: Mike M.

description:
Worst apple martini I've ever had.

Been here once for clubbing and again for happy hour.  Perhaps it was because I was more sober at 6pm that I noticed the poor quality of the drink and the bad decor.  Won't be going back.
author: Nilar H.

description:
I've been to Harlot a few times now, and it's a place I'm kind of torn on. What it has going for it is the music and the space. It's definitely not a mega-club where you can expect to have a ton of room to dance and party; more of an ultra-lounge where there's space to dance but more space to hang around your table while you get table service or chill by the bar. The DJs have been good during the week and on the weekends - rock, house, hip-hop - a good mix.

The downside of Harlot is that it's not always a great experience. For example one-time when I went kind of early they were serving some sort of food that included wings and other finger foods, which doesn't really go w/ the vibe of the place. Also, often if you don't go early then you have to deal w/ the bouncer, which can lead to you getting turned away if you're just w/ the guys. Also, the drinks are kind of expensive for SF.

All in all, not a bad place. But usually if I want to hang around this type of scene, I go elsewhere...
author: Michael P.

description:
A bit backlogged on writing reviews.

Before I experienced Harlot, I was told by many that it is THE place to be in SF.  Have been there on a few occassions at varying times/days and I can say the place is nicely decorated.  I dig the harlot theme.  There are tables reservable with bottle service or you can be like the rest of the crowd and roam around.  The small dance floor in the back functions well and the glass-encased smoke room is a nice addition.  Although small, the upstairs lounge area is a good addition.

The one drawback to the lounge/bar is the restroom.  You have to go into a hallway of the building in the back and wind your way into it...and it's shared by Salt House patrons.  Not thrilled about that.

Otherwise, the bar staff are beautiful and mix awesome drinks.  Everyone I've encountered there, from mid-20's to 40 somethings were super friendly and interesting.
author: Jenny K.

description: ... I'm a fan of Harlot. One of the few clubs that consistently delivers a fun night out. I have to say though, I'm quite ticked at them at the moment. Apparently their operating hours are more of a "suggestion" than a rule. Left my CC there last weekend. Drove cross town tonite (Wed) to pick it up and was told, "oh, we only open for happy hour when it's busy." Really? Info that would have helped BEFORE I drove over. Also, how can you know if it's "busy" before you open? Psychic powers??
author: Jojo S.

description: So this place is pretty fun. I like how it is a step up above a lot of the SF night clubs. It seems a little nicer and the decor is pretty cute. Had bottle service at a table that was right in front of the dance floor which was pretty nice because we had easy access to dance or sit down if we wanted.  The only issue I have with this place is the dance floor is really small.  Also, there didn't really seem to be enough room to stand around and hang out. I'm not sure I would want to go here if we didn't have a table. I would like to go again and get a table in the upstairs portion, I bet that is pretty fun.
author: Raheleh K.

description:
One star, but only because Yelp won't allow none.
This place is an okay club, but the staff were so awful, it is not worth the trip.
The doormen were rude and totally unhelpful.  They did the "generate buzz" thing and kept us waiting in front, when nobody was inside, to make it look like it was full already.  They wouldn't let several of our guy friends in, even though they were on the list; and to top it all off, one of the doormen actually pushed one of our girls.  I'm sorry - but, there really is no excuse for that, ever.  
The VIP hostess didn't know what was going on and was totally overwhelmed by even the smallest of requests.  And the owner offered no apologies for his staff.  
Over all - a horrible experience from a club-goer perspective - there are plenty of other places that are fun and friendly that would provide you with a great night out.  Harlot isn't even close.
author: Andrea S.

description:
I came here Friday afternoon for Happy Hour and I had a good time.  The Music wasn't too blasted and my friends and I were still able to have a conversation.  i loved it when they played 80's music! I've heard many complaints about the drinks but I stick to beer so no complaints there.  The place gets packed and its tough to get to the bar let alone placing the drink order.  I can be pretty aggressive so I didn't have a problem.  The crowd is great and I happen to bump into a few of my old friends.  Now I know its a cool spot.

Well the night scene is totally different.  I've been here before with a couple buddies of mine months ago and we couldn't get in with the guys, but if its just you and your girlfriends- You are set.  Its too bad that if you are a girl and you're not on "the List" then lets hope you are wearing something extra slutty because that's how it goes down at Harlots!  If you like House music (which they mostly play), then this is the spot for you.  I'm not into House but I was just happy to be with the crowd I was with.
author: Catherine M.

description:
like the music, the interiors, that one hawt tender in the fantabulous corset...

dislike the d*ck behind the bar rolling his eyes like a beeyoch not willing to share what he makes well, the pretencious heads that have no reason to be simply cause they are in this sexy joint, two dollars more per drink compared to all the other bars I hit in this area...fuck it I am out.
author: omar b.

description: i was denied entry to see my friends who were already inside. presumably this is because i wasn't dressed appropriately (collared shirt, nice jeans, vans).  otherwise, not sure.. regardless, the bouncer was a jerk. welcome to san francisco!
author: robert h.

description:
I can understand if a club doesn't let a guy in because he doesn't have a girl if we are in Las Vegas.

This club is a seedy venue in the SOMA district, though. There are much better places to go people.
author: Peter J.

description: Teamhellaswag hit up HTC and Verizon Wireless' launch party for the Incredible 2 hosted by Donovan at Harlot. Harlot was smaller than I thought it would be but with the "Incredible Cabaret" theme and decor, it was nice to have a somewhat intimate vibe. Despite the slightly watered down drinks the spectacle was insane . . .
author: TeamHellaSwag ..

description: This place sucked the blonde girl bartender was rude to me n my co workers
author: Arlen C.

description: If I wanted to be reminded about everything I hate about Los Angeles, I would just go back and visit my parents who still live there.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Not really impressed - music was sub par and the drinks weren't very good. Dress code pickiness was frustrating - we had someone in our group in designer jeans & a T... unfortunate - he had to go change (incredibly lame)
author: linda t.

description: Finally, someone has designed my dream house, complete with two bars, a dance floor and a DJ booth (for me, of course).  I would ditch the pony fur couches, though. Homey does not play that.
author: Maria D.

description: DO NOT ever go here!  It is by far THE WORST place I've ever been to. On the night of my birthday party, they screwed up my guest-list and would not let any of the guys in. The bouncers/door staff were rude and complete idiots.  According to a friend who has been there, the decors at this place are not that impressive as the pictures shown on their photoshopped website. Place is small and crowd is old.
author: J C.

description:
Where do I begin? Let me set the scene...

Bestie and I role up around 9:30 to avoid any lines and we are immediately ushered into VIP upstairs. DJ Morse Code is already spinning his fabulous beats so we have a few drinks upstairs before heading down to get our dance on. The place gets crowded QUICK, but since we know a few folks we hop on stage with the DJ and start shaking our little money makers. Friday the 13th never looked better! Then disaster strikes....

I wish I could say that this disaster is something funny or cute or even slightly off-key cute. No, truly a disaster strikes. So Bestie says she's gotta go to the bathroom so we make our way around the corner. We enter the bathroom and I look down and I have blood covering my hands, body, legs and feet. I look at Bestie and she is the same, yet has it on her face and in her hair. True horror story moment. Turns out, somehow, somewhere, Bestie gets cut with glass across her wrist and up the forearm. Blood is everywhere. Crisis mode! I apply pressure while an ambulance is called. At this point we can't wait any longer for an ambulance so the owner's GF gets us in a town car and we race to the nearest hospital (St. Francis) for emergency care. GF leaves us at the hospital and Martel (owner) drives over our jackets and purses that have been left at the scene. I won't go into any more gory details but I will end this review with a few words about the owner: he has been so sweet and accommodating to my dear friend and it is so appreciated. If nothing else, besides the music/drinks/yadda yadda yadda, know that the owner has a sweet heart and is a good person!
author: Stephanie J.

description: It's dark and twisted like Nine Inch Nails meets Manson. It's like walking into a Tim Burton movie or something equally as weird. Drinks are good, music is hard, what an experience.
author: Alex H.

description:
This might be the douchebag-iest venue in the city for this year, although I'm sure they will go under or lose the title within the next 12 months....

Harlot is a sad attempt to re-create the LA lounge/club experience in SF. It fails miserably for obvious reasons (one being that most of the SF crowd doesn't go for that kind of crap)...


Oh, and a little tip to the owners: If you have to use the world "exclusive" in the first sentence of your description on your website, by definition you are NOT exclusive. There is nothing exclusive about the place.
author: Audrey L.

description:
Do NOT go to this place - EVER. I would have given it 0 stars but I was required to give one. I've been to this place a couple times over the last couple of years and always had a decent time. Not this time. It was my buddy's birthday and we showed up at 9 pm to avoid getting stuck outside. Because we had a couple more guys than gals, the bouncer basically laughed at us and said the only way we'd get in would be if we all bought bottle service. Mind you, the bar had just opened and there was NOBODY in the place yet. NOBODY. Yet they were turning away a group of people who were planning on spending large amounts of money throughout the course of the night. 

To make matters worse, the bouncer was a complete jackass. We offered to pay him some extra money to allow us in. He responded with "I worked in the music industry in LA and that doesn't work." Uh, yes it does. And how's that music industry treating you now? You're a bouncer at a crappy bar. Nice work dude. 

I don't know if management has any idea but this place is going down hill fast and the recent reviews prove that. This place sucks.
author: Ryan L.

description: Friday night at 1:00 AM, full of d-bags.  Why did I even walk in here.  At lest there wasn't a cover.  I'll just elbow this rude moustached Euro-trash boy in the chest and leave.  Good night.
author: Corey V.

description: A friend reserved a table here for his birthday and not only did they give it away (yes, we got there on time), they didn't even let us in!!!!  Obviously never coming here again.
author: Lindsay L.

description: HOT! Although not open to the public just yet, I was able to take a sneak peek at a private launch party on Wednesday, and I must say that Harlot definitely made its way to the top of my list of favorite lounges. They have all the elements down perfectly -- swanky interior, sexy vibe, no attitude staff, classy and unpretentious crowd and great dance music. Nothing less than a 5 star experience.
author: Connie C.

description: Typical club.  They have some cool decor but it's just like every other club where people get way too dressed up for their own good looking to either get groped or wasted.  Plus they man the door like it's some hot Vegas club.  Not bad, but not great either.
author: Vanessa Z.

description:
