Love this club, it's sexy and dark.

Great decor, good crowd, it's like a LA style club in SF, it's usually full of well dressed good looking people, can't go wrong with that, right?!? I recommend getting a table. The DJ is on it, love the music, the bathrooms.... CLEAN, yes... I said clean, shocking since it's a club right? Bartenders, fast and great concotionists.
author: S A.

description:
Yelp needs to come up with a ZERO star rating for shitty places like Harlot. Actually, let me rephrase that, zero star ratings for bouncers/security guards who think they're fucking Hollywood. 

Unfortunately, we're not oblivious to the fact that creating the illusion of a packed bar by making everyone wait outside in the cold for an hour and turning people away will somehow make you a more sought-after bar. Yes, we know all about supply and demand. But frankly, when you've been told that the bar is at full capacity and you somehow stumble your way to use the restroom at The Salt House (which JUST so happens to share a joint bathroom with Harlot)... and you ever-so-casually walk into Harlot to find the place not only EMPTY but completely non-impressive... you have to think twice. I will suggest that you do what I did, exit through the front entrance of Harlot and make sure you let those wannabe elitist chi-chi guys working the doors know that it fucking sucks in there and then proceed to tell everyone in line that it's empty in there but if they insist on fulfilling their curiosities about the place, there is always the VIP entrance through The Salt House.
author: Joyce L.

description: WHACK!!!! me and my girl had bottle service, got there @ 9:30 and the old man @ the door didnt want to let ME in..there was only about 8 people in the club at the time..eventually he let me in, but told us (after we ordered our 1st of 4 bottles) that if there were any men coming with our party that they WILL NOT BE ABLE TO GET IN!! remember that its now maybe 10:15...security was great i spoke to most of them and none of them had good words for the old man at the door..and our hostess was great as well....lets not mention that the owner was having a private party upstairs with a man-woman ratio of 6-1..and even he came to tell us theres nothing he can do..DONT GO THERE IF YOUR HAVING A PARTY..OR IF YOU WANT TO HAVE A GOOD TIME!!
author: Derek N.

description: The guys out front need to remember that they work the door at a bar in San Francisco ... not Vegas.  An easily forgotten spot on the map.  Like a fart in the wind.
author: James F.

description: Such a great space, it's unfortunate that they have hired hoodlums to guard their gates.
author: Phil M.

description: Terrible...If you're a guy, they won't let you in without a girl.  Nice try you guys, but what that usually means is that your club is NOT crackin' and you're trying to get more girls in there...I went there one night with a few friends (well dressed and with money to spend), and they wouldn't let us in.  Their loss really, but pretentious places like this have no place in San Francisco, or the bay area for that matter.  Don't waste your time by going here..
author: Michael J.

description: Who knew people in there mid 30s and up still like to party in places like this? Peculiar decor with antlers and cow covered couches. Creepy photos on the walls and even creepier alley outside of the place. Drinks were delicious and the music was a fun mix of 80s stuff and top 40s stuff.
author: Polina S.

description: right by Montgomery Bart, very - walkable. I dig the small venue, nice art work -- and a lady naked by the DJ booth.  lounge looking couches, very chill, good people however -- expensive drinks.
author: Lois R.

description: This place is small.  Was only glad that there was a smoking room where i could bring my drink with me and have a cigarette at the same time.  That doesn't happen to often these days.  What's a drink without a cigarette?  It's like oreos without milk.  Sucks.  Interesting decor.  Dead bugs line the back of the bar, and pictures of nude and scary paintings of women are on the other walls.  Haven't been here yet for a kickin' party, but the venue is alright.
author: Jin B.

description: I really, really, really like the word "harlot" so I really, really, really wanted to like this bar more than I did.  But it's just okay.  I mean it's a bar, it has a nicely sized interior, ample seating, good tunes, decent booze, clean bathrooms, attractive furnishings, decent crowd.  It's just not exciting? memorable? I dunno...SOMETHING isn't floating my boat as much as other places.  I mean, I'll come back but I'm not gonna seek it out.  I liked the pics of the women on the walls and tables but it seems to me that there should be a representation of harlots throughout history.  You know...Mae West, Hester Prynne, early Madonna, me.  Yeah...where the hell is MY picture.  I'm TOTALLY a harlot.
author: Jill D.

description: This place has a cool layout and decor. the upstairs with a bar and lounges make for a comfy hangout as you can gaze on the main floor at the people below drinking, socializing and on occasion dancing. the music was good, the people could have been more involved in the music but I'm sure on a Friday Saturday night it gets more popping (I came on a Wednesday for Cinco de Drinko). Overall I'd definitely come back and check it out on its prime nights.
author: S. M.

description: I wish I can give this place Negative starts. I can't believe the bouncers/owners think they are hot $hit and only let girls into the place. It's so stupid and over priced too. I would never waste your tim ein this $hit hole EVER! We live in SF not LA so hopefully one day those dumb Harlot owners will realize.
author: Nir B.

description: I guess i'm not cool enough for this club. So I'd have to say this place sucks. I can't believe they turned down our party bus. They would have had more business that night. At least my gf got to take a piss along with all her girlfriends and right after that we all left the club. I wish I could rate this club negative stars but i'll give them 1 star since they did let the girls take a piss. So in my opinion I would rate this club 1 star but 5 stars for a great place to piss.
author: Christian T.

description: Pretty chic place. Cheeky, but sleek decor. The sparkly floor and cowhide chairs are standouts. The bartenders were totally accomodating to the lovely hectic-ness that's involved at a Yelp event. They were sleekly dressed to with those sexy bodices. I really enjoyed the 209 gin cocktails that were on the menu. Like any sexy harlot it was tart with a hint of honeyed sweetness. The second floor was a bit small for me, but I'm sure makes for a great getaway from the dancefloor if you just want an intimate loungey night with good friends.
author: Farah S.

description: OK, OK, I have fun everywhere I go...It's a terminal wellness of mine, but damn, Harlot was fun.  My girlfriends and I got tragically skanked up and it paid off because we got to cut in line (sorry fellas, 4 chicks trumps even a 3:1 girl:guy ratio).  I was able to boob my way to the bar in no time at all and the bartendress happily dumped out several ounces of tequila for my ladies and myself.  We danced, we people-watched, we socialized.  The crowd was awesome at worst...Everyone was friendly and the whole energy of the place was very positive.  As a matter of fact, I had so much fun last night, I'm putting myself on house arrest tonight to give my liver a chance to recover.  Good suggestion Phil and Frisco!
author: ellyk E.

description: that place sucks and I will never go back.  Barbacks who wish they were bartenders was very rude.  I ended up cussing everyone out and out the door I went.  They do not have a full bar by the way either!!!!!
author: Ishtar P.

description: One of my fav places to visit club wise in san fran.  Like the artwork and the vibe!!! Go HARLOT!!
author: C S.

description: I was completely unimpressed with Harlot.  A few months ago I helped plan a bachlorette party and Harlot was on the list of potential places, I heard it was the new hot spot in SF.  Boy am I glad we did not go there.  This place is small, teeny-tiny, if we were playing 20 Questions "Is it larger than a bread box?" I'd answer no.  The crowd was LA, fashionable young ladies in fake leather leggings hovering on the dance floor.  I use hover because they couldn't dance in their super high heels.  The door guys, well put it this way, when it comes to attitude, there is nothing worse than a Jersey girl who moves to NY.  This is coming from a Jersey girl, we know attitude when we see it.  We showed up and were let in immediately. It was because we were three girls.  The bouncer specifically asked, just you three girls, right??  Standing in front of the velvet rope was a crowd of guys trying to get in, trying is key.  The place was a quarter full, maybe a third.  I was flabbergasted, ugh typical LA club bulls**t.  When we left 15 minutes later some girl in a small dress was begging the bouncer to let in her guy friends, but its my birthday she whined.....the bouncer held strong, no!  It was ridiculous, I guess having guys stand outside losing their integrity by the second is worth more than 5 guys in your 1/4 filled club buying drinks.  These people actually wanted to be there, we did not!  No I will not be going back.  It has potential but they need to lose the attitude and find a way to grab more space.  By the way the bottle minimum for the tables is a complete rip off, go to Mr. Smiths, you get more space, one bottle minimum and better music.
author: Kristin Marie S.

description: Well, so far I think Harlot lives up to its namesake quite nicely - very prettily tarted up with too many people inside her. Maybe when all the pre-opening grand openings quiet down, the lady will show a bit more discernment.
author: wendella a.

description:
Harlot was the worst experience I've had in the eight years I have been living in San Francisco. 

Harlots thinks it is upscale but it is not. The bar is just a bar, nothing fancy, no exotic drinks, the DJs were average, the sound system was pathetic and the service was below sub-par. Nothing about Harlot reflected the cost of reserving a table.

Though it tries to be, it is not Miami. Well the whole reserving a table is concept copied from Miami, but they should have copied the entire philosophy behind doing so. In Miami, the clubs always treat their guests with respect and consideration. If you have every been in Miami, you know what I'm talking about. And let's face it, this busted ass bar in SOMA that is failing; just look at all the reviews.

The Harlot is just not worth it.  We had a $500 table and were treated like second class citizens. We were threatened by a regular at the club and mistreated by the bouncers... not really a fun evening for a small group trying to have a good time. 

Next time you are looking to have a good time, I recommend a different venue. The Harlot is a waist of money, and they treat you poorly. No body in our group will ever return.
author: Fausto G.

description:
I don't enjoy kicking it at spots which are frequented by 45 yr old women with nose jobs looking for dudes who think rocking a rolex is a pass to get some left over ass and further spread more STD's into our wonderful population. 

YES, as far as the location and decor of this place is concerned, it is very nice. I will give it that much and thats why it gets a 2. However that does not make up for the rest of the losers up in there... yuppie central.. calling all yuppies to the plate...

Oh and if you think Im joking, just check it out.. no cover.. you aint got nothing to lose right?
author: Jay D.

description: We TRIED to come here on Halloween, we did all the appropriate RSVP-ing well in advance and were turned down at the door and told we were not on the list.
author: N S.

description: I went dancing here last night night with some friends, we got there somewhere around midnight, nice little place, DJ was good, there was a good mix of people, the VIP room upstairs was ok, not really all that "VIP" but all in all a good place, I would go back there again.
author: C J.

description:
As a long time SF resident I can't even tell you how happy I am for all the 1-star reviews of this place.
As far as I'm concerned Harlot is doing their job right.

Seriously- who wants a party bus full of idiots running around pretending like they have 3k in their pocket ?/?

After reading all the reviews the only truly negative ones are from people who couldn't get in. And that's a good thing.

Well, guess what - this place kicks ass without you.
...and please ...
keep saying how much it sucks. 
I beg you...tell your friends too.


Update:
Ha-ha. 
No, I'm not a bouncer nor do I work for Harlot in any way.
Although I do enjoy my nightlife as douche-free as possible. My apologies to Ryan C and all your butt-hurt friends but I'm sure there's an Olive Garden somewhere that would just love to take your $25,000 whether they were half full or not. A hot shot like you could have a REAL  PARTY there! That would definitely teach those Harlot guys a lesson!!

As for these ridiculous 'racist' comments - if you knew anything about SF nightlife you would know that not only are Harlot's owners the most successful club promoters of the past 20 years but one is Black, another Middle Eastern and a third is Latino.

Get a life!
author: Christian D.

description: I had never really been "clubbing" at a pick-u spot before. I've showered 93 times since, and I will never get the filth of this place off of me. I never felt like that kind of guy who looked down on club people, until I came here. Jcrew wearing suburban dbags as far as the eye can see!
author: Michael H.

description:
Not being familiar with the SF nightlife scene/club/lounge/whatever else you have, my friend suggested that we go here.  I was all over Yelp prior to taking the Office out for our conference week in SF, and I gotta say - the SF Yelpers are harsh. There are not too many 4 stars and above, so I thought this place would be okay. 

Well we went with a big group from our company, and we really had no problem getting in. When we got in, the ambiance was great. There were burlesque dancers dancing along the walls and the DJ posted at the back stage(?) of the club. It fit the name well, and I liked it.  We got our drinks really fast, and I had no idea regarding price cause someone else in our group picked up the tab. The house music that was spinning wasn't really my type, but I think most people enjoy it. And most were having a good time.  The VIP door guy let us upstairs cause we were all Texas exes, so that was cool of him.  But the VIP area wasn't too bumpin if you ask me. But the lure of "VIP" made us go upstairs anyway. 

The only reason I give this place 2 stars is mainly cause the door guys were really getting on my nerves. Two of my friends who weren't part of our original group and came separately later on ended up waiting at the door for-EVER it seemed like. There was no reason they should've waited for that long outside when there was NO line and not too many people inside. They were told they weren't on the elusive "guest list" which we weren't on upon entry either.  I think the only reason was because they were guys and on their own. I'm not sure if this is characteristic of SF clubs/lounges, but I thought it was quite ridiculous. I know some clubs in Houston often don't let groups of guys in (mainly my Asian guy friends), but I was disappointed in a SF venue to do so. I guess cause I have some elevated perception of the city's weekend scene versus that of the weekend scene in Houston. They eventually got in, but mainly cause we had to beg the guy to let him in, and my other friend's friends showed up as well and the guy was a local DJ who was on the guest list. 

I'd probably go back on a hip-hop night and with plenty of girls in tow to ensure entrance.
author: Jen T.

description: I came here for HH during dinner time on a Friday night. Not completely packed but enough patrons. The drinks are pretty cheap, there's space to sit if you don't want to stand. The only weird thing is when they transition it to a club/lounge and the security guards make you get up and move. Then you move to other seats, and you have to move from those. Very weird. Still had a good time for the most part.
author: Jeanne C.

description: Dark, seductive, love the decor.  We got in through the backdoor from Townhall(????).  We were there early so it wasn't crowded at all.  The drinks were strong enough, not watered down.  Tiny spot.  If you want to grab drinks with a few friends for happy hour, I think this is the perfect spot.  I have yet to check out the club scene.
author: Abby E.

description: I went here to crash a business event because it was an open bar. Walking up to the space, I never knew it existed. it's located in a small alleyway next to some large dock.  Anyway, it was an uninspiring space filled with boring decor.  Nothing about it made it special except for the fact that it appears a lot of businesses hold their special events there. (probably the only reason they still are open).  I wouldn't go back if I had to pay for drinks.
author: Jade L.

description: review for drinks during early evening like 6pm on friday.. came here for drinks on a friday night and left before it turned into a club, for which im glad. i was definitely not looking for that type of scene! it was definitely not as crowded as the pictures im looking at. but it was a good place to grab a few drinks with some co-workers cause they had tables and seating. they also serve pita bread and hummus for free!!! :)
author: Jen S.

description: Behind the bus station, along the alley, stands Harlot...waiting for you to walk by.  Once in front of her, you're drawn in by her charm.  She reeks of sex and sweat...oh, it's only because there's 100's of hawt people that have arrived before you.  She knows how to pack 'em into her large space.  Her two levels split the crowd nicely.  She's big on making people feel cozy.  There's room to stretch...to dance...to mingle.  Her staff is there to 'service' you with a smile. Her libations easily can make you fall for her.  My 1st time with her was an enjoyable experience.  I'll be back to visit this Harlot for some more...you know...quality time.
author: JeFF T.

description:
ugh. i don't go places where i have to wait in line and beg to get in.

this place was obviously way to cool for me.

so cool that they were having a sorority and fraternity t-shirt party. fun.

i turned around and walked away, never to return
author: Kate Y.

description: I went there for my b-day recently and they pretty much ruined the beginning of my night.  I understand what there trying to do with the guy vs. girl thing but when its 10:00 and freakin empty, why would you hate on letting guys in????? Whatever so they have a $500 bottle service minimum, ok..... so..... why not let guys in!!!! Theyre the ones that spend most MONEY!!!!!!!! WTF!!!!!!!!! If people wanna spend money at ur place, let em in!!!!!!
author: Marina R.

description: A good time!  Decor is neat, I've yet to pay any cover charge or wait more than 5 minutes to get in.  Music is so-so, bartenders are good about making sure you don't wait too long.  Places to sit, places to smoke, and the bathrooms aren't too shabby.  The crowd is friendly enough, though it does get crowded and hot!  I like the nice touch of the bartenders wearing corsets, and the paid dancers are a nice add to the ambiance when they're there.
author: Corey C.

description: Lucky me, I'd flown in from Boston at just the right time for SF yelp's elite to show me a wicked good time. The bartenders were considerate while still working hard for our complimentary drinks - and they were hot. Loved the corset look and the overall neo-burlesque style. The next time I'm back in town I will have to attend their new happy hour. Alas, I fly back tonight to the town with no happy hour.
author: Babs P.

description: Very nice interior but that is about it has going for it. I can get overpriced drinks in a pretty place almost anywhere in this neighborhood.
author: Alexis B.

description:
Fire the doormen. They're jerks. 

The main problem I have with this joint is that it tries to act like a Vegas or LA club, and it ain't. It's in a friggin alley! 

If you want a douchy-filled place, go on ahead. Guys, if you arrive dressed casually, you'll be turned away. 

Better options nearby: John Collins, Zebulon, Stefs, anything but this crapshoot.
author: Jeremy A.

description: Dark enough not to care about all the "tools"...that lurk in the shadows.  Luckily I went to hear our friend from Australia spin for the OM party...it was fantastic.  I wouldn't go back unless it was for a dj I couldnt wait to see................
author: Shelly S.

description: I'd been unctuous to see what Martel and Nabiel had been up to all those times in their clandestine meetings at Sushi Groove South, and I'm glad to report they've outdone themselves. An upscale bar that feels like home (provided your home came furnished with the hottest girls in SF wearing corsets). My primary concern once I walked through the door based on the look of it was that it would be attitude all the way, but the staff was amazingly friendly and courteous, the bartenders were swift and catered to the likes of me just as quickly as they did for the beautiful people. The sound was fantastic, and the DJ set up is ideal. I could not be more impressed nor could I give any higher rating to this wonderful new venue in the San Francisco nightlife scene.
author: Tal K.

description: Very cool philipe starck-ish/kelly wearstler style decor. The lighting during the early evening was a little off- but overall you feel like you have arrived. As an event planner I think the space is great for dancing or whatever. I just wish less marina crowd- but it seems that is the only people who like to go out to swanky bars
author: Lindsey S.

description: BOOOOO! The bouncers didn't let my friends in because they were wearing sandals.  This place is pretencious and lame!
author: Natalie S.

description: The crappiest party with the crappiest organizer ever!!! It was a DJ Donovan Event....I hated being there outside the door for 2 hours literally from 8-10 to be told that they are not letting any brown guys in!!! The bouncers were racist and rude...the host had no clue why they had confirmed so many people on the guest-list when all the people that they were letting in were their close friends in fancy cars...lol...This was seriously a bad place to be with everyone coming out of there saying the place inside sucks monkey balls too with lotion on it...My wife had gone in to call friends and we had to wait miserably outside as she could not come out...she said the place was not even that packed...but the bouncers kept saying it was...lol...NEVER AGAIN going to a Donovan event...NEVER EVER!! I would advise you all to stay away too if you do not want to ruin a perfectly good night or simply do not waste your time!!! There are much better places in the same area to go to but this one...
author: Munazzar T.

description: I like the "trees" it makes the place have a nice little ambiance. The music started off pretty good but like alot of clubs around 1:30 am they play only house so you know it is time to start to wind down. It is pretty dressy and nice older crowd. I would probly go back again soon.
author: Ashley H.

description:
If I could give it 2 1/2 stars I would.  This place started out great. It wasn't as crowded the music was fun I could get a drink.  Then it started to get to the point where I couldn't move, every square inch was soak in alcohol because of these benches that were placed in weird places and people kept tripping over them and the bar sitch was wack!  I kept going up to the same girl that had served me when it wasn't that crowded and I went to get my final round and close out.  I was actually going to kick it up a few notches because I kind of couldn't take being shoved around anymore.  I waited for what must have been a half hour, it seemed like she helped everyone but me.  It became quite clear that if you knew her, you were golden.  I finally snapped at her when I swear she was going to help the guy beside me who had rolled up maybe a minute ago.  She couldn't understand why I was peeved....because I've wasted my part time standing here like a chump!  tried to tell me it was crowded but I had had it.  Told her to close my tab out and I left shortly after that.  

I can't explain it but there is something in the design where it if it is crowded and you're petite, forget it, you will never be seen or able to move to the front of the bar.  Aside from that the music was great and the place in itself it nice.  I would only go back for a group event...like the place has been rented out for charity or something.
author: Kirsten M.

description:
My boyfriend works at the parking lot right across from this place. He always gave the bouncers free parking. After the way one of the assholes treated me, not anymore.

If I could give half a star, I would. My first time coming to this place, not bad. Horrible music but they made killer kamikazes and I got in with no complaint. The second time, some asshole with glasses says I look like I'm 12 (uhm. that's just rude) and after scanning my ID for a minute suddenly says "oh we're full", but would let in any slut with dresses barely covering their asses and tits hanging out. The next time the same thing happened, one bouncer said he remembered me however the asshole from the week before once again said I looked like I was 12. I'm sorry I'm not prancing around looking like a hooker just so you can let me into your club. The manager came out this time and my boyfriend argued for a good 10 minutes about how rude one of the bouncers was to me and I interrupted and told him it was bad service and I find it ridiculous you let your employees make comments to people wanting to go into your club and I would rather take my business (and all my friends as well) somewhere else where people can be treated like human beings.
Inexcusable. Mr.bouncer with glasses that make you look like you're trying to look 20 years younger than you are, you disgust me.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Such a mixed bag for me....

I wish the bouncers would just tell me they're not going to let me in unless I can find 12 girls and it's before 11 pm.  No, instead they let me stand and just physically move me to the side whenever a girl walks up without even making eye contact with me.  My friend really went off on one of them one night and I can truly understand why.

Anyway, if you're part of the elite or have two X chromosomes, you''ll be fortunate enough to get inside and discover a very nice place to drink, dance, and mingle.  Music is usually pretty well-mixed and the interior is hip.  Crowd tends to be a little older and more well-dressed in my opinion.  

+4 once you get inside but I have to downgrade it for the fact that I've spent nearly an equal amount of time outside Harlot's front door as I have inside it.
author: Zach K.

description: Super pretentious and euro trash haven.  Stay away.  The staff are all pr*cks and unfriendly at all.  Ummm sorry I thought business were open to make money???  I'll take my hard earned cash somewhere else!
author: Steven T.

description: A friend wanted to check this place out based on its reviews on yelp.  All I can say is if you're not on the guest list, don't bother.  We were next in line to get in, waited 15 minutes while dozens of guest listers walked in, and when we asked the bouncer if he'd be letting in any more people the rest of the night, he said "It's hard to tell." This was at 11 pm!  Also, the female bouncer was overheard snapping "Don't ever touch my rope again" to some clubbers trying to exit the bar.  Talk about a power trip! =P
author: Jim B.

description:
i wouldn't normally review a place i haven't actually been in....

but here goes.  this place was definitely allllllll about themselves.  if you want to feel wronger than wrong, try being a hot girl and not getting into the club on a sat. night in sf while the following freaks parade in freely:

1. vegas style hookers -spangly and fakey-boobed
2. euro-trash - (is that not pc?)these guys in tight ass jeans flick their ashes all over my friend and then look down their nose like "for why for you in da way of ma freegin ashes"
3. the bee-gees - i kid you not, these dudes had the hair, the clothes, glasses, beards.  i really wasn't sure i wanted to go after seeing that and nearly puking on my shoes
4. the hipster - looking grungy in a trucker hat and all, he had a line of 20 trashy friends that all got in despite the fact that harlot was "full"
5. the fire department - who were hotter than the other people they let in. and gave us the genius idea to call the FD on any other club that makes you wait out in the cold like a lesser species.  mynt & mokai in miami, you have it coming.

and the door guy threw a big dramatic prissy hissy fit about how "noone would get in unless we STOPPED trying to get in" which we weren't getting in anyway, and only ruined our chances of getting in further because we were laughing and pointing at the ridiculousness.  anyhoo, i'm sure it's a good looking club on the inside as my friend tells me, but i'm definitely glad we ended up at the less freak-ified john collins around the corner....except for the guy that touched my butt and the other dude in the hawaiian shirt who had obviously just wandered over from harlot
author: Nicole M.

description:
I AM NOT A CLUB PERSON. I WILL ADMIT THAT IT'S POSSIBLE I DISLIKE CLUBS IN GENERAL AND AM NOT, AS SUCH, GIVING HARLOT A FAIR ASSESSMENT. CAVEAT LECTOR, Y'ALL.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
We went here specifically to hang out with a DJ one rainy Saturday night, my fiance's BFF from when they were about 7, so we were spared the waiting in line/$$$ drinks/cover charge routine, which was pretty awesome.
We were NOT spared:
1. Ruder than necessary bouncers. Hi! It's pouring, and there's NO ONE waiting in your line. Care to stop pretending we're invisible and chatting on your cellphone for a moment and let us in? We're cold, wet, and not here to watch your sweet telephone skills. Thanks.
2. The cougar den. Could the surgically-taut, hyper-bronzed "woman of a certain age" with giant fake hoots please stand up? No, the other 28 of you sit down, I'm talking to the one in the ill-advised leather vest, flailing "sensuously" all over the DJ setup, shoving your cameraphone in the DJ's face and shrieking. Hi. I'm not trying to vag-block your game, Mama, I'm just watching my man's pal do his job. Please stop glaring, "accidentally" elbowing me, and flipping your extensions in my face, I don't think this DJ likes his broads skanky, mean, plastic, or older than his Mom anyway. Thanks!
That said, the rest of the crowd seemed to be rockin' out (especially the confusingly Senatorial looking guy absolutely FEELING IT in his three piece suit), we got free drinks, the ambiance was pretty sweet, and the music was fun. So, next time I'm in SF, I wouldn't go to Harlot if I wasn't getting in free and drinking for free  - again, I'm not a club person. And it's probably not fair to review a pretty scene-looking place on a Saturday during cougar season, right? But I went there and my head didn't explode and I wasn't assaulted by the striped shirt mafia. 
The end.
author: G Q.

description:
went back on a friday night and i have to downgrade.  the music was unacceptable and the bar was incredibly slow which was surprising because they don't have much of a mixed drink menu.  a friend wanted a mojito and they couldn't make it.  i tried a lemon drop that was disgusting.  it's still pretty but that's it.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
i had a great time at harlot last night.  the space was lovely with a lot of seating.  the upstairs lounge was cool too but i'm glad i wore pants.  it was kind of hot when i got there but i got over it.  

i'm not a fan of gin but i tried the special drinks of the evening to be polite, of course.  they were fine, particularly the one with honey, although depending on which bartender made them, they tasted like completely different cocktails.  i'm still not on team gin but i don't feel sick today so i don't hate it anymore.

i met a lot of cool people and saw a guy do the worm multiple times, in business casual clothes, i think.  how could i not love it?
author: Seong P.

description:
i stepped in for happy hour, place was pretty lame. about 30 peeps there, the music was boring, like everyone in there. a fight broke, with punches flying...some "asian" dude pickin' on another "asian" dudes woman -whatever!

the space itself is well-done and gorgeous! i wanted to see Ben Watt a couple of nites ago, just could not make it. i would imagine the show must have been real good, the interior offers the perfect look and mood for his type of music.

i would really ding this place, b/c i was on the "guestlist" once and waited for over 30 mins, then left (Fri nite, two guys, bad move on our part i know) granted we arrived late ~midnite, the place was already overflowing with hott women. the reality is, unless you are 8-10 on the looks/body scale, lucks not on your side boys and girls. better pick another destination to party at.

as i mentioned, im not knocking this down only b/c of M&N and business is business, so i totally understand. unless there is a hot act scheduled, i will not be making my rounds here. too many other options in the city.
author: Sha A.

description: I love this new place....Dark, Sexy, Cool...great design, love the exposed steal beams with the original "Carnegie"  brand on it...intimate sitting areas, enough room to walk around and explore...nice outdoor smoking area....great upstairs area to scan the crowd.....great selection of spirits, all the brands I love......BIG thanks to Jacek, the architect and designer......did I tell you how much I love this place?
author: Brenda D.

description: I've heard a lot about this place and finally got a chance to check it out after my company holiday party at the W. My group didn't have any issues with the door staff on a Friday night around 10:30ish...they were actually pleasant. The venue is great! I love the look and the vibe was good. The ladies restroom was by far one of the cleanest club bathrooms I've ever been in! The only downside was the atrocious DJ. He had absolutely no skill in his music selection! Would definitely check this place out again in hopes of catching a better DJ.
author: Krystal C.

description: I mist have gone here during a bad night. This place is nothing but stripey shirted guys from another planet. You know the type. I saw a girl get harassed and shoved to the ground by one of those guys and the bouncers didn't do anything. It seems even the staff doesn't like the crowd this place attracts. The whole gettin in if you wear a skirt or know the bouncer. Or else you line up. I was in quick for an office party, but I wanted to get out as fast as I can once I saw the vibe inside.
author: Esso E.

description: I went to Harlot when it first opened for my friend Sophia's birthday.  When I walked in, I was immediately impressed with the place- I liked the ambiance, decor, lighting and the exotic art on the wall.  It's very LA-ish, artzy, crazy, loud, and unique.
author: Michelle F.

description: I have mixed thoughts on this place.  Cool location and surprisingly friendly door man which is the face of the club.  Tiny inside but that adds to its charm.  I wasn't drinking so no first hand experience with the bartenders.  Music wasn't great but more on the night than anything I imagine. Good energy so all and all pretty fun.  Only bad thing was a few super nasty observations of a cocktail waitress.  Problem #1, the place is tiny so its going to suck to walk through with a tray or anything all night.  Problem #2, waitress needs to walk across dance floor to get to tables.  How is that going to be a recipe for success?  Granted I'd be unhappy if I had to deal with that but then again I wouldn't cocktail because of things that make up the job in general.  None of which is acceptable for a patron to experience or observe.  I'm the first to say, "asshole, just add alcohol." SO thoughts for staff or mgt, if you don't like your work environment or you don't have the patience or flexibility to deal with drunk dancers...GET A NEW JOB and save the patrons the experience and save the mgt. having the whole world read about their nasty cocktail servers.
author: Todd O.

description:
Thank you Harlot,

For no cover charge

For awesome go-go dancers

For supplying me with a plethora of cute guys to buy my friends and I drinks 

For playing some of the best hip hop tunes and allowing me to shake my ass all night on the dance floor like it's nobody's business

You rock!
author: Brenna C.

description: Not fun. We left after like 2 minutes of being there. We got there and it was super crowded which is usually great for a dance club environment, but not when all the people are complete douche bags. My guy friend accidently got knocked into some dude at the bar and he tried to fight him... then there were these means girls... All the guys were all doing the button stripped shirt and jeans look (marina district style) and all the girls looked like coked out whores. Not impressed.
author: heather m.

description: This place could have been cool, except the fire marshall showed up and shut the place down. People wouldnt leave and the nerdy doorman (think Sanford from Sex in the City) got into a hissy fit with some guy still trying to get in after the fire trucks showed up. We ended up leaving. Not sure I would go back....the LA door thing just doesnt work in San Francisco in my opinion (I just moved here from LA)...but people were definitely going for it at Harlot.
author: susan c.

description: Ummm. No cover is good but not good enough to overcome the senior citizen crowd. Please lets dress up and pretend we are in hollywood or pure(in vegas). Please its the SOMA. Music was OK. But i hate feeling like i look like the waitstaff.
author: Chris L.

description: It was my first time coming here last night, and I must say, I had a blast!  A friend of mine was hosting the event, so we had no problems getting in on her list :) The bartenders are all very nice and the crowd seemed pretty cool as well.  I'm not sure what the other review about the two-way mirrors is about, because I didn't see anything of that sort while I was there yesterday.  Perhaps they changed it?  Anyway, I would love to come back here again!
author: Karen P.

description: I was actually kinda disappointed coming here for NYE. The lines outside moved fast and we really didn't need those stupid tickets that ticketgroove said that we did. But...they totally didn't live up to their promise of a free champagne toast and their NYE countdown was LAME.
author: Natalie S.

description:
"You Know I'm no Good" should be Harlot's tagline. Amy Winehouse's dark, soulful sound totally meshes with the sexy, sensuous feel of Harlot. Harlot feels badass. You know she's probably not coming home to meet your parents (black leather and naked paintings and corsetted bartenders oh my), but she definitely makes you want to keep coming back for more.

I love New York, and Harlot is the closest I've gotten to it in a really long time. Even the Studio 54-style survival of the fittest line was in place. Oh the nostalgia. On Saturday past 11:30, don't bother coming with greater than a 1:1 guy to girl ratio unless you're prepared to bribe the doorman. (Tip: it helps to bring a girl wearing a low cut top, pull it down a little further than it was meant to go, and get her to stand with her chest pushed out next to the rope. It's not subtle, but you'll be inside in no time). 

I loved the fact that the lovely DJ not only was nice enough to dig through his music collection to find my alltime favorite song Hiphip Chinchin, but actually mixed it amazingly with another techno song. It was heaven. Do you even know how hard that song is to find? The DJ was so good, I was dancing for 2 hours and didn't even notice how much time had passed. For all the people complaining about the lack of dancing, all it takes is a couple of people tearing it up out there for the entire club to decide it's cool.

Did I mention they took my request for a chocolate martini with nary a "what?" "how do you make that?" "does that involve chocolate syrup?". That definitely propelled Harlot into its last star. Anywhere that can make my favorite drink without even a quickly suppressed questioning glance has me for life.

Positives: No "a bay bay" here, or "damn girl" or "hey shawty." If you feel neglected in that area, Suite 181 will fix you right up.

Negatives: The reason people aren't hollering is because they're too self-conscious to risk rejection.

Also, note to the girls: on Thursday, Harlot's pretty dead so beware the multitude of older men (think 40ish) attempting to be your sugar daddy. A quick "nice wedding ring" should do the trick.

Well done, martel & nabiel.
author: Lisa V.

description: I can handle the "tacky, STD-ridden slice of the LA clubbing scene" - going out should really be about spending time with your girls, not the atmosphere, right? However, what I can't handle are the penurious pours of Oban.
author: Tai N.

description: Lovely decor, huge ladies room, good house white wine, great smoking area, very nice bouncer.  Kinda unattentive not-too-friendly bartenders, lack of anywhere to sit.
author: Jenny K.

description: It seems the reviewers for this place are divided into those who got in versus those who didn't.  Me and my buddies got in (because we showed up super early).  The decor was interesting, the music was fun (lots of old school...you 30 year olds out there recognize it from when we were in high school), and the drinks were typically priced.  It is definitely a scene, so be prepared for a little slice of LA in SF.  Also, the doormen do seem like pricks - they gave me and my buddy a little guff for not being dressed up enough, but still let us in.  I could definitely see how this place would have some serious attitude, but it wasn't so bad the Friday I was there.
author: Curtis H.

description:
It was my sister's b-day night out thing and we were eating at Osha's on 2nd.  I thought it would have been a good idea to get drinks at Harlot because it was so close.  There was about 16 of us, but my sister and I went before the group to check it out.  The man with the clipboard was like "is it just you two" we said no.  He saw our group coming towards us and was like "yah for a large group you need a table service."  He tells us we need to pay $1,000 to get in.  WTF.  we just want drinks.  So, we ended up leaving and headed to the club we planned on going to in the first place.  Is this normal?  I've been here before and I didn't get any trouble, but it was a thursday night as opposed to a saturday.  
This place is a nice venue and I enjoyed my first time there.  Unfortunately, they suck.
author: Aureen A.

description: Dark, vampy and goth. Wasn't feeling the music, but oh well. Love the decor and the theme! The upstairs lounge was a cleaner, crisp sexy version of the rest of the club. Their website is more badass than the club however. Alot of old white poeple who can't bust a move on the dancefloor for shit. LoL. I got some good laughs out of it though.  :)
author: Miss Jessica S.

description: My friends and I had a great time until about 11...when it turned into what it is (a pretentious club).  3 stars for the DJ, nice bartender, and clean bathrooms.
author: Julie F.

description: I came here once over the summer with some friends.  It was a good time!  I really liked the music mix -- sometimes you need the 80s to sing along to instead of having some weirdo come start dancing behind you.  anyway, it was a fun time and I would definitely come here again.
author: F K.

description:
Sharing the same building as Salt House, Harlot promises to be a great new addition to the area. I love the theme of it - gothic themed with all the perfect components: two bars (one upstairs and downstairs) a closed in smoking room, fireplace - the tables are very cool. Giant photos of burlesque type ladies on them.  And the bathrooms are quite interesting as well - even a two way mirror in the ladies room so you can check out what is going on inside the club. 
A perfect mid-sized lounge type of space, very cozy but still room to dance, dark enough to be sexy - mezzanine to check out the action below. The design is perfect.
I think the fate of this place will depend on the crowd it attracts...Opening night was a blast, but because it had all the right people. Hopefully not too many cheeseballs invade it once the word is out. But considering the owners, I have high hopes that Harlot will keep up the good work!
author: Melissa W.

description: I came in with my girlfriend for a fun night. Her drink had a cockroach in it. When I brought this up to the bartender I was ignored.  Harlot offers bad service and even worse hygiene.  With so many other great spots in SF, you can find a much better one.
author: Ilona B.

description:
how did i like harlot? hardly a lot
sure is the hottest lounge in sf, not
models standing around with grey goose in hand
the absolut model of all i cant stand

the main room decor all decked out in black
personally i think personality it lacks
the view to the girls room is cool i suppose
too bad they all had nothing exposed
author: James L.

description: Good spot. Some issues: Is that it gets waaaaay too crowded - to the point where you can't go anywhere.  My suggestion would be that they actually put those door men to use and keep people waiting outside in the line for a legitimate reason such as the place actually being over capacity instead of keeping people waiting outside when there is no one inside and when I can do a bunch of cartwheels & jumping jacks on the dance floor....I don't get that one.  Took a while to get a drink and I don't care how busy your bar is, you damn well better be able to handle a crowded bar...either that or get some more people behind the bar.  My personal favorite was when the two bartenders were farting around gabbing behind the bar instead of making drinks...unacceptable.  Get it together!  Once you do, I just might bump you up one more star.  On a different note, the DJs weren't half bad.
author: Danielle V.

description: Great place, good DJs, awesome dancing and a good crowd in general :) Ton's of fun on Saturday night, good drinks, good vibe. Definitely it's a place to meet a lot of cool people! :) And... lots of yummy guys :)))
author: Joan A.

description:
Just got home from the opening party....the space itself is impressive.  The design is a welcome departure from the quasi "modern" safe and uninspired dentist office type look that is so common.  Really nice attention to detail on some of the materials.  Dark goth style abounds--you can find a corner to be a bastard.

The size if perfect for SF....it mimics the size of our city: med/small.  Does not take a lot of people to make it feel warm and happening.  

And a smoking room!  It is inside too....but has a door to the outside ....and the whole room is glass so you dont feel sequestered.

All in all this place has great potential....we'll see what happens.

I just hope the Douches stay away for a while.
author: Papandreou A.

description: Yeah, it's a problem when I have more male friends than female.  Most nights they won't let you in unless you've got an equal guy:girl ratio, and even then, sometimes they won't let guys in at all.  I have ditched my buddies one too many times at the door that they no longer go out with me, haha.  Once inside, the music's usually great!!!. Bartenders are great! and the crowd is usually good, too. Always a good time here!
author: Christine Y.

description: When I heard the ratio expectation here was 2 women for  1 man I thought to myself ..." For Harlot? Isn't this the place where I heard them play Britney Spears -Toxic  their opening month and proceeded my way across to John Colins like a bat out of hell ? " Skeptical as I was, I went ahead and booked a table for my friend's birthday. We arrived 13 women in total and the staff informed us that they "gave our table away". Blank stares exchanged and I felt a strange overwhelming sense of relief. At the very least, the staff could've comp us midori sours. Oh well.
author: Cin H.

description: Not much of a "lounge" atmosphere. Very nicely designed though. I was expecting a little more being that this is a place that Martel & Nabiel put together. In a lounge setting, generally the bar is much better stocked and the service is much better. I was disappointed.
author: Charise B.

description:
i like how this place looks inside, but the crowd is so so. i wouldnt go out of my way to come on a regular weekend night, but id be open to go for a weeknight hosted event here (i.e. the rumble).

I like to describe this place to friends as "Dracula's Techno Funeral". you'll know what i mean if you've been there.
author: Michael N.

description:
Good Day and Welcome to.......Let's Assume....

Let's Assume you go to Law School at GGU.  Where do you go for alcoholic beverages to drink your sorrows away at the misery of being stuck in school 24/7 for an extra 3 years...self-inflicted of course?
                 HARLOT
Okay, now let's assume you're a poor, starving and pathetic law student who is in dire need of an alcoholic beverages to drink your sorrows away at the misery of being stuck in school 24/7 for an extra 3 years...self-inflicted of course?
                  HARLOT ON WEDNESDAYS-FRIDAYS FOR HAPPY HOUR 
                  $3 Beers
So, let's now assume that you live in a hell hole and are in dire need of a luscious, seductive and passionate environment the exudes sexy and erotic just so you can numb you vanilla senses thus an accompaniment to the alcoholic beverages to drink your sorrows away at the misery of being stuck in school 24/7 for an extra 3 years...self-inflicted of course?
                    HARLOT....HARLOT....HARLOT...HARLOT...HARLOT
Door Security is really nice by the way!!!
author: Karen B.

description: Harlot has grown into one of my favorite spots in the city. Not too small, not too big, typically very good music. I've definitely been approached by some unsavory characters, but if I'm looking for a night of dancing with girlfriends this is one of my go-to spots.
author: Lindsey S.

description:
Oh Harlot, I keep coming back to you.

I've always had fun each time I've been to Harlot.. (Maybe it's because it's always after I've had a drink or two...or um, six....but nevermind that!) Harlot's a small place, but the music has been pretty good the times I was there. (Don't expect all hip hop..they mix it up with hip hop, 80's, and other stuff.) The decor in there is pretty cool too. Harlot's a good place to dance, drink, or just mingle. Make sure you check out the bar area upstairs, just note that it can get claustrophobic since it's tiny up there. At Harlot we always get our drinks quickly, and the last time we were there the girl bartender was nice enough to hold our drinks at the bar while we went to the restroom too. Friday night was crowded, but the good kind of crowded, not the annoying kind of crowded when you wanna kick someone for rubbing their sweat all over you on the dancefloor. We also ended up there on a Wednesday night after we left 111 Minna at 10pm and it was surprisingly crowded then too. I can see how if you happen to catch Harlot on a bad night it might suck, but just don't go on a bad night. :) You can always pop in to check it out and leave if the crowd's not great...there are other options in the area!

Oh Harlot, you have won me over. I think it might be love...
author: Felicia C.

description:
"I LOVE HARLOT!" is probably the first thing you will hear when asking about this Minna street  hot spot. 

And it's true... It's one of the few establishments that have/ had some potential as far as nightlife that come close to Vegas? or LA? in SF. (maybe I'm exaggerating).

I came here for a Hennessey Flaunt party.

There was some uneccessary security/ doorman business going down at the door, when we first arrived, not our group but some poor guys that were just looking to score...

The line was not long at all. I have no idea why these doormen bust their balls! Help the ratio in these goddamn places!!! Every hot woman you let in, will need her basket of eggs~ HELLLO?!??!! 
Luckily we were able to walk right through...

When I first walked in my heart was relieved to find a place that exuded sexiness on this part of town. The decor is rich & masculine, but feels very dark & sexy. It is a little small, but the crowd is beautiful and diverse... The deejay played the perfect mixture of house, soul, & international beats & everyone was giggin :)

They have a tiny smoke room at the entrance of the club which is more like a death chamber. The smoke, the sweat, the 30 people that try to fit in there will literally choke you. But, this is probably the only place to time out and actually hold a conversation with someone if you can tolerate it...

They only served henn that night- which I retired from years ago....& vowed never to return to... 

But it was quite a delight being challenged by the bartender as he  formulated such yummy sugary, pineapply surprises with henn and promised I'd love them.

5 drinks later...

I was in love with the place :)
author: James A.

description: Again I wish there was a minus star option, but this place SUCKS ASS!  We were there as guests of the performer and we have followed his career since he was just a humble guitar player with a dream.  If you are only going to let the sloppy drunks in first - bite my ASS and not in a good way.  I do not take kindly to those that take bribes from the overly pushy hoes this places seems to be interested in.  Therefore this San Franciscan will never ever be back.  If you venture to this place make sure to have a back up plan!
author: Colleen B.

description:
I have a love and hate relationship with Harlot. I typically look forward to coming here with my girlfriends, not so much because I love the place or the looks of it but compared to other clubs in the city- it's just better...
However after awhile of looking at people wearing the same hairstyles, same style of clothing, dancing the exact same dance moves- you start getting lost into the monotony of the place. Throw in the average percentage of bridge and tunnel folks and you just start getting queasy. After awhile it just didn't work out anymore, I stopped coming even though I have missed the place. I came her for Fembar it's on the first Sunday of the month, 4-10 (something like that) and saw Harlot meet her full potential. The staff at Harlot has never been the problem, always quick with the service, extremely nice, and funny too. Music was great, I hate dancing but I had to restrain myself from running out there like a fool (which I recently did at DNA, and The Bar)...;. Crowd was hot, diverse in every way, friendly and the overall energy was fun and later well.. uhm drunk...
author: Gracie A.

description: I tried booking a table for 50 here to celebrate my birthday.  First they tried to get me to book their entire upstairs lounge for $4000.  After I told them that was outside my budget, they blew me off and said they couldn't accommodate a group that large.  Awesome service, I'll do business elsewhere!
author: Kai S.

description: Nice venue, good crowd, lots of eye candy for men, and well hidden from the eyes of those who don't need to know where this place is. But, the music sucks hopelessly on most nights. This place deserves more than 80's and mainstream hip hop from the radio.
author: Eric A.

description: I went to the opening late last night around midnight. I was expecting to say hi to some friends catch up, and have a couple cocktails. I got there, and it was cray-zy. Lines out the door, doormen telling everyone to "calm down". So, obviously I snuck into the back door..once inside, the place is awesome. The decor is dark wood, sultry, exotic paintings, great lighting. The have these awesome chandeliers that are these like deer horns. And the music was great. I really want to come back in the next couple weeks for a more mellow night. Minus one star for being so hot inside. You don't need to bring a jacket.
author: Fallon F.

description:
I haven't written up many reviews on Yelp, but Harlot was so terrible that now I see the wonderfulness of Yelp.  Basically, if you have gone to any decent clubs in your lifetime, you will be disappointed by Harlot.

A group of my friends and I had a "VIP table" up on the second floor for a b-day.  After we went dancing on the first floor, my friends and I tried to go back up to our "VIP" table on the second floor, but the "guardian of the VIP area" wouldn't let some of my group back up---even though all of us had a "VIP" stamp, had been up on the 2nd floor for an hour before we decided to go dancing, etc etc etc.  

After the bouncer doesn't let my friends up, I basically tell the bouncer and the bartender  that we had paid for the table (had unfortunately already spent $1000)  and that we just wanted to go back to our table and enjoy what we had paid for. 

I swear on my life that I didn't say anything rude or yell at the guy  and all of a sudden, the bartender/bouncer guy goes CRAZY on me, starts yelling at me, and tells me to leave the club (I am a 5' 5" girl who weighs 110 lbs--I am sooooo NOT a scary person) .   I don't argue with the guy anymore but instead go get my stuff to leave, and the guys follows me upstairs with two other big guys and tell me to leave again ( which I'm already doing.)  I guess the guy cools down and tells me I can stay, but at that point, I am so annoyed that I just want to get as far away from them as I possibly can.  

Basically, if you want to be yelled at by the "guardian" of the VIP area"  and you want someone to go crazy on you for no apparent reason go to Harlot.
author: KC G.

description: Cool place for some partying after a night of drinking. It can get packed and loud though and sometimes the guys at the door are rude.
author: Siddhartha S.

description:
i wasn't feeling it from the second we walked passed the homeless-hut into the club. so, we went upstairs and, in an attempt to enjoy this place, threw back a few kettle-crans. first off, it didnt work--just gave me a headache. second off, the majority of the crowd was either locked in the bathroom (sniff sniff?) or a rude bitch. i was TRYING to get my way from point A to point B without spilling my drink on a group of girls wearing trashy-but-cute dresses. when they gave me attitude for trying to walk around them (sorry, princess) i told them i was just trying not to spill on them. and then they shot me the death glare. alright skankies.. maybe i'll accidentally drop my drink on you next time..

everyone with table service had a cocky stick up their ass, and i was over it. just cuz daddy pays your rent, doesn't make you better!!
author: Nancy P.

description: Girls in bustiers and black daisy dukes, oh my!  Actually, I just wanted to get one of those bustiers, hot stuff.  4 dollar well drinks during happy hour, lots of plush seating, friendly bartenders.  It's very black, gothy, sexy stylish for an alley in SoMa but as long as it doesn't fill up with cougars it's A-ok!  Anyway, I like the vibe, crowd here . . .  I'll definitely be back.
author: Elena S.

description: Ok so I went to Harlot last night with like 10 peeps and it was a pretty good ratio of guys to girls but when we got to the door our names were under the wrong list and then the bouncers were acting super uptight about one girl and one guy in at a time. We ended up all getting in together and headed up to our table which was pretty nice since we had bottle service but the entire feeling of the club was a bit pretentious without reason. It was a crazy mix of pushy creeps and unfashionable wannabees. I have been to far better clubs that aren't trying to be "too cool"
author: Theresa T.

description: As far as the space goes, I really like its neoclassic decor - it's modern yet sultry.  The Sat night crowd is a bit too meat market-like for me but that's not a reflection of Harlot as a venue.  For instance, when I went back for SF LDM (http://literarydeathmatch.com/Literary%20Death%20Match/Events.html)  on a week night, it was awesome!
author: Tiffany L.

description: I love the dark, semi-Gothic feel of the place. Right down to the antler chandeliers and semi-blasphemous pictures on the ceiling. Cheesy, I know. But I guess sometimes I need to get away from my Ikea looking apartment. The music can be really good or not so much. The dj last night would play like ten seconds of a really good song before mixing it with some obscure salsa music. It was pretty strange and we ended up leaving. But in general I have a good time here and also enjoy the lack of cover.
author: Cathy T.

description: Harlot can be hit or miss, but it's mostly been hits for me. The music is generally really fun (top 40, hip hop/pop, but with a DJ who knows what he's doing and some legit mash-ups) and there's no cover. Place is small though, and sometimes the bouncers can be real d-bags. Come early if there are guys in the group, but you're gold otherwise.
author: Richa A.

description:
So I debated for a bit on how many stars to give this place. If I would have stayed for 45 minutes, I would have given it 4. However, we stayed for a couple hours and I ended up giving it two.. Here is my opinion:
The place looks cool.. I liked the interior.. It is small..
The bartenders seemed nice... Good service.. The drinks were a little pricey. I think it was 10 bucks for a small redbull and vodka...
The vibe is good... Kind of hard to dance with so many people.
My problem was with door guy / pirate... The little, 5ft 6 bald guy has got to go... Too much attitude from a guy who is supposed to count how many people enter and leave a business... Give me a break... We went with a larger group of people and that guy will most likely be the reason we won't go back...Little guys like that who have a negative atitude drive me nuts...  There are so many places to go in the city.. We will look for another place yelp has to offer...
author: Joe B.

description: Harlot is superb on a good night. Lovely decor, no sleezes, service is proper. When the DJ is off it ruins the enitre vibe.
author: Samantha R.

description: Go on Saturday nights! We had a great time here with DJ Ean Golding in the mix, cool sophisticated crowd, and reasonably priced drinks! Very nice interiors too, love the dark/gothic theme and antler chandelier! Just come before 11 pm, it's a small club it gets full pretty fast! Don't blame the bouncers, they have limited capacity...they can't let everybody in ... it's for fire safety! And don't come in with sandals; this is not that kind of club! C'mon lets keep it classy! Please dress to impress!
author: Clarice A.

description: Kudos to the design team of Harlot.  The decor/look of the place is fantastic, rococo paintings mixed with antler chandeliers,  table tops with 70's style fotos of "come hither" women, plush hide seats...we were there  too early to accurate review the dj/dance scene, but the space is so intriguing looking  that it merits another visit.
author: Marina F.

description: The door staff is absolutely retarded.  Harlot doesn't deserve another chance.
author: Brandon B.

description: I love when SF tries to be NYC, A for effort. The art and decor holds my interest long enough for one drink. The music and staff are never consistent leaving me feeling like someone I've dated a few times who I wasn't really into. It reeks of corporate zombies during happy hour and bridge and tunnel wannabe scenesters later in the eve. Oh the best part of it is the amazing ocean front view...I mean the the buzzkillington alley with the transbay tent city terminal channeling a warzone.
author: dan T.

description:
I literally created a profile to write this review. I really like to party here. It's a beautiful venue, but like any place it certainly isn't perfect. 

But here is the deal. I've read a lot of reviews (read: whining) about this place by guys who can't seem to make it past the door. If what follows below seems a bit harsh I apologize. It's meant to be more of a cheat sheet than a slap in the face. 

1st off: Don't arrive at 8:30!!! There are plenty of places to "party" at this early. They're called dive bars. Go get a heater rolling at a hole in the wall THEN go to a club. You standing outside ANY club at 8:30 tells the bouncer that either you are clueless; or you think that the only way you're getting in is to be there ridiculously early. Self consciousness/insecurity is not becoming, only your sister and your mom think that it's cute. 

More importantly: PUT IN SOME EFFORT. Your going out. Don't look like a slob (unless you're going to the mission, I love the mission). An over sized collared shirt is not "dressed up." Try a Vneck sweater over said collared shirt; and maybe push the boundaries of your comfortability by adding a tie (bow-tie for extra points) between aforementioned collared shirt and Vneck sweater. It can't hurt. 

Also: If you are going to grease a palm, DO NOT "OFFER" to kick down some cash. It's tasteless and in some cases borderline classless. Simply shaking the door mans hand with a bill neatly folded in your palm will suffice. Think of it as showing them your appreciation for having been done a favor. Everyone likes feeling appreciated. I don't know anyone (besides strippers) who enjoys feeling "bought." Remember the old adage that the more public the favor, the more private the pass? Save the C-note waiving for your daydreams.  

Lastly: Keep in mind that while some doormen are total as***les, in the end they keep out all the even larger pricks. There is a reason why you are trying to get into a nice/fun/"cool" club: the women, and (hopefully) the lack of an over-abundance of as***les that make meeting people and having a good time that much more difficult. 

Side Note: Take this with a grain of salt. But a little attitude adjustment and some of you may be as lucky as I was to meet a lot of beautiful women who were out of my league. I'm about to turn 30, and I'm about to marry one of those women. Just a thought.
author: M.F. J.

description: Great space...crowd was good the first go around but not the 2nd.  Looks to be morphing into the typical SOMA T&B crowd.   Its worth taking a look as I would assume that it differs from night to night.
author: Solbiato S.

description:
What do I like to do when I am sick, miserable and coughing my life away? I GO OUT TO BARS AND DANCE so that I can infect people with my viral infection. My hacking also keeps the creepy men who attempt to talk to me at bay. TAKE THAT, SUCKER!!! Did I mention that I might have pink eye??? Wait, it has been confirmed; my ophthalmologist told me so today. 

My friends and I walk down Minna St. attempting to find Harlot. We pass by construction zones, bicycle shops, Narnia, piles of dirt, etc. Then all of a sudden a red "H" glows like a beacon in the deserted alley and we run towards it. No, wait, we are too cool for that. We stroll towards it. 

We are here at Harlot for a dance party that all of us thought was going to be F-U-N because Going.com told us so and Going.com is always right, right??? Going.com was wrong. The nice and friendly door guy basically told us there was nothing going on inside. He tried to convince us to go in anyway because "the bar and dance floor are empty. This is the best time to be here." Righhhhhhhhht. 

Pros:
+The interior of the bar is sort of amazing. Gothic but not of the Hot Topic  variety. The place is dimly lit and has 2 floors. There are oil paintings on the walls and ceiling. Cow hide couches and throne like chairs are scattered around on the lower floor. Think of Medieval Times but about 10 shades darker. I sorta wish I had a crown on my head, a giant turkey leg to chew on and a goblet full of wine. 
+Nice size dance floor.  I basically could have spun with my arms outstretched like a helicopter and still have had enough room. Maybe it was because there were only 10 of us on  the dance floor.
+Good DJ set from the drummer from Every Move a Picture. Yes, I will dance to and sing  to Interpol's "Slow Hands." How fitting, Harlot would probably be a place Interpol would hang out at.
+ A friend of a friend is the coat check girl here. She sits in a little room/closet as she watches over your J.Crew sport jacket. She is very talented.

Cons:
-There were free vodka drinks from 8-9pm. I got there at midnight. Cynthia=sad. Who goes out and drinks at 8? I start at 5:31 when I get off work. Yes, I am an alcoholic.
-It was a slow night. I thought the best time to go out was midnight but apparently everyone is in their flannel pajamas at home by then. It was also a Wednesday night which meant everyone stayed home for America's Next Top Model and Gossip Girl. My sister did.
-The crowd. This place seems to attract mainly the older after work crowd. I guess this place is more like a lounge instead of a dance party kind of club. People occasionally did look up from their drinks to watch my friends and I dance. FINE! Sit there and watch!  I will chomp on this turkey leg AND dance. I am a multi-tasker.
-The girl who had her dress hiked up to her hoo-ha so she could get closer to her boyfriend. When I mean closer, I mean have sex. Thanks.

Overall, an "OK" experience. I might come back Harlot if only to fulfill my dreams to live one day in a gothic castle.
author: Cynthia L.

description: The decor is stunning...absolutely gorgeous.  I wish I could stand to be in the place for more than 3 minutes, because it would be soooo cool to hang out in such a stylish atmosphere.  BUT......the music sucks and the crowd is even worse.  They enforce a strict dress code, which essentially boils down to: "Any girl can come in, especially if she's got her tits squeezed up to her neck as to attract fat, middle-aged white guys.  Guys simply untuck their shirts when they leave the accounting office and they've got the look."  Too bad about this place.  It's like a Fabrege egg filled with rancid meat.  You'd have more fun buying a 40 oz. and sitting on the sidewalk out front.
author: Major M.

description:
It is extremely unfortunate that a venue this cool is completely ruined by its lame d-bag staff.  Previous reviewers have charged the staff with being racist and sexist.  According to their social engineering policy of equal part guys and girls, we can now add homophobia to the list. 

My best friend's partner tried to set up a birthday party for him with bottle service for $500 a table.  We needed two tables which would have been $1,000 or more.  The "VIP Services" reservationist had the audacity to request that our party (mostly guys) be evenly mixed between guys and girls in order to be let into the club with no problems.  

What a bunch of douches.  We have to pay Harlot $1,000 to be discriminated against??  No thank you.  What may pass for cool in BFE doesn't cut it in San Francisco.  Also, making arbitrary rules in an attempt to create a "cult of cool" at the expense of your bottom line is just plain stupid.  

Wake up and get to know your market you A-HOLES!
author: Tony Y.

description: This place is great if you come here on the early side, but make a note to leave by 8 or so.  Once the aging douchebag brigade descends on this place you'll want to run out the door.  Problem is that they overcrowd this place by 50 or so people every night, and it's so packed it makes it completely impossible to navigate.  It's like New Year's in Vegas.  Everything else about it is average.
author: Scott S.

description: I like this place. I like this place A LOT. Most of my positive experience here had more to do with the fantastic company I had than anything else, but there's definitely something to this place. It's dark and Gothic but comfortable and artsy. I came here yesterday (Thursday) and it wasn't as packed as others thought it should be. I however, not disappointed in the least, was quite comfortable lounging on their leather sofa, sipping my heavy handed vodka soda while enjoying the loud music that wafted in between my conversations.
author: Julia N.

description: HOT outfits for the staff. She had on a lovely leather corset!! I want one too... The bartendar made awesome drinks! The rasberry French martini was deliscious! If your hungry be prepared to pay $6.00 for some nuts, but they were good nuts! Better be for $6.00.. We went on a Thursday night right about when Happy Hour was over... so I might have to go back to experience it again. In the mean time, I like the female staff's outfits, drinks were delicious.. crowd, couldn't say... it was a bit empty when we were there. But there are times where you just want to hang out at an empty bar, it's like it's your own personal party. I'd give it a second chance.
author: Judi K.

description: Very cool space, good drinks, but that DJ was schizo (10 seconds of Madonna, 10 seconds of Rihanna, 20 seconds of the Police).  Also, someone fucking stole my blackberry when I was in there on Friday night.  I have to admit, I'd probably go back though.
author: Kimberly Q.

description: Unfortunately had my company holiday party here - all I have to say is that their doormen are douchebags.
author: Kai H.

description: This is definitely one of the better lounges/clubs in San Francisco.  The space is relatively small, but extremely pleasing to the eye.  It is very difficult to get inside without  a) knowing someone at the door  b) being on a list  c)being a regular, however the upside to this is the generally good-looking crowd & solid guy/girl ratio.  The bartenders are very responsive and make strong (and expensive) drinks.  Music is generally hip hop mixed with house, last night they had live vocals (rock) that were being mixed into house by a DJ (very cool).
author: T D.

description: This isn't a single friendly club.  Stay away if you are trying to meet people.  Also stay away if you don't have more girls than guys in your group.
author: Jon T.

description: Very cool venue.  The music sounds good anywhere you are standing because of the space/layout.  I had a great time and Lawler sounded awesome!  The $10 cover wasn't too bad either.  Drinks are stiff, so be prepared to forget some of the end of the night...esp driking vodka & soda.  ;)
author: Rise G.

description:
Do not be fooled by the website.  Their website may give the club a very sexy image, but the club itself is not very much so.

The ground floor is poorly layed out - not much room for dancing.  The music and drinks are ok, nothing to really rave about.  

The second floor is much better, but you have to be, like, VIP or something to get up there (except if you're part of a group of sweet ladies who know how work it).  

Nevertheless, it's an alright club.
author: Lisa S.

description: Despite myself I really liked this club. The music is good, not excellent, but good enough to make you wanna shake it on the dance floor. They have a lot of seating all over the place which makes it comfortable if you don't want to dance, their smoking area is unique - screened off in a glass booth and the VIP area is absolutely beautiful - all white couches and gleaming table tops. The parking is plentiful (always a good thing in San Francisco) and the doorman nice enough. This is a good club, there are better in SF but this one is pretty good.
author: Shane H.

description: I have always had a good time at Harlot - the people are nice, the location is great and the music is good.  Music is a nice mix of the new with the old.
author: Angela S.

description: deer antlers and weird ass people.  not how i want to spend my friday evenings.
author: Paran Y.

description: If you want a little piece of LA or NY in San Francisco, then Harlot will do the trick. It certainly seems like the new hot spot and the small size makes for a more intimate crowd/experience. As with any sceney place, my fellow male brethren be warned, a group of unaccompanied guys is going to have a hard time getting in without knowing someone...
author: Mike G.

description: Clubs/bars/lounges are always tough to rate since your experience is largely dependent on the company you're with rather than the establishment. I've always had a decent time at Harlot, though, no matter who I'm with. The music is great on Saturdays (hip hop) but if you like house, then go on Fridays. They would get 5 stars for the pure fact that this is the best dressed crowd in San Francisco but the guys are always difficult at the door, so they lose a star. I get the need to control who gets in the door but a group of 7 asian girls with 1 dude? Is it really necessary to give the 1 dude a hard time?
author: Susan L.

description: Classy place, fun decor and great DJs. I went dancing and had a great time. And it wasn't so loud that I couldn't chat with my friend in the upstairs loft.
author: ari s.

description: Came here for a chocolat event where they gave away free chocolate and chocolate dipped strawberries.  Its a cute little place but from my experience here...I've discovered that I don't really like house music.  Too bassy and just too loud in general...I felt like I was at a rave almost.  I lost my voice by trying to talk to my friends who were literally a few inches from my face.  The location is also a bit sketchy...its in an alley way.  But I did like that there was no cover.  Interesting art on the walls too...
author: Tiffany V.

description: Apparently someone has hacked into my yelp account then felt the liberty to write bad reviews.
author: John F.

description:
I like this place, as it's one of my clubs in the City. Fridays and Saturdays are the big nights, and yes with a line, as most clubs do in the City. What do you expect?

If you like quality House music, this is the place to be on Thursday nights. The Harlot  kicks it up. It reminds me of Pink which was also one of my favorite places before it closed down.

- Amazing sound system and bloody awesome resident DJs.
- Great drinks and rapid service.

Yes, it's difficult to get in, as someone stated below, so get there early.
author: Scott G.

description:
Oh it sure pays off to be a cute girl sometimes...even better when you are a group of 5 cute girls! Yes, there is a line and yes if you go up to the door guy and he sees you and army of female friends he will open up the velvet ropes like he's parting the red sea. Okay maybe that was a bit much but it did make me feel like "king of the castle!" Once you're in please check your coat - I know $3 is a bit much in these lean days but the friendly and not salty at all Coat Check girl makes it all worth it!
