Yes the decor is dark,lovely and has a that Vegas feel to it - there is a massive picture of a female nude frontal that reminds me to get my regular bikini waxing but what really bothers me are bartenders that change the price of your drink each time you go and order one. That is why you get 3 stars! Also what the hell was up with the dj? I don't know if I like my Journey mixed with my Nelly Furtado then to be mixed with Weird Al's White and Nerdy? I guess I'm just too old to get it. Also, drunken skanks didn't bother me so much this time especially when I get to laugh at them slipping and falling on their asses in front of me and my friends! BRAVA Harlot...BRAVA!

I think I'll just come back for Friday Happy Hour w/my co-workers!
author: Alexis D.

description: Went for BPM's birthday.  Hosted by blow up with jefrodisiac djing. In my honest opinion there was way too much coke and yuppies at this club.  I'll take my chances in the mission any day.  At least those cokeheads know how to party!
author: Matt N.

description: I've been here a few times and all I can really think of is, dark, but sophisticated.  Last time it was crowded with downtown SF working folks (it was a Thursday), I wasn't that into the music, but it was fun.  The couches/bottle service looking areas sort-of reminded me of Vegas, but it may have been a few of the women in them that kind-of reminded me of harlots.  The VIP section has a great view of the club and own bar.  I like the fact it's light and heavenly looking down on the mass of dark, earthy (or maybe hell-y) people below.
author: Cara J.

description: I typically don't like going out to the clubs, but this was more loungy than clubby. We got there relativlely early before it really filled up and had a great time. Music was good, people looked good. A bit of an older crowd which was good. I didn't have any expectations so I wasn't at all disappointed.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
Our group of 4 girls, 3 guys waited for a half hour outside at the FRONT of the line while the bouncers waited for a crowd to form outside so that the place would look "busy".  Oh, and we had 2 other girls inside who wanted to talk to the bouncers to let us in, but the bouncers shooed them away.  So 6 pretty girls, and 3 guys -- apparently still not good enough for these douchebags, as we continued to wait. 

Then the US Olympic women's synchronized swim team showed up in limos, and the bouncers were so incompetent it even took them 15 minutes to let them in!  We left before ever seeing the inside -- who knows how much longer we would have waited.

I will pay cover if I need to, but don't waste my time with a fake "no-cover".  Being poorly managed and operated does not mean a club is "exclusive"...
author: movinon ..

description: What a delicious affair!  M&N know how to put a venue together and Harlot delivers, right down to the details.  I went on a Friday nite and the DJ Released the perfect mix of eclectic dance tunes.  Somehow he made New Order, Fergie, Journey and Guns & Roses melt into the perfect blend of exactly what the crowd wanted to hear, but would never expect.  And it worked like Magic.  I only stopped dancing to swing by the bar to catch my breath and then lounge with my girls and soak in the scene.  What a sublime treat to drink Evian out of chilled glass-bottles (no cheap plastic here).  Details.  The doorman is so polite - I think he even called me "Love."  I like how intimate it is, with its sensual vibe, leather couches and lots of sassy, sexy guests.  Oooo, I wish I was there right now!
author: Latteliz P.

description: Love the fact that this place has a Gothic feel to it. Reminds me of clubs in Eastern Europe. I'm really not into Hip Hop, so I love the fact that they play trippy electronica/trance/Trip Trance music.  Surprisingly, they weren't picky about the dress code. Maybe it was a Thursday night, or maybe it way kinda late, or maybe because we walked in as a huge group. And to top the night off, I saw Too Short there. I know this place has gotten a lot of bad reviews, but it seemed fine to me. Do check it out if you like Trance/Electronica.
author: Tushar V.

description: Ok... went here for a birthday party and we had a table and bottle service so once we got inside service was good.  My problem with this place is the two goons they hired as doormen.  Total assholes... giving us shit about whose name is on the list, etc. etc. when we had paid for two tables there.  I was unaware that being a DOORMAN in San Francisco makes you a superior human being.
author: Sayeh A.

description: One word: OVERRATED!! I have never seen a bigger mess outside a club like this before. Where did they get the little guy that look like Standford from "Sex in the City" to run the door? Talk about power-trip. Was there a method to his maddness? Be prepared to stand outside like a group of puppies waiting to get their food and don't even think about bringing a guy. Standford will only let in groups of girls. Biotchs only! For a pretty decent place inside, there should be no need for all the crap outside.
author: Sam D.

description: Harlot, has one of the best ambiance in SF. It is small and cozy. I have been there many times, even sometimes when the music its not so great the vibes inside that club is just wonderful, plus you can make the party as fun as you can or as miserable as you can, right? The drinks are great, maybe a little pricey for a local gal like me. But, that won't stop me for going there. Harlot = good times, for sure.
author: Erika A.

description: This place is so hit or miss (as is every place in SF). The decor is fabulous, and, depending on the DJ, the music is generally fun to dance to. However, they crowd way too many people in here, and it is nearly impossible to shake-my-groove-thang without someone spilling their drink all over me! Also, I don't know what is up with the piping above the dancefloor, but it is always leaking! (I dearly hope that it is water and not condensation from all the sweaty bodies on the dancefloor...yikes). This place used to have a very LA, exclusive feel, but lately the people have been "meh". The place is much more appealing during happy hour when you can actually appreciate the decor and enjoy your drink without someone knocking it over or the pipes leaking into it!
author: I C.

description: DO NOT GO TO THIS CLUB!!! I took my best friend there for her bachelorette party two weeks ago.  Towards the end of the night, I was at the bar waiting for my friend so we could leave when a female bartender sprayed me with cleaning solution across the chest. She immediately asked me if I had a problem and when I told her yes, she started yelling and asked me why I was there.  The bartenders there are very rude, unprofessional and disrespectful.  We spent a lot of money there that night and I will not go back and support their business. The only reason I gave this club one star is because Yelp wouldn't let me post this comment without it.
author: Shanna S.

description: If the Marquise of O had a lodge, it might be named Harlot. Hot, sexy and tarty, with a lot of gold-digging wraithes waiting to suck your blood dry. Dark and sleek decor, requisite animalia and fireplace remind one to keep in touch with the cruel laws of nature. The fierce and brutal always win, be the hunter not the prey or you will be a trophy on the wall.
author: Jennifer O.

description: I have a sad obsession with corsets and as soon as I saw the bartenders in corsets, I knew this was my kind of place. The pomegranate mojitos were served with gin, and I loved it, which is odd, because gin and I aren't friends, more acquaintances. The decor is gorgeous, the music was great, and the crowd was lovely. Really nice bouncers too, which is such a pleasant change from the surliness you'll find at dolce and the like.
author: Noelle Q.

description: I went here for a halloween party on thursday. the most essential part of any good party is having a good crowd. this place did not have it. there were girls that didn't even dress up. i asked them: "what's your costume?" they replied: "we're going as a group of asian girls" lame. 3 stars.
author: Charles D.

description:
Last night (Thurs) was the second time I've been to Harlot and there are mostly good things to say about the place.  For one thing parking is really easy to find.  If you can't get one on the street (which I did) then there is a lot right across from the club.  There is also a smoking "patio" but it's pretty small and it can get nasty in there with too many smokers.  Drinks were easy to get as I never had to wait too long for the bartender and the music,  well this was probably an exceptional night because it was an Om party for Samantha James' cd release so it was all house.  From what I know other nights aren't always all house (my preference).  The bathroom might be a bit hard to find because you have to go to the
"Exit" door and there are no signs.  The sound system isn't bad but it isn't great either.  The crowd is a bit more trendy and upscale than I like it to be, but the way Harlot is positioned that's the type of crowd they will draw.  If you want to go to a place to be seen and like themed clubs, then Harlot is for you.
author: Ben M.

description: I must admit I enjoyed my evening here, albeit brief. But, seriously? The place is named Harlot? I don't think that word means what you think it means, lol.
author: Shooter M.

description: Edgy. Forbidden. Sexy. To experience Harlot is like stumbling upon a mysterious pagan ritual, knowing you shouldn't watch but are unable to turn a blind eye. From the provocative paintings guarding the dance floor to the animalistic furniture and lighting, you can sense the clever sorcery that went into every dark detail. Harlot's seductive and haunting atmosphere, attractive crowd and attentive servers have kept me coming back....and perhaps...it's simply because I can't look away... ;)
author: lacey b.

description:
Great Halloween party.  Probably the best high end lounge party I've been to as far as ambiance and entertainment is concerned.  They had sexy, scantily clad, body painted contortionists, acrobatic performers, hula hoop and snake charmer performers.  It was like an adult circus, but in a more intimate setting.  
Also the Halloween decor was amazing.  There were eerily formed branches, and spiders, and dark nooks, and great mood lighting.   They really went all out, including the bar personable bar tenders, who were had well designed body paint.  
All in all this was a great experience.  The party goers were mostly pretty, young and hot as well.  Everyone was dressed up, including yours truly.  I went as a cereal killer.  I had to come up with an outfit in less than 30 minutes so I sewed on a bunch of cereal boxes to an old shirt and took a spoon with me.  Most people were like why are you stabbing yourself with a spoon.  I either said there were "ten thousand spoons and what I really needed was a knife" or "I'm a 'cereal killer.'"  Most people at least humored me with a chuckle.
author: doug a.

description:
not bad not bad!! :D
we went after the WORST EXPERIENCE at Vessel, so this place saved the night.  the entrance looks a bit shady, but the bouncers were really nice to us and let us in for free! we went in and it was very darrrrk.. however, despite the darkness, it had a sleek, classic feel to it.  the men were dressed VERY NICELY, and people minded their own business.  the music was hip hop, but after 2 the dj started playing some weird underground stuff that my friend and i werent used to, so we left. 
either way, it was a FUN and CLEAN place where people just dance and don't molest! :]
author: Rosa K.

description: Sweet spot hidden on Minna. Its a more upscale, small night spot that makes it hard for scrubs and guys to get in. Key is to go early or buy a table. Has a lounge area and dance floor. Very interesting and unique decor. Highly recommended for a small group of bankers who just got off after working all saturday.
author: Ed L.

description: VIP was weak and the woman in the loo who gives you napkins was yappin' on a cell phone all night. (Silver lining: I felt no remorse about leaving her sans tip.) But the DJ was good and I danced until 2.
author: Angela N.

description: Sid A. has a pretty exact description of why you shouldn't go to this place.  The Moby look-a-like at the door guy is a complete douche bag.  He *must* own the place to not have been fired by now for being so uncool.  I showed up by myself to meet 15 people inside at 10:10PM -- super early, the place is completely empty and there's no one in line.  I tell the guy that I just drove from the south bay to get here and my friends are inside.  He's says "Too bad."  Unbelievable... didn't say "sorry, too bad, just 'too bad'".  I then said, "so what am I going to do now that I've driven an hour to get here?"  He said, "Don't know".  He talks to the bouncer saying how "there's too many guys in there" and even said, "well at least there's no fat girls in there".  Seriously, this guy is a completely assmunch.  Finally, my friends come out who does happy hour there all the time and knows the bartender and throws a fit and finally I'm let in.  Moby-look-a-like is the biggest douche on the planet and this place, no matter how good of an experience you may have had there, doesn't deserve anyone's business.  Don't go there under any circumstances.
author: Dee D.

description: Sexy, swanky, chic . and they serve Swan's Neck cocktails so I'm a happy girl.  I like the tout-blanc upstairs, the artwork, the vibe and the bartenders. The opening party was hot.  Martiel has done a great job, and I'll be back sooner than later.
author: Suzanne A.

description: I've come here a few times now and I have a good time consistently - I think. It's hard to give a 100% review when most if not all my visits have ended hazy.  Well, that just shows that they keep the drinks coming, the music is good enough that I find myself on the dancefloor every time.  Oh, and cabs are plentiful right outside.  I remember shoving my friend in one before jumped in the one behind her.
author: Yve T.

description: I agree with Mary Anne C.  I was truly disappointed by the last of darkness that Harlot falsly advertised.  In addition, I was there for a private party and was too busy waiting for the ONE bartender at the open bar to get me a drink and was unable to enjoy the actual pretentious nature of the other snobs there. I give it 3 stars to keep it hopeful.  Bring some of the dark, seedy, gothic, taboo ambiance that the club was founded on back.  There is potential...Also, another recommendation...name some of the over priced drinks after the old world San Fran SOMA hookers that the club is named for.
author: Lisa M.

description: I like the interior design, although doesnt so match up w/ the name (I like the name itself!). I like the music - type of music that makes you chill with friends in the lounge (french, english and budda bar/cafe del mar) and I like my drink I had.
author: Flora H.

description: This is an interesting bar, with a nice decor but they seriously pack them in here,  I went to a private party upstairs and could barely move.  The downstairs bar staff will barely give you the time of day.  I think this will all improve once they have been open a bit,  but I would have second thoughts about going to any big event there.
author: Nancy D.

description: Harlot gets 4 stars simply because I never have to wait to get in and I've had quite a few good nights here.  Generally, the music is decent and the crowd is hot.  But lately I don't know what to expect: the crowd is hit or miss and whoever decided to spin a little Backstreet Boys and Britney into the mix clearly wasn't thinking straight.  While pop music holds a special place in my heart since I grew up during the boy band era, I don't generally like to hear it while I'm boozin and trying to have a good time.  Maybe I just happened to pick a few bad nights or maybe, Harlot, you need to reinstall my faith in you.  Either way, I have a funny feeling I'll be back soon....
author: laura q.

description:
sexy venue, beautiful people, and the party i went to there last night was jumpin.  the dj's were talented and had the whole club on their feet, and the go-go girls doing the chair routine were waaay hot.  had no problem getting in-got there about 11:30 and there was no line, and the doormen let us right in and no cover. 

minus 1 star for the very un-diverse "LA"-ish crowd, and the loooong wait at the bar every time.  There's also an upstairs VIP area, and as the night went on, the people leaning over the rail started spilling more and more of their drinks on the non-VIP guests.
author: asia c.

description: I had fun at this place, but only because my three friends and I were able to mooch off a table's Grey Goose bottle service (my friend knew one of the guys).  If I had been a normal patron, I would have hated this place due to the long, pretentious line outside, the crowded nature of the bar (you can't even walk through the damn place) and the fact that the people there are just plain weird.  :)  Maybe I don't like big clubs like this?  But I think I've had fun at other places than this.
author: Jen L.

description: mmm.. pretty nice place. Bouncers  are pretty cool. drinks are  a lil pricey, but I guess thats expected in the city. Bartenders are pretty coo too. Crowd was fun, but agreein with Nima G.. dj needs to step his game up!.. other than that, you can find yourself havin fun!
author: Alexa O.

description: Went here for a birthday party this past Saturday. This was about the third time I had been there. I was not impressed the previous times. However, I had a really good time on this visit. There is an upstairs area where they have table service. Servers were fast and friendly. Their outfits weren't my favorite, bustier with tight black jeans. That look can sometimes make a woman look a bit like she has a mushroom mid-section. That said though, they all looked good. Music was good. Love that there isn't a cover charge. Would like to try it right after work and see what that scene is like.
author: Heather L.

description: I've only been for Friday's 80s happy hour, and we went early (right at five). Had a blast... I could see some of the negativity about the "scenesters"... definitely got that vibe as the night went on. But the drinks special was cheap during happy hour ($5 I think), there's no line to get in, and the music was a blast. I'm not into the "see and be seen" LA-type vibe anymore so wouldn't go at night, and definitely not with any poor guys who are going to have trouble getting in (my boyfriend did and hates the place), but I can't wait to go back for Friday happy hour.
author: Shoshana D.

description: Reward for me and five other rather good looking ladies for dressing to the nines on a busy Saturday night: No cover, no looking for parking (they have $10 valet), no charge for the coat check, no waiting in line AND immediate access to the VIP area without even trying.  Pretty darn sweet.
author: Ange L.

description:
whoa! i reread my previous review of this place and realized i didnt give it a fair shake - at all.

yeah, they've got teething issues like all new places but all in all, they did do a nice job for the party i attended last night. there were plenty of bartenders, which is usually a big problem at many bars like this (only god knows why a place wouldn't want to sell as MUCH alcohol as possible) and they were attentive and super speedy. 

what can i say? the interior is super cool and they do a far better job than i could ever do.

so apologies to all those hard working people at Harlot... and thanks for hosting the party for the new boys over at involver!
author: tommy p.

description: Sexy and gothic decor.  I liked that it felt spacious, but then again I was there for a private event.  The bouncer was very nice and chatty but the bartender and event manager not so friendly.
author: Vera D.

description: Entering the VIP entrance and sitting at a reserved table made the experience great. The interior decor was dark and had interesting fixtures such as the huge portrait of a naked woman and the shogun warrior with a geisha.
author: Anh N.

description: Stopped by here en route to 111 Minna last nite. It was early (7pm) and a Thursday, so it's not the bar at its best, but I still enjoyed my time here. Goth/victorian deco is cool. Only gripe would be the size, it's rather small and its gotta get super packed on the weekends. Also, area is very sketchy, wouldn't want to lose my friends and meander drunk post-bar. I'll be back on a weekend night for sure.
author: Sarah G.

description:
Last Friday night was my second visit - the first one was back in May and I have decided that Harlot is a bit overrated, but still a fun place to have drinks.  The first time I went was back in May with work people and we got a table up in the mezzanine section so I didn't really get the full experience of the place.  There is no bar upstairs, only waitresses that service your table, but the plus is that there is a bathroom.  The bar is decorated in sort of a Gothic theme and is very, very dark.  It's not plush at all, but nice enough.  

Last Friday I went with two girlfriends and arrived around 10:30pm.  There was no line or cover.  The place was comfortably packed, but not so crowded where you can't get a drink at the bar or move.  The bartenders are pretty speedy and drinks costs aren't cheap nor are they too expensive.  One apple martini and two vanilla vodkas and Cokes were $24.  There are no seats to sit down on (typical for a bar like this) unless you book table service.  But it was okay since I had planned on staying for only an hour or so.  The music was terrific!  It was very fun and danceable.  There is a small dance floor towards the back of the room near the DJ.  Only a small number of people were dancing since Harlot's not really a club, but more of a lounge.  I felt the crowd was relatively attractive compared to other clubs in the city.  Parking can be hit or miss in the area, but there is a flat fee lot right across the alley (literally 15 feet from the entrance) that is $10.  Turns out Harlot has happy hour Wed-Fri until 9pm, so that seems worth checking out.
author: Karen K.

description: As someone who tends to avoid "clubby" clubs for various (mostly bridge-and-tunnel-related) reasons, Harlot ends up being my go-to. Yes, they sometimes have a line, but I've found the door guys to be reasonable after a friendly convo. Yes, the drinks aren't cheap, but the bartenders are attentive.  And though I'm not a Top 40s chick, the mix is eclectic and fun enough to show that it doesn't take itself too seriously.  Throw in no cover, a smoking area and a good vibe, and I can honestly say I've never had a bad time here.
author: Liza D.

description: Not fun, not classy, not much of anything. The staff is actually incredibly rude. There are much better clubs in SF. Don't waste your time.
author: Shelly C.

description: I love the word "harlot" for its personality . . . but it's a little misleading in the context of this SOMA spot.  The pony chairs are fab, there are pretty paintings on the ceiling, the lighting is great and the house music was solid.  They have fun tables that are covered with photos of what look like American Apparel models gone high class.  Cheers to the pretty bartender who kept me in strong drinks all night.   Unfortunately the crowd doesn't really match up with the fierce atmosphere (think marina girls in sparkle shirts) but there's such potential . . . I'm going back and I'm bringing more people  . . . Viva la Revelucion!
author: Valerie D.

description:
another decent, nicely decorated bar/club in the city. good location, a bit hidden in a side street in the financial district. ample street parking and i hear there is a parking lot across the street from bar which is always nice. that way, you can just run into the club without lugging a heavy coat around. :)

2 bars, a smallish main dance floor, lots of VIP seating areas, a smoking area, and an upstairs part that i didnt venture to check out. music is ok, overall, its a great space (on the small side), seems good for more smaller group parties and the like. nothing that stood out to me.
author: Miss Lili F.

description:
First time I went to this place I had to sneak in. Why? well my friends and i had just come from 111 down the street to meet up with some other friends. Apparently there was some "special event" and we were denied entry. Special event huh?  yeah right, my friends got in just 10 minutes before and we knew it. WTH, So We took the "secret" entrance, (which isnt really much of a secret if you've been to the Salt House bathroom.) One martini and too many tall anorexic girls with low cut boobie shirts walking around, my friends and I left, not really my scene for a Wednesday night
OF COURSE, I forgot my ATM card and had to go back , this time on a Saturday. This was the first stop on our list and I was pleasently surprised.  The crowd was laid back and social, the security and doorman were more than courteous, and there wasnt a huge line to get drinks. All in all it was a cool place to chat with friends and enjoy a cocktail. I guess my first impression was absolutely wrong.
author: Jordan V.

description: I missed the Yelp party, but I went here just for a drink. The upstairs wasn't open. The smoking cage amused me and the naked paintings were cool. They had cow skin chairs and a dj. HA
author: Anita C.

description:
pluses:  almost everybody was dancing and having a pretty good time.  decor is kinda random but the pieces themselves are sorta thoughtful.  they were fun to point and look at.

minuses: cougars galore.  dance floor actually got too crowded and the people bumping me were totally oblivious.  how rude =x and the dj .. eh .. it was good at first with the hip hop but maybe he got tired or something and didn't feel like trying anymore.  

plus/(minus?):  the bouncers were very selective in whom they let in.  don't try to enter this place with a 5+ crowd because they'll probably lie to you and tell you it's guestlist only which happened to the big asian group before us.  very interesting ..
author: Amanda N.

description: So it's not a bad place if you're in your  late 20's and beyond. Me and my friends don't fit into that area so my judgement is bias. The drinks were strong; being the non-drinker/light weight that I am one drink was good enough for me. The DJ was horrible! He didn't play one whole song! It was just all bad we left early because of him. No lame pick-up lines or sleazy guys for sure because of the age of the crowd.
author: Pawanpreet G.

description: Over-rated night spot tainted with bouncers that feed off of doorman power.  Let me and my beautiful friends in, but gave trouble to the second half of my friend's birthday party.  Attention-hungry and passive-agressive wanna-be-trendy bouncer said to my male friends, "You can stand here all night and you won't get in."  Meanwhile 75% of our group was already inside with the rest of the rude staff.  Entrance is purely superficial, and depends solely on the mood and rules of the doormen at that given moment.  Overheard several other groups complaining in line as well.  And let me tell you, it was pretty empty inside...
author: Liv L.

description: I went there with three other girls, we headed straight for the front of the line, told the bouncer there's four girls, waited about five minutes, and then was let in while others waited in line.  The decor is anything but fabulous.  The drinks are a shame.  I ordered hennessey and coke and I basically got coke with splash of Henn.  The only good part of Harlot is their decent music.  I don't care to revisit this place.  I recommend Slide.
author: Jules M.

description:
I can't stay silent any longer.  I give in.  I gotta throw my 2 Yelp cents in about Harlot.

Yes, Harlot is an almost painfully trendy/shi shi hot spot in SF, trying to claim and maintain exclusivity with LA-ish/upscale clientele.  Whatever. That's beside the point.  What REALLY matters here:

- No cover.  
- The bouncers are cool.  The bouncer that most folks complain about is the one that looks like Kid Rock.  But if you're a chick - and, even better, if you're a chick sportin' something short and cute - he'll let you in w/o any trouble or drama.  Last night, our crew consisted of 4 girls and 5 guys, which isn't the best ratio.  But, the girls and I chatted up Kid Rock + the other bouncer and, after a few folks exited Harlot, they let us in.  
- More than a handful of tall guys there. Oh. Mah. Gawd.  Somebody pinch me.  A club in SF where a majority of the guys are NOT at eye-level to me?  I'm not saying they were my type (too pretty, too pretentious, too much hair gel and too many dang blazers) but, I was pleasantly surprised that I actually had to look UP to make eye contact.  
- DJ Zhaldee + DJ Solomon, among my Top 10 favorite DJs in SF.  If you want some dope and danceable hip-hop, house and Top 40, go when either one is spinning.  I done mama proud last night and shook what my mama gave me, almost hurt myself dancing.  
- It's kind of refreshing to see so many hottie women in cute dresses.  The typical jeans/dressy top outfit will get you in but, you might feel slightly out of place at Harlot.
- Lovely interior. Swanky.

Now all I have to do is examine and comment on the bartenders.  I'm sure I'll find some eye candy, though. :)
author: Nancy L.

description: I work in the area, love to go to new bars and clubs, this is a cool little spot. I go there a lot, since it opened. The place isn't too big, but It's really cool inside. i recommend you checking it out.
author: Stormy M.

description: Easily my favorite hot spot, until the next best hidden treasure comes along.  I love that it's in an alleyway.  I love that it hasn't been infested / overrun by too many clubby clubbers (a la Slide and Ruby Skye).  Good music, good vibe.  Let's keep it that way!
author: La A.

description: Myriad collection of music and variety from hip hop to quirky house, to rockabilly indie punk.  The drinks are good and the clientele is as varied as the music.  There is some cozy group seating if you are lucky to snag, there is dancing, and there is always a friendly conversation to butt in on.  There are two floors, but the top floor has never been open when I've been there on the weekdays.
author: Diana L.

description: Thursday happy hour was lame.  I can't talk to the night time so I can't justify giving it a worse review.  The DJ was good,  but there was no other aspect that stood out.
author: Eduardo A.

description: Went for a friend's b-day party, to which I had an invitation.  Doorman could not have been more rude in not letting us in. His reasons kept changing through the conversation.  The place is bullshit.  Read the other reviews herein and don't go there.  Tell your friends and co-workers not to go there, and certainly NEVER book a party there.  Places like this give the club scene a bad name.
author: H. Scott P.

description:
amazing.

i've been waiting for a place like this since i moved here.  and it delivers 100% on the buzz and hype.

the layout shows careful attention that only comes with decades of experience in nightlife.  flow is great, access to bartenders given the small size is unbelievable, with two great bars on the ground and mezzanine levels.  and the lighting, ambiance, and attention to interior detail is nearly flawless.  this place would hold up very well in new york, LA, or south beach.  and that's a tall order for a san francisco club/lounge that few, if any others, can claim in the city.

other notables:
- sound system is unbelievable.  they designed the sound system before they even designed the interior.  and it's obvious.
- vip tables are layed out exceptionally well.  great table areas on the ground floor that allow people to mingle with the crowd but still hold good positioning.  and the tables upstairs provide some great partial privacy and exclusivity to those looking for it.
- great DJ setup -- gives the DJ a commanding but not overwhelming/obtrusive command of the place.
- interior touches are very cool without trying too hard, from the paintings to fabrics to lighting fixtures
- amazing crowd.  young, attractive, and very low-key and down to earth.

and, most importantly, the owners are unusually committed to making this place a success.  too often have i been to a place, whether just opened or around the block for a few years, to find the owners absent or generally ambivalent about their parties.  these guys work hard, running from place to place throughout the entire night, taking care of guests, helping bartenders and servers, and it shows.

well done - this will be a hot spot in SF nightlife for a long time to come.
author: Matt O.

description: Bartenders have way too much tude for their own good. BUT hopping over here with Lia W. and other fabu post work peeps is a must when I've got the hankering for a yummy cocktail! (Adding Apps to the menu could only help!)
author: T L.

description: This place lost a star in the past few months. Harlot needs to invest in good DJ's and then they'll win over the SF crowd. Bad mashups that your relative is playing because you don't want to fork over some cash to get a decent DJ for the night ain't worth it. Build it and they will come... only for a few months until you hire bad DJ's. Other than beautiful interior ...
author: flo t.

description:
i like the idea. i like harlots. i like black house of ill repute wall paper and paintings of nekkid ladies. i do. the crowd was pretty random and lame. the dj had his moments, but was kind of lame too.  granted we got there at about 1 am but it seemed like a place you go if you want to pull a lass or lady. i guess, that could be any club at 1am, but whatever.

it was packed, again- crowd random. had some video vixen wanna bes and some indie rocker-past-their-prime dudes and everything else in between. not entirely sure where i fit into the mix but you know, cast the first stone.

anyway was always curious to check it out; glad i did. didn't suck but don't see a need to go back.
author: ms.kiki g.

description: Good lookin' bar, and the drinks get stronger and stronger as you order them (yeah, my kind of place too) but it's a little bridge and tunnel-ish.  I probabaly wouldn't bother going on the weekend, but for after work drinks, definitely visit.
author: Carol T.

description: I've been to the BEST open bars at Harlot. Maybe I should be reviewing the promotion group, but I still like the space.
author: Nini G.

description: The ambiance is sexy. The staff is friendly and unpretentious. The music is great.
author: L B.

description: Really kewl place tucked away in a lil alley.....the decor is quite interesting and very avant-garde.....esp with skeletons on the walls..and pop-out pictures hanging downstairs.....the music is pretty good but it can get very crowded here.....i like the upstairs...very cozy! and lighting is very soothing....theirs also a lil room on the right hand side when you come it.  It is glassed...is that a private sitting area or does a show get performed in there in the wee hours of the morning??????????
author: Mee-stique K.

description: it could have gotten 4 stars if it had been free of charge. for SF, i have to say it was a cool place. They had a guest DJ - forgot the name, but he was really good. I had just gotten back from my European adventure, and I felt like I could be in Europe - good music and people were dancing. Well done. thanks harlot.
author: Jess P.

description:
First time I went here a few months ago and was with a few ladies after a night with the dissident chef. The place was fun, music was good, crowd was good, but a mix of young and old. 

So last night after leaving the new 83 proof we headed over to Harlot which was having a Maxim party and wouldn't let me in. I was with the only girl with 3 guys.. odds were against me. Anyhow, we turned the corner and opted for drinks at Salt House. One of the guys heads to the bathroom, comes back & says Harlot and Salt House share it, we can head over to the Maxim party just walk the opposite way. So we head over the guys walk across to the Maxim party while the bouncer at the door stops me and won't let me in. SERIOUSLY? I thought it was the funniest thing.. only in fuking SF I swear ... I don't argue, I honestly don't care and at this point, I'm ready to head home. I go outside to catch a cab, no cabs I start walking towards the "W", I eventually end up there after being hit on by every Tom, Dick and Harry along the way. Everyone and their mama was out last night (makes me feel good attempted to party). So I call my hero Makram (car service) he swoops me up and takes me home, in style and ensuring it's not me.. its this city I love to call home.
author: melissa g.

description: interesting decor. I thought I was invited to a Halloween party when I walked in. Drinks are average quality. Nice atmosphere. We were occuping a table and were told that at 9pm we have to free it or pay an exuberant sum of money if we want to stay. This was very strange but by 8:45 the place was empty since they kicked out everyone. Not sure if there was a private party of some kind but this was very strange.
author: Alex k.

description:
I ordered one drink here, and this placed charged my card 100 dollars....

they do it to everyones card.  A "preauthorization", but it takes at least 5 days to come off your account.....i mean seriously....they are not that important

its a freakin dirty dance club....wtf.....
author: Allie M.

description: I always have a fantastic time here. Harlot has a vibrant crowd that really reflects SF nightlife.  They consistently attract great DJs and a positive scene.  I am  a big fan of clubs that have a door policy...think of it as vibe control...and wish more clubs would do it.
author: Angela N.

description: I like this place, although out of the 4 times I've been I think the weeknights are the best.  Weekend crowd can be a little B&T and the place just gets overcrowded.  Drinks are reasonable for a club/lounge and I like the decor.  They bring a couple of my favorite DJ's too!  Definitely could use some AC though!!
author: S B.

description: We were required to stop by Harlot  by 9pm in order to be let in for our pub crawl on Saturday night. While they were gracious to let in 150 screaming San Franciscans in t-shirts scribbled with writing we were bringing them a lot of business and the bouncers could have been nicer to us as the clock struck ten (our pre-arranged leaving time). I understand the security at nightclubs in this city have to protect themselves but you guys could smile once in a while. Regardless- Harlot is a sexy venue with a great space for a DJ, dancing and an upstairs VIP area. Awesome for groups and easy to work with staff! Thanks Dennise for our great first club stop.
author: Jessica M.

description: My coworkers and I wanted to find a place that was fun, classy, and had a good table service.  We definitely found that at Harlot.  The ambiance of the club is really nice.  Swanky but not stuffy at all.  It is definitely worth getting a table up stairs.  Not that we are high maintenance ladies or anything, but we wanted to have a spot to get away from the crowd below.  The music was great to dance to which is the most important thing.  I will plan on coming back for sure!
author: Dominique T.

description:
Where to start. 

1) I recommend coming from 2nd st. I walked down Minna from 1st and noticed all of the homeless people begging for change right outside. Great choice of location.

2) I showed up at 10:15. My group was one female and three males. They would not let us in even though we were there for a birthday party. Stood outside, while no one else was in line, and they still refused to let us in because we had too many guys.

3) It was our friend's birthday party. She had a decent sized group. Part of the reason they didn't let us in is that they said her party was too big. Please heed that warning if you ever want to have a birthday party at this location. Your whole party will NOT be able to get in unless you grease the bouncer or spend $500 for a table.

A worthless club. Worthless bouncers, and I nor my friends will ever come close to going here again.
author: Aaron L.

description: Place sucks. Waaay too much attitude from staff.
author: Boss H.

description: To sum it up: It didn't suck. We attended one of the opening nights of this club and it's just another trendy club with the option of table service. It shares a bathroom/hallway with Salt House so it's in a pretty good SOMA spot. The bartenders served you fast and were pretty nice. The DJ played great music but each song was only played for about 1 min then there was a 2 min "mash up" in to the next song.  The crowd seemed a little on the young side - my friends and  I both had to laugh when we asked the boys that were chatting us up  what they did prior to the job they currently held - and the answer was always "college." You can get a table there but I don't know if they are arraigned very well. They are all kind of grouped together back to back in a block as opposed to some clubs that have them circling the dance floor.
author: All About Town ..

description: Great music and set up. Easy to get to restrooms and the bar was easy to get to as well. Drinks didn't take too long to get. Pretty good crowd of people. I like it overall. Never tried going upstairs, didn't seem that great up there (low ceilings).
author: Mike C.

description: I really enjoyed this spot . Yes the D.J did play alot of Brittney but dammit her music is hot. The drinks were well priced  and I got them in a timely fashion. The atmosphere was initimate but mostly women , so if you are a straight guy this is your spot . The bouncer @ the VIp let me and roomie upstairs  but it was okay just a bunch of locals. Overall the experience was a B just because I went with a group of fun people. Word to the wise bring lots of frends !!!!
author: shunna d.

description: I attempted to go to Harlot for halloween. After waiting outside with my co-ed group for at least in hour, it started to rain. The line didn't move any faster while it lightly rained for 15 minutes. When it started pouring, the bouncers let all the girls in, but then refused to let the guys that came with us in. We came out multiple times and asked the bouncers to let our guys friends in. They ignored both us, and our friends who where standing at the very front of the line. It wasn't very crowded inside, and the music was pretty lame, so we went over the Fluid, which was better time then at Harlot.
author: Allison M.

description: Pretty cool club, except it was quite crowded in the back where the dance floor is at. The drinks are ok and expensive. I spent about a good hour dancing and lounging with my friends and had a good time listening to the great music. The DJ definitely had a sweet gig going.
author: Dave Y.

description:
I am SO excited about this place.

What a hot new venue. Don't even get me started on the decor. I love it. So sexy. So posh. So cool. And a sexy crowd to match? Perfect.

I can forsee a new routine--dinners at Salt House, hop on over to Harlot for drinks and some flirting.

Yes, San Francisco is finally getting some sexy new places to go besides a couple techno clubs and bars. 

Did I mention how incredible the place looks?

CHECK IT OUT.
author: Nicole R.

description: Hot bartender-everyone in my party was in awe...anyway...Its nice to be in a bar that I can sit down and enjoy my friends as well as meet new ones.  I'm so sick of SF hole in the walls.  Great after work place and great location, not too in the middle of things and I like being able to get dinner at Salt House after.  Love the sexy interior, I guess 4 stars because the music could have been better.
author: Jane J.

description: This place would be better if they could get a consistent DJ situation worked out. Been there three times. The first night was cool because they had a great DJ. The second and third time were real bad. The good music was gone so it made it a whole lot easier to notice the douche bags and clutch purses there. What was real bad was the attitude from the staff. I feel people in the service industry should make it point to be polite, not just because you should, but because it is more lucrative. The Doorman was the worst of all. You stand in front of a door dude. You're not that cool or you'd be behind the decks.The place is swank as hell though and has an overall nice aesthetic. Check out to what is going on the night you choose to go down there.
author: santiago g.

description:
Not sure who the DJ was on Saturday, but if he was a regular - but he was HORRIBLE...was playing for himself and not the crowd.

The crowd was not that impressive, but it seemes like it was a lot of couples just leaning against the wall.

The bartenders were suprisingly quick servers...and the drinks were strong (mine was almost undrinkable strong, but I got over that really quickly)

Wouldn't be my first choice but would go back if my friends were really insistent of going and it wasn't too late...not really a fan of waiting outside in line, no matter how cool the spot is.
author: Melind H.

description: Happy Friday! Great 80s music by a cool DJ every Friday afternoon until 9pm. Crowd gets yuppy at times, a lot of people coming in after working in the Financial district downtown, still needing more time and drinks to unwind, most definitely...
author: Maile V.

description:
Meh, if I had paid any sort of cover, this would have been a 2-star. Overall my experience was good. Drinks are expectantly overpriced, but the dance floor is decent sized and the music is equally on par. The illusive "Upstairs VIP" was a disappointment, but once again, that part was also free. 

Of course, getting a cab home from outside Harlot was nearly impossible, and my too-short dress wasn't ideal for cruising downtown at 2am. Good thing my mom made me take those self defense classes. Oh, and the pepper spray helps.
author: Ali B.

description:
If you notice other Yelpers' review of Harlot, you will see a common trend - slutty girls love this place and guys hate it because they can never get in unless they are with slutty girls.  Bottom line:  this place is pretentious, the BOUNCERS SUCK  and are total losers who justify their existence by acting like they have a real job. For a business to be successful you should have a professional staff, Harlot owners/managers obviously dont know that. I give this place another year until the bridge and tunnel crowd finds another place where they can stand in a fake line and get harassed by bouncers.  
The music is good, but if you are only looking for good music, you can play your I pod at home.  If you want good music, good space, good people, and friendly staff - skip Harlot. Go to Jon Collins across the street!  Thats what we did.
author: Ruhee R.

description:
Sexist bouncer at a club that's trying to be more than it is.  They created a fake line but not letting people in (even in crappy weather).  They randomly decide who to let in:  if the girl-to-guy ratio of your group is higher than 2, or you're a girl dressed in revealing attire, you'll get in.  Guys that don't sneak in with a bunch of girls... good luck! 

But that's not just my opinion... read the many reviews here that suggest the same thing.  And dude, the old, slightly overweight bouncer... get a life!
author: Just M.

description:
Decor: 4 - Good, but nothing really new. The tables in the lounge were pretty sweet, though.

Staff: 4 - Friendly, attractive, and I never stood at the bar for more than a minute.  The guys didn't seem to be as successful, however.

Music: 5+ - I've been here twice... the first time was amazing old school hip hop (is that Ahmad "Back in the Day?"), the second time was house-y but not the same old shit.  Solid solid solid.

Atmosphere: Umm...3?  I can't say I paid much attention to anyone outside of the groups I've come here with.  Some attractive people watching can be done here, but it's mostly "semi-attractive but trying really, really hard" people watching.

Overall: 4.  I'd definitely come back, but not to hang with the crowd.  I'm not going to make a "marina" jab... but yeah.
author: Sarah D.

description: man, as a native of sf never thought i'd get kicked out of a club for literally closing my eyes.  - i kid u not dudes.. if you close ur eyes to listen to music they will tap u on your arm and send u effing home!!!! ...  and get this, they even staged a blanket and put it down by my seat and pointed to it with their flashlight to prove something or other ( it wasn't there before i closed my eyes for the  50 seconds) can u believe that!  this place is so not cool   it was almost funny
author: mat s.

description: no cover on a saturday night, great music
author: Talia R.

description: Definitely one of those places people go to to be seen. EVERYBODY was taking pictures like every two seconds of everyone and everything. Epileptics beware: you WILL go into a seizure from all the camera flashes. Upstairs VIP room - what makes it VIP I've no clue. The music here is pretty good though, and the bartenders are chill.
author: Polly F.

description: its funny to me that people describe this as a LA or LV-type club as if that were a compliment. but that says all i need to know about the club and its clientele.
author: Stinky M.

description: This is my first Yelp post because this place sucks ass so much, I actually took the time to register to place this review.  First of all, they should rename this club "HarLotto" because the chances of you getting in (if you're a guy) is like hitting the lotto (if that).  Basically, you need to be a girl or a transvestite to get in.  If you do manage to get in, the place is empty, the crowd is much less to be desired (women waiting for their bfs to come in who are constantly being harassed by old dirty men who greased the bouncers to come in and eventually leave anyway because their guy friends can't come in until almost closing time).  Don't go here!  You'll end up wasting your time waiting in line near a nasty ass dumpster in the nasty ass alley where this place is located (and where they belong).
author: Lawrence C.

description:
We tried to go to Harlot yesterday (Saturday night) for a friend's coworker's birthday party. We had a mixed crowd of men and women. We waited for more than one hour at the front of the unmoving line. Although the bouncer was minimally not-too-rude, the manager/supervisor (who was also outside) was rude and completely indifferent to the (at least) couple dozen of us who were waiting to get in, stating that the club was just too full to let other people in. While we waited, a lot of people who had ordered bottle service arrived and were let in (legitimate) and the manager, rather crudely and rudely, stated that all "the girls" could come in....maybe (not legitimate). Our guy friends, including the birthday girl's boyfriend, would have to remain outside.

We left after shivering outside for around 75 minutes, never having gotten into the club. I have little use for the idiocy of places with bullshit sexism of "girls" being allowed in while "men" have to wait outside. (Yes, I'm well aware that many "trendy" places catering to the heterofabulous crowd do this.  I just watch and comment on the bullshit.) Aside from that, I DEFINITELY have no use for any business, of any sort, which treats patrons as dispensable. Yes, they may not need all the patrons queuing up on a Saturday - but those same patrons, if treated well, may want to come back on less popular nights (or to order bottle service, book the VIP room, etc., on another weekend - things I'm not averse to doing for special occasions). As a Financial District professional type, I'm apparently in their target demographic for weeknight socializing. Unfortunately, Harlot doesn't seem to have included in its target demographic "people who like to be treated politely." 

I won't be back.
author: B L.

description: it's a small space and gets crowded. its perfect if you're into fancy vibes and expensive clothing... candle lit and caged-in smoking room. beautiful ladies on the walls and upstairs you can watch everyone below.
author: aerin w.

description: Harlot is scary!  What I mean is there location.   You walk into an alley to get to harlot, but along the way, theres a homeless shelter on the left with tons of homeless gawking at you.    The bar is only decent, I definitely wouldn't risk my life going back to this junk.
author: k f.

description: Crap, crap, crap! That's all I can say. We walked in, were inside for all of 5 minutes when a girl bumped in to us, no harm done, we thought it was just the regular drunk girl who can't walk straight due to having too many drinks. So we walk passed her and she taps me on the shoulder and says, "you guys better leave because I'm getting you thrown out" (I'm caught off guard because I have no idea what she is talking about). So it turns out that she is an employee at Harlot and has deceided that she wants us kicked out because she walked in to us! She is obviously trigger happy and has never been given any authoritative postion in her life before and feels the need to be a juice monkey just because she can. So she sends security over and we voluntarily  offer to leave because we are looking to have a good time and don't want to hang out a place that employs bitches like her. We live in the neighborhood and have been to Harlot before but this was definitely our last visit! Minna and John Collins are right around the corner...why not check them out, they aren't employing a bunch of idiots!
author: Dakota W.

description:
I gave this 5 stars so everyone can read this review.

5 negative stars!

This Place Sucks Ass!  DO NOT GO HERE.  I REPEAT DO NOT GO TO THIS CLUB.  They let your girls in but not you.  You have to wait outside the club in line, while your ladies that do get in don't do anything cause you're not with them!  What kind of F'n logic is that?  So basically you have a club with women inside, sitting around waiting for their men to get in, a fully stocked bar, that no one is buying anything from, because the men are the ones that will be paying(not saying the ladies are incapable...but yall get it!)  I brought $3000 dollars in my right pocket and another $7000 in my left, not to mention the other $25,000 or so my friends brought to throw down and have a good night ....but Harlot did not give us the chance to do that.  I was about to offer the bouncer $1000 thinking it would help out with his facial problems and get us all in, but as I approached and got a better look at him I clearly didn't bring enough for what he needed.

I guess I also give 5 positive stars to Harlot, for saving me and my friends from spending our chum change at a low class, dirty, poorly supervised, s#ithole of a place.  

Thank you Harlot?


Hmm...Looks like we know who the Bouncer is....dont we Christian D?  Pretend having $3k?....Son, thats why you work as a bouncer for a living...you couldn't possibly understand how someone can bring that much money.  Reply when you make as much as me.

For those that did get in and enjoyed, great.....good for you...looks like Christian D. has friends after all.....and thanks for giving advice about reserving a table but when a club is half empty, wont take a bribe, and they state that they've run out of tables....then....that's just either racist or sexist.  You choose....And if you think we were "mostly guys" then.....thats just either...You were way too Drunk or you're one of Christian D's Friends...You choose...
author: Ryan C.

description: Saturday Night - Top 40 music was great since we were having a girls night and wanted to dance. The drinks however were off. I had a shot of Grey Goose and it went down so smooth. Ten minutes later I had the same shot and it tasted like nasty Wallgreens brand charcoal vodka. There was definitely something fishy going on.
author: Sara D.

description: good place to scope out tall, good looking people.  i felt like a little person here.  the music was pretty cheesy when i went, and the dj sucked, but at least there was nice scenery.
author: Helen T.

description: LISTEN TO THE PEOPLE WHO COULD BARELY GIVE THIS PLACE ONE STAR! It doesn't even deserve that! What do I most agree with? All those people that said the bartenders, bouncers, managers, and overall staff are incredible rude and only care about profit over customer service. Seriously, a business should care more about customer service. First of, the bartenders are NOT FRIENDLY and need to go back to bar school to learn  that they are supposed to ACTUALLY ADD ALCOHOL TO A $9 DRINK! The staff is completely inexperienced and immature. I understand it is a bar/lounge and all but they need to get better management in order for the place to salvage their reputation. HORRIBLE place to go for anyone with a brain. DON"T WASTE YOUR TIME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Karla B.

description: Went here for one of the first stops of our bachelorette's party bus last Saturday.  We were 12 girls with 2 guys (yes, weird for a bachelorette party, but due to some flakers, we had to bring the headcount back up).    The security guy/host was pretty rude and yelled as us "HEY! GIRLS! STOP YELLING AND GET IN LINE AND TAKE YOUR IDs OUT!"... Girls are usually pretty loud and giggle-y ...especially when in big groups.  OK?! sheesh man. SORRY for being excited and having fun! ugh. Then they wouldn't let the two guys who were with us in because they weren't on the guestlist so we offered to pay.  They wouldn't take it. Eventually (I don't know how), the two guys were in and said the guy gave the money back to them rudely. another UGH! haha. As far as inside, the dance floor is pretty small... not much space to move and the bar is pretty small... I think there was an upstairs, but that was for "VIP" (not sure).  We left after 30-40 minutes of lame-ness. Music wasn't that great.  I wouldn't recommend any of my friends to come to this place. Boo.
author: Roxanne K.

description: came here after a wedding reception...i was absolutely trashed from the wedding..so no matter where i went it would have been great..so i guess this review is useless.....
author: dates w.

description: WHACK is the best description of this shitty place! We had 6 girls and 3 boys with us and the bouncers would not let the boys in. The bouncers were utterly rude and the only way to get on the guest list is to "know" someone. I asked the old fart (bouncer) for his name and he came back with a rude ass remark. First of all, this place isn't even nice enough to be having an "exclusive" list. So I told the bouncer off and went to 525 across the street, way better place and they let everyone in! They need to calm the eff down with their attitude and their "exclusiveness" or else it'll get shut down. this isn't vegas! Stupid place and would not recommend it to anyone.
author: Ravali R.

description: great place to do a last call sweep.... but other than that this is just a faux vegas club....too much cologne in the air!
author: Ishmael V.

description:
If I could give this less than one star I would. 

DONT BE SWAYED BY THE DOUCHEBAG GIRLIES LOOKING FOR FREE DRINKS WHO ARE UPPING THE RATINGS - THIS PLACE SUCKS

I arrived with about 8 friends, secured a bottle table ( with $250 minimum two bottle ) plus the $300 we had to slip the doorman. Whatever - we were in. I had to go to the bathroom and had never been there before,so I edge around the bar and some 20 year old bouncer pounces on me like WWF. Startled, I said, 'hey - I'm just looking for a restroom'. He proceeds to antagonize me, calling me an idiot, so I just walk away. What I didn't know is he calls three of his trigger happy bouncer buddies and they meet me twenty feet later, and physically throw me out of the bar. So, I'm cool - saying there must be some misunderstanding and they proceed to literally throw me out of the club in front of my friends. I ask for a manager that I can speak to - wait 30 minutes outside, then they finally tell me to F^&*% off and take a hike ( after I've laid out $800 for a private table ). I give them a business card and ask for the manager to please call me and the head doorman tells me to screw myself and 'they don't need advertising'
well, enough said. I will NEVER go back and neither will all my collegues and if I can persaude anyone to to go else where I hope this ad has been worthwhile.
Harlot - listen to the people - sorry you've invested so much cash  but you're going down.
author: John J.

description: i've been here for holiday parties and for friends' birthdays...it's a cute little nightclub.  the food is okay, the service is pretty good, and the decor is just as the name applies.  i also like the little area for the dancers.  i would probably come here again for drinks.
author: Marjie T.

description: Hmm....where do I start?  My girlfriend and I wanted to party since we were already dolled up, so we decided to try Harlot since she was curious.  We arrived down the street since the club entrance was in the alley.  Normally we would be scared, but it was well lit and you can see the little H above the doorway right across from a lit parking lot.  Entry was simple, since we were 2 chicks, but after that, things started to go downhill for me.  Granted that usually I liked hanging with the asian crowd, the diversity of this place was sufficient, but I began to get flashbacks to the mid-western town I grew up in.  It felt like a trust fund kid's playground/frat house.  Majority of the population consisted of upper suburbia/yuppies, and when I say yuppies (flash to pretty in pink where guys are wearing polos and a sweater over their shoulder tied right in front of their chest).  Shudder...next the dj (dj sam issac) was a newbie..or at least he played like one.  The dj was switching back and forth between different types of genre along with after playing a fast song, would go to a slow song.  I mean, what good dj does that?  If you want to keep people happy, you get them dancing on the floor!  Besides that, he didn't know how to spin, so in between songs, you'd hear silence.  Lastly, though the place was small, but nice decor and clean, we did get hit on.  I remember the guy introducing us to his friend b/c it was his "friend's birthday"...could I not have felt like one of the girls on the show The Pickup Artist and just have fun with my friend?...Please guys, if you're going to try and pick girls up...be smoother and at least funny or interesting...
author: Eling H.

description: I was at Harlot on Halloween as an Asian-prisoner.  I got jumped by two guys in the smoking lounge and then thrown out of the club.  The police took a report then left me by myself.  I tried to go back into the club to get my belonging and tell my friends what happened.  Despite bouncers knowing I was the one attacked I refused to be let in.  I took one step across the velvet rope then the bouncer started to hit me without warning.  I called the cops but before I could tell them what happened another bouncer ran to them and told them I assaulted the bouncer.  SF police took his word and took me into custody.  Irony.  If anyone saw any of the events can you please contact me because I was not able to get any witnesses. Thank you and god bless
author: Robert L.

description: This place gets two stars because of the decor...I loved it.  However...a few things really RUINED my night. My best friend came from out of town and we decided to try this place.  After kicking several empty glasses away from me on the dance floor...my friend said her foot hurt and reached down-only to pull up a hand covered in blood. Instead of being accomodating and sympathetic, the staff took us down to the basement and put several bandaids on her foot....making us all the while feel very uncomfortable. When I expressed my feelings to the staff, then told me to be quiet or go upstairs.  At a place where the drink prices are at the higher end, the dance floor is small, and the music is average, you expect a little more friendliness from the staff. They basically pushed us out the door, no offer to call us a cab...nothing.  Even their own bouncers were shocked. One person felt so bad that she offered my friend her whole pack of cigarettes!! The people there were really nice, but I have been to much better places in SF.
author: M s.

description: yeah i agree- awesome decor and design but the guys out front make you never ever want to come back...course you can arrive at 930 and not have a problem
author: Rob C.

description: Harlot.  I like the name.  I have been here twice, both for private parties.  They often rent the bar out for private events, is what I've been told.  The first party was a Halloween party, sponsored by ? Anyhow, I walked in, and it was a hot, sexy scene.  There were girls more than half naked, dancing, stretching on tables.  It was open bar, so of course I was in heaven.  The cocktail servers were walking around with passed appetizers:  things such as ribs, garlic goat cheese puffs, shrimp, etc.  There is an upstairs area, a stage, a smoking room; so you have choices.  The second party I went to at Harlot was for a work holiday party.  Again, open bar, and passed appetizers (but no girls dancing on tables).  Basically, both nights I remember walking in, but maybe not walking out (damn you, open bar!).  I have yet to go to Harlot on a "regular" night, but look forward to it one day soon.  Oh, I have to add that the bartenders are all really nice.
author: Sarah F.

description: Very small, the decor is awesome but so many people there can barely move, plus the stuff is not really nice.  Overall a much better place during the week when there is 1/3 of the crowed there.
author: Ina S.

description: horrible club!!!! if you are from sf you have to be a retard to come to this club.  i went here for a bachlor party and they kicked us out.  horrible music and the staff was pretentious asians who were soo rude.  worst club i have ever been to in my life.
author: john d.

description: AWFUL. Pretentious management telling potentials guests (2 guys and 1 girl) that we had a bad ratio and were probably not going to get in the club. This was at 930 pm with no one at the club! I have never been to a club that treated its potential patrons like that, i will never spend a dime in the club. Save yourself the hassle and go somewhere fun.
author: Joshua S.

description: this place makes happy hour extra happy because the decor is so lovely. it has a sort of understated elegance with its gothic/chic vibe. i like. thanks to my friend for showing me. the location makes it extra exciting as we walked through the dark alleyways of the SOMA...
author: Stacy C.

description:
Don't go there.  
I went there few weeks ago to meet a group of friends. At the door, i was asked by a Russian employee whether I'm on "The List"? I said: what list? he said guest list? I said: I don;t know, check please if my name is there. He pretended to read the list, an in a sec, he said, No your name is not there! (at the same time he was allowing others to go in without asking if there where on the list, just show the ID!! 
When I saw that, i told him why are you not asking the others if they where on "The list" too, he said to stand on the side and not to ask a thing. Then I said : do you think that I drove 45min from Palo Alto to come to this bar to check out ladies (although i might cause girls in Palo Alto suck)? then my friends came to my rescue and he refused to let me in cause he said "I have a bad attitude!!!" 
I think that had i was a white guy like him (and like the others that he allowed in) he would have let me in. While it is possible that he did not want to let me in cause i came initially to the bar as a single man, and bars prefer not to allow too many single guys in, my group that i went to see had 5 girls and 4 guys!!.
Anyway, we all had to leave that place and went to another bar nearby. 
So please don't go to that place until that racist Russian doorman is fired from there.
author: H J.

description: This is by far the best club scene and designed interior of a club I've attended since moving up here from LA two years ago.  If you are in your thirties, I recommend the Friday 80's club night.
author: Donna K.

description: Visiting this club for the first time was so much fun.  My girls and I were greeted by the friendly bouncer at the door.  We were waiting for one of our gfs cause she had the hookup with someone in the club but the bouncer kindly let us in for free!  That was a great start to our night.  The drinks were a bit on the expensive side but that's typical of the city clubs really.  The music was awesome.  They played all kinds of music and also some MJ hits since that was the wkd after MJ passed.  Club went crazy whenever his songs were played.  It got packed around midnight but for the most part, we encountered mostly fun people just there to have a good time.  Yeah there were a couple of guys that were weird but didn't ruin our night.  The club has a top floor but we didn't know how to get up there.  Either way, we were having too much fun on the dance floor to worry about it.  I liked the decor and the crowd was pretty diverse.  All in all, I really liked this club and would go to again.
author: Beverly C.

description: this place oooooozes swank without being snobby.  the crowd seems more elegant.  music played on a friday was ok.  not exactly hip/hop but it had a beat and was danceable.  no cover but i did see a group of guys get denied.  so fellas, come with some ladies.  maybe it will be easier to get in.
author: Cindy N.

description:
Oh Alice, what have we here?  It appears we've fallen into a rabbit hole.  Or, better, a time-warping wormhole, because I suddenly feel compelled to don a shiny striped shirt and a pair of square-toed shoes.  Alice, you say need a backless dress with stilettos? I wholeheartedly concur.  What's this?  It appears to be a dark, modern space infused with a post-post-modern surreality accomplished via furniture and fixtures...starck/shrager circa, could it be, 2000?  The Hudson?  Clift?  Sanderson?  Hmm, it appears not to be the case...but this downtempo-ish music seems to reinforce notions of the past...where's the electro, the microhouse, the German techno, the French touch, the Philly hip-hop pastiche, hell (indeed I've resorted to such language) where's my Nu Rave?  Yes Alice, a fit is perfectly appropriate; it certainly is too soon to relive 7 years ago.  Perhaps a drink is in order (and frankly, when is a drink not?)

Me: Would you happen to have any rye?
Bartender:  No [blase, semi-patronizing tone]
Me: Then you wouldn't be able to make a sazerac now would you?
Bartender:  No, and I wouldn't if I did; I used to work in a bar that served rye once; it's an old man drink [really cranking up the bombast now]
Me: oh really?  [slight look of incredulity]
Bartender: Yea
Me: [snicker]
  
Oh yes, the renaissance of mixology had yet to reach the shores of SF in 2000, how silly of me.  Of course I'll have a vodka and red bull in a cocktail's stead.  In fact, make that two.  Perhaps three...some energy will be required to return to the present.    

P.S. As an aside to the management, have you been to the Box in the East Village?  If yes, perhaps a page should be taken from their book.  If not, I strongly suggest you visit.
author: Wilfred C.

description:
First impression:  Hole in the wall club/lounge with chill people and
good music.  Cool, eclectic club that resembles a NYC ambiance.
Reality:  Overly pretentious, obnoxious douche bag doorman that treats
everyone in line like second class citizens.  There's no cover charge
however don't take this as a good thing.  The doorman (a Caucasian
male with thick framed glasses) holds up his guest list like it's the
key to Emerald City.  Those on the guest list pre-paid b/n $200-400
for a table so they have no problem getting in.  I was with a group of
8--4 girls with our 4 boyfriends.  We were in line before 10:30 on a
Saturday night.  They had no problems letting in the girls but treated
the guys like dirt.  We waited in line for over 20 minutes while half
our group was inside waiting for us. The club wasn't even full yet
they made us wait and refused to let the boyfriends in.  When we get
to the line the doorman says to the guys in our group "I can either
say no to you guys or say no with flowers but you can wait here all
night"--doorman's response to our group at 10:30pm on a Saturday night
when the club isn't even half full.  B/c they don't charge cover this
club makes money of pple buying tables.  If you're not buying a table
then forget about getting in here if you're not a girl or with a bunch
of girls.  This club is not worth a second of anyone's time b/c the
doorman and staff are a bunch of superficial jackasses.  I prefer
paying cover to a club where the doorman isn't on some power trip b/c
his real life is a pathetic waste of time. Go anywhere else but here.
author: S K.

description: Went to Harlot on Saturday night (9/08) with 5 other girls. We were standing outside talking (after eating at Salt House) about 11:00pm, when the owner of Harlot came out and promptly & politely asked us to come in.  We received a table on the main floor with bottle service.  We had no reservations.  Although the club was extremely crowded, we received excellent service (clean table, fresh glasses, fresh ice, Grey Goose, etc....).  Yes, we saw the baby... it was very sad (The couple also brought it to the Salt House and dropped it -- poor baby).  We were dressed up, polite, and kept to ourselves -- maybe that is why we received such good service at Harlot?
author: Kate K.

description:
I ALMOST had a good experience...

It was my birthday and some friends from work took me out. We got in right away (all girls) and the place is nice and not too crowded. Being it was my birthday, I got a little tipsy and forgot to close out my tab at the end of the night. I went back the next day at about 8pm to see if I could get my credit card back. The door was open and 4 bartenders and a couple doormen were inside setting up. After saying excuse me several times and being ignored, I finally walked up to the bar and explained my situation to one of the bartenders. She then looked quickly through some cards and said they didn't have mine. Now, I know I was tipsy when I left but that was the only place I went and I KNEW they had it. Another girl piped in and said it might be in the safe but it would take time to go look and they didn't have time right now and to come back at the end of the night. At 2AM!!! Then they told me I should have called first (I called several times during the day, NO ANSWER). I said no way to coming back and after arguing with them for 10 minutes they finally told me to come back in half an hour and they'd look. Then they tell me that they're not even open yet an I shouldn't even be there! Don't leave the door open then honey!! Sure enough, I come back and it's sitting there waiting for me. They didn't apologize and barely looked at me when I came in to grab it. Awful....I'm boycotting from now on.
author: Katherine K.

description: Be careful...Harlot wrongly charged my credit card $100.  When I called to notify them, the guy who answered the phone cut me off mid-sentence to say that they've been getting a lot of calls about this and I should see a refund in 4-7 days.  Then he hung up on me.  7 days to get my money back???  Not to mention the dj on Friday night was beyond awful and the bouncers had so much attitude it was comical.  Honestly, it was such a bad experience overall that I registered for Yelp just to ding it.  The 6 friends who were there with me agreed.  Don't waste your time.
author: Kacey B.

description:
really i think its 3 1/2 stars, but since i cant give the half, i am settling on 3.  i went to harlot for a private b-day party which was really fun.  we were in the upstairs area, and had part of it reserved for our group.  other than that, i guess it wasnt really "private" but you know what i mean.  harlot isnt that big, but it does have plenty of room for the bar. sizeable dance-floor and couches for sitting when your feet get tired of dancing.  it was absolutely packed - too much so, i thought.  i liked the music - good mix of songs and it kept the crowd going.  the interior is pretty - dark with paintings on the wall (some strange) and cool furniture.  upstairs, the seating is all white - very glamourous.  i thought the staff was nice - i didnt have to wait too long for drinks at the bar even though it was so crowded.  
i would go back to harlot again, although im not sure how long i could stand the crowds.  i didnt get a good feel for what the actual crowd was like since i was with a party.  i liked harlot enough to give it another shot on my own!
author: Carolyn B.

description: I feel like I'm wasting ink here but I honestly felt compelled to write this in case it stops someone from going. The staff is incredibly rude, incompetent, and LAME. At the door, they act like this is some super exclusive/ cool/ fashionable place, when in reality they are all tacky and depressing. They let people wait inline for half an hour until just minutes before last call in order to let in their similarly tacky and sad friends and appear "exclusive." Of course while waiting you can see they are all dressed in the most hideous and slutty outfits you can dream of, which they consider "upscale" since this place has a "dress code." When you do go in the music sucks, the drinks are weak, and you are confronted by the same bottom-of-the-pile crowd, with some of the sketchiest/ drunkest ones occasionally trying to rub themselves on you. Yuck*1,000,000. If you are one of those people who consider themselves "cool" by subjecting themselves to Harlot I feel extremely sorry for you and will pray for your salvation :)
author: Victoria K.

description: the only thing i didn't like about harlet is how creepy it could be in the alley outside at early night however between late bar hopping it was fine there were plenty other hoppers walking around.  the crowd was mixed, there were some older guys there like in their 40s?  but then again i rather be around 40s than the fake ID holders.
author: Dee Y.

description: Tucked away in an alley south of the financial district lies Harlot. Not the best location since it is right in front of an ugly parking lot, but oddly enough there has been a surge in bars and lounges in that area lately. The feeling inside was a bit "industrial" - Brick walls were exposed and the painting selection leaned on the goth side. But, it still maintained a modern look with its sleek couches and chaise as well as a simple facade for both bars. One of the most notable things this place will be known for is the smoking area, which is a glass (floor to ceiling) room that opens up into a porch...keeping the smokers in touch with what's going on inside. Plus, all of the tables have a picture of a fashionista as its tabletop which I'm sure will add to many a conversation. And even though it has an upstairs area, the space is pretty small so I can see it getting crowded pretty quickly!
