The drinks were good though...my cosmo was great and my bf's drink was strong, so you know they don't skimp out on the alcohol! Tanqeray and Johnny Walker were the drink sponsors the night we went but since I don't care for either, I decided to pay for my drinks! :p Overall I think it was nice and I'd probably check it out again. But, I still have other bars and lounges that I favor.
author: Nina R.

description: came here a while ago but this place is great. the decor is greatm the bartenders are friendly, and the crowd is hot. the location is great too-- super convenient to a parking lot (like 10 feet away) and off the main drag. you won't be disappointed.
author: Jon N.

description: i had a surprisingly good time here, but i think to get through the crowd you kinda have to go with a regular. but i love the ambiance, there are tables and seats for the reserved. there's a smoking area. the parking doesn't seem too bad. the crowd seemed really diverse. i went on a saturday night.
author: Maureen M.

description: It's a nice looking place...but it gets crowded very early.  The staff was really nice.  If I were them I would open up the upstairs area to regular traffic...it was almost empty up there and you couldn't even move downstairs.
author: Marie M.

description: cool venue....great bartenders (danny!!).....awesome DJ on friday night!!!!
author: betty w.

description: love it! perfect- way cool! what more can i say....go and check it out for yourself....it's the best place you can dance near my house- watch out john collins, you have some competition now!
author: Ricquel N.

description: this place is pretty good. the only gripe i have is that when the place is half full, and there is no line, why do people at the door need to make it so exclusive? i mean i why do me and 3 other people need to wait for 4-8 minutes to be let in? it makes no sense... maybe its the exclusive element. still i think it is a little over the top. good drinks, i really like the lighting: NONE. so everyone looks amazing. music was okay the saturday i went. not a bad place. but these lists and vip shit has to go.
author: Ryan B.

description: been here a couple times and its pretty fun. the people who work there are always supper nice and friendly. lots of people dancing around the good dj . they have pretty good drinks, but its pretty hard messing up my beloved vodka soda :).
author: Vanessa M.

description: the door guys/security were nice and polite, the bartenders were cool, especially the female bartender who was buying me shots.   but the non etiquette having no common courtesy douche bag of a crowd sucks.  you know and "excuse me" usually does the trick if you need to get by or to go to the bar to order a drink, try it sometime, you might notice it works.
author: Pickle R.

description: hmm, harlot. any place that decides to put in a one-way mirror looking IN to the women's restaurant (so that people on the dance floor can see in, to be specific), is immediately suspect in my book. reasonably strong and well mixed drinks? sure, but isn't that standard these days? excessively hip interior decorating? another check mark for harlot, though again, nothing remarkable by san francisco standards. lots of random people, trying too hard to look cool? yeah, another point for harlot. and the final nail in their coffin, as far as i am concerned. no harlot, no thank you.
author: oona m.

description: I went here for New Years Eve. It was okay. Bar is fine, but the place feels quite small - plus an awkward dance floor. For $50 a person, I was expecting something far more extravagant. DJ Sam Isaac was spinning some pretty weak stuff. Going to Slide the week before was so much more fun. The location of Harlot is pretty shady...if you go the wrong way towards 1st, you'll run into some slightly aggressive homeless folks. Go somewhere else.
author: Jay E.

description: The decor and ambiance was so beautiful very burlesque, and fitting since Harlot basically means whore.  We were admittedly one of those groups of girls that the door man looked at and let in right away. Nice but still cheesy. We got there around 11pm and the place was relatively empty. However the people that were there were quite attractive, and even though the after work crowd should have gone home by now some delicious men in suits were still lingering. This was a pleasant surprise. By midnight the place was pack-ola. But the later crowd seemed pretty bridge and tunnel. Drinks WILL cost you an arm and a leg. The bartenders are punky and fun. The music was retarded. My six year old niece could mix better.
author: Anna F.

description: went last night to harlot for the third time.  it seemed the crowd was not that classy and the music sucked.  i just dont understand why people want to play old hip hop (sounded like a bad night at slide).  if this place goes back to classy house like when it opened it will be much better.  please change the music.
author: icon p.

description:
it really isn't a place to dance. 
it took a while for the crowd to start dancing and the first couple of hours were just unattractive ppl dancing. 
there were way too many old men checking out people from the second floor and that was a bit creepy. 
i was with a big group of ppl and had reserve seats and one thing that got me was the waitresses would stop by and constantly checked on your drinks and wanted to take them away if they got empty. it was almost every 5 mins. this really distracted us from having a good conversation so I was not really pleased. 
also when i started dancing, the bouncer asked me and my friend to get out for a while. i knew that i was drunk but i clearly knew what was going on so i didn't like how i couldn't have the choice to just stop dancing and go back to my seat. I guess it really was for older crowds. I'm too energetic to dance and I didn't fit into this place...very sad. The drinks were okay, overall you should see this place as a lounge and not a place where you can dance and move around a bit. I learned my lesson.
author: sarah m.

description: Must Be fun. Working as a security gurad on the 21!!!! hope all is peace and fun
author: Rafael M.

description: Very cool space - dark, sleek,  and sexy.  They did a really good job on this place.  It has a more sophisticated vibe to it.  So, thankfully, it seemed to attract a more mature crowd.  Start out the night with dinner at Salthouse next door, and then head right over to Harlot.
author: clancy t.

description:
they're horrible. i drove into the city to meet up with some friends & celebrate someone's b-day & they wouldn't let me in.  excuse? the table we have is full. they wouldn't even compromise & let me hang at the bar. that's the kind of b/s, wanna-be elitist attitude this little club in the middle of an obscure alley wants to take.  wait a minute. i take it back. they're compromise was if we "upgrade" to a bigger table for $500 plus 2 bottles of wine.

That's why going to the "triangle" is way more fun. Don't gotta worry about dress code, waits in lines, $10 watered-down drinks, uppity-attitudes. & the people look just as good!
author: perry c.

description: we had HUGE expectations for this sultry SOMA hot spot...... even as we were leaving the office yesterday our coworker yelled  "oh yeah, you girls are going to loooove harlot!". we were excited. we wandered down the alley and saw the red scrolling H above the door...... finally. we sauntered in and looked around. not bad, cute space. immediately loved the dramatic windows and dark gothy colors, plus its intimate. it was friday night and packed. i wanted to go up to that loft area perched above the bar, but was wearing a very short dress last night and got nervous about going up those stairs with so many guys standing down below. instead we got comfortable lounging with some goose & tonics in the crowded area right in the center of the room. the men were ok. not bad.... so we tried to work with the situation. we sipped our cocktails, socialized with everyone standing around us and yelled at each other over the music. inevitabley it was like a balloon slowly deflating though, we just got bored. something was missing in the energy here...... we were barely there for over an hour and it seemed like forever. sorry we tried. the people seemed to be a mix of corporate slaves drowning their sorrows from a long work week or guys scoping the crowd for a hook up.... typical for a friday happy hour i guess, but not really what we were looking for on this particular night. so... as pretty and provocative as the artwork was to look at, we just didn't find our groove here. we fought our way up to the bar to close out our tab and left our weakly made drinks on the table. then we moved on to Johncolins..... you know, a fun bar. sorry harlot, but i'm really easy to please. especially with a cocktail in my hand. one more thing i would like to mention: as we were exiting this place, the door guy offered his hand to make sure we didn't fall going down the step. a very nice touch... will give them another shot later. i can see potential.
author: Michelle I.

description: The people who work at Harlot are pretentious, rude, seriously lack customer service know-how, and have their noses waaaaaay up in the air.    This past weekend, my friend had planned to have a birthday party here.  When we got to the door, they finally told us that not everyone who were expected to come will be guaranteed to get in.  This is after knowing for some time the number of people that were expected and after weeks of correspondence. Not once did they tell him that this was a possibility.  As my friend was trying to explain his dilemma and confusion to the hostess, she haughtily turned to the doorman and rolled her eyes.  Is this not enough reason to never come back to this place?  They obviously are greedy for their patrons' money (otherwise, they would have told him of the situation), but they have no concept of valuing their customers.   If I could, I'd give this horrible place ZERO stars.
author: Josephine V.

description: Perhaps the owners need a dictionary or thesaurus. "Harlot" conjures images of plush decor and furniture, deep/warm colors, and a risque environment. The actual club is instead, a cold, sparse, warehouse of a room. A couple semi-nudie pictures does not a harlot make. To make it worse, the DJ seemed to have trouble with the concept of spinning one tune into another, often leaving the platform for 15-20 minutes at a time leaving a song or a pre-mixed tune to entertain. This happened all too much in the space of a few hours. The drinks were not well made enough to make up for the overall disappointment. I think everyone is pretty much onto the scam of keeping a long line outside while the inside is empty. Everyone knows this, it seems, except for club owners. The spirit of a harlot was only carried out by a a majority of girls in skirts so short it made me wonder if it was sanitary to sit in the same spot that one of them just vacated.
author: Maria Y.

description: I worked in the nightlife industry for 2 years and all I can say is good luck Harlot. Wasn't terribly impressed with the power trip door dude that had "THE LIST," we called ahead for a birthday party of 10 girls- told we couldn't be on a list unless we bought two bottles ($600 minimum-kiss my ass!) then ended up calling a friend of a friend that worked there to help us out. We got there and got in without any prob but the people who came later in our group got the "you're not on the guestlist treatment." When they offered to pay to come in they were told "guestlist only." When we were told earlier there wasn't a list. WTF? We're not UGLY. In fact, me and my friends were probably the best looking group there. Sometimes San Francisco just needs to get over itself. Anyways to make a long story short- VIP area looking down on you is simply retarded. Charged a difference price for the same drink on 3 seperate occasions. The glass smoking cage was plain weird. Bartender chicks not that hot, sorry, and the music was all over the damn place. Oh and the crowd... BARF. I've seen more attractive people at the DMV for Christ'ssake. Only reason this joint gets 2 stars is because the drinks I got poured were semi-decent and there was plenty of parking once you actually find the alleyway where this place was located. Probably not coming back unless I absolutely have to though. I'd rather go to a dive over this place.
author: Danielle M.

description: faux trendy. faux cool. all the pretension without the appealing ambiance and attractive crowd; this club tries too hard. skip it.
author: jeremy g.

description: its hard to review places where you've only gone for yelp events, because it's not representative of how it would be normally... but i can try. i walked down minna street and came across this in a corner, right before the street ended. such a weird spot. the coatcheck girl was nice, the bartender wasnt. not overtly rude, but not nice. i asked whether there were any special yelp event drinks (maybe a yummy strawberry yelptini?) and he said no special recipies and you can just get gin. i dont like gin, so i decided not to. my plus one ordered a regular drink for unfree, which i didnt even think to do because he was obviously so annoyed at my question. the place itself was nice. a smoking lounge at the front (i dont smoke but you may), and a little dance floor at the back of the ground floor. i loved the table tops with their harlot art, as well as the harlot art on the wall. the antler lights and deer head on the wall was a bit too much.  there is another bar upstairs, and you can sit there, or look down at the floor below. cute. the music was at a good level - that generic loungey music that you dont really notice. i never got any sushi... one helpful drunk gentleman holding 2 drinks pointed out you really have to stake out the door to the kitchen to get any food at these events. i suppose he's right. :( i'm not a bar/lounge person, and found myself just chatting with my friend the whole nite, because what else is there to do at a lounge? i wouldnt go again, a little too dressyish place for me, but i can see how it would be fun for others.
author: Merredith L.

description: this place is cool.  always have a good time when i go...the door guy is a prick...but you can't blame him for trying to keep the place the way it is.
author: Michael C.

description: what a dump!!! if you are trashy and have no self esteem, i strongly recommend you go to harlot...otherwise- stay a w a y !!!!!!!!
author: Twitty T.

description:
lame! so, the boys and i went out this past friday to the hyped up "harlot." after reading much reviews about this place, i got in my sexy outfit and met up w/my party boys at harlot. we werent even in the club/lounge yet and i was already unimpressed. we got there at 9:45pm on a friday nite to avoid all the line waiting bullcrap...no one was in line and when we showed this douchebag w/the "headset & clipboard" our IDs, he asked: "is it just the 3 of u tonite? and ur not on the list right?" we said, "actually, we have one more--he's finding parking and no we're not on the list." 
the guy looks around and gives us an exasperated sigh, "uh..ok, well make sure that when ur friend comes, he calls you so you guys can meet him out front." well, our friend came by 20 min. later and there wasnt even a line!! i was smoking inside their smoking room that looks outside minna street and ooohhh, big whoop...one person was in line before my friend. 

their bar sucked...made ick drinks but of course, to me it was still alcohol. the place had a nice dark, deep, rich colored decor but it was sorta small...the upstairs looked like some sorta VIP area..never went up there. the DJ was just playing lounge beats...we ultimately decided to go some place else that was more jumpin' and left at 11pm. definitely a 28 and up crowd which i dont mind but they just seemed so boring...maybe ppl were too shy to dance since the DJ didnt bust out the real dance songs....

i just hated how this place was so hyped up and how the doormen make it seem like it's uber exclusive and that u cant have more friends coming in if they're not there right at that moment....ppsshhh! that place aint that hot anyways, didnt see any hot guys and no hot girls for my guy friends....
author: Yolanda L.

description: the short guy that works the front door was so rude and such a dork.   but i suppose if you're that big of a dork, the only way you can get respect is by getting a doorman job and saying "no"  to all those that wronged him in the past.  walk across the parking lot to john collins.  that's a class act place.
author: michael k.

description: yes, i agree with the previous posts; nothing more annoying than getting denied from a bar by a short, bald bouncer (just imagine the Six-Flags dancing old guy but less cool).   fucking prick.  zero stars!
author: M L.
